review_body: Lovely clean hotel but the superior room was at best basic.The balcony was tiny, no furniture could even fit out there, it was like a block of flats.The bedroom was clean and nicely presented but the smell of drains in the bathroom was unpleasant. The bathroom was a great size but would rather it was more modern and the space better used on the balcony.When you think of superior, you don’t expect a bedroom then bathroom and that’s it. Was not worth the money.Location was good, easy to get to anywhere as it was literally a 1min walk to the main Barcelona train station and the metro line.Food wise, breakfast was nice and there was a lot of variety. Drinks prices at the roof bar, for a double and mixer well over priced!!The swimming pool on the roof was tiny, leave your lilo at home. The area around the pool was a good size, kept very clean and tidy and had all day sun shine. The hotel on the whole was clean and tidy, the 3rd floor where the meeting rooms, lounge area and food and drink were served was the best feature apart from that save your money and just book a basic room and least you get what you pay for then.If you want a good night of food pop across the road to out of India AMAZING!

0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in the centre and close to all attractions, and transport links. It was clean and well maintained. It had all the facilities we needed. Staff were very welcoming and willing to please. There was a large restaurant with extra extensions although it was still very busy every morning The breakfast offering was large and varied, well cooked and frequently replenished. Thank you Expo Barcelona for an enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed at this hotel and the room was filthy, especially the floor. we complained several times but nothing was ever done. Also my towel was taken from the room and when I reported it to reception, I was told it had been taken by mistake by the cleaner and sent to laundry and I would get it back. Nobody got in touch to update me and I had to ask for an update several times. I was always told they had it and I’d get it I heard this every time including up to the day I was leaving. They took my address and said they’d send it to me. Again they did not contact me. K have written but was told they don’t have it and would not compensate me in any way. I can only presume it was stolen. I felt the hotel handled the situation badly and didn’t care at all. Extremely poor customer service and standards off cleanliness. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel , as my daughter was working nearby and the hotel was convenient. My first impressions were not great, as it seemed to take forever to check in. It was not the hotel’s problem, as we had booked via booking.com, so as we needed to adjust our booking, that was totally acceptable.Once checked in ; we were showed to our room; it was ‘stark’; two single beds ( on wheels) reminiscent of dormitories, pretty basic , but lots of space. I found once we had adjusted to the room , it was actually ok. The room , though basic, provided very comfortable beds, duvets, and pillows. The Bathroom , although a bit dated, provided a bath and shower with great water pressure, and lovely hot water. I would give this hotel a 3.5 ,l.M
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very clean and with a fantastic location it is near lots of restaurants and the train station Barcelo Sants which can take you directly into the city centre or the beach very quickly. There is also a taxi rank just outside the station around a 2 minute walk from the hotel, which always had taxis waiting there for customers. They served lovely food and the views from the rooftop restaurant are amazing. During the night there was never once any noise disturbance. Spacious bathroom and excellent air conditioning within the room. However no chairs or any furniture at all on the balcony.Although the pool area is quite small it is very peaceful and relaxing up there on the rooftop. The only problem was you couldn’t take up any drinks which weren’t purchased within the hotel up to the pool area. So we had to go back to our hotel room and leave our water and soft drinks.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: pros- modern, good location; next to the station/underground, good prices, nice staff, room service food was also nice.cons- beds were not the comfiest, breakfast very overpriced for what it was, no drinks not from the hotel allowed in the sunbathing area.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we felt welcomed. Staff are friendly and nothing is to much trouble and helpful when we needed advice. my partner had a birthday whilst there and he received a lovely card through our door lovely. Rooms were clean and tidy and the air con was so nice. Breakfast was everything that anyone needed I was full every morning. Rooftop bar was an added bonus lovely atmosphere. We didn’t use the pool sadly as we got back to late most evenings. Great location near train station that’s 3 stops from airport. Thank you for making our trip great

review_body: we had 2 rooms with balcony view over the city, really pretty. they had comfy beds, an iron and safe is a must, what they had. to play with the water in the bathrooms were a bit difficult but overall the rooms were good. got good service. we would recommend this hotel to everyone for their super services and amazing city views.

0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been visiting Expo Hotel since 2010 at least twice a year. Still admired of quality of staff and friendly environment. But it’s to be mentioned that the variety of rooms accessories is declined.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family HolidayJust home trip to Barcelona durning our trip we stayed in Expo Hotel. We had a very pleasent stayfelt like home from home . The hotel had a excellent standard of cleanliness throughout and our room was lovely and spotless and cleaned to a high standard.We stayed on 9th floor and had no trouble at all with noise from roof top bar and pool area. Hotel had a large buffet breakfast to suit all travellers taste hot and cold food served and we ate lunch in hotel restaurant it was lovely and very reasonable priced as was beverages. Staff were extremely helpful and very friendly nothing was to much trouble and very informative about local area and able to tell you what was within walking distance of hotel. We were within walking distance of Sants train station and Metro system so were able to get about easy with a bit of advise from staff. There was some lovely restaurant directly across the road from hotel which we ate in and a supermarket next door. We felt Expo Hotels location was good and were able to travel around on metro system by purchasing a 5 day travel pass. Would highly recommend this hotel to all.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall the hotel was fine - if you dont need any luxury or any extra and just want a place to sleep and relax in Barcelona. The hotel it self is near to Pl. Espanya and actually in a really livedly area. It’s a bit far from centar it self as it takes around 40-45 min to walk there and one hour to Beach Barceloneta (and therefor even longer to one of the other beaches). Therefor you have to take the metro (which is right next to the hotel), bike or taxi really often. It didn’t bother us, we were there for one week and therefor it was okay but for an extended weekend for example I would choose something in the centar. The hotel had a really nice terasse plus an okay pool. A bit small though - but def better than nothing! When I read the reviwes (old ones) my self before I arrived I thought that they’d fix a few things by now but no.The hotel it self was really simple - and that’s what it is. A few pictures, a blanket on the floor and a fake flower in the room could make a huge difference. The hallway was really dark and kind of creepy. The room seemed a bit old and had no tea/coffee area as every hotel I’ve ever been in had. I could read that you have to buy a more expensive room - but honestly. Why not have that in every room. The mini bar was empty. There were no toiletbrush in the bathroom - why!? They have that even at public restrooms. The bed was on wheels, was noisy and not good at all. There was a fine balcony but with no table or chairs. Thin walls which made it loud and you could hear when people walked in the hallway/opstairs plus you could her traffic noise and people outside (we were on 5th floor). It was basically like being in an old apartment building. It is definately not a 4 star hotel. I would say 2 if it wasnt for the terasse and pool (good cocktails!) - that makes it 3 to me. I really feel like the hotel has a lot of potential and I really dont get why the owners doesnt do a bit more to make it up to date and add basic things as a toiletbrush and tea/coffee area. For the money the hotel was fine - but next time I will probably look for another hotel.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very conveniently situated near 2 stations and the main bus terminal and a huge supermarket right next door! Very modern looking entrance and friendly reception staff who checked us in. Room was very spacious as was the bathroom. Tea and coffee supplied in individual packs and obviously there was a kettle too. Mini bar fridge with complimentary bottles of water. Safe in the cupboard if needed. Bathroom had a hairdryer as well as soap, conditioner, body lotion, hair and body wash, a comb, toothbrush & toothpaste, a shaving kit, and a kit with earbuds and cotton wool. I also noticed in one of the drawers there was a mending kit and a shoe buffer. We had a balcony which was great. There is air-conditioning in the room. Room was made up every day and bathroom necessities replaced. There is a restaurant on the 3 floor which we didn’t use as we went out to eat and there is also a rooftop bar serving burgers and a few other snacks which had an awesome view. A few steps up was the swimming pool with loungers and towels supplied. Price was very reasonable and it was a nice area to wander around. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at the Expo in Barcelona during the Sonar festival. At first glance the hotel looks very nice with a beautiful and stylish lobby area. Our room still wasn’t ready at 3.30pm so we had to wait an extra 20 minutes while they found us another one. The hotel was busy so it was no big issue. The hotel rooms are very poor with large cracks in the walls some have been covered and some not. The room is very basic with no comfort or kind of luxury for a 4 star hotel in one of the most amazing cities in the world. The bathroom was nice but felt old as many holes in the tiles around the shower and bath. The bed was ok even though it looks like a hospital bed but was ok to sleep in. There was good space for clothes in the closet with more than enough hangers. The roof pool is very nice and the view is incredible and roof terrace bar was very nice too, for me the highlight of the hotel. We where however interrupted every morning at 9 am by construction in the next room with very loud machinery and banging when we called down they said it’s ok they will be finished in 10 minutes, which was not true. Also the house keeping ladies seam to stand in the hallway most of the day taking very loudly while one of them vacuums two of them stand there and have loud conversations with each other most of the day. I can see why they are still cleaning rooms until 4pm as they are too busy taking.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Barcelona for the last 3 days of our trip. We had a great time since we were able to visit touristic areas in the mornings and stay by the pool from 3/4 pm to 8pm (got a very nice tan). The Montjuïc palace is only a 10 minute walk, and the Gaudí casa’s and Rambla street are a 7 € cab ride. There is breakfast at the hotel (16€/person) but if you’re looking for a cheaper option, there is also a restaurant right next door called Solric that serves a hearty English breakfast for 6.5€. For dinner we mostly went to the Terraza (very good prices), which brings me to my next point. One of the waiters named Paolo was great, super attentive, remembered our names, and overall made us feel welcomed. His hospitality and professionalism played a huge role in our overall experience and how much we enjoyed ourselves. Because of him, we would definitely recommend Expo to our friends.  Thank you Paolo!
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and comfortable and the hotel staff provided a portable crib for my 2 1/2 year old toddler. We enjoyed the rooftop bar and pool and the view. We appreciated the proximity to the full grocery store downstairs as well as plenty of restaurants nearby. We enjoyed the Parc Industrial also nearby where I could let my son run around freely and play. If I have any criticism whatsoever, it is that the service was a little slow on the rooftop--not because the staff wasn't working very hard to satisfy the demand--there was just too great a demand for the staff on hand. The hop-on-hop-off bus stop was also close.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is within a short walk from Barcelona Sants station - everything is within metro distance; convenient, smooth check in; helpful staff. Two great aspects are: it’s away from the centre but not too far so it’s quiet, tranquil and peaceful and the rooftop bar has the best views of the whole city.

review_body: Very basic - no chairs to put clothes on - in fact one had the feeling that all the furniture had been removed for another room. Pillows were horrendous. The staff were not very friendly. Overall a very disappointing experience.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having looked at photos of the Expo hotel online I expected a similar room to what I stayed in the week before at the Gran Torre Catalyuna but I was to be very disappointed. As soon as I walked in the AC was blasting so the room was freezing cold and it had a dull cold feel to the whole room generally. There was no art work on the walls like the photos online, no tea and coffee facilities, no ironing facilities, no luggage stand. Just a room with a bed and an old desk that had seen better days. The balcony door was also not sealed properly so you could hear all the noise from the street including the rubbish collection at 3am. The room had obviously had some work done on the wiring at some point with a very poor job on patching it up afterwards. Definitely not 4 star.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel, good location but additional charges upon check out. Be sure to get your receipt and go over all charges before leaving the building. I booked for $565.84 euros but was charged more than this. I think I may have been charged for a breakfast I ended up having to cancel due to the fact that I had ordered for an 8am breakfast and by 9:00 they still hadn’t arrived with my breakfast - hence the cancellation, I would’ve continued waiting but I had a tour I had to attend. Perhaps book through a travel agent so it’s a fixed price and you can minimise any additional charges.

review_body: This hotel is a lovely place to stay, it is close to a few main attractions, the staff are so helpful and friendly and the rooms are comfortable. The rooftop pool is a bit smaller than expected but there’s plenty of sun loungers and views from the top are incredible. The metro station is also really close only a 2 minute walk with all the central areas then being a 15 minute journey. The rooms in general are probably more of a 3* rating but the bathrooms are really nice and social areas are nicely decorated with amazing food.

review_body: A lovely hotel which is a 5 minutes walk from Tarragona metro station or 5 minutes walk from Sants, which is the main train station. This helps you reaching very easy in any place you want from Barcelona or to/from the airport.The hotel is modern and the room was clean and nice the wi-fi connection was good. The staff on reception was friendly and helpful.

review_body: Chilling on the deck at the expo hotel. Enjoying the vibes but un Hope's when the sun goes down Paulo will return to the mix and give life to the evening. Expo hotel undoubtedly the place to stay in Spain.

0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel for the 20th anniversary of the MUFC treble, so me and my friends could go to the Camp Nou and reminicse. We took the RENFE train from the airport, which was pretty easy really and very cheap. The taxis are pretty reasonable too if you don't fancy taking public transport. The hotel is opposite SANS train station, you can see it to your right as you come out of the front entrance, by Mercadona supermarket. It is quite an ugly building, grey concrete, but don't let that put you off. the interior has been refurbished to a modern standard and the rooms are a good size and nicely appointed.I didn't get to see the roof top pool & bar as the weather wasn't great. I only used the bar in the restaurant on the 3rd floor, which was perfectly good.I can't comment on breakfast as we ate out each day, but it looked like a nice area.Check out was smooth but be aware you have to pay a tourist tax (ours was 7 euro per room).Overall a good base for sight seeing and taxis into the city centre were approx 10 euros and this hotel was quite a bit cheaper than the ones in the centre.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at the Expo hotel although a smile would have been nice when I checked in. I would say this was more a 3* hotel rather than a 4* as the room was basic. The bed was comfy, there was a fridge and a hairdryer and a balcony but the shower was atrocious, it didn't stay upright so had to wash holding the shower head and it was either too hot or too cold.I would rate the restaurant highly, the food was delicious and well presented and the staff were so friendly and lovely, they made up for the unpleasant reception. I only went up to the roof terrace once and it wasn't really busy, and I was quite surprised as to how small the pool actually was, compared to how it looked in the photos but a cool place to hang out on a hot sunny day and enjoy some drinks. All in all a pleasant stay, restaurant staff are amazing, reception staff should take some pointers from them, nice enough hotel in a great location with Sants Estacion a stones through away and a taxi rank right outside the hotel to take you wherever you need to go, the hop on hop off bus stops just behind Sants Estació and there is a supermarket right next door so you everything on your doorstep. I would stay here again.

review_body: Great location. Rooms are ok. Didn't have breakfast had dinner in bar, there are better places to eat within walking distance. Close to Sants train station which is handy. Found it a bit noisy but it was all external to hotel.

review_body: Lovely hotel near Sants Station. You can walk if not too much baggage - about 15 minutes maximum. Very comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic in its variety.Suggest buy a Hola Barcelona card if staying in city for two or more days. You can buy online and redeem voucher at any Metro station. There's a Metro station at Sants and you can get there from the airport.

review_body: Great hotel upon arrival we were so well greeted by sgfred mareille and the argintian receptionist. We were made to feel most welcome. The staff in the dinning room gave me milk for my Irish tea in my room. All the staff on the terrace amazing. Had a problem with food but food beverage manager Mr Quainton sorted it out. We are here for another week. Sun shinning happy hotel.Eileen

review_body: Wonderful location, friendly, helpful staff, delicious, expansive breakfast included.Very, very close to the train station.Good restaurants across the street and nearby. Reasonable price. Clean, comfortable room.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived last night at the hotel. Upon entrance the man behind reception was very polite and informative and willing to help in anyway, great start! We were even given a complimentary room upgrade which was very welcome and lovely, particularly considering our reasons for travel. After dumping belongings in the room, we headed for the rooftop terrace... food was expensive, as was drinks.. albeit to be expected for hotels own food. The burger itself was first class although for €11 I expected to get at least some fries with it. A plate of nachos was also another €9 so all in all an expensive meal.After paying I waited at the bar for my change while the man neither said thank you implying I had made a gratuity or asked if I would like to. They simply kept my change and walked off???? Very bizarre. Thus my already expensive meal became a little bit more expensive!The room are nice and clean, also modern with a comfy bed and an extra pillow which I had requested, thank you! Although I struggled to sleep unbelievably due to the air con being more of a heater than a cooler! We were absolutely sweltering... I am yet to complain about this and see what is said.Breakfast was €16 each and was in fairness relatively good. Although I do believe a price of €10 would draw more customers in as I won’t be going back for my remaining two nights due to the price of it. Much cheaper breakfast can be found local to the hotel.Location is slightly out of where you would probably like to be but it is easy enough to get to the tube stations.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Since we are traveling in and out of Barcelona, we booked three separate reservations at Expo. When we made the reservation, the hotel confirmed we could store our luggage between visits (the three reservations were all within a 10 day period). When we arrived to pick up part of our luggage and head to the airport, they declined to store the rest of our luggage. Despite what we explained, the supervisor refused (there was plenty of room in the luggage room). We did a mad scramble in order to store our luggage and make our flight. We booked a room around the corner at the Hotel Torre Catalunya. They were happy to hold our luggage for 5 days until our return. We then hailed a taxi to the airport (vs less expensive plan to take the bus) and just made our flight to Bilbao in time. Because there was no time, we paid 100 euro more for the hotel and more for the taxi. Not cool Expo staff. By the way, the maid did not clean the room during our stay. She only made the bed. The trash was full, etc

review_body: Very nice hotel right by the train station. We had a little balcony and the room was spacious and clean. The reception staff were really helpful and we were able to check in a little early which is always a relief to lose the luggage. Looking at summer prices for this hotel I think we got a great price for the time of year and the facilities.

review_body: This hotel was lovely, great location for all, it is without walking distance of the stations, great restaurants near by and within walking distance of the magic fountain.Hotel it’s self is the perfect place to stay, staff on reception were lovely and cleaners were amazing! Room was cleaned everyday! Room was also lovely... yes it’s noisy at night but that’s a city for you, would be the same if you went and stayed in London Lovely stay for first time in Barcelona, will be returning

review_body: I was extremely satisfied with the accommodations at Expo. First of all, its literally across the street from the main train station Estacio Sants and 10 minute walk to the Placa Espanya. Most of the major bus lines are near the hotel which is excellent if you're not renting a car and just walking. The hotel itself was great, the friendly check-in staff was very helpful and the rooms were very well prepared and comfortable. You're going to be touring most of the day so coming back to a clean room is a luxury! Thank you Expo!

review_body: The expo hotel barcelona was well set up friendly and helpful was well placed for transport links the rooms were clean and spacious well worth the visit i brought my son to visit the nou camp and general sight seeing and exploring

review_body: The hotel is clean, comfortable, well equipped. Staff is professional and friendly. Well situated, close to metro and lots of sights. The breakfast is absolutely rich with big choice. We would have liked to change our room to 2 bed room, itwas not possible, but what was ununderstandable that they could not solve the change the double blanket for two single. Why? Inspite ot it we were satiesfied wirh the hotel and its services.

review_body: The only good thing to say can be the balcony with a chair where there was not another chair in the room. At check in I was told that we could not sleep in the same room ; me my wife and two kids at the ages of 1.5 and 4 . The only thing that I have to say the reservation was made for one person but I never expected that we could not stay in that room even I prepared for the extrapersons bills. I did not know that it was illegal to stay and sleep in that room as a family. Even ready for the extra persons bill but I was told noway. And was reminded that we could be cheched at night whether I was there or not Sooo surprised and dissappointed . Anyway after 30 minutesI moved to another hotel where we had a nice family room. Further even I was alone I would not stay in this room for it was so below than my expectations.

review_body: Very nice hotel very close to historical Barcelona. Lots of good restaurants nearby the train station is right behind the hotel.Check in was fast and staff were very courteous and helpful. Walking tour is close by as well
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located to your right after exiting the train station( Barcelona Sants train station). A 2-3min walk really. It is wheel chair accessible.Upon booking with voyage-prive, our room was upgraded.All hotel staff were good and friendly.The room was clean and stayed that way after housekeeping did their thing each day.Also in the room was a fridge, flat tv and safe box, as well as a wardrobe/cupboard.Bathroom was well equiped and also had a pouch with soaps and gels, a comb and disposable shaving equipment. Very detail oriented i must say.I have seen people complain about having plastic coffee cups. Well, they are the same type of cups you would get at starbucks, tims, mc donalds etc. I dont see the big fuss.We had breakfast included in our deal. For me atleast, breakfast had all and much more. Eggs (scrambled, boiled, sunny side up), sausages, bacon, ham, bread croissants, cheese, tomato, muffins, yoghurt, juice, they even had hashbrown!!!We were on the 7th floor and pretty tired to hear any noise from outside.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Few meters to the station for metro and train, rooms are not well Furntured, it is clean, breakfast is nice , the most impressive thing is that staff their are highly supportive and ferindly behaving.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the hotel, was given details only a few weeks before travelling.The reception staff are friendly and welcoming. They are very attentive and helpful.A feature I liked was then breakfast was on the third floor, and away from reception, I liked that a lot.....and they do gluten free bread upon request (ask early as it takes 15 minutes obviously frozen) their Buffett section was amazing from cold and hot, fruit cheese. Really good. Did not try dinner there ( see my other reviews)The only downside was that the pool and roof terrace being closed was not information I was given by “my” tour operator (have since found it reopens in May) The rooms are spacious and have balconies, however the wall is low so be careful with small children, rooms have a fridge which is handy, tea coffee facilities and an ironing board and hair dryer.There is a supermarket built underneath it too. Not a massive one but would do for essentials. The only downside was a little noisy on the station side, but that said would definitely say again
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although we as a family struggled to find it due to the blazing sun blocking our view of the hotel name we fully enjoyed our stay here ! Everywhere was spotless, Moredon and all the staff was friendly especially Andrea on reception who my 5 year old took a liking to ! The food was nice and the rooms were great. Pretty central for walking to places but also right next to train station and metro so only a ever a 10min journey away from anything else ! My only nab is the balcony’s are not child safe at all ! My little boy loved looking out on the balcony but we was feieghyend to death of him going out. And also the balcony door didn’t look which is a problem with a child who now and again sleep walks ! But they are small compared to all the great things this hotel offers.You can get the train from Barcelona airport to Sants estacio station and as you come out turn right and it is right there! Next to the dragon sculpture, just walk round the back to the doors it’s on top of a super market. Literally 2mins left ! We used the metro everyday to get to places and bought a T10 ticket which was 10euros.20 and we could use it 10timea so does take slight journey planning to make them last. Little Italian restaurant round the corner of the hotel is very nice and responsibly priced ! Stadium tour is amazing and we’ve never seen anything like Barcelona zoo ! Absolutely brilliant ! But we did pay £76 euros for the 3 of us to do the city bus tour which was overrated and over priced for what it is. Hope you’ve got something out of this review and it helps someone enjoy their visit to Barcelona :)
hotelName:

review_body: Have the best bar man and lady in Barcelona called Paulo and Emma . Nothing is no problem .make you feel welcome always smiling and look afte you . Have come to the same hotel 5 years and the reason is the people in the bar . Would always recommend Picasso

review_body: We stayed in the expo hotel which was suppose to be 4 star. They have plastic cups now for tea making in your room not good idea. The cleaner never replaced are used cups not good. The bathroom was not clean around the bath so this was not good. The bed was of good quality slept well. Overall it should be a 3 star not 4 star just a average place to stay now so we won’t be back.

0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here before getting a train to France so it was fine for one night and the staff put us in a clean and spacious room. However, it is one of the noisiest places I have ever stayed and I am a very deep sleeper. You could hear people speaking quietly in next door room and in the coridoors so we would not stay longer than a day. Reasonable price and the shower was excellent.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and i stayed here in august its a great hotel and near the city weather was great and kids loved it,we will return next summer.Bar is nice and all staf were good food was decent and price not too bad.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is decent enough....very strategically located near the Saints station.so bus/train/metro all are within walking distance. But don't venture out early morning (before 8) and be careful at night.Every chance you may get pick pocket as they operate in groups. How shameful and how much bad name it gives to this wonderful city
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is good - right by the railway station. The rooms are perfectly adequate and clean. There was a bit of a smell of drains in our room. Nothing exceptional but served it’s purpose when in town watching Barcelona play. Not a hotel to take a mistress...
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Due to both, its concrete architecture and its location at major roads it is very noisy day and night. Every step your neighbours walk is transported through the walls and I could easily follow the conversations of the people in the next room. Two four lane roads are passing the building and their noise prevented me from opening the balcony door. Even with the doors closed I learned more about the schedule of Barcelona busses than I wanted to. With the balcony door closed due to noise the restaurants smell outside was not such a big problem.The people working here are interesting. Reception staff is not very helpful. They seemed reluctant to care about the customer, even though I was the only one around. Worst is the breakfast Stasi, a lady lurking behind a desk in the breakfast room, waiting for you to pass and then yelling behind you “Sorry Sir, sorry” so that you have to return to tell her your room number. Friendly service looks different to me and since Honekers and Francos time such attitude should have been extinct.But there are sunny sides as well. The cleaners I have met where all friendly and really nice. So, poor sleep, bad staff. What about breakfast then? The best about the breakfast are the Korean hotel guests. They are lovely, curious and friendly. The food was the same for 4 days, for Spain a pretty good breakfast, the coffee is good. WiFi coverage is good.The location is too far to walk into the city centre.So next time I either take a hotel in the heart of the city or outside at the beach.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the time of our stay, expo hotel were experiencing some problems with google, they were showing up on google maps on the opposite end of carrier de mallorca This information wasn't forwarded by either the hotel or booking.com in days leading to check in, as a result. It took 4 taxi rides starting @ sants train station, costing €48 ( which is only across the road,) into the middle & been dropped on a corner & told it was opposite side of a building, we ended up walking from here to taxi to be taken back to same spot, repeatedly , this went on for over 2 hours, language barrier didn't help. You couldn't Write it, Its that unbelievable, it was like groundhog day.Thankfully we can laugh about it now To the hotel, it itself is good, beds are comfy,rooms are cleanish, views from bedroom was onto a carpark.Breakfast was amazing, Rooftop bar has a great atmosphere, bar staff were warm friendly & fun, food was nice. The reception staff let the place down. After a very lengthty & costly unnessecary road trip around the 1 way system of barcelona, with ourselves & every taxi driver following google maps,having spoken to girl on reception about this, she got very defensive, they were aware of the situation, their attitude was, it was googles fault, They were trying to get it fixed for weeks,that she'd get the manager to email me, which of course they never did.The hotel is located to the right, just the far side of taxi rank, as you come out front of sants train station. It's location is fantastic, there's a fabulous restaurant across the road, to the right on the end of street called roma. It was amazing. Rooftop pool wasn't open when we there, which was a bit of a let down, us been irish the weather @ 21 degrees is perfect pool weather .I'd definetly stay again, Now that i know where it is.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel could not be better located! It’s a two minute walk to the main train station. As you leave the train station, look to your right and you will see the name of the hotel up high - it’s that easy! Took 15 mins to get from the airport to it on a train and cost very little as we bought the T-10 ticket (€10) which allowed the 3 of us to use the one card and have 7 trips left over for our stay. The triple room was comfortable and clean. We never ate here as room only rate, but there are so many very good places across the road and around the corner. Check in was very easy and the staff were helpful. We would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stop over on the way through Barcelona, easy book in with welcoming staff. Room was large, great bed really comfy we did get a free upgrade. Roof top bar was amazing with great views of the city, even in Oct it was open and not too expensive for city center. Quick check out process which helped as we were in a rush for train. Didn’t do breakfast so can’t comment.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights, was welcomed and checked in early, room available, with upgrade provided as we had booked through 2 different agencies. Staff knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast was good, lots of choice. Room had view over hills behind, and station, which although busy was not too noisy. Air conditioning in room was good. Bathroom large and good range of toiletries. Only bit of shame that website states rooftop terrace closes in September, but its just the pool that closes, so an hour before we left we discovered the rooftop terrace was open, but empty as guests were not informed of its availability. Would go back as it was great location and very friendly hotel.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only had one night here on our way to our cruise, and before we arrived the staff could not be more helpful. They arranged a bottle of champagne and a card for our friends birthday which was delivered as agreed. Wonderful service. The hotel has large clean rooms and is in a great location. Getting around by underground is easy. The staff are very friendly and accomodating and couldn't do more for us. Thanks.
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi! If you are on the business trip, please, keep in your mind about documents and wifi.Regarding wifi - it just does not work well. But the main problem was with providing documents like invoice etc. Because reception said we will provide on checkout time. But on checkout time, said we did not say it and of course, we will provide, but you need to wait a few days for get docs from other company. Therefore I provided my email for scans. I did not get any email till end of September, then I have dropped email and got reject. It is really terrible.Cheers,reservation number 151312363628
hotelName:
0    Expo Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a three night stay in August and was very pleased. Excellent location with restaurants and shops outside the door inc a 24hr supermarket round the corner with very competive prices. Paid for a room upgrade at 40e extra per night but was dissapointed that breakfast was an extra 25e each as we did not book directly with the hotel. The room was sized ok, good drinks machine and minibar with free water daily. The room was spotless as was the Bathroom, the shower was excellent. The rooftop pool and bar area was good and we spent most of one day sunbathing there. If returning to the city we would stay here again.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in a good neighborhood. Short walk to two subway stations. Great little roof top bar and pool. Nice exercise room. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff were efficient and friendly. We had a nice little balcony on which to enjoy our morning espresso that was provided for free in the room. Also, two bottles of water provided for free each day.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed one night in this hotel before taking our flight back home. The location is good but the hotel really lacks any atmosphere despite all the arts around. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony which was a nice gesture. However we found the room was dated and in need of a refreshment, especially the bathroom.Staff was very helpful and nice.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great start to our weekend, the first guest at our party arrived before 10am and the room was already available. The hotel is well presented and welcoming. As a room of three girls, we found that there was sufficient space for all of our bags and belongings. We were located on the first floor with our balcony backing onto the terrace. We enjoyed the use of the pool on many occasions over the weekend, making good use of the bar and receiving friendly service from the barmen.The hotel were very accomodating in providing us with ironing boards and irons and it was good to see a full size hairdryer provided in the bathroom. We did not eat within the hotel but found many local places nearby to enjoy. We made use of the electric scooters available in reception, exploring the city in a new and exciting way. These cost €19 for the day, we had ours for more than 5 hours and there was plenty of battery remaining. Rooms were cleaned daily with clean towels and a lovely addition of rituals toiletries.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights in the Junior Suite (We were upgraded from a terrace room). The suite is lovely, massive, very comfortable bed with a great bathroom. Everything about the hotel was brilliant and made put short trip to Barcelona very enjoyable. You get lots of little extras, free bottled water every day, free chocolates and cookies, sun cream available to use by the pool, free welcome drinks. Breakfast was impressive and free if you book direct with the hotel, loads of choice and served until 11 which suited us as we're not early risers.The staff were all helpful and friendly.Would really recommend staying at this hotel.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The H10 franchise has a series of hotels spread around Barcelona. For our first trip to Barcelona, we studied the various areas that we wanted to see. Our thought process was tempered by the knowledge that we had only one day to cram in as much as we could. Further, we wanted to walk to as many attractions as possible. Factoring in the variables important to us, we rolled the dice with the H10 Art Gallery. We came out winners. The Art Gallery was everything that we wanted, meeting and surpassing all of our desires. They are located on a beautiful tree lined one way street. The seven story hotel is nicely framed with other buildings that came together to provide us a sense of vibe of the city. We arrived early morning after a transatlantic flight. Although we could not check into our rooms until afternoon, the hotel staff was great. They placed all our luggage in a secure room for storage. They provided us complimentary juices and water. They also gave us a great map of Barcelona, circled some suggested sites and got us started on our own self guided tour. The area immediately around the Art Gallery has many pubs and restaurants, within a few dozen feet of the main entrance are several. Further, within a couple block radius are dozens. Of course, the hotel itself has two bars and a restaurant. None in our foursome spoke Spanish, but we had zero communication issues at the hotel or anywhere else around the city. Not that everyone was fluent in English, but many had a very workable understanding. Speaking no Spanish, amazing how clearly I understand someone else speaking even a small amount of English. The people of the city could not have been any more friendly. As stated, we easily walked to various sites including Casa Mile (La Pedrera), Palau Baro de Quadras, Basilica de la Sagrada Familia, Passeig de Gracia (with Casa Batllo, Casa Bonet, Casa Mulleras & Placa de Catalunya), La Rambla (Barcelona's Social Hub) with La Boqueria Market, Palau Guell and the Christopher Columbus Monument. We even made it down to the port and walked along the Rambla de Mar. Of course, along the hike, we periodically stopped in at a side walk cafe for a glass of wine or beer. We had an excellent day walking around the city, facilitated by the great location of the Art Gallery hotel. Once back to the hotel, we checked into our rooms. The rooms were not large but we only needed a place to sleep. The room furnishings were fresh, clean and comfortable. The bathroom too was wonderful. Being there in late June, we appreciated that the A/C worked well. Also are WiFi included. We had a very comfortable, restful nights sleep. The next morning, a free buffet breakfast was included (cereals, coffee, juices, milk, eggs, sausage, ham, yoghurt, breads, rolls and more). The breakfast was extremely excellent - more than enough to get us ready for the day. Upon checking out that morning, the hotel helped us secure a taxi. The taxi stand was just down the block maybe 30 meters. Upon arriving at the taxi stand, we immediately had a cab. We loved our stay at the H10 Art Gallery. Again they met and exceeded all of our needs. We would gladly return, perhaps for multiple nights in order to further explore Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was very friendly and efficient with a lovely glass of sparkling wine. The hotel is lovely with beautiful modern art throughout. The bedroom and bathroom were good sized and looked well. We booked through the hotel website and had complimentary breakfast which was very nice with a great choice of food. All the staff throughout the hotel were very accommodating and helpful. The Metro was a short walk away. There were a selection of restaurants and coffee shops nearby. I would definitely return to this hotel if I was in Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel with nice staff, good location and fair prices. Located in a nice area of Barcelona with restaurants, bars and shops nearby. We really enjoyed the hotel and the staff was nice and efficient.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Barcelona recently with my parents and found these hotel chain. Though I have been in Barcelona many times, it wasn't until now that I got a chance to stay in any their hotels. I loved the hotel, it was a good location ( Though I know there are others that are closer to the main city center depending on your budget). The rooms were spacious enough and the perks you get if you sign up to become a member is just great! You get a welcoming drink and also a drink at either 2 of their bars. The breakfast was really great, you get a plentiful choice of hot and cold items, coffee, the awesome orange juice and the attention by the staff was incredible. In terms of the pool...unless is something really important to you..It is small, and is at the rooftop. Everyone was helpful, incredible genuine and friendly. The hotel grounds are pristine and all the small personal touches like the nespresso machine in the room, the complimentary mini bar (if you become a member), the robes...all makes this my new hotels of choice when visiting Spain.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can't rate this hotel highly enoughLovely welcoming staff in the reception and bar areasSpotlessly cleanLovely room (stayed in room 110, cant speak for other rooms :))Nespresso coffee machineAutomatic lights that are just enough to stop you stubbing a toe in the middle of the night without waking other half upLovely extras like toothbursh, shaving equipment, etcBrilliant location
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is good value for the money I think. I have stayed before a night before a cruise and we did it again. Walking distance to Los Rambles and great coffee shops nearby. Good for short stay. I would stay yet again :)
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to Barcelona for the birthday of our daughter who celebrated 15-year-old. We were 4 persons, booked 2 rooms for 2 nights. When we are arrived, we were given a room so small that we cannot stand still in the room, we have to sit on the bed. 2 persons cannot be in the same time in the bathroom, you can sit on the toilets and brush your teeth on the sink in the same time. The other room for the children was very noisy and smoking! We were explained that they could not change our rooms. The bedroom is not even 6 M2 ! Just the place to put a bed and one suitcase! Nothing to do with what we saw in their website which shows big rooms. This is pure lies and dishonesty. We are used to travelling abroad a lot but never experienced such a tiny room for 250euros a night!
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 nights at this hotel and had a wonderful stay. The room was large and comfortable and the staff welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was a highlight particularly on the first morning when we were able to order hot food off the menu to supplement the cold buffet which had a good variety of food.. The fruit was very tasty and we particularly enjoyed the Orange juice and Nespresso coffees. For the other days the hot food was also buffet style and it was not up to the same standard but the staff were always willing to make us some chocolate con churros. The hotel is in close proximity to a range of good restaurants and Large Ramblas. We were also able to easily walk to Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia and also to the tennis stadium and Camp Nou as they were all within less than 4km. The walks were all enjoyable as the roads and buildings are beautiful.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel the week of April 17th. The hotel is beautiful and original. The room with a terrace for three was a perfect size for us. Very clean, whatever supplies we needed were replenished on time. The cleaning staff, front desk staff, and breakfast staff are very friendly and always available to assist. The breakfast was excellent- great variety of meats and cheeses, juices, cava, hot eggs dishes and delicious churros with hot chocolate.We were concerned with the reviews that mentioned construction noise- but while we heard it, it didn’t bother us. As to the thin walls- again no complaints, even though our room was right by the elevators.The location is right in the center of all. We walked everywhere - no need for metro. Taking a taxi is a great and cheap option.Overall would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Flawless...that is how I would describe this hotel. Spotlessly clean, with super helpful staff. The decor is amazing and the amount of artwork on the walls if just a joy to behold. It is an art lovers paradise. This hotel is classified as 3 star superior - this is way too low a classification. It goes above and beyond in every sense. I am someone who finds fault in every hotel, but in this one...nothing. Possibly the only niggle was the size of the bedrooms, but the space in the building is confined and they do the best they can with it. That said, I didn't go to Barcelona to spend the day in my bedroom, so it served it's purpose. Would I stay here again? Happily!
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a H10 member and travel to Barcelona often. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. I have stayed at H10 before, but like anything, the staff make the product. This staff sucks. The location is a bit out of the hub bub of the city action but close enough to walk.This is a convention hotel - when I say this, that is who they cater to. I walked in every night at midnight, asking for Ice in a glass to take to my room. There was a corporate party going on blocked by barriers. The front desk told me to walk in and get it.... I was shocked. Typically, they say, I will send it to your room. He pointed to the party, continued chatting with his friend and said -" Go ask the Bar."The room was nice - but again, they had a hard time replacing coffee, cream or used cups. I will not stay here again.... I suggest you don't. I LOVE the H10 METROPOLITAN!!!!
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came in the hotel for one night, we were upgraded to the Junior Suite as it was available and we were only staying for a Night.The room was perfect: Large bubble bathtub, rain shower, giant comfy bed, living room area and very luminous ! Insonorisation is perfect as we did not hear a thing once in the room. Only thing is that the room has no balcony.Staff is very friendly and breakfast is good.One of the best point of the hotel is that it is super well located ! You are at walking distance of many point of interest in Barcelona.I would absolutely come back to the hotel.Quentin
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights and absolutely loved it! First of all we noticed that the location is fab with it only being a 5 minute walk away from the diagonal/provença metro station which gives you access to every part of Barcelona if you don’t want to walk, and ensures you don’t have to lug your suitcase for miles when going to and from the airport. When checking in we were greeted by lovely and helpful staff who gave us a welcome drink which you choose from juice, champagne or water, and are given a map of the city as well as a leaflet for the hop on hop off bus tour. The room was a good size, very modern and clean with a very comfy bed and huge shower of good quality! The whole stay we kept getting surprised with the lovely small touches by the staff which go a long way, for example when we returned from a day in the city we were greeted with chocolates and cookies on our bed, we got free crisps when drinking at the bar and we got a free drink each at the bar for becoming h10 member which costs nothing to join! The breakfast was gorgeous with a continental range of breads, yoghurts, meats and cereals etc, and then you could order hot food from a menu. We tried pretty much everything over the 4 days including crepes, scrambled and poached eggs, bacon, mushrooms and beans, and we weren’t disappointed with any of the dishes. Everything was cooked fresh, tasted lovely and was presented very well. Overall I cannot recommend this hotel enough and we are definitely going to look out for these hotels when booking anywhere again.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and even though it didn’t promise much at the beginning, it turned out to be quite a pleasant surprise!The hotel has a clean look, the rooms are quite spacious and is well located, since it’s close to Metro and FGC stations and also to Passeig de Gràcia.I also have to compliment the food variety at breakfast, which got even better with the hot plates menu (tip: try the Nutella pancakes, they are amazing!).I would only say that the hotel should improve the breakfast organization, since it was quite hard for personnel to focus and fulfill all their tasks, as well as the way to connect to the wifi network, which is way too complicated.Overall, I would recommend staying this hotel if you are looking for a good night of sleep followed by a quality breakfast.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the end, hotel is about the experience. The many small details make it a non memorable experience. In a so called 4 star hotels, I wouldn’t expect to have to call the front desk to get toilet paper or soap, as there was none after cleaning (more than once). I also would not expect a “you must go downstairs to get your bottle of wine openned” response. All in all, It was way below expectation, nothing really stood out as really good. On the lighter side, location is great.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights. Great hotel and location. Too cold to use the pool but it looked lovely. Breakfast good although waiting staff appear disinterested. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Will return.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were here two weeks ago, first of all the hotel is very nice, the breakfast and service is good. When we arrived in this hotel we had to pay the bill immediately. We got basic room on second floor, the room was to small and to dark. We have always heard of the use of the toilet in the room above us.Unfortunately the room is very bad for reason we couldn’t enjoy 100% in our relaxing.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week at the H10 Art Gallery hotel in Barcelona.Overall our experience was great. The room was small, but we only went in to sleep and shower since Barcelona is such a wonderful city. The other minimal amount of time we spent at the hotel was at the rooftop pool, which was very nice and offered great views. Get there early if you want to get a good spot though as it is kind of small up there.The hotel was located in a fairly quiet area, away from much of the hustle of Las Ramblas. Taxi stand right out front and a metro stop a block away. We chose this hotel specifically on price, which was great. Since we planned to explore the city alot, we didn't require anything fancy, but this hotel went above our expectations. The employees were very nice and the hotel was very clean. The bathroom in the room was also very nice.We did alot of walking and came back some nights very late and never felt as if the area around the hotel was unsafe. Next time we might try to stay a little closer to a more "major" area, but if you don't mind walking a few extra blocks, this hotel is great.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our 5 nights in this hotel. Rooms were not big but breakfast was great! Location was quiet and near to luxorious shops. Only minus was that the beds were 190 cm, not 2 m long! The junior suite was the only one with 2 m bed...
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A pleasant, modern hotel in the centre of Barcelona. Quite easy reached using Aerobus direct from the airport. I got off at the Placa Universitat stop from which it is a simple10-15 minutes walk once you get orientated. There is also a metro station about 50 m from the hotel from which you can get easy access around the city. Would certainly stay here again- breakfast buffet was very good by Spanish standards
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night before going back home. We wanted something decent / economical for our last night in Spain since we had an early flight the next morning. The staff was really nice, and offered Champagne during check-in. I believe breakfast was 15 or 16 Euros which is not that expensive for a hotel. However, I recommend eating outside at a cafe where breakfast typically run 7 to 8 Euros. This hotel is only a few blocks away from Passeig de Gràcia (high end shopping and access to the train.)Overall it was a nice hotel, but the rooms are small. If you are on a budget I would recommend staying here as it's cozy hotel, but don't expect luxury.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this hotel as we have stayed at H10 hotels before and they are always good and it didnt let us down. The hotel was very clean and tidy as we walked in and welcomed with a drink. The room was excellent bright and very modern the bathroom had a walk in shower and spacious. We had breakfast and it was excellent plenty of choice and plenty of it. The staff are very friendly and very helpful they couldnt do enough for us . The decor was good as it was based on different artists very interesting. The manager should be very proud of his staff.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would not recommend for a business trip. I was in a superior room, which was okay, but I wonder how basic the normal rooms were. The desk was very small, the Wi-fi in the room slow (faster in the bar) and not a proper chair to sit and work at.Service was mediocre the entire time across the entire hotel. The bathroom venting didn’t seem to do anything other than letting the essence of cigarette smoke come in to your bathroom periodically. On my second night I returned to find the voile curtain had been removed, which meant you had to leave the curtains closed in the morning as you would have no privacy. The following day two mismatched ones were installed in their place, but they didn’t fit so left a 30cm gap between them as they were too small; in essence same problem. They had fixed the large window that had a gap large enough to put fingers through, which on the first night I had to pack with tissue paper to reduce the external noise and breeze.Odd lighting situation, where the bedside light worked off the main switch so if you wanted that on you had to have the main ceiling lights on. I did enjoy the welcome glass of cava while checking in though. As of November 2018 there is construction going on next door which seemed to work through the night which while not massively noisy did disturb me. Rooms are small, barely enough room to do a cramped yoga session in the morning. I wouldn’t go back because of these things.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really surprises me that both the reviews and hotel website fail to mention there is a major construction project next door and it is VERY LOUD. Upgraded (and paid more) for a room to face Enric Granados as the interior room was very claustrophobic. The street view room was viewed at lunch and it was quiet b/c the construction was on break. Was awakened quite early the following morning to jack hammers, drills, etc. It would have been nice if the staff had informed of this.Note the interior rooms are quite small and no privacy due to the nature of the window facing the elevator courtyard and all other rooms. It might be good for one night but not for a longer period.The hotel is at a good location, amenities as stated, etc. The breakfast is extensive with eggs and hot dishes made to order, pastries, bread, charcuterie, cheeses, fruit, juices and coffee.In the end cannot recommend staying here due to the very loud construction.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights as a group of 4 friends. We received a voucher on check in for a free cocktail to redeem in the hotel bar which was a nice touch. We had an internal room, which I was worried about as I have stayed in hotels before where you are looking at a brick wall, but this was nice as you had a door that opened onto a courtyard so it didn’t feel claustrophobic. The hotel is in a nice spot with a good choice of popular bars and restaurants on your doorstep, but it’s a lovely leafy quiet area. About a 15 min walk to Sagrada Família and other sights. Breakfast had a decent selection, can’t complain for what you got, as it was included in the price. Room was a decent size with a coffee machine and docking station and enough wardrobe space. Good bathroom amenities and a lovely shower and a great feature where a little light comes on when you walk in, which is great for the middle of the night not having to search for the light switch. My only complaint about the hotel, which did have an impact on my weekend was the bathroom door!! What a terrible design! It’s a frosted glass door, but it has at least a 1 inch gap where it is hinged so when it’s closed you can see right through. This wasn’t just our door, as our fiends door was the same and that’s the way it’s been fitted. You could hear and see everything, which when you are away with a friend it makes it quite awkward! That is the only reason I wouldn’t give the hotel 5 stars as it really was a hindrance.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: IT's relatively big room compare to Paris hotel. People were nice there. The location is a big plus!!! It's like 10 mins walk to casa mile and 15-20walk to casa batilo. Overall I had a great stay and if I ever visit Spain again, I would come back!
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights in the H10 Art Gallery. Overall I would say that, for what we paid for, it was good value for money. The room, even though it was small and quite limited space, was really clean and well maintained each day by housekeeping. Fresh, modern interior and a nice bathroom with a really good shower. The bed was very comfortable. It has a lovely rooftop pool area which was perfect for chilling in the sun in the afternoon. Location wise, we felt it was well placed in terms of accessibility to all main tourist attractions. We could get to Las Ramblas in 15 minutes easily. We were able to get to all the various tourist attractions and areas of the city on foot, but close by are metro stations and bus stops. The only negative would be the breakfast. There was a small selection of cereals, fruits, toast/croissants etc and you had the option to order from a small menu. We were quite surprised that when we ordered scrambled eggs on toast, we were presented with a small, thin, disc of bread with some egg piled on top. It looked like it was trying to mimic some kind of fine dining. Not really necessary for breakfast. The restaurant manager had a bad attitude and was not welcoming at all. I would definitely stay in this hotel again if returning to Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Elegant ambiance awaits you in this luxurious hotel. Comfortable rooms complete with all the amenities you want. Attentive Staff cater to you needs, but are also knowledgeable of the points of interest through the city to direct you where you'd like to visit. If you're visiting Barcelona, this is the hotel you want!
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just recently stayed for 7 nights here and had the loveliest time. Fabulous ambiance from check in until checkout. Great room. Great breakfast. Nice attendant staff especially fernando Lovely rooftop terrace. Great area. Won’t stay anywhere else when we return to Barcelona. Just loved it
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location in city quite a quiet street. Room with balcony was lovely not much of a view though. The rainfall shower was awesome.  The little issues we found was that on the bedding there was a huge stain on one of the quilts, we left bed unmade next morning with the stain on show and after the room was cleaned checked and it was still there we took it off the bed and left a note to replace they just took it away . Sunday when we stayed took ages we left the room numerous times waiting for it to be cleaned we had no towels , no shower gel , and clean cups , coffee , water . We went down to reception at 3pm and asked and said they would send cleaning up st 4.15pm we rang down to say nothing has arrived , they arrived about 10 mins after that call but couldn’t do much as we didn’t have the facility to anything within the room and had to wait all day pretty much . Breakfast was lovely the selection was great though two out of the five days we stayed we were given a menu for the eggs your own way however no one came and took the order, but for the days we order they were nice . The rooftop pool was a great feature , nice place to relax.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Things you want at a hotel- comfortable bed, cleanliness, helpful staff, quiet sleep, location location location. 10/10 this place has it all including a rooftop pool and a gym. There are excellent choices for dining, nightlife and shopping all around. Extremely walkable.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was ideal, on a quieter street and within walkable distance to some of the attractions. Close to plenty of places to eat. We went to the Italian Restaurant, La Piemontesa which was very good and virtually next door, quite a few times. We upgraded the room and had a balcony although the view wasn't too good so we didn't sit out. You were overlooked from all angles unfortunately. We loved the themed artists' floors. The room itself was lovely as was the bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We will most certainly visit Barcelona again and stay at this Hotel.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel on booking.com but cancelled it after seeing the added value of booking directly to the hotel (free breakfast, cheaper price, free WiFi). In the end we still paid 150 EUR for a deluxe room with terrace, which isn't too bad for an August in Barcelona, but certainly not cheap either.We arrived at the hotel late at night, and weren't offered a welcome drink. At the reservation I made 2 requests: a double bed and a quiet room. Unfortunately we were given a tiny room, directly opposite the elevator which was poorly maintained. When I complained about this, the reception said that all the rooms with double beds and terrace were directly opposite the elevator; luckly the manager "found" a room a little further away from the elevator the next day. It was quieter than the first room, so well appreciated. The room similarly showed signs of damage: wall paper torn and stained.Be careful and know that all the rooms are extremely tiny. You cannot open 2 large suitcase in the room. There is only 1 small chair to sit on. The bathroom was OK in size, clean, with a good shower. However, they have annoying lights with sensors that go on an off if someone uses the bathroom at night, causing the other person to wake up. The best aspect of the room was the terrace and the location of the hotel in Eixample: plenty of restaurants and bars very close to the hotel. Don't rent the bicycles of the hotel (20 EUR/bike/day); there are cheaper options a few blocks away. I don't understand why they don't give the bikes for free use... The small pool on the roof of the hotel was nice as well.Breakfast is decent but if it weren't included in the room rate, I wouldn't pay extra for it.The main reason why I won't return is when we got to the room on our 3rd day, the room was made up, but the bed sheet showed a large stain (dried up blood? Melted chocolate? Who knows...) which is completely unaccepable. I went down to the reception and asked them to change the linen while we went out for dinner. 2 hours later we came back and found that nothing had changed. I returned to the reception and 15 min later they sent housekeeping who changed the sheets. No apology was offered at any time. Totally and completely unaccaptable. The small size of the room was a disappointment but my fault (I should have researched better); the unprofessional housekeeping is something I cannot tolerate. There are better options available at that price.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our visit to this hotel such a good spot for everything with in easy walking distance! The rooms are small but provide all necessities and modern and clean and the air con was great in a very hot City! Lots of restaurants nearby and whilst we didn’t use the Hotel restaurant it looked nice and the reception staff were informative and friendly .. loved the area and would definitely go back ..
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this H10 hotel. It was near the action, just a couple of blocks from La Rambla, but on a quiet, tree lined street. Our room was very comfortable and well designed. The staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't get up there, but there is a rooftop pool, which I think is not common in European cities. There are a number of good restaurants nearby. The hotel breakfast is excellent.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to base your self. Food for breakfast is second to none.The girls get a great view of sexy male waiters.The rest of the pace is good as any 5-star worldwide.Well done to staff and the team running this place.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing 4 nights at the hotel for a city brea. Excellent locations and loads of cafes and restaurants nearby. The hotel was immaculately clean and had an added bonus of a roof top pool!! The best cocktails served in the bar my strawberry daiquiri was one of the best I’ve ever had!! Will defo be back
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this H10 for five nights. We did splurge for a junior suite, and the extra space was fabulous. Our friends were in a regular room which was a little on the small side. Rooms were clean and our bathroom was very large. All the front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We did the breakfast buffet out on the back patio three mornings and it was very nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second visit to Barcelona, but my first stay at the H10, I would come here again, great location to the metro,very clean hotel, shame breakfast wasn’t included in the price, was given lots of quotes, 13 Erous via email, then 18 and then 24,so we decided not to go ahead, bit confusing Staff were friendly on reception, nice pool area to sunbathe, overlooking roof tops,We had a meal at the bar,nice man served us with a smile, which I like to see,Only the downside was the chambermaid,The floor wasn’t cleaned, so we had to wear footwear, And the sheets weren’t changed,and no instructions how to use the coffee machine in the room, And we were only told there were no taxis to go to the airport, when we try to order the night before, a note in the hotel to the would have been great, like myselfI have a bad leg, and it was hard to struggle to get to the airport, But apart from the three hiccups, we had enjoyable stay,
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the H10 for our recent trip to Spain. Firstly, the decor of the hotel is absolutely beautiful. I love the art theme, and how each floor is devoted to a particular artist. The front desk upon arrival were very helpful and friendly! Our rooms were very clean, and cool (which is great during the summertime in Spain). The location of the hotel is excellent. It's in a more quiet part of Spain and in walking distance to many restaurants and bars. Each restaurant we tried were in this particular area and they were very good. We also loved just the atmosphere of this area. Further, the location is right by a taxi stand, which is super convenient when having to go to the train station or airport. The breakfast was good as well. They had a nice variety to choose from and all were very good. I also love that we were in walking distance to so many important sights in Barcelona. This is a place we will definitely stay in the future because were really enjoyed our time here!
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a room for a few nights in the hotel. Rooms are very stylish and service was excellent. Lovely pool at rooftop, would highly recommend. The hotel is also very central, walking distance from main landmarks and only a block away from the metro station. They made us feel very special during our stay.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fantastic experience at this wonderful hotel. We booked online direct through the hotel & signed up to their rewards program. We got a better rate than all the so called on line discount websites such as booking.com etc. On arrival the hotel had upgraded our room to a deluxe room. The rooms are not huge but nicely furnished with a great balcony. Beautiful bathrooms. Clean & refreshed everyday. The inclusive breakfast is amazing, so much choice and the staff super efficient and friendly. Situated a 5 minute walk from the designer shops of La Rambla. Highly recommended. Oh and a huge plus for me free champagne (Cava) every morning for breakfast. Win , Win.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very clean, modern hotel with an extremely friendly and accommodating staff. You are welcomed within the first few seconds as you enter the hotel. They have wonderful, clean common areas, a great pool deck and a very nice bar. The coffee makers in the room were such a nice touch. Espresso in the morning is a wonderful way to start the day. The hotel was within walking distance of shops and wonderful restaurants. This hotel set the tone for our visit to Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel, the staff here are fantastic and really care about its guests. We arrived around 10am but check in wasn’t til 3 but we were greeted with a choice of drinks and given maps and directions and they took our bags to store. The hotel is in a lovely area with a great selection of places to eat and drink and close to main attractions.When we came back around 4pm our rooms weren’t ready and we had to wait in the lobby for around 15 mins however for this “inconvenience “ we were given a voucher for 2 free cocktails in the bar.The rooms here are small but perfectly formed and there are very nice “Rituals” toiletries in the bathroom. Although this is a very popular hotel in a good location, it never felt crowded. While on our last day my wife fell over and was quite poorly, the staff on reception did everything to get us to the best hospital.
