review_body: From the check in to check out terrible experience. Poor service. Not worth it for value of moneyThe staff at the reception are not friendly and professional i dont that they have hospitality background.The rooms towards the road is noicy you litterly hear everything happenig oustide on the road the whole night. There is no enought staff at the hotel to serve the guest. Whatever you need the reception will answer by we dont have enought staff please come down and collect by yourself. location good but service is very poor and more over the staff at the reception are very rude. Really dispointed.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because of the location. The hotel itself was really great and were very pleased with our room and everything else. There are only a few options for food nearby that we found and it is a little bit far if you are walking from a metro station. We had two big suitcases and walked a good mile and a half to get there, which was our own fault with planning. But just so you don't make the same mistake, take a cab if you have a lot of luggage. We did walk from the hotel to La Sagrada Familia, which was not terrible. Just don't do it at night or with kids. It's fine if you are solo or a couple that doesn't mind walking a couple of miles. Room Tip: keep your curtains closed during the day while you are away, the sun made our corner room very hot with them open. If you keep the curtains closed it's fine, we did that the next day and it wasn't hot anymore.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked my room five months in advance. When I arrived on Saturday 15th of June you made me pay the full charge and after that, without any significant apologies, informed me that due to a technical problem the room had no electricity (no lights, no television, no hair drier, ecc.). At the beginning no alternative solution was offered since I was told that on Saturday (as well as the following day) was impossible to solve the issue and the hotel was fully booked. After various complaints (I was travelling with two kinds and one of them was just 2 years old and it was dangerous to leave them in the nights without any light) a room finally came up. I have never seen such an unprofessional behaviour and will never attend a Fraser's facility again.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel!!! Amazing staff!!! This hotel is great place to stay, with great rooms and amazing breakfast. We will stay again. It is located in the residential neighborhood. Supermarket and pharmacy close by. Sagrada Familia is 20 minutes away, on foot.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great in all three: (1) the location is near to Metro station, (2) the room was nice and (3) the staff was courteous. We are a family of 2+2, and we had a wonderful stay here. For the amount that we paid, it was value for money. More importantly, we were really happy to stay here.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed with different Fraser’s hotel around the world and this was the simplest we seen. It’s new and clean. The sofa bed was not nice to stay in. Reception staff were friendly and helpful and so was the breakfast staff. Breakfast was good and fresh ! Location is I the more shabby parts of Barcelona so make sure you don’t get into any inconvenience if you are out and about at night.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good things:1. Location. It's not center of the city but it is located quite nicely. 2 tube stations near by, 15-20 minutes walk to either beach or Sagrada Familia.2. Room equipment was very nice. Owen/plates/cutlery/toaster/kettle/frying pan/safe all here. Although toilet brush was missing.3. Retractable clothes line which is nice addition to anybody that's going to the beach.4. And that's pretty much it.... Now:Bad things:1. Hotel service doesn't respect your privacy. When you have do not disturb sign on, they will still enter and want to do the room.2. One day when the were even asked not to do room, they still did it and took a soap with them and didn't put a new one.3. When asked reception to deal with it I've got the soap. I've also asked not to do my room until I checkout, yet still my room was done.4. Ecology... Not a greatest thing. They still were changing towels even though they were not on the floor.5. Aircon wasn't cleaned for some time I guess. When I turned it on and left for an hour, room was stinking...6. It seems that my room was somewhere close to some smoking rooms. As every now and then I could smell cigarretes coming through vents... Not a pleasant experience.7. For some reason hotel is 'locked' and to get into the hotel you need either a hotel card, or call reception via bell which is slightly confusing if you've never been here before.8. Two different bulbs in bedside lamps.9. My room was missing DND sign. Reception just shook their heads and said 'it has to be there' - there wasn't...
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay in Barcelona and the hotel was fantastic! Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. It’s an easy location to get around the city and conveniently has a taxi stop right outside! Great place
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel, facility wise, is spot on; its clean, tidy and has everything you need. I have withheld two dots because we were given a ground floor room right next to the intersection of two pedestrian paths. This meant that we were woken from 6 am by the constant clip clop of high heels and loud conversations as the walkway was literally straight outside our window. We also kept the curtains closed at all times as it felt like we were in some kind of goldfish bowl due to the proximity of pedestrians.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel and lovely room (606). Excellent breakfast. Very helpful catering and reception staff. Sound proofing between rooms not the best but we were not disturbed during the night. Basic cooking facilities.Two small supermarkets nearby (within 5 mins walk) and one larger 'Consum' 15mins walk towards the beach.Immediate vicinity of hotel did look a little run down in places but it is a very good (and quiet) location to access Barcelona's sights. 25-30 mins walk from Sagrada Familia and Bari Gotic area. 5 mins walk to two Metro lines with easy and cheap city access tickets. Taxi to airport cost 40euros for two people with 2 suitcases.Our second stay here and we would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay just minutes from the metro station. We stayed three nights and the facilities are fantastic. Very nice, clean spacious rooms with excellent kitchen facilities. The decor is lovely too. Coffee and tea available in room. Room very comfortable and nice large bathroom. Would definitely stay here again & would recommend. Nice lemon & lime water in reception area - nice touch.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights at Capri by Fraser and the experience has been very good. The kitchen was amazing as we had our two kids with us. The hotel is clean. The location is very good and the rooms are large.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location - quiet , accessible, while not in a central place so much. Excellent staff and service. Very comfortable 1BR suite which was perfect for us with a 17 y old child. Using the Gym and it was very suitable. Nice decor too. Highly recommended
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 4 with 2 children given ground floor room (107) which is very very noisy .Reception staff just said it will stop.I don’t normally write reviews and really upset with the noise and disturbance.In the end u want a good night sleep after a long day.No signs of stopping and very uncomfortable with 2 young children.Have travelled to so many places and have never stayed in such a noisy place before.Also they couldn’t even rearrange a quite room -esp when traveling with kids.If I had known I would not have booked this apartment.I will not book again .
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel at a good location. Perfect for families due to the spacious room and bathroom and kitchenette. We were their with two kids and enjoyed it a lot, it was very convinience for us to have a bedroom as an extra room while kids were sleeping in the main room with kitchenette on convertable sofa.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Capri Barcelona is a really fun place to stay. The decor is cool and fun, the staff are super friendly, fun, and useful, and the apartments are really well thought-through - perfect for business or leisure.The hotel is just 15 mins walk from La Sagrada Familia, too, and their restaurant is so nice.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with such helpful and friendly staff. Can highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were clean, the breakfast was delicious and the area safe and pleasant. We stayed for 4 days and just wanted to stay longer. The staff had the answers to any questions we had and were always so willing to help out with any tour info or bus/metro questions we had. The laundry facilities were all free to use which helped a lot. Overall a brilliant hotel and I would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are so pretty and so modern. The cleanliness of the hotel is always very important to me and for this reason I fell inlove with this hotel. The staff was also very helpful as the taxis were on strike and they helped me by telling me how to reach the destinations I want to get to. I felt very at home in a city I have never been to before! Thank you :)
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was filthy when we arrived. Dust was everywhere, and the table was not clean.Plus, the tub was full of dirt. Shampoo was caked on the water tap. I asked them to clean it once before I left, and they never did. Asked again when I returned at night, and it STILL was not cleaned.They came in and made the bed, but I could visibly tell that they never dusted, vacuumed, or did anything else. This is completely unacceptable, especially when a guest politely informs them this is not OK.The TV was unplugged when we arrived, and we had to reprogram it to get it to work. A pitiful amount of channels were offered. This is a minor issue, but when we told them the TV was unplugged and was not working, we got a response akin to "What do you want us to do?". Unacceptable service and I would never stay here again. Too many choices in the area.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a nice one, we stayed here for 2 nights recently. It is near a underground station which is handy.Easy availability of taxis around the area. The hotel has all what you would need for a holiday. Nice toiletries, small kitchen (microwave, kettle, tea making kit, plates, spoons etc).The cleaners do a good job, however on the first night the towels provided in our room were damp. I guess they were folded whilst damp. The reception staff was very helpful and kind.The welcome drink of lemonade was very much enjoyed. It was a nice touch I guess and it was available all throughout the day.Overall I would stay again. Love Barcelona. Also lot of eating places around the hotel so it is a great if your flight lands a bit late, also an in house menu which we didn’t try.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was amazing, especially Rosa who took care of me during breakfast - Really kind and amazing lady. I Didn't have any problems during my stay overall. Called the hotel about my anniversary in advance. They prepared the room with a cute note and complimentary champagne. Everyone just seems so happy here! I would totally recommend. Location is good
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located outside of main areas and away from markets, in an industrial neighbourhood. It is not very far from beach area, a walkable distance. Cleanliness is good, rooms are large and with all amenities including basic kitchenette. Laundry services are available ( laundry machines and dryer are placed in basement) and are part of room tariff. Friendly front desk staff.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, kitchen fantastic. Wonderful position, near the Metro L1 Marina.The staff very kindle. I suggest it for all!! Near most place of interest and the port olimpic is very nice for a wonderful dinner!
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Clean, good Location, Breakfast staff cooked Vegetarian dish just for us, even though there were Vegetarian options already, very impressed.Chen in and check out was smooth.Felt very safe.room service was good,staff very friendly
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located, hotel in Barcelona, close to three metro stations in easy walking distance and large shopping centre with Carrefours supermarket, which was helpful as we had a suite with cooking facilities. No washing machine or dryer in room, but laundry on lower ground floor was well set up with everything you needed. Staff friendly, helpful and professional. Room had windows that could be opened which is great, as we prefer not to use air conditioning if we can.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is convenient for transportation, restaurants and site seeing. There are a few nice restaurants just a block away and others just a short walk. The Metro is a short walk and 3 stops away from the centre. There is a small convenience store around the corner that sells eggs,bacon, bread ,milk etc. Our apartment was clean and spacious. The bed and sofa bed were comfortable. You use your room card to access the building and use the elevator. We felt secure in the quiet neighbourhood.The employees were efficient and very helpful with information about the city. Polly, on the front desk even came up to our room to show me how to use the oven. The manager was present at times greeting and assuring that we were satisfied. I would definitely recommend this hotel for visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Capri is located in a central location where we can walk to many attractions. The facility is modern and staffs are very courteous. The room is big and equipped with a sitting area, eating area, and kitchen. It's a good value for the size of the room we have. However, a few things will make our stay a lot more comfortable though - (1) The dryers in the facility doesn't work. There doesn't appear to have any vents to the dryer so the clothes never got dry even though the clothes got really hot in the dryer. Many of my clothes got shrank one size because of the heat but they never got dry.(2) The air condition didn't work in our room. It got really cold in the room even when we turned up the temperature. We spoke to the front desk twice. The second time, they acknowledged that the air condition is broken but can't be fixed until morning. We didn't know if it actually got fixed the next day or not. We just turned off the air condition.(3) We love the pressure of the shower! However, because of the strong pressure of the water, the shower head won't stay in position in the holder and it caused the water went all over the place in the bathroom. I could actually see some mold on top of the shower area. I think it must have been there because of the problem with the shower head.(4) The bathroom door stop is installed on the bathroom floor right in front of the toilet. It's really not a good place for the door stop. I tripped on it and almost fell in the bathroom.(5) My sister went to the front desk and asked if the breakfast was included in the stay. The front desk said yes. So we went downstairs to have breakfast but then was billed for the breakfast after we finished the breakfast. When my sister went back to the front desk to ask about the false billing, the front desk would not admit that they told my sister the breakfast was complimentary just an hour ago. Instead, they they just gave us a discounted rate. I'd much rather that they acknowledged the misinformation and certainly don't want to have other guests experiencing the same.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived 1 pm, without booking, and the girl from reception was very nice and helpful. Clean, pleasant rooms with comfortable beds! The bathrooms were also very clean. Close to Sagrada familia. Enjoyed our stay very much, and we will certainly come back here! Cheap for such high quality of facility. Well done, Capri by fraser!
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a one room apartment for a few nights and really loved the brightness and quietness of the place. The kitchen was perfect for fixing meals, the roof top terrace was lovely and it really was not that far from all the places we wanted to go, and we walked to them all. Nice big bathroom, bedroom with very comfortable bed and sitting area with kitchen to the side. We made good use of the place. Wifi was great. Going back again too.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay very much, 5 minute walk from a metro. Very close to both Sagrada Família and Cituadella Park. Great staff & very nice rooms. We stayed in the apartments & loved the fact that there was a 24/7 reception.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with my wife and two grown up daughters after a last minute change in plan and a hotel was required. Lovely modern room with separate bedroom, sofa bed and kitchen/diner,Staff were friendly and extremely helpful. We ran out of tea bags and they sorted it immediately. Plenty of large fluffy towels for the shower which was also extremely good.The location is very close too Marina station but you can easily walk to the beach and La Rambla.Will definitely use again.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was clean, large, and comfortable. Thanks metro is about 3 blocks away, but be careful there is a homeless community on your way back to the hotel. This is also in the college part of town and the parties and noise on the street can come into the room. Only downside is the location. I wish I would have looked more closely. If you want a more Central location choose anything near catalunya.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: capri is a value for money extremely comfortable hotel with free laundry facilities (2 washing machines, 2 dryers). A convenient 4 stop by underground to Placa de Catalunya. Hotel to nearest underground Marina a 5 minute walk. Highly recommend, if you don't mind not being in the city centre. there's a cafe nearby; didn't see other restaurants.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely modern large studio apartment. Marina metro close by but can walk to city or beach. Free washing machine use in basement. Daily room service. Good air con and comfy very large bed. Quiet rooms.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 2 weeks until my apartment was ready in Barcelona. The staff is very helpful and kind and the housekeeping was great. The only negative I have to say pertains to the bathroom. There was a bit of mildew in the shower. The hotel could take take a look at this. There was, however, a very large counter space to put your things. I was happy about this rare occurrence. I didn't eat breakfast here so I cannot comment on the quality of the food. The kitchen in the room was nice and had stocked utensils. Overall, good stay for the price and in a quiet and safe part of Barcelona. Loved the Sant Marti neighborhood. Thanks Capri!
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went on a family trip to Barcelona. everthing was just great until we arrived at Capri. First of all we received a room in a bad condition (room 007). Everything was broken or rusted inside. The second problem was that although we mentioned that we are traveling with two small kids the hotel did not have enough baby cribs. Arriving late in the afternoon we found ourselfs with a baby that has no place to sleep. We informed the staff which was very not responsive until we demanded to cancel our stay. Then out of nowhere they found a crib. We tought that the problem was solved. But then on our last night someone came and took the crib while I was putting the baby to sleep. The staff said that another family needed the crib and that there were again no cribs in the hotel. We again explained that an 11 months old baby can not sleep on the sofa because it can fall on the floor (a fact we tought does not require any explanations..). Again requested to leave the hotel. Again they found a crib. That was a really bad experience that could not have happened. The room is also not sutible for kids, like the shower that is not accessible for an adult that needs to shower his kid. The room does not look like in the picture. The equipment is old. The nice thing is that there a daily cleane. The free laundering and the gym is also very good. To summerize it is probably a nice place for couples but not for families.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel was located in a quiet area of Barcelona but within walking distance of many attractions. Also the metro is located around the corner if you want to go further afield. The staff welcomed us and made us feel at home
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a pleasant stay in this apartment hotel. Not many hotels around that can comfortably accommodate a family. Quiet place close to Marina station so we could walk to station and get around the city quite easily. A convenient store, cafe and pharmacy was within minutes of walking distance. Staff was friendly.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had high hopes for this apart-hotel as the reviews were so good, but it just didn't meet my expectations. The Pros: 1) The decor (lampshades, cushions, throws, chairs etc) was modern and fresh. 2) The location was good, 15 min walk from Sagrada familia, near metro and loads of buses. 3)The Air-con in the room was lovely. The Cons 1) Mould in a bathroom is just unacceptable. It's so easy to remove so I was really grossed out to see it. 2) The bathroom itself was very tired. The door didn't close properly and we had a shoe on the inside to keep it closed. The soap dispenser at the sink leaked so we came into a large puddle/pool of liquid soap each morning/evening which soaked one of our washbags. Annoying that the cleaners didn't think to do anything about it. 3) The TV in the main bedroom didn't work. We didn't report this as we were hardly there but it should be checked. 4) The main TV remote didn't work properly. Got this replaced, but still didn't work. 5) At check-in the hotel requires that you present the credit card that you used to book the room. We booked in over 6 months ago and don't have that credit card anymore. Luckily I could take a screen shot of the transaction from an e-statement on my phone and email it to them then and there, but at check-out another couple were having the same discussion for their check-in. They didn't have such luck in having access to an online statement so I'm not sure what happened there. Since my husband called the hotel before to check bed layout (there were 4 of us and using the sofa bed) it would have been an idea to mention some of these mandatory check-in requirements then, or send an email confirmation beforehand as it's not normal for the actual credit card used for the booking to be required. 6) We had a service apartment but it was only 1 of the 2 days that it actually got serviced. 1st day, no beds made, no cups washed as you'd expect.I think there are better places to stay in Barcelona.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, close enough to walk to many of the city's main attractions (about 20 minutes), but far enough away to get a "local feel". Thanks to Jenniffer at the front desk for all her help and advice!
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were fantastic more than adequate size. The restaurant service was fantastic especially a lady I believe her name to be Maria Rosa very attentive to the diners. I wish to visit Barcelona and stay at Capri again.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean Hotel,staff very helpful,in a quite part of Barcelona,15 min walk into the center and beach,good transport near by,Sports bar around the corner very good for food and a good beer,new cafe on the corner just open is also very good.Hotel has every thing,large rooms and kitchen well stocked.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Capri by fraiserHotel is simple with a modern flair and most importantly, clean.Rooms are comfortable, yet can be stuffy as the hotel does control the ac with minimum at 19 celsius. We had the one bedroom apt. The apt consisted of a small galley like kitchen with mini frig, microwave, stove top, and hot water kettle. It is fully equipped with dishes, coffee mugs, drinking glasses, silverware, pots and pans, and even a glass pitcher. It also has soap and sponge to wash the dishes. No dishwasher. There is also a table. The area is all open so you see the living room with sofa bed, desk and TV. There is a USB in living room by the desk to charge the phone, unfortunately mine did not work. I recommend you bring your converters, adapters, and power chargers to charge phones and iPads from the power chargers. There is a very small breakfast buffet. The price is 14.50 euros if purchased at the restaurant and 12.50 is purchased via the hotel. In my opinion, it's not worth the price. You can easily walk to a local cafe and get fresh bread and coffee etc. for much less. There is free wifi throughout the hotel.There is a gym nice size with water-cooler and towels, but no showers.There is a washer dryer room with a sink.
hotelName:
4    Capri by Fraser Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel without knowing much about it and are very glad we did. It is close to two underground stations and on good bus routes to tourist spots you will want to visit. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Great breakfast. All in all a great place for your stay in Barcelona.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been in this hotel in August and this is a good place where stay with own family, but i saw a lot of group of friends! I recommended this hotel if you want to spend little money you can try an excellent holiday!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed only for 1 night in Barcelona since we departed in the airport at 01:00. The reception was open at that time (24h service) and the staff was very friendly. The room was very clean though a little bit small. The breakfast was up to the price of the room. As a conclusion, it is a very nice, clean and friendly hotel to stay.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I checked out this morning from a week long stay here. Cannot fault the hotel! Brand new reception area is beautiful and staff very welcoming. Room compact but perfectly functional. We were extremely lucky to have a 9th floor room with a small balcony area outside the bathroom. View was spectacular! Breakfast had everything you would want from a continental offering. Would have loved a fridge in the room as weather was hot but not expected at a 2* hotel so not a negative at all. Would definitely recommend this gem of a hotel which has excellent transport links to the entire city, including the beaches. If we are ever back in the city then I'm sure we will be back at Via Augusta!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed my stay in this nice, centrally located hotel. The room was spacious and comfortable. I had originally been told I'd be given a twin but got accommodated to a double. Extremely friendly staff. Would stay again!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is great, with big and modern rooms. It's just few steps from tube gateway. Staff is very nice and kind, always willing to help.Location is also good, on Via Augusta avenue, near Rambla Catalunya.Breakfast is amazing, with a lot of options and with quality food.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can certainly recommend this place to everyone. It's tidy, comfortable and the service is great. We preferred to walk everywhere, but you can always use metro to save time. Metro Fontana is 3 minutes of walk from the hotel. Hotel is located perfectly nearby Carrer de Gracia that leads you through many cosy restaurants and boutiques to all most famous Barcelona sites: placa de Catalunya with casa Mila and casa Battllo on your way to La Rambla and in the opposite direction to park Guell. Personnel are extremely friendly and helpful and service is ideal. We dealt a lot with Jordy and he is your Bruce Willis there. We thought we try out different places for breakfast, but ended up eating breakfast in the hotel every day, because variety was great and coffee proved to wake up. Definitely coming again!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location. 45 minute walk to Las Ramblas and the Gothic quarter but there are plenty of shops, cafes and things to see on the way. When you stop for lunch El Pob el sec has a spectacular range of Pinchos bars where you can get amazing tapas style bar snacks from 1 euro each then stroll back to the hotel stopping for wine or coffee in one of the many cafes on the way.The only real complaint i would have is that the hotel list was out of order for 2 of the evenings so if i had been with my husband who is disabled this could have been a real problem. There is a service lift however but i believe you need to ask at reception to use this as you can't just call it.Apart from that the hotel was very reasonably priced clean and comfortable and i would definitly stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a good value hotel in the centre of Barcelona. The hotel is about an 8 minute walk to the Fontana metro station which is an ideal line for getting everywhere very easily.Rooms were clean and tidy. Included everything you need (fresh towels, shower gel, shampoo etc.) Reception spoke English and were great for giving us directions and booking taxis where necessary (back to the airport etc.)**HOWEVER,** since getting home. I have two fraudulent transactions on my credit card statement for Amazon transactions. These were dated on the day of our check in. These card details were given to reception on arrival, and the card was not used previously or during the rest of our trip (we had Euros). It was ONLY used for hotel payment.So, intentionally or not, their security of card information is poor. This is not a surprise as there is renovations at the hotel and there could be compromised access. In fact, when we arrived there was no one at the reception for around 15 minutes and the small reception desk was left unattended.Despite being a nice hotel, for these security issues they get one star. And be warned if you leave card details with them.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just returned home after staying at the Via Augusta Hotel for four nights. The rooms are spotless, breakfast was included in the price, it was excellent value for money! I woul definitely stay again and would highly recommend it. The staff were lovely, extremely helpful when we left our passports in the safe after leaving on the last day!!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived and was very pleased at the reception... Staff helpful with excellent english ( Phew!) Even more pleased with the modern clean room and well appointed walk-in shower room. Modern air conditioner too! Breakfast is of a good quality - Buffet hot selection (small) some cold meats, cheese and the usual pastry /bread options. Finish off with fresh fruit and good coffee.No complaints! A first for me:)
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here last week for 4 nights.The hotel is in a quiet part of the city and a bit out of the way but the transport links are very good with buses and metro within a 5 min walk The hotel is clean and staff are friendly and helpfulOur twin room was in the middle of the hotel with a view of a fire escape through a small window so the room never really got very light, even on bright daysThe room itself was pretty small but I think you could upgrade if rooms were available We chose not to as although a view of some sorts would have been nice we spent most of the time out and about We tried the buffet breakfast once and it was fine but for nearly 10 euros each we chose to eat out the other 3 daysAny request was answered and dealt with efficiently and generally I would recommend this hotel but try and get a bigger room with a view when booking I imagine it would be less claustrophobic
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and accommodation. We had a clean, modern and quiet room at the back of the hotel on the forth floor. Friendly staff, room cleaned daily and fresh towels provided, adequate continental breakfast. Perfect for a city break, especially if visiting any of the Gaudi buildings/locations. Next to Gracia train station and only a 6 minute walk to Fontana Metro station (main line to Pl. Catalunya and other central locations). We made use of the rooftop balcony - great views day and night.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: Reasonable. Not in the hottest district of Barcelona, but easy commute everywhere walking or public transportation (metro or buses). So it's less expensive and more quiet around.Staff: Nice, helpful and friendly. Respond a guest needs. Our special thanks to the Reception Supervisor Juanjo Rodriguez. He was always ready to go an extra mile to help us.Room: Not very big bat clean and cleaned every day, fresh towels, soap etc. We could use more hangers tough.Breakfast: Surprisingly good. Cost extra with our type of reservation 9.35 euro per person, but definitely worthy. Good selection, plenty of choices, always 3 variety of juices, fruits. Always something hot, like rice, pasta, sausages omelet. Excellent pastry and coffee.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cannot fault this hotel at all. A little outside the main tourist area but only a 5 min walk (if that) to Fontana metro station and only 3 stops to Las Ramblas, so all in all a 10 min journey max. Hotel is clean, the beds are comfy, complimentary toiletries and bed linen and towels changed every day. You would not know this was a 2 star hotel, it definitely deserves more. We didn't have much dealing with staff other than checking in and out but they were very friendly and always said hello when we returned to the hotel after a day out. Wifi is good throughout the hotel. Would definitely stay again if we go back to Barcelona.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely, large air conditioned room with a very modern bathroom. Excellent buffet breakfast. The hotel is relatively easy to find. We took the train into Barcelona from T2 and changed at Passeig de Gracia to Metro L3 and a couple of stops to Fontana. To be fair the Via Augusta is not in the 'heart' of things but Barcelona is such a large city. It's about a 20 minute walk to La Rambla and 30 minutes to La Sagrada Familia. There are lots of nice streets around the hotel with plenty of shops and cafes. Would recommend and would stay again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just had a 3 night stay at this hotel and had a lovely visit. Staff were very friendly upon check in, and helped us out throughout our stay there - nothing was too much! Location is good, nice area (train station next door and metro station around the corner). Bars and shops also nearby. Air conditioning was good, although did click quite often throughout the night, and was not in the bathroom. Only issue was the fire alarm. It went off upon check in for around 10 minutes, and then happened again the second day whilst we were busy having a shower etc. with no explanation as to why it was going off so often! Also a bit of a shame that out of the 3 rooms we had, none of them had a view (all faced onto a brick wall!). Roof top terrace is lovely to sit up and have a drink before heading out, and has amazing views of Barcelona. Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there in early May and appreciated the friendly, informative staff as well as the breakfast every morning. The rooms are really bare minimum but the showers worked well and the beds were comfy. We don’t mind walking so as long as we had the subway close by it wasn’t a problem.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So I’d been to Barcelona before and wanted a central location. It was close enough (walking distance) to all we wanted in Barcelona providing you like walking. Camp Nou (stadium) Waterfalls Barce tours Bus tours Train lines Gaudi experience Ramblas Etc Etc. The list can go on The staff can’t do enough for you. The breakfast is what you would expect in Spain (don’t expect an full English your not in England)
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was not in our shortlist. But a very attractive offer on a third-party website, and the good reviews landed us at this hotel. The good:First, you are very close to the tourist area, without being in it. The metro is a couple of minutes away. Lots of good restaurants in the area which are frequented by locals. So you get authentic local cuisine at non-tourist prices. Second, the front office staff is very helpful with directions, maps and advice. Third, I liked the late-check-out facility at a nominal additional price.Fourth, if you have an inside room, it is very quiet and the drapes are really black-out.The not so good:-Bed linen is gloomy, and the asymmetrical patterns on the ceilings resulting from the placement of lights and detectors are a bit disconcerting as is the placement of the air-conditioning unit. Also the air-conditioning takes ages to cool the room. The room itself is smallish.-Breakfast is just about okay. Fresh fruit , in a city known for it, was at best, very limited. Tea was not replenished regularly. And the spread was unchanging. The breakfast room too needs some cheering up.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel rooms are very no nonsense and have a hostel/dormitory style.We somehow got placed in a handicap accessible room that had a strange shower that did not drain properly. Since we only stayed one night we did not bother to ask to switch to another room.One thing to note is there was a lack of outlets in the room (there were none near the bed). The location is pretty good though because of the Gracia neighborhood and nearby Metro.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four nights, our room overlooked the road which was a little noisy but it did not disturb us. The room was a good size, clean and airy, the bathroom was large with toiletries supplied. My only issue with both the bedroom and bathroom was the lack of storage for clothes and nowhere to put your wash bag. We had breakfast each day, we found it was fresh and quite good quality, it was certainly adequate to start the day. There are plenty of bars and restaurants around the area, it is also close to Fontana metro station if you wanted to go further,
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an amazing stay with them for that few days I have been there. Very friendly and helpful people you do not even have to ask they were way beyond to exceed your needs. Informations like transfer, transport, map with touristic places. Excellent! Thank you!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a city break, great area, great breakfast, comfortable rooms and very friendly staff. We went there for a 4 day city break with our 3 year old and had were not expecting much from a 2 star hotel, but were surprised to find a hotel that in France, for example, would be at least 3, maybe 4 star,
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable hotel near to the centre of Barcelona but away from the tourist crowds, in the stylish district of Gracia. We enjoyed our stay and have recommended this hotel to friends. Rooms are good size, bathrooms clean and breakfast good.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pricing is fair and definitively great value for money. I would highlight their friendly staff who went out of their way to support in small errands. Great location, conveniently near metro, buses and availability of taxis.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights on a solo vacation trip. I picked this hotel based on its location - away from touristy areas, price and the good reviews on TripAdvisor. I had stayed in the Le Meridien prior to arriving here so was moderately surprised by the size of the room - small but comfortable. The location to me became a major advantage over the next 5 days, eventually. The local subway station (Fontana) is only a few minutes away and with a T-10 pass, I was able to travel to various go to spots in Barcelona, pretty easily - Kudos to the gentleman at the front desk for revealing this little secret on exploring Barcelona on a budget (sorry I forget your name but the person with the shaved head and glasses - very knowledgeable and friendly!). It is right across the Gracia area in a more residential part of town but with a lot of great restaurants and bars - all walking distance away.There is a McDonald's (McDonald's, Carrer Gran de Gràcia) and a Condi Express a few minutes walk across the Hotel for cafe Americano and supermarket needs. There is also a Fresh Laundromat less than a 5 min walk away (Fresh Laundry Travessera de Gracia).Room service was prompt and the front desk folks was quite friendly and conversant - learned a lot about Catalonia and the lifestyle, thru them (Thanks, Jordi and Leticia!).Ride to the airport from the hotel was about 25mins in the early hours (7ish) and cost about 36 euros.Overall, I enjoyed staying here and will stay here again, next time I visit Barcelona.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The main reason we stay at this hotel is the distance with our favourite halal food restaurant, Bali Restaurant. The hotel is also quite close with Metro, ATM, and even DHL. The location is quite close with the city center.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival the friendly reception staff spoke good understandable english, lots of local information given, tips on personal safety and other aspects of the city, were appreciated. Not in the hustle and bustle of being too close to city centre and La Rumbla but easy walking distance to all areas of city. Close to a supermercat and laundremate and places to eat as well. Only served a full continental breakfast that was great. We ate as we wandered around the city and found lots of interesting places where the locals eat away from the high tourist areas and was reasonbaly cheep and good value for Euro. Found all of the sights and places of interest to us very easily by the directions of the staff and maps given. Only issue was no mini fridge in room to keep drinks cold as with being so hot here but this is due to ratings. Not all room have a balcony however some did
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights last year, the staff were great - witty and informative. Tactfully advised against meeting ladies on the main strip! Better than than that they filled us in about a "Block Party" that was happening locally - which turned out to be the highlight of our 2 days in Barcelona. The rooms are fine, if you're not planning spending much time there - functional , not luxurious, nor rundown at the same time. Hard to describe. One thing I noticed was that the HUGE window in my room opened fully - I don't have kids but would have been watching them if I had. I'd go back
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Via Augustus with 2 friends (had a 3 person room) in April this year. The location is perfect for a city break. It was an easy tube ride into Catalina and other places, for a cheap price as well! The area it's located is also beautiful for walks and takes a lovely photo. The hotel itself is small but smart. The room was good considering they had to add an extra bed - spacious and clean! The roof top sitting area was lovely to have a coffee in the morning, and the breakfasts were really impressive for the price! Thank you for looking after us!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had booked a room at a hostel but that hostel was so loud and low quality that I immediately looked for a proper hotel to transfer to after quite some sleepless nights. I found Hotel Via Augusta and spent my last night there. I found out it is a 2* hotel but I'd give it one more star. It felt like heaven after that horrbible hostel experience. The room was very clean and mostly quiet and I slept wonderfully. The location was fine as it is close to the Fontana subway. Maybe the view was not the best as my room was an internal one but all I was looking for was some peace and I definitely slept like a baby.I might come back here.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned from a 2 night stay Friday to Sunday. Doing my research before choosing this hotel really paid off. What an absolute gem of a place! Fabulous location, not a touristy area but so near to centre. Little delay on checking in but then given a great room on the 8th floor. A very spacious twin bedded room with black-out curtains, air con, safe in wardrobe, plenty of storage, flat screen tv with many channels in different languages, full length mirror and very comfy beds. Big bonus were the doors opening onto a sweet little balcony with table and chairs and views down the main road. The room was very quiet at night. Slept really well. Free wifi worked fine. Good lift to all floors. Bathroom was also spacious with bath and shower. Good water temp and pressure. Windows opened which is always good when it's hot. Nice toiletries supplied.Breakfast served till 10.30. What a spread. Selection of hot foods, cold meats and cheeses, fresh fruit, cereals, yogurts, cakes and pastries, rolls and toast, huge selection of hot drinks and very nice fresh juices. All fresh and replenished right up until 10.30. All staff so friendly and helpful. Happy to advise on buses and metros. Fontana Metro station 4 mins walk - handy supermarket and ice cream parlour on the way (this line L3 took us to nearly all the places we wanted to visit - got to know it really well!) 2 stops to centre of city. Had ordered BCN Hola 3 day card before leaving so just had to collect cards from machine at metro at airport. Really easy to get from/to airport this way. Used our cards many times on buses and metro so certainly good value for the cost (38 Euros for 2 people). I don't understand why this hotel only has 2 stars - I've stayed in 3 and 4 star hotels that were not as good. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and I can't wait to return to Barcelona (what an amazing laid back, friendly city) and will definitely stay here again. To finish I would just like to say thank you to the lovely staff, especially on reception, for helping us have a truly memorable stay. See you next time!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night before flying home. Room small and outlook was "ugly" so, we had to keep curtain closed. That said, we had requested a high and quiet room so, there was no traffic noise. Sound proofing in the rooms is poor. When neighbour showered we thought our water was running due to the noise. Breakfast choices were very poor. Fruit was tinned and breads and pastries were not very fresh.Staff friendly and helpful. Location was adequate. There was limited access wifi for free but, connection kept dropping out. Over all, this was adequate to provide a one night stop over but, not suitable for a longer stay. Not good value and we will not be staying there again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not a flash hotel but a really good one. Staff are really helpful and friendly. The location isn't super central but it's nice to be away from the noise and hustle and bustle of the tourist centres. Rooms are basic but clean and comfy, breakfast isn't amazing but is cheap. You can walk to the main tourist places in 30/45 minutes. Would recommend as good value for money.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and never regret it. The location near the metro station is a big advantage. The room was very clean and cosy. The staff was nice and extremely helpful. We had breakfasts here and it was very good and tasty. The view from the window was amazing. The only downside was weak signal of wifi. The most enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights on b and b basis.Basic.Very clean.Good breakfast.Very helpful staff who will go the extra distance to help.Excellent free wi Fi. Just beside metro stop.Good value.No tea coffee making facilities in room.Would stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recomend to anyone, really great hotel. Staff is polite, rooms are clean and quiet.. metro is nearby. Za svaku pohvalu, hotel je odličan. Blizu je metro, sobe su ciste, klimatizirane. Svakako bi se opet vratio u hotel, moja ocjena je 5/5.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was good as well as the staff and cleanliness. We could walk everywhere and both a type of underground train and bus stop is close by that we used when arriving and leaving. Most people in Barcelona are so nice and the staff in the hotel are very helpful and good at English.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very well located and connected by public transport to the main city attractions. The service is very friendly and very good including and excellent breakfast. I have stayed here 4 times and usually come here when I visit Barcelona. I will continue to come in the future. It is an excellent choice in a city that became quite expensive.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel are very accommodating. Nothing was too much trouble. Evelin never got tired of explaining the best form of transport that we should take to do our sightseeing the next day. The rooms were very clean and tidied everyday. The hotel is very close to the metro station and bus stops. Wifi was excellent. Lovely roof terrace to sit out on.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was wonderful, the price wasn't expensive and the area was just perfect. Everywhere I wanted to go was within minutes but it also wasn't a very busy street which was great. The hotel deserves more stars! Plus, they had cable tv in my room which was a first.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had booked this hotel via another travel website about 6 weeks prior to my stay. When I arrived at the hotel for check-in, I learnt that there was no booking for me there. The hotel staff especially Pilar and the Manager were incredibly helpful, patient and friendly. They tried their best to retrieve my booking details through several sources, continuously asked me for refreshments and assured me that they won't let me down. They even made calls to the India travel agent who had booked my stay and somehow just made me feel at home even amidst the chaos. Finally I checked-in and after that the staff was extremely particular if I am comfortable.The rooms are simple but extremely clean, hygienic and comfortable. The hotel is very close to the city centre and is very easily accessible by public transport or a 20-25 minutes walk.Buffet breakfast has several options and isn't bad at all.Overall, I had a good time and would highly recommend this to others.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the staff is very friendly and helpful the location is very convenient close to the metro and two stops away from the Ramblas. We love the fresh breakfast and the rooms are pretty comfortable. Highly recommended for your next visit to Barcelona
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel via Augusta is very good location very close to metro Garcia station lots of place to see around the hotel so many restaurants and cafe nearby hotel very good size staff are lovely and helpful room very clean like shower and bathroom too got everything you need. Bed is comfortable we really enjoyed staying here, How to get to the hotel From the Barcelona airport ?? we get the airport bus (Aerobus)blue bus A1 get this bus on the ground floor at the airport will only cost €5.90 take about 25-30mins then get off at last stop work across to other side you will see Hard Rock Cafe on your left get the train ( L6 or L7 )at Catalunya station to Gracia station hotel via Augusta is on your left , we bought tickets €9.95 for 10journey was work out very cheap with this tickets you can also use with the buses too, How to get to the Barcelona beach from the hotel ?? Using bus again walk around the back of the hotel using V15 bus this bus will take you to the beach :) lots of restaurants to choose from happy trip to Barcelona recommend to any one really easy place to get to lovely people good we had a great time here! Will go back again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel on 7 January 2017. As always very efficient, clean and extremely reasonably placed. I have stayed at the hotel on and off for some 18 years and it gets better. Great location and the staff are very friendly and professional especially the front female desk manager/supervisor who has been there for same period of time that I have been visiting. I would recommend this hotel. Mark Legister, London.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a single room on 3rd floor, overlooking delightful back gardens of neighbouring properties - mid November and there were white jasmine vines, purple morning glory, slivery olive trees...large opening windows let the sunshine in throughout the day. The room was quiet, and plenty spacious for one, esp. the ensuite bathroom. Buffet breakfast good value and abundant, though not top quality.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd never stay here again mostly based on the farcical check in, I arrived at 1:15, it said check in from 1:30 on my confirmation so they made me sit in a chair for 15 minutes and wait. At 1:30 they then decided my room wasn't ready, despite the fact they'd insisted I check in at precisely 1:30.I was however offered free water as compensation despite the fact I sat there drinking a juice I'd brought myself.They couldn't give me any indication of what time I could check in but finally around 1:50 I was called back up to the desk.Either change the confirmations to a later time or deliver on what's advertised! Weary travelers who've come from the airport want to put down their bags and take a shower not sit in the lobby being messed about.I was given room 404 - which when I walked into there was already someone in. Finally an hour after arriving I got my room.The room is ok, although there's an ant in the bathroom and the complimentary shampoo has been spilled all over the bottle so hasn't been changed. There's also no English TV channels which I always find ridiculous in big city tourist destinations.There's a safe in the wardrobe but no instructions on how to set it. There's only one plug socket in the room and it's 1.5 meters off the ground no where near the bed or anything to rest your charging items on. To say something positive... the location is good and close to the subway - the wifi is also good- but I won't be back.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Delighted with this hotel, it's knowledgeable and courteous staff, cleanliness, location (great neighbourhood) and excellent pricing. Their recommendations as to where to eat were exemplary. So much so that we modified our trip plans to return to Barcelona, the hotel and the restaurants.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 wonderful days visiting my son who has recently relocated here, but chose to stay at this hotel. It was a good choice! Very comfortable rooms, good bed, good shower, aircon, a full length mirror and enough closet space & shelves (often lacking in even better hotels). Just right for a city break. Buffet breakfast with varied choices, enough to satisfy anyone. Front desk staff and all staff, polite and helpful.The walk to Plaza Catalunya is 25 minutes at a leisurely pace past some of Gaudi's most beautiful creations. If you don't fancy walking, Metro Fontana is a couple of minutes away on foot. Barcelona is very walkable. Like a large village with an open minded city mentality. My favourite city in Spain and I lived in Madrid for 3 years. However, Barcelona has the edge and, of course, the sea! I personally find the Catalans charming and very helpful. A very civilised society in a very beautiful city. Hasta la proxima!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A family member had stayed here and recommended it. We looked at many places before booking the Via Augusta, and they all seemed VERY over priced if all you want is a good base to stay. But the Via Augusta seemed to fit the bill! At the airport train station, we bought a 5 day 'Hola BCN travel card' which you can use on the busses and trains. It worked out much cheaper. We caught trains from the airport and walked from Fontana metro. I will say that to find it, the instructions on the hotel website, were not clear to us and we got a bit lost! When you come out of the Metro, turn left and walk down until you get to Rambla del Prat on the other side of the road, walk down there, turn left onto Via Augusta, cross over on the crossing and the hotel is a few meters down. The staff were all very helpful, informative and welcoming. We actually booked a twin room as we thought the doubles looked like only 4ft 6 beds. Our room was on the 9th floor, 906. We had views over the rooftops and could see over to Montjuic, and over to the hills in the North. It was not a large room, but was all we needed as we intended to be out all day. There was a small desk and chair and plenty of space in the wardrobe, plus shelves and a suitcase stand. The bathroom was clean and had a bath too which was nice. The shower had good pressure, although it did go cold on me a couple of times. We were impressed with having daily maid service too. The room was quiet and the beds comfortable, which was a nice surprise, as often more reasonably priced/2* hotels have rock hard beds! The air con worked well. The free wi-fi had a good signal and was certainly fast enough. There is also a computer in reception if you need to print out any tickets which was useful. There is a free to use safe in the room. There was a small roof terrace which would be nice to have a beer in the good weather. There is one lift for guests. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, I think it would have been 8Euros, we preferred to do as the locals do and have a coffee and mini filled roll in a cafe, which is enough for us and cheaper!The location suited us very well. We actually walked all the way down to the waterfront, down through La Rambla, about 4k. It was a great introduction to Barcelona! We caught busses and metro's and the location of the hotel was never a problem. The only thing we felt would have been nice to have provided in the room, was tea and coffee making facilities. However, we knew there were none when we booked, so we brought our own.I would certainly highly recommend the Via Augusta if you want a quiet, comfortable, clean, base to explore Barcelona. If you want luxury, this hotel isn't for you.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff very helpful, location great for the city and metro. Shower was a bit intermittent but bearable, room was OK, fit for purpose and the Wifi was reliable. Overall very good value for money, didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Business tripin Barcelona.Very small room.Good housekeeping and not so large bed.Btw, it is enough. You cannot adk more during trade show time.Not so far from metro (just 2 stops from Plaza Catalunja & ramblas).Price is ok.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was ok. Quite small and dark and near the lift, which was audible. But for a city hotel at that price it was fine and location to Passeig de Gracia was good. I didn't try breakfast. The staff were really helpful and friendly and it was very clean. I would stay again despite what seems to be a criticism.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Via Augusta
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for five days with my sister. Close to the metro line. Quiet area but tint too far. Clean room and buffet breakfast was very nice. Would definitely recommend, only thing missing was a fridge in the room.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plusses: Nice neighborhood.Minuses: WIFI is terrible and weak, no minifridge in the room, bathroom had two dried boogers on the wall and not cleaned despite telling housecleaning, and mattresses are very firm = borderline uncomfortable.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel! It has a beautiful entrance and foyer and the staff were very friendly. They have my son and I a really lovely room at the top with incredible views over Barcelona and plenty of room. The hotel is surrounded by various restaurants and shops. We took taxis around so didn't use any public transport this time. Would highly reccomend this hotel!!
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very clean, affordable, accommodating, and supplied a large, diverse breakfast for 12 EU. The staff was very helpful and even made a couple of calls for me about locating a meeting place for a walking tour. The computer area was quiet and easy to access. The Hotel Condado is close to good restaurants and a mini-mart, but a ways to the red/orange/green bus lines, especially if one has walking issues. It is quiet, clean, and provides rooms that are compfy, and roomy, and have lots of closet space, shoe racks, safes, etc. We had a balcony, but it looked out to other apartments across the way. Quiet rooms and hotel.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the hotel Condado after booking up for a long weekend and a match at the Camp Nou , thanks to Barcelona for delaying winning the league till we were watching !!So this hotel was part of our package and we were all very pleasantly surprised as rooms were clean, comfortable, although my room only had a view of a square inner courtyard / service area, those on the outer edges had views of the street.Breakfast had a reasonably large choice that you normally get so all good.Staff were always helpful which although is expected at three star and above hotels you don't always get it.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, modern simple room. Friendly, helpful staff. Well placed for walking to the old city, La Rambla, Sagrado Familia, etc. Buses convenient for trips further afield. Good choice of restaurants in the area. No drink facilities in the room, but free water in fridge in corridor. Good value.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I brought my Partner to Barcelona as a surprise for his birthday in March, This hotel is basic but perfect for a short break, staff are friendly and happy to help. Rooms are clean and spacious. Would stay again.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel with good transport links, there are metro stops outside and a small walk to get tickets. Lots of little restaurants and shops nearby also. Clean and tidy rooms with welcoming staff. Through the window you can just see the busy street.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a beautiful large room on the 6th floor with a shower as requested. The shower was one of the best I've ever had, with a large shower tray. Regular wooden door to the bathroom area with a glass door to the toilet inside it so no problems with modesty. The window was treble glazed so no noise from the street which we were facing. The beds were comfortable and we slept well, 2 single beds pushed together and made up separately which was what we preferred. The staff were very professional and friendly, any requests were acted upon quickly. All reception staff spoke good English. The room was clean and towels were changed daily.There were 2 small fridges in the corridor with free bottles of water. Large safe in the room. If the bottled water runs out you can always find some on the ground floor. We brought our travel kettle as knew there were no tea making facilities in the room. There is a very good supermarket across the road and a bus from Las Ramblas area stops 70 yards from the hotel so easy to get back from the centre. We stayed for 7 nights and will stay again next time in Barcelona.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in March for 3 nights. Room was well presented, super comfortable beds and a pretty central location. Shower wall hadn’t been cleaned properly, some shower gel was evident, but by the time we realised we were desperate for a shower so rinsed it off ourselves. Other than that the room was spotless. Staff were super helpful and friendly. Overall a very positive experience. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel which I woudl visit again. Good pointsClean hotelGreat location- close to hop on hop off bus. Good Breakfast - had cereal, toast, bacon/eggs/sausages, pastries, cured meats and fresh fruit.Tv had lots of Spanish and english channels.Bad pointsShower was freezingBathroom door was frosted glass so you could see through whilst people on toilet
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideally situate for the tour buses run by julia travel Breakfast a bit pricy staff very very helpful. Only improvement I can suggest is a list of local nearby restaurants for dinner as evening meal was not offered by the hoel
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel, was cheap, but nice and you Get what you pay for! However if you want some privacy, my compagnion and I found it quite strange given that there is no solid door between the room and bathroom. Very Nice staff and cleaners!
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location for visiting main sights. Several buses stop nearby. Room clean and comfortable. Reasonable rates for room only. Didn't eat at hotel, so not able to comment on food. Plenty of places to eat nearby.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to Barcelona for 4 days which is amazing loved the hotel buffet breakfast which was scrambled eggs bacon sausages and lovely bread as well a continental breakfast rooms were clean great shower it is about a 30 mins walk to the tourist area but not a problem loads of lovely shops on the way we got a taxi from the centre and it was no more than 6 euros back to hotel for a city break we will be back again one day beautiful place the hotel is in a nice area
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff.. Each floor has free water in the minibar. The room and towels were clean every day. Our flight was late at 22 o'clock. but the staff saved our luggage after we released the hotel. Big supermarket opposite the hotel. Perfect location - only 2-3km from Sagrada Família, Park Güell, Casa Batlló, Casa Milà, La Ramba, Placa Catalunya - for lovers of walking. Comfortable bus stop to Camp Nou (H8). Me and my husband we recommend Hotel Condado and we will come back again. Greetings from Bulgaria.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not too far from the main stretch in the city and very easy to catch a cab. The biggest issue was with the refusal to give out more than one key for the room. If you and a fellow traveler decide to go separate ways during the day there is NO way to get into the room without them. IF they let you in, you won't have electricity while they're gone because the room key is required to power the room.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We bought a package and found this place by chance.The hotel is exceptionally clean, well run, the staff are great and the room was extremely comfortable. The best bed I can recall in a Hotel. Thoroughly recommended. Excellent value. Central and easy walking distance to the old town and with plenty of good places to eat and entertain locally.Deserves an extra star.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were pleasantly surprised about our stay at this Hotel. It was part of our cruise deal. The room which is a classic design, was clean, comfortable, and spacious. Breakfast was tasty, fresh and substantial. Couldn't resist the Spanish cakes so yummy also enjoyed the fresh fruit and patisserie.The reception staff particularly Jaime were incredibly helpful. We would highly recommend a stay in this hotel which is a little out of the tourist centre but close to many shops and restaurants.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in central location, easy access to bus stops, metro, shopping and places to eat. The hotel itself was nice, the staff weren't terribly helpful or friendly, but answered direct questions. The breakfast was overpriced in my opinion.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've spent 4 nights in this hotel. The room and the bathroom are big and clean!. We had a balcony in the room and the place is really quite. The reception is extremely helpful. A hotel worth booking. Recommended!!!!.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really lovely and clean hotel. Ideal for friends that need somewhere near to the centre of lloret de mar. Its a short 10 minute walk from the centre. Supermarket underneath hotel which has everything you may need for your trip. Shops and a few restaurants across the road too.Easy check in with friendly staff. You'll get new towels after two days.€100 deposit required but you get back once room has been inspected on departure. You need to bring your bins down though.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The experience staying at the hotel was satisfactory. A few things that weren't were its amenities i.e. there's no iron/ironing board, no in-room mini bar, no bottled mineral water, no room service and internet/WiFi connection was bad. Breakfast at the restaurant was decent though. If it weren't for its proximity to the office and the airport, this would have been the last hotel I would've booked or requested for. Overall, I do appreciate the good service of the hotel (hence, the 3-star rating for this review) and would likely return for a night but no more than that.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this 3* hotel as we didn’t really expect too much. The staff were very friendly and happy to help with any questions we had. The room was spacious, very clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was of the same standard, we couldn’t fault it. The breakfast although continental was of a great standard with something for everyone, they had hot scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages so you’re not limited to just cold foods . The waiter in the restaurant was a lovely chap and we communicated through broken English and lots of smiling/nodding. Location is great too, we walked everywhere except the football stadiume bus to. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a brilliant hotel for exploring Barcelona. We stayed for 5 nights. The area is quiet, but with lovely restaurants and shops nearby. Our room was small, but spotlessly clean. The rooms have air con, which is powered by the room key inserted into a panel on the wall, along with the electricity. There was a small desk, tv, and wardrobe in our room. The bathroom was clean, with a lovely powerful walk in shower. Word of warning, the toilet roll holder has sharp metal edges, and I scratched my arm a few times on this. There are fridges in the corridors that have free bottles of water. There is a washing and ironing service provided by the hotel for an extra cost. Breakfast is also extra. We didn’t try the breakfast as there are many cafes and bakeries around the hotel.There is also a supermarket just across the road that came in handy for snacks and drinks. Unfortunately there is no restaurant on site, but lots of nice places to eat within walking distance. We used public transport for our entire stay. Very cheap and reliable. I’d recommend the T-10 ticket for €10 which allows 10 journeys on all public transport including the bus and metros. Lots of buses run down the Diagonal street, which is great for getting to the tourist areas. We used a transport app called Moovit and I’d highly recommend using something like this. It makes using public transport an absolute dream. Another word of warning, the metro is a hotspot for pickpockets. We unfortunately witnessed an older gentleman have his wallet stolen out of his trouser pocket while using the metro. I’d recommend using a secure bag with a zip.We used the Aerobus to get to the airport from the hotel. It picks up from Plaça de Catalunya every 10 minutes and costs €5.90. If you don’t want to walk to the Plaça with your suitcase, there is a bus from the next street that stops there. Overall, this hotel is perfectly located to visit Barcelona.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights in Barcelona and found the hotel both modern and comfortable. It is near key bus stops and allows for easy walking into Gracia (a great neighbourhood to eat and drink in plus we were there for their fiesta which is brilliant - more luck than judgement... ). We had two rooms that had a joint entrance door that meant our daughters could go between our rooms without going into the corridor. There is a nightclub opposite but the windows are good sound proofing. Beds are nice and big. Staff all very helpful. I would use as a base again.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is nice, clean, 15minutes walk from train station Diagonal, if you like to walk, it is for you. Room cleaning service is just perfect, staff, especially all men from reception are very very very nice, ready to help and explain all the things, make useful recommendations, give good advice. There is a good supermarket Mercador right in front of the hotel, a lot of cafes around and a disco club and sports gym in front of it.
