The only thing is that breakfast is for separate cost and rather expensive: 12 euros per person+taxes.On the whole I highly recomment it for short affordable stays!!!!
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was comfortable, clean and quiet. I really liked the modern feel in the room. A bath tub and bath gel was a pleasant suprise. The staff was friendly and professional. The location is awesome. The Eixample area is full of good restaurants and bars and it is not outrun by tourists like some areas in the city. The hotel is within a walking distance from Diagonal subway station, from where you can travel easily to other parts of the city. As for negatives. There wasn't an own fridge/minibar in the room. There are only common ones in the hallways. And the blankets in the beds could be a bit thicker. Now they were more like bed sheets. But these were at least for me minor complaints in othwerwise great hotel.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Condado is not a bad hotel - it is simply average. If you had a "GOOD" rating I would give it that, but it doesn't deserve "Very Good". The rooms are typically European and small, which is fine. There is no real door between the room and the bathroom which is a little disconcerting and not very private. The hotel staff was extremely nice. The buffet breakfast was copious and the food was fresh. Parking cost 21 euros/day through a deal with a garage across the street which was very convenient. We had a little terrace off our room. No mini-fridge and no tea making facilities.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location close to bus stops. It is located a little away from the center of the city but this is what we prefer when traveling. The metro was a little bit of a walk but easy to use. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room were ample sized and clean. We enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 2 rooms (1 triple and 1 twins) for my family stay for 6 nightsGood points:1. Hotel is very closed to bus stops connecting well to tourists scene. Walking distance to Illa de la Discòrdia and Passeig de Gràcia (it helped as it was taxi strike during our stay)2. Rooms were spacious.3. Nice air-conditioning 4. It offered valued at par with its priceBad points:1. Hotel was dated.2. Breakfast with variety choices but not good in quality 3. Lots of night clubs nearby
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here for 5 nights. Just had my first nights sleep and it was amazing. Super quiet, great sized single rooms and the wifi is strong and fast.amazing vaule for money. Feels more like a 4 star than 3.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and a friend stayed here for a week at the beginning of June. Lovely building and nice room. Very spacious with everything you could need. However a mini fridge in the room would be a good addition although they do have mini fridges outside the room which they stock with free water bottles which is a nice touch. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. The receptionists were always willing to help and greeted us with a smile every time we saw them. Breakfast was nice. A little variation in what is served everyday would improve the breakfast but apart from that, it can’t be faulted. It is in a central location. About a 5 minuet walk from a train station which takes you to Plaça Catalonia where you can get most forms of transport that Barcelona offers. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. I recommend parking pizza which is about a 10 minuet and does the best pizzas. Also there is a bar/restaurant opposite the hotel which do great burgers and sangria. There is also a supermarket which is opposite the hotel which supplies everything you may need. Overall, a great hotel which made our week in Barcelona extra special. Thank you for a great stay.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is well located for sightseeing, whilst it is in a quiet area there are enough small cafes for a cheap breakfast and nice restaurants to dine in the evening. We were only there for four nights, and spent little time in the hotel but it was clean, had comfortable beds, and the room was ample. Our only window opened into what can be described as a “shaft” which gave a little light and you had to lean out to see what the weather was like, it didn’t trouble us but maybe others would prefer rooms with views onto the street. The staff were knowledgeable and helpful but they could do with smiling a bit more. There was free water in the lounge area but we only discovered that on our last morning so it is worth noting for other guests. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who is happy without a bar on the premises.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as it was recommended by Sawdays, and seemed very good even though it was only a three star hotel. We were not disappointed. Staff was extremely helpful in every way. Our superior room with balcony was great. I found the bed a little hard and the blanket and sheet situation frustrating. Would definitely recommend a duvet upgrade, but otherwise all good.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for work trip. Generally clean and in good location. However, hugely frustrating that they don't have any irons or ironing boards for guests to use. Really difficult when you are here on business and certainly first place that I have stayed with work where you cannot borrow an iron!! Other downside is that the bed is really hard and uncomfortable. Definitely wouldn't recommend.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little place just off the Avenue Diagonale which is one of the main roads into the city centre. Lovely walk down the road to the Ramblas about 25 minutes Staff at the hotel were very friendly and very helpful with suggestions of what to do and where to eat. Free water in a fridge in reception and on every floor was a nice touch. Breakfast was 12 euros and had a good selection of both continental options and eggs, bacon and sausage. Rooms nice size and clean. Lots of cafes and restaurants around the hotel. Close to the hop on hop off tourist buses which were easy to get on from this hotel.Would definately stay again if we return to Barcelona.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel served all our needs and met all expectations for the price range. It is well located, you can either walk or use several public transportation options to get around the city, and the overall area seemed quite safe.There are lots of nice restaurants and shops nearby. The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. The free water bottles were also a nice touch! The reception staff were polite and helpful. While not fancy, overall this is a great hotel to crash and recharge batteries when exploring barcelona.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights last week and had a great time. We arrived at 11am and were lucky enough to be able to check in straight away. As newbies to Barcelona we needed help with finding our way round - all the reception staff were very helpful and their english was first class. The location is a little far out from the centre, but in walking distance. We chose this on purpose to meet our criteria for relative peace in a bustling city and the hotel delivered this - although our room was at the front of the hotel we slept like babies ! We did not have the breakfast so cant comment on that. There is a reasonably sized mercadona over the road and several good restaurants. If we go to Barcelona again we will definitely return !
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel via BA website. Great little place just off the Avenue Diagonale which is one of the main roads into the city centre. Lovely walk down the road to town took about half hour but distracted by all the shops! Hotel so quiet and peaceful. Staff there were lively and couldn't have been more helpful. We arrived around 9pm first night and they suggested a restaurant (left out of hotel then left again and up the road about 100 metres) called Patron which was lovely. Free water in a fridge in reception. Didn't try breakfast but was told it was 12 Euro. Lovely and clean great room attendance. Can't fault it. Also close to the hop on hop off tourist buses which were easy to get on from this hotel.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and quiet with good sized rooms. The air conditioning works!! They provide free bottles of water from fridges on the landing. The hotel is within a short walk of the bus stop which will bring you into the centre and there are lots of coffee shops and restaurants nearby. We enjoyed our stay in the Condado and would recommend it
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel around 6 am after a long trip from Granada. The hotel staff were very friendly and offered us a beautiful room around 7 am which was magical for us since we thought we have to wait till noon to get a room, but they were super nice and quick in preparing a room after the early leave of a guest.No breakfast was included in the reservation.The location was not ideal for those who love to walk in city center, we had to take the taxi each time we wanted to go out.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just spent a week at the Condado Hotel, Barcelona, which I booked through EasyJet winter holidays some months ago. I wasn't sure what to expect of the Hotel, other than what I read from other reviews. It was given a 4 star rating, and was considered close to the the well known sites. The reviews weren't far wrong. It was not typical of your Costa type hotels, but more of a professional business type hotel catering both for travellers and business people attending meetings in Barcelona. I found the hotel well cared for and clean with nice decoration and facilities. The staff were very helpful and most spoke English well if you had a query. The rooms were very clean and maid service was daily ensuring new towels; shampoo & shower gel; as well as making beds etc. One of the bonuses of this hotel for me was on each floor there were a number of small fridges providing free bottled water to use in your room or take out with should you feel thirsty. I booked daily breakfast for my wife and I, which was more than adequate with continental breakfast; scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages; fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals etc. The location of the hotel was quite central, with a 15 minute walk to the main shops and 30 minute walk to La Sagrada Familia church. Although we walked everywhere, there were buses and trams in the vicinity if you wanted to go further afield. The main road near to the hotel, is called Avenguda Diagonal, which by its name travels in a diagonal length across most of Barcelona. This Avenue is tree lined with beautiful walkways throughout its central area. It has many benches for sitting down if needed. I found it useful to use this avenue as my focal point to get about Barcelona without being lost. After a couple of days walking, I found my bearings with the area and was able to make my way to many of the sites around the central area of Barcelona. All in all, the Hotel Condado was very convenient with lots of supermarkets and restaurants in the nearby area. I would definitely use this hotel again. The only pointer I would mention as I wasn't aware of it before travelling to Barcelona, is that there is a Tourist Tax in force that all tourists have to pay. This was brought to my attention as I was checking out of the hotel. For the week, I had to pay €10.01 for the privilege of staying there. Not a fortune but be aware of this before booking.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel after a recommendation from friends. The hotel was ok it was clean and the beds were comfy. There were complimentary shower gel and shampoo and house,eeping did a great job when they looked after the room.Unfortunately we realised that this hote was a bit too basic for us, we usually choose a hotel a bit more luxurious but as the reviews were alright and our friends had been we thought it would be fine. There wasn't anything specifically wrong with it but it was just a basic hotel.The best bits were fridges with bottles water free to everyone every day, the reception staff were informative when asked for help although didn't volunteer anything without asking. The beds were comfortable and there was plenty wardrobe and cupboard space.The bad bits were it's a good fifteen minutes walk from the metro and a good way from the airport bus stop and the train station to the airport. It's also on a madly busy road which is always expected in a busy city and the substantional double glazing helped with th noise. We have stayed in lots of city hotels and have always accepted the noise as part of the holiday however right across the road from our window was a night club. On the second night were were kept awake from 1am until around 5.30am when the club emptied. We decided we couldn't stay in that room again and asked to be moved. We were told we could but had the inconvenience of having to pack everything and leave our cases at reception for the day until a room could be found. When we got back that evening we had been given a room at the back which was much quieter and a lot nicer. Unfortunately we were leaving the next day somdidnt really unpackmproperly again. We slept a bit better.Overall we definitely wouldn't return to this hotel but it was a decent price for an expensive city and was clean and comfy. We would probably chose something a bit nicer and a better location but I think for some, like our friends, it could be perfect it's just not for us.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good location and very reasonably priced. We had a family room on the quiet side of the hotel on a b n b basis. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The. buffet breakfast was excellent. The free WiFi worked well. The only negative was the lack of a fridge in the room.Next time we visit our friends in Barcelona we will certainly stay here.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small hotel located in Eixample district of Barcelona. We stayed here for 5 nights. The common areas of the hotel are nicely decorated and inviting. The room was a bit small and the bed was not the most comfortable. Also, the room was dusty. However, the location was fantastic and the front desk staff were friendly.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located near all the fun things to do and the train. The restaurants downstairs are sooo good. We came here for dinner 2 nights in a row and the food was very good. Service great as well.The rooms were a bit small and the beds very not that comfortable. Otherwise.... good value.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value in a part of town reasonably close to where you might want to be. About 8 blocks to either of 2 closest metro stations. Numerous restaurants and shops nearby. Quiet location, even though nearby busy streets.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is elegant and quiet. Has balcony but no view. Room we got is on the small side and very dark. A block from the diagonal is a plus. Two gentlemen at the reception are helpful but a bit impersonal. A welcoming smile would be nice. Overall good stay.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great. Very polite, helpful and friendly staff. Free use of computer and printer so great to print of flight tickets. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Only downside I had was I put some fizzy juice in the fridges that supply free water on floor and someone took it (not hotels fault). Great location in Garcia and within walking distance to all attractions if you are not afraid of 25 to 40 minute walk. Transport available near hotel although didn't check these. Near to train station and metro for getting around and to airport. Good selection of breakfast items continental and hot. A little pricey though I got a great deal for the accommodation including breakfast. Very quiet at night as room was away from traffic noise. Would book this hotel again if visiting again. In addition the tour buses were great to get around as we used if first day and lets you get off and back on at various stops throughout the day.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Condado is a three star hotel but in my experience it should be four star. There is nothing to complain about, staff were courteous and helpful even to us non Spanish speakers. Rooms were clean and bigger than I thought I was going to get. Breakfast was good as well, everything you need for continental and cooked. Breakfast was updated by staff all the time and I have to compliment the gent who looked after the breakfast as he never stopped cleaning tables and keeping the food at the breakfast table up to date. Also the reception was very clean and had fresh iced water for anyone to use. The bonus for us was the unlimited supply of bottled water in fridges on all floors. All I can say is thank you for a good stay, and thank you to the staff member who found my money belt.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean and location was good. The front desk staff need to more customer service skills as everyone I ran in to came off as very standoffish and aloof. I was afraid to approach them to ask any questions because they seemed so involved with themselves. The one time I did ask for some direction, I was given a very curt reply. Overall, I would look for another hotel if you are going.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My young adult daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights to explore Barcelona before a great bike trip with Creative Catalonia.We then returned for one more night 10 days later and it was like coming home to family!!!The rooms are quiet with great double paned windows. We were on the 6th floor facing the street and I am a very poor sleeper.With ear plugs in, the street noise was barely audible until 7 am when the mopeds were operating- time to get up and explore this wonderful city by then anyways.The staff are very professional, helpful and go out of their way with their clients. Treat them with respect and a smile and the staff will reciprocate. Their manners are much more formal than in North America, but please don't misunderstand this as being "cold"- that is not the case.I like hot herbal tea before bed, so although there is not those facilities in the room( very common in Europe), I went to the front desk staff each night with my tea bag and travel cup, and they were more than happy to prepare this for me in their breakfast room.We always felt safe in the neighbourhood, and the staff are quick to observe the comings and goings at the front door as far as clients that are entering.The water bottles on each floor were a godsend as it was 35C for several of those days.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel. Quite central about 15 minutes walk to Diagonal metro station. Quiet and clean. No tea /coffee making facilities but there is room service. Breakfast but no evening meal. But plenty of restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
6    Condado Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic stay great location to everything amazing view of Barcelona from the room and rooftop. I was nervous from previous review on location but this was no bother to us as the bus and metro was right next to us and you have to travel to get to see everything anyway
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel through easyJet and were a bit skeptical as we are a young couple who wanted to be in the centre of the city and saw a few reviews saying the location was bad and out the way. Turns out the hotel is in a great location! It is a 5-10 minute walk from a quiet beach, which has a beach bar that serves amazing food, and also a 5min walk from a huge shopping centre that has a Zara, Bershka, Sephora, pull and bear, a supermarket and a load of restaurants etc. The surrounding area is quiet, and more of a locals area. It also feels safe at night. In terms of getting to the city centre, the hotel is near two metro stops which are on line 4 and take about 10 mins to get into the city centre. The metro is extremely easy to use. It costs about €2.20 for a single journey. Despite also being told the metro is bad for being pick pocketed, we didn’t experience this at all and never felt unsafe. The hotel itself is extremely modern and very clean. Our room was a standard room and was lovely. We had breakfast included which had a massive variety and was also tasty. The hotel has a roof top pool and a few sun loungers which is nice, although we didn’t really use it as we preferred the beach. Staff were friendly and informative. I would definitely return!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely greeting by reception on arrival, we had a triple room which was a good size and the beds were clean and very comfortable. Shower was hot and powerful and towels were nice and clean, replenished when we needed them to be. Breakfast was delicious and very relaxed. Walked to Barcelona but it took about an hour they're are always taxis outside the hotel which usually cost around 13-15 euros into the city so it's expensive but there was 3 of us so wasn't too bad. Roof top pool is lovely but there aren't enough loungers yet enough space to fit in at least another 6 . Overall a great stay.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my short break here, staff were accommodating and bar staff were friendly, a little distance from the centre and in a rustic area but great views and easy transport options provided by the staff ! Thank you we will be back
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my family booked this hotel because on the website it looked very nice clean,close to the beach close to the shopping mall. But this wasn’t the case we had stayed in this hotel for 11 nights and I have to stay it was not what it seems on the website. The shower was terrible i had turned it on to find out it was only dripping no pressure at all from the shower head. Therefore I had to go to reception for them to change my room and they did but the shower wasn’t that great from the previous room. Also I had notice that when the cleaners had cleaned my room they had not checked under the tv stand or under the bed for dust. I had mentioned to the reception staff that this had not been cleaned and that there were gonna get someone to clean it straight away that was not the case no one had cleaned it. I don’t recommend this place at all and will deffo not be coming back!!!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A short two day stay for a conference at the nearby convention centre. The hotel was ok, but maintenance and presentation not up to the standards I would expect for the price being charged. Also, the hotel was very noisy due to the open plan design on one of the nights.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The experience of booking the hotel was good. It was my partners birthday and I wanted it to be special. When we pulled up to the hotel, the area was not great the taxi driver warned us that it was not a nice area, however said the hotel was beautiful. The place it’s self beautiful, the staff at reception incredibly helpful and the booking in process incredibly slick. When we got to the bedroom to the bedroom that also was amazing. In the morning we were greeted and shown to our seats. The provision of tea and coffee was not as clear and we struggled to get the milk and coffee until well into breakfast. The food was pleasant, however the topping up of certain intense such as cold meats and cheese was slow leaving many little choice for continental. When we finished breakfast we went up to the pool and terrace bar.... despite being just gone 10 o’clock (the earliest you can get to area and find somewhere to settle on a sun bed)... we were shocked to discover that neither this bar, nor the main bar on the ground floor was open to sell drinks...no water, no coffee, soft drinks... NOTHING. I asked in reception if this was correct and perhaps there was a vending machine to catch the period between end of breakfast and 12noon (once you are out of the breakfast area you are out!!). NOTHING!! I went back to the mini bar in desperation at circa €5 euros per drink, ideally you wanted something more... but needs must. Once open one of the days the barman from the night before “forgot” to leave a key for the soft drinks cupboard... so for the first few hours that was a limited choice also. We ordered a pizza for lunch, this was not pleasant, despite being hungry we barely managed half a pizza between us... excluding everything we had removed in a separate pile which was inedible!! - it was tasteless and bland. We spoke to the bar staff, but whilst they acknowledged little had been eaten wasn’t really interested. The club sandwich the following day was better but still not brilliant. The room service we ordered that evening was vile... the french fries were over cooked and reheated potato bites... they were disgusting!! They were so bad no amount of salt/vinegar could salvage them and the smell from old cooking oil left us both beeping nauseous. Don’t get me wrong the hotel and room were great. But such little things could have saved this trip!!Fast forward to checkout.... Smith and pain free no issues with settling the mini bar bill (from the previously mentioned drinks drought). We handed the keys back and the front desk team were kind to allow us to have a complimentary gym pass until we were picked up that (early) evening.That last day we stayed on the rooftop and relaxed... the gym equipment barely worked, was in poor working order that said it was complimentary but I am just illustrating again how little things make it difference... the showers and toilets post work out had no way of ensuring privacy of someone else coming in!!! And stunk of mould/poor drains. Now fast forward to being home... I check my bank balance to discover two transactions from the hotel... 1) authorised amount for the room 2) £137... I email the hotel to receive a prompt apologetic response advising the amount had been credited to my account. No explanation but an apology. The next day I check my account... £4 short. Now I know it’s only a small amount, potentially the strength of the £1 with recent Brexit events could have affected this... but when I emailed the hotel saying where is the full refund I got a short sharp response “we’ve refunded you - we’ve already told you so”. I responded with a screenshot to illustrate I was out of pocket...nothing back. Regardless of why this happened, this is poor. Communications ceased. Would I recommend the hotel... yes, would I recommend the experience of staying... NO!!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 nights here and it was perfect. Hotel staff were friendly and really helpful, appreciated the time they took. Room was very clean and bigger than expected. breakfast buffet was lovely and fresh ( book it when you arrive as cheaper than if you book online or in the restaurant itself) Hotel is not in the best of areas but only took 10 minutes into city centre and this was not a problem. Would recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights recently. Turned up 2 hours early for check in and were greeted by a lovely member of staff who checked us in, very friendly and helpful with regards to getting around and seeing things, The room was gorgeous, well equiped with shampoo, conditioner etc safe in the room. Breakfast was the best i have had in a hotel, so much variety constantly be re stocked. All in all a great location, metro was super easy to use, and the taxis to and from the airport were super cheap and again friendly. If we come back to Barcelona will definately be staying here again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 3 days in July with a group of friends. We were all on floor 6 with 7 of us sharing 3 rooms. On our first day I put a number of items including my ipad in the safe in our room however we could not get it to close as it was faulty. We left the room at 11.00am and went to the lift which was about 5 metres away, while we were waiting our other friends appeared and we decided to use their safe as it was working. I went back into the room to get the items in the safe to move them. However in the time we had been out the rooms which was not more than 5 - 10 minutes the ipad had been stolen. Someone with a key to the room had gone in and stolen the ipad from the broken safe.When I reported this to the manager Susana Jimenez we were told someone would fix the safe and they would check the records of who entered the room. However when we went back to the room the safe has not been fixed and the manager advised there was no record of anyone entering. The manager further advised none of their staff would take anything and nothing they could do.The hotel clearly has a security issue. Our room was accessed with a key and the thief went straight to the broken safe. The management were clearly not interested and for this reason I do not see this issue being resolved. We lost most of Friday dealing with the broken ipad as we had to report it to the police station and did not get out until 2.45pm.The staff advised they would approach their insurance company however they confirmed they would not pay out despite both the negligence of the broken safe and the room being accessed by a key.I would not recommend staying at this hotel as I felt the management attitude to the theft would mean it could happen again. I have stayed at Melia group hotels before and had good experiences however I would not recommend the group again if my experience at this hotel represents their brand.I travel internationally professionally for work as do all the people I was travelling with. I have been lucky so far to never have had anything stolen until I stayed here - so a very upsetting experience made worse by the poor attitude of the management.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent two nights for my work.The staff is very friendly, the welcome respect and responsiveness are very good.the beach and near and a shopping center too . This hotel is highly recommended.Thank you
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely breakfast, quiet area, friendly staff, good breakfast. What else can one ask for? I enjoyed walking down to the malls, the stores nearby, the Metro, etc. Make sure you try the rooftop swimming pool!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family used this hotel and loved the upstairs bar and pool. The staff from check in, the buffet, the pool bar were extremely nice, friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back to this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is lovey and the rooms are quite modern and clean. The only thing that let the rooms down is the lack of mirrors. If you wish to stay in the centre of Barcelona it may not be for you (it usually took 10 minutes on the metro). The breakfast at the hotel was OK, it was just what you would typically expect but was enough to prepare you for a full day's sightseeing. The staff in the hotel were all genuinely quite pleasent and very helpful, however the staff at the pool area at times where very rude and I could find myself waiting 10 minutes for a drink despite being the only person at the bar. One major downfall of the visit was on our final day the pool area was rented out for a Birthday Celebration which meant we could not use the area that day. I'm unsure if this is something the hotel regularly does but I wasn't impressed by this
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we got to the hotel every member of staff was helpful, I arrived nearly 2hrs before my checkin time, they phoned and a room was available, so I was checked in straight away, the room was very clean, the WiFi was fast and reliable throughout the hotel.The staff asked what sites and places I wanted to visit and told me the best way to get there, and I was able to buy tickets at the hotel for some.The rooftop was a very pleasant place to relax or have fun in the pool, with some nice views
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived today 07/24/2019 around 5pm and the AC at the room was off, it’s around 40 outside. We turn the ac on and after an hour we ask a person thy came to the room to bring an extra bed that was supposed to be there before we arrived she said is ok wait. Now is almost 1am and we can’t sleep do to the room temperature and is nothing they can do at this point. Outside of the hotel is terrible. Employees are not welcoming at all except for a white woman on the front desk.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived at the hotel we checked in and in the bath in our hotel room there was several hairs in there which straight away was off putting. The location is extremely bad for pick pocketing. Stayed here for 4 days not once did the housekeeping come in to change our bedding out change the towels which is unacceptable considering on booking.com website it states “daily housekeeping”. Also after we checked out the hotel I checked my online banking to find I had been charged on my card by the hotel but was not sure what for. I called the hotel and was told it was for 2 drinks out the minibar which I DID not take. The hotel agreed housekeeping must have made a mistake and agreed to refund me and send a confirmation email on Tuesday 16th July. Today is Friday 19th July and still had no email or refund so called back up told the same thing again no one was helpful on the phone. Person I spoke to put me on hold for 5 minutes and then a woman came on the phone not sure what the reason for this was. Overall would not stay in this dump again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to explore the city. Everything can be accessed by the Metro which is very good value for money and very close by. The roof top bar and pool are great and offer a panoramic view of the city
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So we got a junior suite which had a huge speaker in it and after coming home from our first night we played some music not even half way up - the security were at the door. Long story short, if you plan I'm having any fun in this hotel then go else where :)
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice get away with the Mrs. Relax and wind down! The hotel staff was so friendly, rooms clean and made every morning! The breakfast all you can eat is a must! They have a roof top pool that you can go in but felt too cold for that. The only downside was the bar at reception was lacking in service as the bar tender had to run around and leave us un attended all the time to do room service!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights. The room was a bit outdated and the mattress and pillow were as well. I really don't like it when you hear and feel the mattress springs.Breakfast was good with a wide choice of food.Rooms have air conditioning but in the lift and corridors it can be hot. There is a nice pool and great pool bar but unfortunately it closes at 00:00. There is really nothing else in the neighbourhood so you will have to take the bus to the city centre.Would give a 3,5 quote but this is not possible.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Welllll . . . except for Daniel, the bartender at the rooftop snack bar, and a couple of front desk folks, the staff (especially bartender at main bar downstairs) was rude and seemingly uncaring. The room itself was OKAY, but no shampoo etc., the location is way away from the city center and not even walking distance. Close to bus, but definitely not a good idea at night if alone. Should be better for a four star hotel!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt so welcome when we came and we were so pleased with everone we met! A great Hotel, a wonderful tio roof and a breakfast that had it all! The room was big with a very fresh and modern bathroom!Thank you!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel rooms and staff were nice and clean. Echoing other comments about needing more mirrors,the only one being avaliable at the sink right next to the bathroom (with glass doors...). No coffee, and toiletries as you would expect. The breakfast was very good. However, big disappointment with not being allowed to take coffee or even water up to my room! Some weird policy! The chairs are lethal, as we witnessed a child tipping over. Pretty dangerous for adults leaning forward as well.Management need to do something. Difficult for me to recommend.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were exceptional - really friendly, helpful and professional. The room was large and comfortable, and the bathroom very pleasant. Breakfast was fabulous - a very good spread and some lovely special treats as part of the selection, including churros and a wide array of pastries, as well as good savoury options and lovely fresh fruit. Thank you for a great stay!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff where excellent, very friendly. Hotel cleanness was excellent. Location not the best but taxi’s always outside. Happy with the choice I made to stay in hotel condal mar managed by melia for our girly trip away.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was nice and modern, staff very friendly and helpful. But this hotel is way further away from a metro than I thought and even the beach. The location ruined our trip a bit as are feet were tired as it was from all the walking so by the time we got back from our day out we couldn’t face the 40 min (door to door) journey back into the centre.Bathroom door is completely see through and the only mirror and sink is right by it so couldn’t get ready whilst other person was in the bathroom and just made the stay very uncomfortable just for the sake of trying to be trendy.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was completely worn out. Edges of pictures were scuffed, the chair was so stained. The AC display was broken. But luckily it was still working. My colleagues was not working. Location was not great. It was at least 30-60mons to get to the center. Bus stop was not too far away tho. Metro stop was about 15mins walk away. It took us 2hrs to get there from the airport by public transport.Breakfast was average but there was not much choice nearby so we opted for having it at the hotel. The man seating us was rude. The hot food was all cold on both days even when it came straight out of the kitchen. Choice of teas were not that great either.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel a bit far from the city center but with good access. Quiet and quiet area to rest after sightseeing. Great breakfasts with a very large selection. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful in every matter. Room spacious and well-equipped. Beds comfortable. I really recommend staying at this place.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was well organised staff professional as from checking in.We felt safe living our belongings.Staff were helpful with guidance about tourist attraction sites.and how to reach them instructions were clear.We took pictures to keep memories and recommend to friends.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean and modern and very nice to stay in. Bit of a hike to the centre but big shopping centre close by.Restaurant service for breakfast was brash and not very polite but the food choices were great. Can't change the location but improving the service would make a big difference.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Condal Mar for 4 nights in May and had a fantastic stay. It was unfortunately a little too cold to sit by the pool but the views are amazing and having a bar and music on on the roof are really nice features - this would be excellent in the summer! We didn't use the spa facilities either but these are another bonus!The rooms are really modern, spacious and have a snack bar, hairdryer, shower creams etc. in the room if needed. The bed is also really comfortable. It was quite noisy early in the mornings as the doors slam very loudly and you could hear loud voices in the corridor (I think the cleaning staff) but overall we slept very well.The location of the hotel is not the most ideal if you intend to sightsee a lot, although there is the option of public transport. We walked to the Sagrada in about 40-45 minutes for example so it is doable but can be a lot of walking!We would definitely stay at the Condal Mar again for a more relaxing holiday by the pool and it's only 10 minutes walk to the beach too with lots of restaurants and bars. The beach is also much quieter than in the centre which is really nice. It's also close to the Diagonal Mar shopping centre with numerous restaurants so you are spoilt for choice!We booked our stay with last-minute.com and everything went very smoothly including our transfers and the whole booking process. I would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not in the best location to get to all the tourist attractions but very close to beach. And public transportation very very close by. Would stay again if interested in being in that part of town. Breakfast buffet was best part about hotel.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for our second trip to Barcelona. The reason we opted for the hotel was that we wanted to stay close to the beach so that we could run along it. The hotel is modern clean with a great breakfast choice. The upgrade options were a little annoying as I would expected to have a kettle already in the room and not have to pay for a better room for a kettle. That said the was fine, it is situated 1km from the beach which is a great walk to the harbour approximately 3/4 miles. It is a little out of the city centre so as long as you are active it's a good location.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good stay for people who want to see Barcelona/ Good location in the city - near from city metro and bus lines (bus is very close). Very good breakfast - everything was delicious. Very professional and friendly staff.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice Hotel with excellent breakfast, nice rooms and good service. The Staf at the the reception were very helpful and gave many advices. The food at the restaurant was good but there were not so many choices.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: pay the extra money and book somewhere central where you won’t have to keep getting taxis and may get better service and food. Or wait until more in season as you may find it is better when they have more staff and guests
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel sight unseen on a meeting website and only learned after I paid for my stay that reviews were not stellar.To my surprise, I have been treated very well by the staff, almost everyone speaks English, the breakfast (which was included in the room) was sumptuous. For lunch and dinner there is a snack menu which I found suitable but many likely would not.Lots of places large and small within walking distance and a 5 minute walk to Av. Diagonal.The hotel is oval, and the rooms are on the oval so the room shape is a bit strange. The room decoration is functional but plain (fine by me). The room was plenty big for me, but would probably be tight for two. Had my wife been able to make it, one of us would have lived out of a suitcase.If I were back in Barcelona for business again, I would stay here. If my wife were with me, I would probably stay elsewhere
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was okay, we arrived on a Monday. Originally we did not get breakfast as I thought it’d be better to find somewhere to get something I know I’d enjoy, the receptionist convinced me to get breakfast for the duration of my stay (€60). When arriving to the room it was lovely no problems, during the evening the temperature of the room was freezing so we turned the heating on however it didn’t actually get any warmer. The water was very annoying, you couldn’t actually have warm water, it was either you had boiling water or cold so couldn’t really enjoy a nice shower.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is good but the location is a bit far from the center, but the H14 bus stop in front of the hotel and the metro station is an advantage and we did it very easyI am very happy because I got the room very early when I arrived at the hotel:), around 11 o'clock
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable, even if it is quite far from downtown. There is shopping center not far from the Hotel, but not many other locations so a taxi is needed if you want to visit Barcelona. Sevice and Rooms are very good even if I found quite long the queue for Check IN and Check OUT.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite far from the town centre, but there are taxis available.The staff are skilled and experienced. And if you wanna go to shopping there is a shopping center close to the hotel.And the beach is within walking distance of the hotel.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got such a great deal on this hotel I didn’t know what to expect and was so worried. This was our first trip to Barcelona and international and the accommodations went over and above our expectations! The hotel is very modern, walking distance to the mall and restaurants. It’s not a far drive to La Sagrada Família about 15 mins! It’s a bit away from the center but close to Bogatell Beach. The staff was amazing and food was good. I wish the bed was softer it was a bit hard but everything else was so great!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wasn’t a very friendly or welcoming place, hardly any staff had to ask if their was someone to take your food or drink order and the staff hardly cracked a smile apart from one or two.. shame the atmosphere isn’t better because it’s a lovely hotel!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked direct through the Meliá website about a week before travel and had no problems getting a room at a very reasonable rate given it’s low season.A very modern hotel in what appears to be a developing area of Barca. Selva del Mar L4 is the nearest Metro station which within 20/25 mins has you bang centre in Catalunya Sq.Staff were fantastic, Sonia on reception, Marina, Albert & Yeremi in the restaurant and bar were attentive and always smiling.The roof top pool and deck has great views of the city though pool not open as it’s winter.Thanks Condal Mar - I’ll be back
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff. Staff at the reception is very friendly. Staff at the morning breakfast are certainly much less friendly you can never see even a smile at their faces. Hotel is quite clean. Not a nice neighborhood, thus it is recommended to always take a taxi from right in front of the hotel.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was one of the best hotels we’ve stayed in but felt it wasn’t in a good position Over the weekend we felt isolated and scared to go out in the darkLoved our room especially the bathroom Breakfast was very nice and staff were very helpful and friendly
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located a bit far from the diagonal - problems: no a/c, not clean, terrible taxi service, over crowded dining room, private car service troubles, no food variety, all in all a very bad experience
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is decent and built stylishly.The staff is very friendly and professional and the restaurant is very good with good options for breakfast.The location is okay and there is connectivity.This could have been a much better experience.The zest was missing...
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel looks nice but is not in a good area. Nothing nearby to the hotel, it is in an industrial type area. Walking distance to the metro which is 20 minutes ride into Barcelona centre. Roof terrace was not available to use during our stay in October. No tea and coffee facilities in the room or even a complimentary bottle of water. Quite basic for 4 star hotel. Breakfast very nice.Lady on reception was lovely although the rest of the staff were not overly friendly. Disappointed with our stay. May be best for business people but not tourists.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very disappointed with pool on rooftop compared to photos staff very good and friendly. Very very noisy ever time phone rang you could hear in room can’t understand why phone turned up so loudly as staff standing right be side it . Doors banging and banging all night so hard so sleep .
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel. Lovely views. Lovely staff. Lovely room. And lovely breakfast. My only criticism would be the beds were hard, but still slept well. And the pool is freezing. Other than that I would 100% recommend!Even put a birthday cake in my room. Cuties!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good choice for a stay in Barcelona. The position is suitable for visiting the beaches as well as for the city center. The place is quiet. There is a large shopping center within a 10-minute walk. Standard service at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not a 4 star Hotel, location not great and far from centre. Rooms need maintenance. breakfast was ok, but hot table not very hot. Bed sheets were stained as well, just not very nice. Also why don't all the rooms have a kettle and tea/ coffee facilities?
hotelName:
7    Hotel Barcelona Condal Mar By Melia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently spent 8 nights at this hotel (1 extra night, thanks to BA strike). The staff at this hotel were fantastic - friendly, helpful & good at communicating when I had to extend my stay at short notice. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Clot metro & you can travel 2 stops from there to Sagrada Familia or walk there in 15 minutes. There are plenty of shops, restaurants & a laundromat on your doorstep. My room was clean & the bed was comfortable & I had a decent shower in my bathroom (once I figured out the 3 different shower heads). Unfortunately, I do have a few gripes, the first being the fact that there were no plugs near the tea/coffee tray, which meant that I had to plug the kettle into a plug in front of the door to my balcony, on the floor or the other option would have been on the shelf at the head of my bed. I would have also appreciated a full length mirror outside the bathroom, instead of a full length picture. I was glad that I took my hairdryer, even though a hairdryer was advertised on the website. The hotel dryer had about as much power as a butterfly flapping its wings on my hair! Recently, when I stayed at a brand new hotel in Amsterdam, one of the staff told me that they all stayed in the hotel before it opened to guests, to see where it might be improved & experience it from a guest's perspective. Brilliant idea! I think all hotels should do this, maybe once a year & get a male & female perspective on how a room might be improved. My stay was pleasant enough, but I marked the hotel down slightly, due to the niggles mentioned.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean small boutique hotel with modern updated rooms. Hotel staff was very friendly & breakfast was good. The only problem is that the hotel is near absolutely nothing! They advertise as near the Sagrada Familia, but is actually a 30 minute walk or 10 euro taxi ride away. We had to take a 10 - 20 euro taxi anywhere we wanted to go. Rooms & service are 3-4 stars. Location is Zero! If you're coming to Barcelona stay in town.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went there to stay 3 nights in August. Upon checking in, I had to give my credit card which they noted its numbers, as a security! Never had that any of my holidays or 40 Euro deposit. Location is excellent with Metro nearby and the main attraction of Barcelona; Sagrada Familia, only 15 mins walk away. Nearby there are shops and bus stops. Breakfast is excellent with unusual wide selection for a city hotel and clean modern breakfast area. The beds are comfortable but noisy if you move about, while it's clean and modern looking bedrooms. There is only one lift and sometimes you have a wait a while for it, there are stairs, which not many people use, the reason for that is often the stair lights are switched off. Strange why that is.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is easy walking distance to the subway. Were were there in June and it was very warm out but AC in rooms worked nicely. Showers were great and managers were nice. Very English friendly and small shops near by for snacks, sodas, or other items. Breakfast selection was good. I would recommend as a short "get away" from the hustle of the typical tourist areas. Don't expect lots of extra room as this is Europe but great clean place to crash after long day of sightseeing.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife, daughter and I stayed at this hotel after booking on an easyJet package deal.Lovely well equipped rooms, very clean, breakfast on the terrace if the sun is out. Rooms were serviced daily. Breakfast choice was fairly good. Great coffee.Location was great, close to buses and metro stations, and only 15 minute walk to Sagrada Familia. We felt we were in the middle of the community, well out of the tourist type hotels and very handy for several mini markets and a few takeaways. Definitely would book to stay there again.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel. Clean. Smells beautiful throughout. Modern. Good facilities in the room.. ie decent size TV, kettle, water & fruit daily. Helpful English speaking reception staff. Nice touch on arrival with fizz, fruit & pastries. Also has a check out room to use if leaving later than check out time for freshening up before flight etc if you are making the most of the sunshine on the terrace before leaving Beautiful Barcelona. This hotel is within walking distance of tourist spots, metro station.... and the big red tourist bus...which is a must!!! Enjoy.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights in this hotel after a cruise. Friendly very help staff. Rooms spotless. Breakfast nice with gluten free items, toast, muffins and cereal. Complimentary water and fruit in the room.Nice outside terrace off breakfast room and small terrace on 9th floor. Only ten minutes walk from Sagrada Familia.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel just off La Ramblas. We were out walking on the first day of our stay in this beautiful city and my daughters phone was snatched straight out of her hand! She was walking about 15 ft behind us and last in a big group. The thieves had watched us walk by and targeted her. I just wanted to post this to let you all know and hopefully avoid the stress and wasted time in filing a police report. Hotel is in great location but you need to really careful. Only positive is it was not passports!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling with baby is always a challenge , but we make a great decision by choosing this hotel to stay ! Suite room was a blast ! Big room with kitchen, comfortable bed, breakfast is quite good. Staff were kind, helpful even help us to book our ticket to Camp Nou and the hotel also provide welcome drink, snack.definitely will stay in this hotel again if we go to Barcelona
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our 3 day stay at the Leonardo Boutique Hotel. Our room was clean & cozy. We loved the big shower in our bathroom. The Breakfast buffet was amazing with so many choices. Coffee machines also had many choices. Just a great way to start our day each morning. The location was great & close to the metro station & the Sagrada Familia. We were able to take a short taxi ride to the Cruise ship dock from this hotel as well. We would stay here again should we ever be back to Barcelona. Friendly front desk staff
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, accessible to Metro station and breakfast has good selection. There's a grocery store next door if you want some quick bite and try some nearby restaurant, they have some good authentic food.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For overseas tourists, the most important criteria is location.This hotel scores full marks for that. It is within short walking distance to the Clot Metro station. From there you are connected to the entire Barcelona, places of interests, etc. The El Clot-Arago Renfe train station is also nearby which connects to Barcelona Santa for onward train connections to other cities and Barcelona International airport or Aeroport.The staff were friendly and most helpful with whatever questions you may hv. For €9, you can avail yourself to their decent albeit limited budget breakfast.Room was comfy, clean and well maintained. The free WiFi is good.Just next door to the hotel is a supermarket with super afforded prices for take away food such as roast chicken, BBQ pork ribs, sandwiches, pastries, drinks, etc. There are plenty of cafes around too.Recommended by a seasoned traveller.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a 5 day break in Barcelona we booked in on Monday 15 April 2019- we chose this hotel for the location but we were unsure when we researched the area on google maps - first impressions around the area looked suspect - however it was a fabulous stay - the hotel smelt fresh in the corridors and impeccably clean - staff very welcoming and friendly - welcome drinks when you arrive and complimentary fruit and water every day in your room - it was a triple room and super clean - modern wooden floor and super size bed ! Slept like s log ! - no noise - every day our bed was made up - wonderful! Continental breakfast was overwhelming- friendly polite staff food all topped up from fresh fruit to scrambled eggs ! Lovely - roof top terrace imagine it to be stunning in the hotter months - this hotel is about 4 mins to Clot rail station - super service literally every 4 mins a train arrives - we bought T10 ticket gets you 10 journeys per person - brilliant - we went all over Barcelona totting up over 28 miles walking ! The Sangrada Familia ( unfinished church) is in this location it is a masterpiece - about a 12min walk from the hotel - lots of tourists congregated around the church - police on guard for security- some pleasant shops we spent half a day looking around - lovely - everything was great - highly recommend thank you Barcelona!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed in one of the suites in this hotel along with my elderly parents. First of all the hotel was accommodating with an early check in, about an hour before which was great, as we were pretty weary from the travel. We were also able to store luggage allowing us to grab lunch before check in. The area was safe. It is good to note that if you rent a suite (which is essentially an apt) that the entrance is in the back of the hotel. It’s a little bit of a bummer than you can only pass through the connecting hallway of the building for breakfast, otherwise it is locked and you have to walk around the hotel to the front. Breakfast was good. The staff were very nice. There was free espresso, water in the lobby which is awesome. Importantly the hotel was quiet and clean, about a 20min walk to Sagrada. Very easy to hail a cab as well from across the street of the hotel. Metro is around the corner. I would recommend.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. We booked a superior double room. It was big, night and airy. The shower was fab. The place was clean with a big comfy bed. Breakfast was lovely, with lots of choice. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The Metro / train stations are close by, so it’s easy to get around. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights and was impressed with everything. Excellent location. I got the train from the airport and it was a five minute walk to the hotel. Be careful if you are a lone traveller. I had my rucksack rifled as I left the train station. Luckily they only stole my glasses. The welcome at reception was excellent and I was offered water and fresh fruit whilst I checked in. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. Large flat screen TV in the room. Breakfast was excellent value. I did think I'd booked breakfast with the room but at just €9 for an excellent choice of continental options I was happy to pay again. Good faculties in the room. Hairdryer, tea, coffee and water. There is also a small fridge in the room. All in all I would recommend
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I decided to celebrate my engagement weekend with my fiance in Leonardo Boutique hotel. That was the best choice. I make surprise for him. To be honest after was lovely surprise for me as well. Amazing communication between reception. Hotel is modern, clean. Room are big. Nice breakfast as a buffet. Close to bus stops and metro station. I can high recommend and we will definitely back there soon. Thank you very much for all decorations. You make our day ❤
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, easy access to public transport, friendly staff (bubbly on arrival is always a winner!) nice room, good breakfast - everything perfect for a quick weekend away. Would happily stay here again
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel the day of. Great price and quality. Free glass of champagne upon arrival. Room well decorated in bright colors, had a double bed and a pull out. Was perfect for three people. Bathrooms clean as well. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I had this hotel booked for us through srprs.me so we were completely in the dark until the day we flew. When we arrived the reception were very courteous, spoke very good English, and got us checked in as quickly as possible. The room was very clean and well equipped, including a small safe which was a nice touch (we used it for passports and cash). The main entrance it's controlled by reception staff which stops just anybody from being able to walk in. 5 minute walk (if that) to Clot metro, and 10 minutes to Sagrada Familia. Very nice people, very clean and well connected hotel, would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This modern design hotel is located near the Tube, which is the best way to move in BCN. The rooms are nice though the views from the window are nothing special. The bathroom is fine but needs some maintenance soon. Good breakfast. Good option for a short stay.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very clean bright and friendly. The champagne on arrival and champagne breakfast was a lovely touch. Staff very nice and helpful as we booked the tour bus at the hotel. Would definitely recommend and we will be back. Thank you.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as a couple in November. Chose the hotel for the proximity to Sagrada Familia. Hotel reception are great, friendly and helpful. The rooms are small and we had opted for the private balcony. These are not really worth bothering with as the views are not great. The biggest issue was that you can hear everything in the rooms above, below and around you. There seems to be a lack of any insulation or sound proofing! Overall cleanliness is good and the rooms have everything you need, just a lack of space.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So the location is great in a safe neighbourhood. The rooms were very clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast is mediocre at best. Staff are lovely. Room size is good but just feels very dark. Would try a different hotel next time we come.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to Clot Metro station, giving good access to anywhere in Barcelona. The price is right. For 9 euros you can have breakfast, or you can walk to the many restaurants nearby. We found the area to be very safe, and enjoyed having an outdoor drink at the many nearby cafes.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Welcoming, friendly staff who gave advice on somewhere to eat. Comfortable, quite room which was clean. The bathroom had plenty of hot water. Excellent breakfast with a good choice of food. Convenient for the underground.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated just outside main city but close to top attractions, and close to good public transport connections, including to/from airport, the hotel was Ideal. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable, some bathroom fixtures were beginning to show some wear but again was clean and worked as a base to enjoy Barcelona from. The breakfast was typical continental style, and again the staff there were helpful and friendly, ready to show how things like coffee machine worked (watched staff member happily show grumpy ungrateful American "lady" how to work equipment and where plates/cups etc were stored.. don't you love our American friends?). I used the laundry facility and had the item back same day, washed and ironed and hung in my room, great. I'd use this hotel again if visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious and clean rooms; friendly and accommodating staff; excellent location just foot steps away from train station; near historic sites; delicious food (definitely try the little bakery around the corner (dulce leche cake); and entertainment. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights whilst in Barcelona for a holiday and Primavera Sound festival. The hotel is ideally located right next to Clot metro station and a couple of minutes from Clot Arago station which connects directly to the airport. We could be in the city centre or at Parc del Forum within 20 minutes. There are a couple of supermarkets and cafes/bakeries right next door and lots of restaurants within a few minutes walk from the hotel.We stayed in a suite which are in a separate building directly behind the main hotel and have their own entrance. We were not disappointed, it was very spacious with separate bedroom and living area with a well equipped kitchen and our own private terrace with seating which got the sun all afternoon. The bathroom was clean and modern with an excellent shower. Bed was comfortable with lots of storage in the bedroom and black out blinds which were ideal for sleeping late after the festival.The main hotel also has a roof terrace with sunbeds.Only slight downsides were the lack of any washing up/cleaning products for the kitchen but we found that house keeping would often wash up our cups/plates etc. Also you aren't given a key for the main door and have to buzz the main reception when coming back in giving your room number. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and I'd definitely recommend the suites to anyone else and would stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 3 nights while on a business trip, it is such a great location just off Las Ramblas.Hotel is clean & modern, rooms are small but that is to be expected in the city centre. Bar downstairs is pretty quiet but a good location to work from during the day.Breakfast is a cold buffet & it was tasty.I didn’t have any meals other than breakfast in the hotel as it is literally 5 minutes walk from dozens of restaurants, bars and La Boqueria food market which has everything you need!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to Barcelona for the weekend with some friends and really liked this hotel. It was near the subway station which is really easy to use and the staff was really helpful on every question we had about the different tourist attractions and how to get there. The room was clean, spacious, and the beds were comfortable.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. Very easy to take train from airport to hotel. A couple of supermarkets less than 5 minutes walk with all you need - fresh fruit, yogurt, wine, bread. Bakeries also within 5 minutes. And Glories Mall 15 minutes walk - here you'll find all the European brands, a Carrefour, and restaurants. Leonardo Hotel had apples, water and a welcome drink upon arrival - this was lovely! Breakfast was above average with choice of coffees and teas, fruit, pastries, eggs sausages. A terrace to enjoy breakfast if you prefer to start the morning in the sun. The staff upgraded our room upon arrival and although we had to walk 2 minutes outside and around the corner the extra space (a living room with kitchenette) was appreciated. Also, very close to attractions- just a 15 minutes metro or 40 minute walk. I would definitely come again! Book confidently.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable, quiet - and within a reasonable walking distance of the Sagrada Familia. Also very handy to the Clot metro station. Staff on reception were helpful and friendly but reception got very busy with only one staff member on, and multiple groups checking in/out. Would happily stay again however.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely 4 night stay clean , friendly service . Really cldnt fault it . Different stay there again , close walk to good restaurants . Metro station handy . Barcelona is a lovely city too visit very clean
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with amazing breakfast and helpful staff. Breakfast was really good!!!!!Nit really in the city center. But it is very easy to get there. Only like 30 min walk to sagrada fam. Staff is so kind and helpful. Love them all and miss you guys:)Will come back to spain and only to this hotel
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 6 nights in a one-bedroom suite with kitchenette and spacious deck in the hotel's adjoining apt. Hotel staff were enormously helpful and the housekeeping was a very high standard. A 15-minute walk to Sagrada Familia, and 15-minute Metro ride to Las Ramblas, from Clot station which is metres from the hotel.We liked staying in this quieter area with a great local vibe. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very helpful. Breakfast delicious compared to American hotel breakfasts. Well located near subway and bus. Very close to Glories shopping center which was a fun way to spend the evenings. The 9th floor patio worth exploring for sunset. Some quirks though: entry lighting goes out once you’ve been in the room 5 minutes (but this is where your clothes and suitcase are so it makes it a challenge to get dressed and pack); no wash cloths; few electrical outlets (definitely need a converter); not great pillows (and only one per person), but great bath towels!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked two rooms at this hotel on Booking.com by mistake. I realised my mistake immediately and cancelled one of the rooms. Two months later I cancelled both bookings, assuming I still had the free cancellation option. Turns out the hotel charged me €116 for the room I had originally booked in error. I’ll never use Booking.com or this hotel again. What a cynical way to make money!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s ok for short stay but the “double bed” was 2 joined single bed and it keeps moving around. so if 2 people plan to sleep together, either you stick to 1 bed and squeeze in or forget about it. also the mattress seems like it’s the cheapest one you could find in the market.the sofa was super old but they still put it there. the leather of the sofa was chipping off ALL over! it would be way better to just take it out, maybe the rating would be higher. though it’s good location super close to the metro station and super market. and the staff are nice.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little boutique hotel. Not exactly as close as stated to Sagrada Familia but its fine(2 metro stop away) as public transport is cheap, reliable n efficient. Rooms are small but functional, well kept and staff does good job keeping it clean. One of our friends had his wallet pick pocketed on the train and Augustine one of the front counter staff was very helpful with everything. You can literally ask him anything and he will tell you. Didn’t have breakfast at hotel as there were so many great cafes/patisseries close by.
hotelName:
