8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a week.I was made feel very welcome by Silbina on reception and she pointed out a lovely local restaurant as it was late at night.Big plus is the nearby Clot metro..you have access to all of Barcelona from there.The room was comfortable and clean..but be careful of the shower..the base was like a skating rink.Tea n coffee making facility.I stayed in a few evenings and the TV only has 3 English speaking channels..all news.Thankfully wifi was good.Supermarket right next door.I didnt have the breakfast so cant comment.I would stay again.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: location near metro, friendly staff, very good breakfast, priceCons: small and not very comfortable room which was cold the first night and heated very slowlyAll-in-all the hotel is ok for staying a couple of nights
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A small boutique hotel within 15 min walk of Sacreda Familia. Next to a subway station, lots of small local bars and restaurants. The rooms are decent sized,clean and updated, breakfast included wasn’t bad, has a rooftop terrace . Parking is available at the usual high rates (we paid 18 euro a day).
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this place to see Barcelona in two days with a friend. Good access to metro, Clot station 5 min walk or less. Room was clean and spacious and the shower amazing. The receptionists were friendly and helpful as my friend and I arrived at different times. I do not remember their names but one was Argentinian and the other from Philippines I believe. Both very helpful and gave us a lot of tips about times to visit touristic places, etc. Thank you again ladies!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just two streets, less than 5 minutes, from the Ramblas. Direct access to the metro. Clean rooms and very friendly staff. Hotel has a great atmosphere nice design several spaces in the lobby to sit and enjoy a drink, each section another theme.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this place for a long weekend touristing in Barcelona, and it didn't disappoint. The rooms were clean, reasonably spacious and the staff were friendly and responded quickly to queries. It's a very short walk (just round the corner) from Clot metro station, giving access to the whole city, and about 5-10 mins walk from El Clot-Arrago train station, which gives direct connection to the airport.Only downsides were the room was slightly dark (second floor window looked out on to other tallish buildings), it was not huge, and the hotel is not quite as close to the Sagrada Familia as the name suggests - it's actually two metro stops, or about 20-30 mins walk away. I'm happy to give it a 5* rating though, because it doesn't purport to be the Ritz, and its prices are entirely reasonable!
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff helpful and friendly, especially Juan on the front desk. We spent first night in a double instead of the twin we expected, but that was rectified the next morning and upgraded to a suite. We really enjoyed our stay, in this clean and well maintained hotel. There is a small supermarket next door, and great bakeries, restaurants and shops on every corner. Having a Metro station round the corner made exploring so easy and Sacrada and Recinte Modernista de Sant Pau are both within walking distance. We totally enjoyed our 5 nights at this hotel and would recommend it as a good place to stay. Loved the Shower...lol
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We has a lovely time here in a suite. Back entrance to the suite was only 100m to the subway entrance. Room was very clean and tidy, well appointed with a nice private courtyard. We had a few minor issues which were fixed most promptly. Staff are friendly and attentative and speak good English.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location: A 15 minute walk to the Sagrada, on the doorstep to the subway, a few steps away from a great breakfast bakery/cafe and immersed in a cosy neighbourhood. The one bedroom suite was clean, comfortable with a courtyard balcony. My two boys (13/17) were comfortable on the pullout couch, had good wifi and tv.Lots of pressure in the shower.We would stay there again or maybe at the Leonardo on La Ramblas.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 7 nights at this hotel. On arrival we had a cold drink and a chocolate each given at check in. Rooms were very clean. On arrival to our room there was a free large bottle of water and apples. Our toiletries were replaced daily as we're our top sheets. Quiet location. Breakfast had a big selection but was mostly the same everyday. Kept warm was eggs, bacon, sausage and Spanish omelette. There was a Bread selection. Pastries including croissants and doughnuts. Then there was cereal, dried fruit and yogurt. There was a large Nespresso machine, fruit juice and water. Helpful staff who always answered our questions. Lacks a pool. It if you ask for a small fee you can use the pool and sun terrace at the other Leonardo hotel in La Ramblas. Only one lift but we didn't have a problem with waiting. Convenient location to walk to Sangrada Familia (10 minutes walk away) and the metro station Clot (5minutes away). Free Wifi which is good for the most part but did cut out at times. Two sun terraces with spectacular views across the city. Supermarket right next door. Would stay again.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel for a short stay in Barce. We had an issue checking in, we paid upfront for the room when we booked so the room was already paid for. When we checked in the 2 slightly rude girls on the desk said we needed the card we used to pay for security reasons to prove who we were despite having other cards in the same name & our passports this wasn't good enough for them. They said we couldn't check in without it so we had to leave our bags with them while we went into the city & waited for a relative back home to take a photo of the card and send it to us. This meant we couldn't use our room to freshen up after a long day of traveling. This was sorted later that day but some basic common sense from the hotel staff would have fixed this. Very stupid.Location is a little way outside of the city but good public transport links solve this problem. We got the train from the airport to Clot main-line station which is only a 5 min walk away. Also Clot has a metro stop with an entrance just meters from the hotel.The rooms are basic but nice for what you pay. Shops in the area for food and drink if you need any in your room. Bed was comfy & the was pretty quiet at night, our room faced the main street.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights 2 rooms, positively surprised even after reading positive reviews on TA. Rooms were extremely clean, bathroom was great, service was good. Comfort rooms are smallish but okay, the Deluxe room (with Nespresso machine!) is great though and doesn't cost much more. Location is nice and cozy, and 2 minutes away is the Clot metro, at 1 EUR per ride anywhere in the city I would much rather stay in a quiet and affordable location. Sagrada Familia and the Glories Mall are easy walking distance, and there's also a bus we took to Parc Guell and the science museum. To the budget-conscious, you can get from the airport to El Clot Arrago railway station for 1 Euro using the R2 train and walk to the hotel, which we did on arrival and return. Wi-fi was super fast. The breakfast was okay when we tried it but most days we got some croissants and pastries from the several bakeries up Mallorca st.Had a couple of good dinners at the strangely-named "Glow Bar" a few steps from the hotel entrance.Would certainly stay here again on a next visit to lovely Barcelona.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cons: Old and smelly towelsA bit expensive for what it offers but that was still the cheapest I could find matching my budget and criteria.No minibar/fridge in the room.Smell of cigarette smoke from the adjacent room in our bathroomThere were sometimes cut offs in the Wifi connectionPros: Clean, quiet near the public transportation (Metro Clot)Helpful staff. The receptionist provided us with new, clean towels because the towels in our room were old and a bit smelly.The room has got coffee and tea facilities. There was a large glass bottle of mineral water in the room for free.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel for a surprise trip for my fiance'. When making the reservation I told them that it is a birthday surprise and when entering the room we found it decorated very nicely with balloons and chocolates and even a birthday note. It was so thoughtful and sweet. The room was clean and staff was very friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel because although it is not in the centre , the metro is only 2 mins away.
hotelName:
8    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff. Location is slightly off the city centre but still quite easy to get to the main sights. Metro station near by is closed for refurbishment so we used the bus instead.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: |The hotel is well located in the heart of the city, very close to sagrada. The metro stations require a little more of walking. There is also a bus stop near hotel that takes you to Catalonia square, where you can find shuttle bus to and from airport (we took metro in our arrival day from airport to hotel which was a difficult journey). The room was too small. but the bed and facilities were neat and comfortable. The breakfast had low variety. The price is high compared to our much better hotel in Milan. The rooms had a safe, but there was no refrigerator in the rooms.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice hotel. It was clean and we had a quad room for four people and it was very spacious. Larger than the average European hotel room. Shower was nice. Staff were always helpful and friendly. Fairly easy walk to many places in the city, especially close to the Sagrada Familia.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was really helpful and warm. They arranged the room for me prior to check in hour on my demand when booking so it would arrange my early arrival. Everything was made so my stay was smooth and nice.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great. Good location next to a 24/7 convenient store where you can buy 1.5 L water for .70 Euros. Some good tapas places near the hotel. Really easy to get to and from airport with the bus line.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. Good location in a quiet neighbourhood away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough to all the spots you want to see when visiting Barcelona. Public transport links close by and taxis aplenty. Friendly staff. Our room was comfortable and the bed was amazing. It might only be a ‘2 star’ hotel but we enjoyed our stay just as much as we have in other more ‘luxury’ places. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel within a walking distance from Catalunya square and Sagrada Familia.The rooms are clean.Staff is polite and willing to help in case it's needed.Haven't tried the food, but the breakfast is 9 euros/person.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the price, there's very little to not like about this Hotel. The location is a 10 minute from the Sagrada Familia and about 30 minutes to La Rambla, everything is easily accessible and its surprisingly easy to navigate your way around the city with the grid like design it has. There is a 24 hour supermarket 1 minute walk away where you can buy essentials and a few local restaurants around which were nice and good value Hotel staff very friendly and happy to give recommendations of places to eat, things to see and even flag down taxis for you.The rooms are adequate with nice bathroom facilities.All in all i think it represents good value for money.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really great hotel, it was fantastic for a 2 star, I personally felt it was more of a 3 star. Really friendly staff that would always say hello and smile. Spotlessly clean, great sized rooms, delicious breakfast. 30 min walk into the centre good location, metro station a 5 minute walk.We accidentally flooded the bathroom on day one of our stay and the staff were very understanding and helpful, additionally always available to help with directions. Would stay again on a trip to Barcelona. Thank you!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had a very thorough check-in process. Just after booking, I received a few instruction and information emails, and even an option to book transportation direct from the airport. They also requested confirmation of arrival times and if any special needs were required, etc. I really appreciated this. A day or two before my arrival date, I again received a follow-up email confirming that nothing had changed.The staff here was just lovely and everyone was very helpful with the exception of one female staff member (maybe she was just having a bad week?) who we eventually just avoided asking for help at all, and that solved that! Our room was cleaned daily and we never had to request fresh towels or linens. For two travelers, there was ample space - keep in mind that the rooms all over Europe are often much smaller than what many are accustomed to. We never turned on the tv, but there was one in the room, along with a safe and a writing desk and chair. The beds were stiff but comfortable. My only complaint is that the walls were very thin and even thinner from the bathroom! In fact, we could hear our neighbors very clearly, when we stepped into the bathroom.The location is good for the price. You'll find you're about a 8-10 minute walk from both the Sagrada Familia and the Arc de Triomphe. For those that have purchased the double decker bus tickets or metro pass, you can find stations at both of these attractions. The major train station is only about a 6 minute walk away as well. To get to Casa Mila or Casa Batllo, it's about a 25 minute walk. Montjuic/ Magic Fountain, about 55 minutes. I took a walk to the bunkers one morning, and even at a pretty quick pace, it took me about 45 minutes. But this city is spread out and you'll need to expect to do some walking no matter what. Plus, you'll want to get in some extra activity after eating all of those tapas!For the frugal traveler who's always looking for a deal, like myself, this place was perfect. It was a decent location with good accommodations and enough space for 2 people comfortably. There are small markets just right across the street, for water, snacks & essentials. The ease of public transportation was also a big plus.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Location and friendly staff. 8 min walk to Sagrada Familia. The Room is comfortable and clean. we were there in Mar, so the evening is still a bit cold, the Room was warm and shower facility was good, Disabled friendly.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice, centrally located near great tapas bars and la Sagrada Familia. Price was decent, was misinformed about the breakfast though, it is not free so I suggest you eat somewhere else. Overall it was very clean and the staff was accommodating.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable and inexpensive accommodation near the city centre. Room had heating and air conditioning and shampoo, soaps provided. Bed was comfortable and the hotel very clean. We didn’t try their breakfast. Staff helpful and friendly. Will come back for a return visit.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a pleasant, satisfying stay here. Nothing fancy, just plain and simple decent service. Exactly what you would expect for a mid-level (3-4 star) hotel. Practical. Not cheap, not expensive. Not exactly in the hectic city center, but close enough to be convenient. Very near one metro station...it was easy for me to explore the city by foot or by train. Nice and helpful guys at the front desk. Everything works in the rooms. No fancy features but that will encourage you to get out and see this beautiful city !
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a bit out of the way for me but it had more reasonable prices. I received a very large room, which was very practical but not fancy. Breakfast could be a bit more varied. All in all, no complaints.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got bargain tickets with ryanair for a weekend in Barcelona, booked this cheap hotel when I got the flights.Location is good - central and close to bus and train links.Hotel room was ok, clean and as good as it gets for the price.Helpful staff, no problems explaining where we needed to go.Barcelona was very hot, but we really liked it, especially the tapas bars.Recommended for trips like ours.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location Near to Sagrada FamiliaNear to Arc de Triumph 2 bus stations and 1 metro station Helpful and friendly stuff Many restaurants and supermarket are available around Little bit expensive for value Major comments:No refrigerator No kettle Minor comment:No balcony
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was so pleasantly surprised how good this hotel was for the price. Spotlessly clean and the staff were just marvellous and couldn't enough for us. Fairly central and very close to Sagrada Familia. Would definitely go back there.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 min walk to monumental station and 15 to 20 min walk to sagra familia . Big supermarket and one fruit store and plenty restaurant near that - the best thing was its staff- the man I think was the chief staff help me to change my 500 euros because at barcelona you cant spent that. Our tripple room was strange ! Two separate small room one of with twin bed and another with single bed approperiat for families with snorring dad !! What a pitty rooms had not refrigerator or kettle but had safety digital box - the breakfast was very good for 2 star hotel and had fresh fruits .only dis advantage was at night when you want to sleep . The noise of other rooms annoying . Generally that was memorable. Thank you HOTEL ACTA ANTIBES****
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, just a few minutes from the subway. The staf is great and very helpful. Price is reasonable (yet considering the quality of stay, it could be lower). Now the cons: The breakfast selection is ad, wifi connection is problemmatic in the rooms. The rooms are outfashioned. Cleaniness of the rooms is not good (especially the bathroom). The worst thing is that the room door has no isolation. You can literally hear everything and everyone in the aisle: People walking, talking, laughing and so on. This is soooo disturbing at night and in the early morning. The hotel management must definitely do something on this.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very conveniently situated - only 15 mins walk from La Sagrada Familia & 20 mins walk from Plaça de Catalunya (the main city square). There's a 24h supermarket two doors down the street, and a metro station (Monumental) only 2 blocks away (less than 5 mins walk) which will take you downtown or up to La Sagrada Familia. The staff at the hotel were amazing (especially Eduardo) and the breakfast had plenty of choice and was regularly topped up. The room was small, but was clean & tidy. Unfortunately, the window of our room had no view at all (other than a brick wall and a fire exit), so very little light got into the room, but this wasn't of much concern as the room is only for sleeping in - not for sitting looking out the window all day. The beds were comfortable and clean, the aircon was good, there was a wardrobe and a safe. The bathroom was very very compact but had a sink, a bidet, a toilet, and a bath with a good shower in it. The only thing that would have been a nice extra would have been a small fridge to store drinks in, as it was quite warm and being able to keep drinks cold would have been good.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great find. It is about a 20 minute walk to Placa Cataluyna but there is also a metro station close by. It doesn't look anything special from the outside, but don't let that put you off. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, quiet, comfortable and really well equipped. Best wifi I had in the three weeks in Barcelona. They have all the little extras that make you feel at home. Great wardrobe with full length mirrors (necessity for females), comfortable bed, TV had lots of english speaking channels. Great desk, safe and the bathroom was lovely and big too. I cannot believe that this is only a two star hotel. I am coming back to Barcelona and will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so impressed with this hotel! Yes, the rooms are smallish, and the bathrooms are very small, but everything was clean and well-presented. Despite having a room at the front, overlooking the street, the double windows kept out the noise and my sleep wasn't disturbed by traffic at all. The only disturbance was from people using the lift, so I'd recommend requesting a room away from that area.The very best thing about Acta Antibes was the friendliness of the reception staff. Without exception, I found them extremely accommodating, welcoming, and helpful, with advice about using public transport, finding places to eat, and general information.The location is great! The closest metro station is only a very short walk away, and a local bus stop is also close for an alternate way to get around. It's in a walkable and safe area, which is very important to me, being an older solo traveller.Breakfast is nothing special, but it's more than adequate and a reasonable cost for Barcelona standards.Yes, it's only a 2 star hotel but it presents as well above that. I've stayed in 3 star places that weren't as good. If I head back to Barcelona, this will definitely be the place for me.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good & Clean room, good noise-proofgood location, only few minutes walk to the metro station which leads to the major transportation hub Passeig de Gracia and the city center , one station away from the famous impressive one-and-only Sagrada Familia!Quiet area but safe, good & reasonably- priced local cafes and restaurants in the local neighbourhood Very helpful and understanding staff who take time to help guests book tickets, give advice on transportation, to tourist attractions, share good tips on visiting the gorgeous city of Barcelona, Flexible and kind to accept my early check in given the circumstance of my arrival I really enjoyed lovely chats with the knowledgeable hotel receptionists at Acta Antibes , about the attractions, the city, and the Political crisis that is gong on , All and all, such n enjoyable experience I had with both the places and people in Barcelona which I sincerely wish to still remain unchanged next time I come back.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really well located, close to the metro stop. The staff was friendly and helpful, rooms and bathrooms are small but clean and houskeeping came everyday. In my opinion, for 2* we really got something good. Only things why I didn't give 5 points, that the walls are really thin, you can hear every single world from the neighbours, and the breakfast(optional 9 euro/person) didn't include any vegetables. Anyway everything was ok, we were satisfied choosing Acta Antibes.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value basic accommodation and breakfast. The outstanding feature of this hotel is that the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly, going way beyond the call of duty to be of assistance. The locality is very close to the Gaudi's Sagrada Familia temple and is also close to Barcelona's exceptional metro system. In the locality there are several good local restaurants, both Spanish and international cuisine. Not the fault of the hotel, but Barcelona, and particularly the metro system and metro stations are notorious for pick-pockets, and I was a victim on the first day. Hotel staff were very helpful in helping me to notify the police (not that they were able to do much except provide me with a form to use in activating my holiday insurance).
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was friendly, accommodating, and helpful in answering our questions. The location was perfect for walking to all of the destinations that we wanted to see each day, and the room was exactly what we needed for our stay. We would come back and stay again!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely well located, it has a subway station 1,5 blocks away and in path to the subway there is a good "Panaderia" for your breakfasts! Addittionally, it is 13 min walking to Cathedral Sagrada Familia!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a good room with king size bed which was very comfortable. Reception staff were very friendly and remembered our room numbers every time. Great places to eat near the hotel and it was a good walk to La Rambla and the gothic quarter.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a double room at the end of the high season and were therefore focused on avoiding the rip-off prices of other hotels in touristic areas.Acta Antibes is a 2-star establishment and one cannot expect the level of service and lost of amenities of a 4-star, but the basic requirements were met: clean room, bedsheets and bathroom, free wifi and friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was a bit limited in choice and its price was not included in the room. I found that it deserved to be, all things considered.The hotel location is not exceptional, but we already knew our way around in the city, so it was a minor inconvenience.For the purpose of our trip, Acta Antibes did the job, but it may not have all the frills regular tourists look for.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Air conditioner could have been a little colder but the room was fine. We could check in early after our long flight which we greatly appreciated. It was clean and quiet. The metro was a short walk away. We didn't have breakfast.. there was a cheaper cafe down the street for pastry and coffee,
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at Acta Antibes. The location made it easy to get around to the rest of the city; just 2 blocks from the Metro station and 4 blocks from La Sagrada Familia. The staff was wonderful and were a great help!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A clean but basic hotel in a quiet neighborhood. Hotel Acta Antibes is reasonably priced, the accommodation for our family of 4 consisted of 2 comfortable rooms with good air conditioning, there are two beds at each of the room, and a bathroom within the unit. Great location for visiting Sagrada Familia, and short taxi rides to Park Guell and Magic Fountain. We were also able to walk to Avinguda Diagonal area to visit La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. A 24 hour supermarket is around the corner of the hotel.We will consider staying here again should we come back to Barcelona in the future.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fab stay we had in this hotel!!! A smart looking hotel from the outside, amazing air con as you walk through the door from the heatwave outside. Better yet you walk in to some polite and friendly staff.Amazing location, just 2 min walk from metro station, 10 mins from Sagrada Familia and around 25 mins to La Rambla.We had booked this through booking.com and could cancel for free up until the day before and pay at the property. We didn't need to cancel. The staff couldn't do more for us. The room was clean, comfy and was quiet - couldn't hear much from outside. Great shower, clean bathroom and we had our room cleaned/made each day.Better yet, we had a safe in our room - which they didn't charge for!!!Thank you to all the team for a fab stay!!!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've visited during the MWC confrence but even taking that into account, chatging the price the hotel charged was shameful.Other than the nice location near the segrada familia and the truly pleasent staff, the hotel is not a reccomended experience.Rooms are tiny, built in a way that makes them extra uncomfortable, lacking in some basic elements you'd expact, not even a kettle.It looks, feels and is old, as if time froze in the early 80s, and breakfast tastes as if it was made then.Too bad - nice team and in hotel that leaves much to br desired.Eoukd only reccomend if the price was VERY low, and in MWC it was not.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 5 days at the end of June and thought the hotel was brilliant! The rooms were comfortable and cleaned thoroughly everyday! Didn't get a chance to have breakfast there but overall stay was fab
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean hotel in a really good location, 10/15 minute walk to Sagrada Famila and metro station. Reception staff super nice & helpful. Didn't try breakfast as it seemed a little expensive for what it was but good options in the neighborhood. Only thing missing in the hotel is a small bar, the breakfast area could be a bar in the evenings.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most importantly, The Antibe is clean, very close to the metro in a nice quiet safe neighbourhood within a close proximity to everything. The front desk staff and house keeping were amazing, the wifi was so-so in my room but perfect in the breakfast area and reception. Their breakfast was adequate. I ate at three nearby amazing neighbourhood restaurants: Portoles, Nogal, and Vic Braseria. This Canadian will be back and would happily recommend the Antibe to my family and friends.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel, nice rooms and a good service. Hotel is located near to the Sagrada Familia and also a metro station with excellent connenctions al over Barcelona. The neighbourhood is quiet and calm. Lot of small restaurants are near.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel in good location to sightseeing. I booked a twin room for me and my daughter. We got a suite, 2 bedrooms and bathroom. Very clean rooms and beds, air con or heating. Friendly reception staff and free maps were very helpful. Vending machine in dining area. We didn't get breakfast as we preferred pastries from cafes which were to die for. Restaurants 5 minutes away and supermarkets, cafe, bars. 5 minutes walk to metro station and bus stops. Can walk to Sagrada Familia easily.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room although small was well designed. Enough space to unpack. Bed was very comfortable, air conditioning worked immediately, and the shower, although it did not have a strong pressure, worked well. The room's have been updated and are well kept. Elevator worked well. Front desk was always helpful and provided a power adapter for my wife's hair straightener. The hallways have not been updated which can be off putting when you arrive but don't fret. Our room had no view but there was no street noise. The walls were a bit thin and you could hear the shower running from next door but we never heard voices. It was a 10-15 minute walk to the older section of town as well as to the newer restaurants in the quarter of Eixample. We grabbed coffee from the numerous cafes surrounding the hotel. There were many small grocery stores nearby as well. Recommendation; bring your own soap or body wash. The size of the soap bar was hilariously small.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for access to the bus station as we were over for the grand Prix .it was five minutes walk to the bus station and 3 minute walk to get the bus to the beach the hotel is very central for what we required the staff were very helpful and pleasant,our double room was actually a double and a single with the window facing out onto the street ,the breakfast was fine saved us from going looking for breakfast, we had pizza in lucanos just around the corner and another evening up to a kebab place called monumental both places inexpensive and tasty . the only negatives for us was no TV all 71 channels were in foreign language and as a smoker no place to go for a cigarette just out the front door onto the street ,it would be nice if there was a seat outside to watch the world go by
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet but small room,breakfast always same,hey we need vegetables.tomatoes etc.friendly reception,view back yard not so nice.small hotel who need center location,ideal walks.around or rent bike or scooter.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at ACTA ANTIBES 3 nights pre cruise from April 28th-may 1st.(-4 couples). Rooms are clean and neat. bathroom has a bathtub and all toileteries. Towels are changed every day.breakfast is very good and above all ,I must point out the outstandingly patient and helpful staff.Returning from our cruise ,we had a late flight , so we asked whether we could leave our luggage at the hotel for the whole day and pick it up before the flight-they agreed and were very helpful with 10 pieces of lugggage.(at no cost)The location is also very good.i highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Acta Antibes. The staff spoke English, the metro was 3 minutes walk and the neighborhood had lots of pastry shops and restaurants. Sagrada Familia was about a 10-15 walk. Great value with big room, just basic and clean.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are all welcoming, friendly and helpful. The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. The hotel is perfect for a city break and is in a good location for the metro and within walking distance of several of the attractions - Sagrada Familia and La Predrera. The breakfast was good value and there was a good range of continental breakfast selections.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel exceeded my expectations for a 2 star hotel. It was very clean and the rooms were spacious and comfortable beds. It is centrally located, within walking distance to most city attractions. I highly recommend this hotel for travelers on a budget.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not far from the Center of the city, connected very well with subway and pedestrian and biking infrastructure to all landmarks. Very pleasant stuff, and decent food.In quiet area, so you can rest well after all day exploring Barsa.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 night stay whilst visiting Barcelona. Great location and very close to Monumental metro station and within walking distance of Segrada Famillia. Hotel very clean but basic. Comfortable rooms with air conditioning. No tea/coffee facilities but vending machine available. Optional breakfast but we ate out in the many nearby cafes. Very friendly reception staff who were so helpful and knowledgeable about the amazing city. Would thoroughly recommend this central value for money hotel for a short break and would definitely return.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice and clean room! Too close to Sagrada Familia and to metro station "Monumental", this hotel is a good choise. Don' t expect a very big room with outstading view, but is always clean and tidy, with hot water and a helpful staff. Also, has a 24hour s/m next to it!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my husband stayed here for 3 nights, room was quiet small for our standard but it was very clean and quiet . Housekeeping everyday. No coffee/tea maker, no minibar inside the room. We asked for a couple of slippers but they don't provide this kind of amenities. Soap and shampoos amenities could be better,poor quality. Really disappointing. Staff from the reception were all helpful. We left our luggage in the reception upon check out, beacause we had our flight in the afternoon. Wifi connection worked fast all the time in all areas! We didn't get the breakfast in the hotel, but there were lots of cafferterias around the area, and supermarkets just in the corner open 24h.Metro station just 5minutes walking, sagrada familia 15minutes walking. You can also go to the Gran via it is a main road close to the hotel where you can catch a bus (H12) to reach other main spots. Because taking metro wasted more of our time going up and down the stairs to change lines. Overall it was a good stay ,I reccomend this hotel for its cleanliness and its location. We'll surely be back in Acta Antibes!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel -- 2stars doesn't do it justice.Good, well-appointed room, extremely comfortable beds, very good bathroom, everything very clean.Continental breakfast buffet ample, as much as you want to eat. Everything continually refreshed, tables immediately cleared and cleaned.Small lounge with snack machines always available.Reception manned 24 hours -- exceptionally helpful staff.Reliable free WiFi in rooms.Location ideal -- easy walking distance (10-15 mins) to La Sagrada Familia, which also has stops for the open-top, hop-on-hop-off tourist buses (an absolute must !)Longer walk (25mins) to Passeig de Gracia and Casa Batllo, etc. Also near metro station. Various Tapas Bars and Restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent friendly helpful staff. My wife chose this hotel because she read good reviews about it,and it was in our price range. We were not disappointed, our room was clean , modern and sufficient. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and everything matched our expectations. The hotel is in a good position for exploring Barcelona,as it is close to the Metro. We would have no hesitation about staying in this hotel again.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the beginning we weren't sure about our choice. I do not trust 2 or 1 star hotels. But the room was big and very clean.Stuff was very friendly and helpful. It's location was great. I definitely recommend this hotel for your trips.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel for 4 nights in July. We had a very good experience. We were close to La Rambla and walking distance to to a lot of main attractions around the centre of Barcelona. The room was very clean and a good size for a standard room. The only thing was the window in the room overlooked a wall of the hotel. I wasn't impressed but thought i wasn't going to stay in the room that much anyway. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as there were a lot of cafes/bakeries close by. The buses including the hop on hop off buses were walking distance. Overall i enjoyed staying at this hotel and would stay again.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the HCC Montblanc for one night before our Mediterranean Cruise. The staff was welcoming and helpful with directions. The location was ideal for exploring Barcelona and dining choices. The guest room was updated and had a balcony. The bed was comfortable. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet which had a wide range of offerings. It was tasty. The hotel price was easy on the wallet. Overall, the quality of the experience exceeded our expectations for a 3-star rated hotel. We would recommend the hotel. During our next visit to Barcelona, we will be booking a room here. Albeit short, thanks for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I emailed the hotel several times before our arrival to ask a few questions. The hotel replied very quickly and were really helpful.I stayed here with my 16 year old daughter. I requested one of the refurbished rooms on the pool side and the hotel met my request. (The new rooms have plenty of sockets). The rooms are modern and kept very clean by the staff with the towels changed daily. All of the staff are very pleasant and welcoming, especially on reception.The hotel is in the perfect location, a 2 minute walk from Plaça de Catalunya and the Gothic Quarter. There are lots of places to eat nearby.The pool area was really nice, we always managed to get a bed around the pool at any time of the day. We didn’t eat in the hotel so I can’t comment on the food.I have visited Barcelona 6 times now and would definitely return to this hotel, I couldn’t fault it.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is centrally located in the heart of the city. Gothic quarters are 2 min walking and most of the popular places are walking distance. Only thing I hated the most was lack of power sockets in the room. Breakfast was awesome. Staff is really helpful and polite. I would recommend this place.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just stayed in this hotel while in Paris and have to say it was incredible value for the price. The staff were friendly, hotel was clean and location was super handy with a tram stop just out the front and plents of restaurants nearby. It's not a five star hotel but will serve you very well if you're looking for a nice break for a few days and - if this review was based on the price - I'd be giving it five circles. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel fits the bill if you are looking to stay in Barcelona. It was neat and clean with efficient staff. The decor is distinguished. It was so nice of them to have a big complimentary water bottle in the room. Will stay there again on another trip to Barcelona.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really easy to get around Barcelona and they had very friendly staff. The pool (though not huge) was also a good area to socialise and speak to other guests.The drinks were good but get food somewhere else. Our room was great
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel was clean, nice, and very friendly. nice breakfast selection too. If there's one suggestion or MUST Have : please make sure there's sockets next to the beds to plug smartphone and or other chargers as there was only 1 socket in the room. this is a must have for travelers to charge their phones during the night and use their alarm clocks on their cell phones.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The shower leaked everywhere and we would end with a river in the bathroom and room every time we showered. The pool was good. The staff on check in acted like we were a nuisance and told us to come back later to check in even though it was 2.30 and check in was 2. Not welcomed after all the travelling. The location was good. They tried to charge us for mini bar bits which we hadn’t had.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was wonderful, the buffet breakfast was great and rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was courteous and professional. area was great with short walks to great attractions and site seeing.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hospitality of HCC Montblanc was excellent! The hotel is clean and in a great location. The dinning room was well taken care of, specially during breakfast time. I was impressed with the attention to detail and the food spread. I would recommend the hotel to anyone traveling for business or traveling with children. All the details are carefully taken care of to make the stay and travel experience smooth. Thank you Willie for your hospitality! Your dedication to serving customers and to your job are truly admirable. It is refreshing to find someone who cares about his job as much as you do, and who also has such a deep respect for customers.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located centrally but not too close to the loud Rambla. You've got good metro connections from the stop close by. We visited during July and it was really hot so the pool did all the difference. The staff was helpful and friendly. Room was big and clean. No complaints, would definately consider booking the same next time.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Partner and I stayed here for 5 nights and 6 days, I had read the reviews and they seemed good overall.We had a wonderful stay!The hotel staff were wonderful, from reception staff to the Breakfast Staff and the chaps upstairs at the terrace bar, we had great service.The House Keepers were lovely too and were very apologetic when our room was cleaned late one day.I would highly recommend this hotel, it has a great dipping pool with sunbeds beside the Terrace bar and the Sangria is to die for (I mean, really good)!The hotel is in a very central location and just great to get to everywhere, we walked to the beach almost daily, there is a lovely Cathedral nearby, Las Ramblas is an easy stroll away from the hotel and Sagada Familiar is a quick train journey away.All in all a great stay, we will most definately be staying here again!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights with my children. Great location and smart interior. Clean and comfortable rooms. Helpful staff. Breakfast had a good selection of fruit, cereal, pastries and drinks. Pool terrace is a lovely area. Pool is small but great bonus for a city hotel.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights at this hotel. It was in a good location. We enjoyed the breakfast, there were adequate options to satisfy everyone in our group. Although we did not lounge by the pool the area of the terrace and pool deck looked nice.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good hotel for a fair price. Do not hesitate to book a room here as of July 2019. One caveat, it has an advertisement advising you to pay in your home country's currency. As most travelers already know, this is the wrong thing to do. First impression of this hotel then, is that they are trying to take advantage of me. Which is a shame, given all else was good.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: they don't want to accept their fault due to not to compensate my lost Chanel bag. I have sent mails for 2 months every week and nobody answers.. I will share my all the email I sent to SNS and everywhere. you need to check your CCTV that how you made mistake...
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited 16-19th july. Arrived at the hotel quite late and was greeted well at the hotel. Proceeded to the room where it was a good size and bathroom was large.Used the hotel purely for a base and to get our heads down. And for that it was perfect. Couldnt have asked for a better place. Perfectly located. Staff that we spoke to was always polite and welcoming.Yards from the gothic quarter and metro.My only small criticism about the room would be the electric sockets, they could be better placed by the sides of the beds but we made do with the ones around the room. I cant comment on the breakfast or the other facilities as we only used it for sleep and shower. Would definitely return when back in Barcelona. Thanks for a great stay
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stafff was great, and the location was perfect to the city center! My room was a bit small, but had a beautiful, large balcony overlooking the pool, and city. The dining/ breakfast hall was large, and they had a great breakfast spread with fruit, juices, coffee, espresso, eggs, hot meats, cold meats, toasting ovens, and pastries. The staff makes it great!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At check in, we were not told of the best things to do or see at all. We were not told of the free glass of champagne, luckily we read the card the room key was in and found it. The pools hours are so short it is useless if you want to see the city at all. I had a used comb provided in the bathroom with another persons pubic hair in it. We paid for a double bed and got 2 twins individually dressed with separate coverings shoved together. I paid about 200$ for a room that I wasn’t provided a complementary safe to use. After using the glasses for wine on the first night and leaving them stacked and clearly not clean they were put back side by side still dirty on the desk.Overall, it d a very nice hotel with terrible service. The housekeeping is lazy and pays no attention to any details (such as a previously used comb, absolutely disgusting). To sleep with my other half one of us had to sleep on a crack between two mattresses and we had to either use separate covers or share a twin cover, ruining one persons sleep every night.Extremely disappointing result for a nice hotel that we paid significant money to stay at.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyable 4 night stay at the HCC Hotel MontBlanc. Need to be aware of the lack of handrail and non slip steps entering the pool. My wife slipped and received a painful injury to her lower back which did not require medical treatment but she is still in some discomfort today. Apart from that one incident/accident our stay was otherwise satisfactory. This problem should be addressed asap in case of a repeat incident. Staff were friendly and helpful and cleaning staff courteous and polite.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived very early to e hotel and asked to leave our luggage at e concierge. We were lucky and staff at counter was able to let us check in right away. It was a bonus for us as we travel quite a long way. Was able to have a quick shower before going to explore e city. Location was great, near almost all e places of interest. Room was of a good size for 2 of us..we asked for kettle from e reception and was also given it.. Minus point was e noise from our next door neighbours but of course that's not of e hotel's fault as e walls were thin. Overall very happy with e 4 nights stay. Thank you!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at Hotel HCC Montblanc. This hotel was nicely appointed. My room and bathroom were spacious, bed was perfect. Excellent location -- very close to a Metro station. Walking distance (~2 blocks) to the Gothic Quarter. My only two unmet desired: ability to open window to see out of it and down the street (not just across to housing immediately outside my window), and there was no coffee maker so I had to go downstairs to breakfast just for a coffee. Would stay here again!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend this experience, the place is near most of the attractions and the most important, is near the metro station Urquinaona, which is great!Great location, great price, awesome service! See you next time!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came from Barcelona and it was my first time to visit Andorra. The the weather during May 2019 was very good, so so I spend most of my time outside the hotel. The hotel location was right at the center of the city. You have a nice view right beside the city's mighty river and overlooking that very lovely bridge. My trip to the city was short and hopefully when I do have a chance to go back, I might consider checking-in to your hotel.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: our first night in very tight quarters, and air conditioner supper cold even in lowest setting, room 120. Next morning taking showers water flowing out running all over bathroom area. So they changed our room to one with bathtub. Better, a bit more space, but the air conditioner not functioning properly.and only one available plug in room to charge electronics,room 214. We advised front desk but nothing was done. Location of hotel was good in Gothic area close to good food and attractions.Supplied breakfast was good, and staff nice
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very close to Plaza Catalunya, the most central spot in Barcelona. It is very easy to go to and from the airport and to get to the most famous attractions of the city. Besides that, the staff was very solicit and helpful. I strongly recommend it!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I wanted a shirt getaway and choosing this hotel was a good choice and it is perfect walking distance to shops and tourist attractions. front desk was helpful and efficient. Breakfast could be made cheaper as it was too expensive to have.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here for 3 nights and it was comfortable enough. I would not say the room was spacious but it was OK. Reception staff are excellent, very helpful. Hotel is in a great location, very central, metro station just up the road. Breakfast was included and it was very nice. No tea/coffee in room.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: especially appreciated the welcome from Reception. Loved the area. Very easy to visit places of interest and lots of eating places nearby. Would always like to have a kettle and small facility for tea of coffee available in the room but otherwise comfortable and had good sleep
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms and food were amazing. While our group was checking in the desk person was distracted and frequently went off to perform other tasks which made our check in extremely slow. The breakfast hast was grouchy and made one of my students cry. He was also unpleasant with others in our group. The hotel itself is lovely. We love the hotel location and out rooms.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location within very short walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. Also very close to metro station. Good sized, clean rooms. Nice private pool area. The staff was friendly and accommodating to all my requests.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very elegant and comfortable hotel, HCC Montblanc offered a lot for our group's comfort. The breakfast buffet was the best among all the places I had stayed with a traveling group of students. Additionally, my students enjoyed the pool and sunbathing deck.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful breakfast selection, nice meeting space, clean rooms. Location was great, close to many sites. Quiet neighborhood. Staff was very friendly. I would stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Montblanc is very well situated for sight seeing, only steps from the Gothic Quarter, the Cathedral, the Teatre Nacional, the Ramblas and the Placa de Catalunya where all public transport is available.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is great, very close to a lot of amazing places to eat, drink and relax. The staff was really helpful and polite, all spoke English perfectly and had no trouble at all. The room was good size, however there was no power outlet close to the bed and the walls seemed quite thin so I was woken up the neighbours every morning.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel with good cleanness . They have store room n allowing the luggage till your onward journey . Catalunya is very near , where from you get easy access to whole City . Shopping area Rambla is also on walking distance . Near by lot of Indian vegetarian restaurant are available . I will recommend this Hotel for Indians for a nice stay with comfort.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did have some noise issues. We were right next to were some drilling was happening every morning at 10 o clock and it was very loud. We complained to the staff and at first they did not seem very bothered, but we pressed more about the matter and were eventually moved to another room. The other room was much nicer and you could barely hear the drilling the next day. The location of this hotel is great. Fairly basic but clean.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, clean and neat. 5 * service!! The room was in a second floor away from the street noise, the hotel was close to everything. The shower was AMAZING!! The energy save system is outstanding! Will definitely come back!!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for a long weekend and the location couldn't have been better! It was in the Gothic area with the cutest alley ways! I walked everywhere, but there was public transportation close by. The bus stop from the airport was the last one, I think there were only 3 stops, which was just around the corner which was nice with a very late arrival. I was able to walk to La Rambla and to Barceloneta Beach. I also walked to La Sagrada Familia and around that area. They gave you a free welcome drink upon arrival from 9-10p in the bar. I checked in late though, so I was able to use it the following night. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely hotel centrally located in Barcelona. Friendly, efficient staff, good sized rooms on a busy main street but nice and quiet inside. Well decorated, clean, modern. I would return for another visit
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The HCC Montblanc is a lovely hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean and have AC ( not always in hotels in Europe). The staff is courteous and helpful and the breakfast buffet is one of the better ones I have enjoyed at a hotel. The only comment I have is that because so many of the guests are American, British and Northern European, I would ask the hotel to start serving dinner before 8:00 at night! The food is good for a hotel, but waiting til 8PM is not for everyone. I had a student group with me and the meeting rooms were perfect for our classes.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great. It’s very near the catalunya station. The staff are kind and friendly. The room is clean. The swimming pool is cozy. The breakfast is not bad. There are many cafe and restaurants
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from our third stay in this hotel. We were delighted to be given an upgrade to a room with a terrace as our visit was part of celebrations for a big birthday and wedding anniversary. As usual the staff were all very helpful and courteous. The breakfast buffet was substantial. The only niggle was the very poor soundproofing. It's not great hearing your neighbour's bathroom activities! But overall our time in HCC Montblanc was very enjoyable. And Barcelona is still a fantastic city!
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is considered a budget hotel. Great location. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very clean. We were on the 3rd floor and we could hear a dog barking in the morning. Other than that, no complaints.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a couple of nights before catching a cruise to Italy. This place was close to all modes transportation, close to pier for the ship, shopping, Las Rambla, Plaça de Catalunya. We booked it through NCL, our cruise line, and were able to get a good rate and transfer to the cruise.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were roomy and very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious with many choices. The staff was warm and very helpful. Xavier at the front desk was fabulous. He was so very caring adn helpful.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The size of hotel and Lobby looks good but when it comes to facilities they stayed on vintage No iron , no real blow dry ( they put the age stone blow dry), no coffee maker, no water dispenser at lobby) no umbrella to offer the guests and safe box belong to vintage ( no digital opener) you have to get the key with deposit from check in desk ) all three stars hotel offer all above without exemption!Very disappointed
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very great location but very poor wifi. You do not provide any complimentary coffee, tea or water like other hotels. Cleaning was done very late in the afternoon. Otherwise, check in was great. Room was ready for us.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service excellent. Comfortable and sizeable room. Central Barcelona location good. Particularly liked the helpful and professional staff. Evening meal on the 13th May was substandard and not worthy of the hotel which was superb in every other way.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall pleasant experience. Centrally located walking distance to Las Ramblas. Spacious rooms. Nothing missing. Pleasant staff. Good selection for the breakfast considering it is included in cost. No concerns.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean hotel, with kind and friendly staff, would stay there again.great location close to major tourist sites and local coffee shops and dining location , great visit had a wonderful time, your review needs to be a little shorter
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mom booked this room directly threw the hotel about 6 mths. before we were there . Check in was very easy the room very clean .When we went to plug in our phones because they were almost died we noticed the plug was not like ours so we went to the front desk and asked for an plug and the lady said they were all given out . Okay thats fine but she didn't even give a place to purchase one . Then I went to give the lady a time for our shuttle in the morning and she said we didnt have free shuttle because we didn't call the hotel directly , but my mom did she even had their phone number and time of call on a piece of paper, so we had to find our own way to the airport that cost us extra money. Then in the morning we went to go to get breakfast and they said it wasn't free but when my mom called they said it was so there goes more money that we didn't except to pay.I think if they tell you something they should live up to what they say not just brush it off like oh well . Overall we had a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I will visit Barcelona again I will stay at HCC Montblanc with all my pleasure . The services were excellent. The sleep quality just perfect. The location of the hotel is the best - very closed to the centre.
hotelName:
10    HCC Montblanc
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely place with super design and a magic roof top. Staff charming and efficient. Modern and clean rooms. Good breakfast. This hotel will allow you to relax and we’ll locat for sightseeing and walking in the city
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel, it was very stylish, rooms were spotless and it was only a 15 min walk to La Rambla! The staff were super helpful letting us check in at midday as we had an early flight and also let us leave our bags in their safe room on our last day as we had an evening flight. The room was lovely, we stayed in 345 and it was a little bigger than the standard room for no extra cost, the beds were super comfortable and was very quiet as never heard anybody form any other rooms. They also had a stunning rooftop bar which is worth a visit! Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5 bubble rating is relative to price paid.......Modern, efficient and very comfortable. Rooms small by US standards, but are thoughtfully designed and have everything you need. Lively bar, but roof deck closes at 9pm.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, very clean and modern. Rooms very small compared to other hotels. Bar area is very nice and swinging chairs are cool. If you require an iron just ask reception and they can sort this for you. Taxis are also always outside which makes it easy to get around the city.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel for a solo traveler! It is beautifully designed reflecting character of Barcelona. The lobby is very spacious and comfortable for leisure hangouts and work on the laptop. Overall, hotel offers a great value for its amenities. Taking one star off for the lack of swimming pool and workout room.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay: fine rooms with very comfortable beds, clean rooms with a small safe. Fine bathroom. Good breakfast and lovely lobby. Beautiful roof terrasse. Staff very friendly and servicable, who can get you a taxi in no time. The area is quiet with the big park just opposite .
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights. Pleasant location and conveniently located for the city centre and waterfront.As with most Motel One properties the lobby was huge and very stylish however be warned that most bedrooms are very small and seem quite cramped. If you can do without a view and an outdoor terrace (they charge a premium for these rooms), rooms ending in 45 are at the end of a corridor, quiet and offer much more space than most. Be aware though that they have a fairly narrow window which looks into a light well and are therefore not blessed with much natural light. The rooms are simply but smartly furnished, clean and comfortable with a decent walk-in shower.Breakfast was OK although not as nice as that served in some of the chain’s German & Austrian hotels.The rooftop terrace is very stylish and offers great views of the park and across to the old town. A real sun trap offering comfortable seating and bar service at certain (limited) times.A great budget choice for what can be a very expensive city when it comes to hotels.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m stayed here 6 nights before a cruise. I chose this hotel b/c of all of the positive reviews about staff and location. I fully agree the staff is fantastic and shows they care, answers all questions I had and makes you feel at home. The location is directly across the street from the Citudella park and about 6 blocks from the Arc De Triumph metro station. There are a lot of nearby restaurants to choose from also.They do not have a restaurant at this hotel however there is a very good breakfast buffet for 9£ from 7am - 11 am. The buffet has rolls and croissant, pastries, cheeses, bacon, fruit and hard boiled eggs. It’s very satisfying and I recommend getting it (they will offer at check in if you did’t choose your accommodation). There’s a very nice bar area, reception area and courtyard where you can relax. My room was very quiet and was on the courtyard side. Love this hotel I’d definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was fantastic next to beautiful park and easy walk to Gòtic Area and La Ramblas.Small room but well designed and good quality fittings. Comfortable bed. Good air conditioning. Tight bathroom but good lighting. Magnifying mirror for make up application. Communal areas very stylish. Enjoyed the roof top bar with panoramic views over Parc de Cuitadella. Tasty breakfast. European style - Juices, yogurt, cereals, cold meats,cheeses and croissants all really delicious. Friendly staff on front desk with helpful suggestions about best local places to eat.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 5 people and enjoyed our stay at all.1 metro stop from La rambla..We just loved the design and the lobby area.The staff at the reception is very very kind and should be appreciated for they work.The rooms are very clean and the breakfast is ok.The only minus i would mention that there is no phones in the rooms so if you have some request you need to go to reception every time.In general I liked our stay .I will defenately will come back there on my next stay in Barcelona
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time visiting this part of Barcelona, absolutely great place to stay. Great room with modern decoration, great bar and also all the wonderful staff defiantly recommend if you around and I’ll probably will be back to the same place
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best thing about this place is the staff, who are all lovely. Rooms are really tiny and inconvenient with no wardrobe space. Bathroom with shower is good and the products included are nice to use. The little touches such as complimentary water, glasses to drink from, tea/coffee in the room are sadly and noticeably missing. Corridors are noisy and busy!! You can hear everything! Breakfast was a let down, nothing cooked available and simple things such as cucumber, tomatoes and fruit were not fresh, looking unappealing if anything. Rooftop terrace is beautiful, quiet and the lady who runs the bar is friendly and helpful. However, you can only pay by cash which is a little annoying. Lobby area is cool with ample seating and has a nice design. Sadly, for over £100 a night, we felt we did not get value for money. Location is good, walking distance to the Gothic quarter. A well-stocked supermarket a two minute walk away. Would have been delighted with our stay with a better more suitable rate for what you get.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great funky hotel especially for the price. The lobby is very nice with cool swings and seats in the bar. Staff are welcoming and we were given some amazing recommendations by the receptionist so if yours doesn’t I’d suggest asking for some. Lovely clean rooms only downside is they were slightly small (couldn’t really have your suitcase open unless on the bed). Nice rooftop bar but it doesn’t open many hours a day that’s the only thing I would change!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Motel One for a few days before going on a cruise in June. The location is very convenient, the bus stops right out front and the subway station is a few minutes away. The rooms are on the small side but if you don't have a lot of luggage this should not be a problem. Bathrooms are very functional and inviting! The optional breakfast, I highly recommend: ample buffet with quality ingredients including serreno ham and manchego cheese...The reception staff is young, energetic and helpful. Tamara stands out, she helped us solve all kinds of minor problems and always with a smile! Motel One has come upon a winning formula: great location, cool vibe, young friendly staff and excellent value for your dollar!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I had a fantastic stay at motel one and I would recommend it to anyone who is thinking of staying Barcelona.Pros:Very cleanLate barRoof top bar with lovely seating areasModernVery friendly and helpful staffClose to Bohemian (El Born) and Gothic QuarterFantastic decor - very relaxing and comfy chairsCons:No drawers in rooms (I need them to organise myself)Limited hanging spaceBathrooms very clean but shower floods the floor - fixed shower head needed perhaps?Only double beds available for 2 sharing a roomDespite the few niggles I’ve mentioned, I’d definitely stay at a motel one again. Excellent value for the standard of hotel you’re getting and the location is fab!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Motel One is a good hotel located in a handy area and a 5 minute walk from Arc de Triomf metro and regional rail station. Only 1 stop by regional rail or 2 stops by metro from Placa Catalunya (top of La Rambla). Yes the rooms are small but what do you expect from a budget hotel chain? The hotel is also located across the road from Parc Catalunya which is great for an evening stroll. My only criticism is the breakfast is definetly not worth the €9.50pp, much better options for half the cost nearby. Not sure why people are complaining about the hotel being of a 3 star standard, that's because it is a 3 star hotel!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time that I have used this chain (the other being in Berlin). Clean, neat rooms, nothing fancy but the bar area is great and the staff are fantastic. A genuine smile and welcome every time you passed one. Breakfast great and most of all the whole exeperience is value for money. I will look for Motel One before I use any other hotel. 10/10
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a modern, funky hotel with a large lounge and bar area and a pleasant rooftop bar (open to 9pm) with good views. If only the rooms had been made a little larger and better equipped? this being the first hotel I've ever stayed in without a kettle - essential after a hard days slog around Barcelona. Very limited 'wardrobe' space meant we lived 1/2 out of our suitcase for the 5 nights we stayed. Opted NOT to pay 9.50 Euros each for breakfast and found cafes around the corner doing bacon sandwich and coffee for less. Some decent eating places for all times of the day nearby and it seems to be a popular area with locals. Opposite the park and close to both major bus routes and Metro (Arc de Triomf station), Easy walking into Gothic Barcelona (Las Ramblas and port area etc). Great location overall.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as part of a business trip. It’s a really lovely modern hotel with a really nice reception area.Rooms are smaller than some of the other hotels I’ve stayed in Barcelona but they’re still perfectly comfortable.Just 1 moan - most hotels I stay in always have 1 or 2 bottles of complementary water in the room, particularly in warmer places. Here there is nothing which is a tad annoying. Whilst there’s a bar in the same building (not part of the hotel specifically) it would be really helpful to have a bottle of water in the room please
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are fans of Motel One. During our business and some leisure trips we have stayed in several Motel One around Europe. This one is Barcelona was no surprise for us: good room, excellent breakfast, fantastic roof top bar and very professional staff. We liked as always!We highly recommend Motel One. You should try.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
