review_body: Nice reception and barFast liftsComfortable bedsBrilliantly accessible bathroom ( I’m a chair user and very unsteady )There’s even a roof terrace bar and parking on site.However the accessible bathroom is let down by two issues.First, no grab rails between shower and door.Second, walk in shower has textured non slip tiles. Rest of bathroom has polished marble. Like a skating rink when wet. Couple the two together and it’s unsafe.Final beef, they should put fridges in room. No need to stock. Plenty of shops. But I like my water cold.All in all, however, a good stay. Convenient. Happy punter.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Motel one for three nights on a City break in Barcelona. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Located near the Gothic Quarter with lots of lovely tapas, the Arc de Triomf and lovely park to explore. Lovely, friendly and helpful staff.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely loved my stay at motel 1. From checking in, the staff was so nice and accommodating. She noted my request in my reservation and gave me options of which room I would like! (Quiet, low floor, garden facing patio or street facing higher story). We chose the room over looking the inner garden. It was great. Super clean room with a lot of sunlight. Quiet also since it was facing an inner garden. The hotel sits on a rather busy road so we were really grateful for the quiet room. The room, although small, had great space allocation. The location was great - 10 minutes walk to anywhere you want to go. Close to El Born and the Gothic Quarter. And lastly, the staff made the biggest difference in going above and beyond for the clients. The only con I can think of is that there is no gym, but not a deal breaker in this case. I highly recommend and if next time I go to Barcelona, I will most definitely book this hotel again.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, very modern and clean. I would highly recommend staying here if you come to Barcelona. The hotel has all you need facility wise, is in a great location and it’s very modern and clean. The breakfast is also good. It is about a 15 minute walk to the sea front and harbour area. It was amazing value for money. We stayed for 4 nights and 5 days. We normally went out in the morning and came back around 4pm, the weather was lovely so we would go and sit up on the roof top bar which overlooked the park and other sites. I couldn’t have been happier with my stay. If you want to go out for dinner at night there are a some nice restaurants near by I recommend Tantarantana.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have visited Barcelona last week and it was great! We stayed in this hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. The staff is helpful and polite. Hotel is new, modern, nice design. They offer organic breakfast, gluten free options. The hotel is close to the Barcelona Nord bus station, which is advantage if you are traveling from Girona airport (Ryanair travelers), also it is a very good vantage point for sight-seeing, with its location next to the Ciutadelle park and walking distance from the Gothic quarter or the beach.We have spent a nice spring break here. We´ll be happy to come again! :)
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is 15-20 minutes walk from the centre of Barcelona in an area I didn't really know, which was a plus as I discovered new things to visit including the Arc de Triomf and the Parc de la Ciutadella which I enjoyed exploring in the early evening. It is also only a short walk from the ocean promenade and Frank Ghery's Gold Fish sculpture. The decor is very design-orientated, which is fun, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the room is a good size with, a nice touch, the television showing moving images of fish at night to help you relax for sleep. We enjoyed drinks on the rooftop bar which has great views across the park to the various buildings beyond it. Excellent value for money and I would happily return here again.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with my friend. Couldn’t fault it! Great location, amazing value for money, chilled on the roof terrace every evening after a busy day in Barca.The roof terrace was only open until 7pm (May), but wasn’t a problem for us.Rooms are ideal, as with all motel ones! Worth knowing that in this one, theres no kettle.Staff were great! Rooms made spotless every day. Nice vibe. Didn’t have breakfast but lots of others were so must be decent, had a variety of organic options.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend staying at Motel One. Request a room with a view of the park - it’s worth it. The hotel overlooks Parc de la Ciutadella and its gold monument of Aurora on her chariot.Rooms are smallish, but very well designed, modern and very functional. There’s some excellent shared spaces on the ground floor and rooftop.Breakfast is from 7am to 11am, but gets busy from 8am. It has everything you need.The staff are excellent and very helpful. The bar downstairs is great for coffee, beers or cocktails. The hotel is a short walk to the beautiful Arc De Triomf boulevard, and also very close to the awesome tapas bar area El Born.Would go back to Motel One anytime.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed for 2 nights. Very nice, modern, exceptionally clean place with friendly and helpful staff. Room was small but very comfortable, overlooking Parc Ciutadella, Nice rooftop terrace with great views of the city
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel only because my friends stayed there.I have received exactly what I was expecting for the price paid.Hotel: the same as all other Motel One hotels (this is a concept, I heard). Huge lobby bar serves breakfasts and some food during the day. It is advertised as open 24 hours a day, but don't expect to buy some alcohol (including beer) at night. One night they stopped selling it at 2.00, the next night - even at 1.00. Both times I was late to grab a glass of wine before bed.Rooftop terrace closes at 7 PM, so don't expect it to be available to you every time you wish to enjoy the views.Rooms: yes, they are tiny and basic. No wardrobe (just a couple of pretty high shelves), no work table, no telephone (but would you even call reception, if there is no room service at the hotel?), no amenities in the bathroom (except soap and all-in-1 washing liquid). Everything in the room tells you, that you chose to save money for your holiday stay instead of enjoying the trip to the full.Plus points: good location next to El Born, very decent WIFI, cleanliness.Verdict: this is the place to sleep, nothing else.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location on the park. And quite modern design. But that's where the positive impression ends. Absolutely tiny rooms. Really, one can stay here as a single traveler, or intimate couple with backpacks, but not us, not a couple with a infant daughter and three suitcases.. we physically could not fit in the space. The advertised king sized bed is a misunderstanding.. for the motel, king size means two doubles pushed together. Less than a queen size in canada. the staff was friendly and refunded our subsequent prepaid nights after a single very difficult night. If you put everything on the bed, two people can stand in the room. When you sleep, you put everything on the floor, but then you can't stand or even walk to the bathroom.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 85% of the rooms do not have any light since they are interior and facing a wall. It is dirty. Only backpackers would give this property a 5 star review. I do not usually leave reviews, but this time, the pictures on the website and the great reviews are extremely misleading. I was going to forget about the noise, but someone just slammed a door...again. The corridors are busy and doors are slammed every 10 minutes, I am staying in room 207. Oh, no closet or nowhere to put your things away. DO NOT RECOMMEND!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel as a birthday present for my sister. So delighted. It was perfect. Staff friendly, decor really cool, comfy bed, excellent shower and the roof top bar was perfect. I was so pleased with our choice of venue and would definitely return.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: hotel. One of the coolest places we've stayed at! Decor is super fun, lobby lounge with numerous cozy seating options including swinging chairs , roof top patio with views of the nearby park and city. Comfortable small well planned clean and comfortable room. Efficiant, friendly staff. A great place to stay for a reasonable price.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at my first Motel One over a decade ago in Berlin -- at the time I thought it was adequate, but I gave it, and other locations a chance. I'm glad I did: Motel One consistently had clean, comfortable, functional, and well designed rooms. The Barcelona location is no exception to this rule. My room was not large, but it was comfortable with everything that I needed: a comfortable bed, some hangers to hang clothing, and a safe for my valuables. The only issue was in the bathroom where the design of the shower stall means that water splashes out onto the floor of the bathroom in general.The ground floor bar is comfortable and busy, with reasonably priced drinks. The rooftop lounge area has a great view over the city (although it closes rather early at 7pm). I do skip breakfast, so I cannot speak it its price/value aspects. Instead I popped out into Barcelona and tried some local cafes and restaurants.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a new modern hotel with an extremely friendly and helpful staff always smiling and willing to go an extra mile to help you.The hotel is lovely, rooms are spacious, clean but very basic. No desks or phones in the room, so if it’s a business trip, it’s better to go downstairs and use the lobby.They have long tables with plugs for your computer and great comfortable seats.Breakfast is also basic but delicious and with a great quality.Location is great, central within walking distance to the metro station.Please beware of your belongings. The lobby is always open for everyone and a friend had her bag stolen while having breakfast.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A group of 16 work colleagues stayed at motel one during mobile world congress and were all pleasantly surprised by what a great hotel it is. Very trendy, lovely bar areas and fantastic views from the roof terrace. I can't recommend highly enough. Good price too!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love Motel One’s entire concept and this one is fabulous. Design, beautiful furnishings, absolute service with a smile from all staff, comfortable bed, nice room and shower, cleanliness, brilliant rooftop, top location, nice buffet breakfast, value for money, the groovy bar and cocktails... all day open...the beautiful park opposite, very serene and quiet, need I go on? Motel One has hit a great niche market of modern urban travellers who enjoy consistent style, German high standards and infrastructure and an overall relaxing and easygoing place to stay. Hope more are going to be built around Europe!!!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella! Quality exclusive concept and a truly five-star service. Spacious room, really modern, with a beautiful bathroom with shower! Breakfast was delicious, plenty of choice and good coffee. The staff was friendly and welcomed me, i had few requests and they sorted all of them in few minutes and also helped me to find a restaurant to eat tapas at midnight just 5 mins walk from the hotel.The stay was comfy and strategic for who like me needs to explore the city and wants to be in city centre
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: location: located next to the Parc de de la Ciutadella. Main sights, lots of retaurants and bars in walking distance (15 minutes walk). 10 minutes walk to train stations (Arc de Triomf or Estación de Francia).price-performance ratio: goodcleanliness: room was clean and tidy good quality sleep: bed was really comfortable - unfortunately the room was close to the lift and quite noisyaccessibility: big room, big bathroom with a wheel-in shower.food: good barfree goodies: free wifi, nice view from rooftop terrace
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was just a basic stay, nothing special about the room( only minus is the shower where’s no door and all the water is getting on the floor). The breakfast it was really good and I liked the outdoor tables where you can take your breakfast. The lounge was fine with a chill atmosphere where you can enjoy your drink. I recommend this place!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, beautiful design and nice atmosphere. The personell was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are small, but comfortable. We enjoyed our visit at this hotel. It is a quiet and relaxing. I can only recommend, you can visit every place by walking.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you like a stylish lounge atmosphere with friendly & helpful staff situated just 5 minutes walk to Arc de Triomf and Parc de la Ciutadella, than this is the place to be.Stunning hotel lobby with cool furniture and ligtning. Nice rooms (although a coffee/tee machine would be welcome) with good beds and bathrooms. We had a stunning city view over the Parc de la Ciutadella.Very good breakfast buffet with large variety of food, juices, fruits, cereals etc. The roof top terrasse has a magnificent view over the Parc; great place for drinks and meet before heading downtown.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grrrrrreat location! Walking distance to everything including all the parks and action. Rooms were small but that’s to be expected in Barcelona. We arrived around noon and called ahead of time... however, once we got there.... no room was available? . Tired from flying all day, that was the last thing we wanted to hear . Situation could’ve been handled better as rooms were available. Food was delicious and the pick-pockets are vicious!!!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is an example of how a bad personnel management can ruin a great investment in a good location.Location is good, and Hotel is brand new, but since you just arrive for check in your problems will begin...We had to spend 30 minutes for check in, with 2 trainees and one more experienced staff just to pass our credit card to have access to the room.Then, every request had to be asked twice or three times as anyone at either reception or customer service seemed to know or have the motivation to help.Then, most weird experience was at check out, as I told clerk if possible to have a late check out as our flight was nearly midnight that evening. She understood we wanted to stay one more day and said 'yes, no problem, Hotel is plenty of free rooms', but when I clarified we just wanted to stay a few more hours, she said 'sorry, there is no availability'. I insisted she first said one thing, then changed, asking to talk to a supervisor. That was even worst, as a very arrogant tall lady came, and did not even looked at us, but said 'no way'...No more words.We won't ever return.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was perfect! Beautiful design, cosy, nice and kind staff and a very comfortable bedroom. Very well located to walk around the city or taking the underground. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to spend some days in Barcelona also if you compare the price with others in Barcelona, it has a good price/quality.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just getting around to write a review for this hotel from my stay with my partner in a July this year. We had a 3 night break in a cosy double room with a fantastic view across the park. The hotel design is just stunning and extremely tasteful. I love the hanging chairs in the bar area! The rooftop bar had beautiful views too and served great drinks. Staff were helpful and polite throughout the hotel.Thanks for a memorable stay!
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great, the lounge is large enough and has a great bar with a lot of gintonic available. It has with nice design furniture. Breakfast was good with lots of different food and good coffee. Room was good, not very large but with a good bed and great shower. At fifth floor on the back of the hotel it was very quiet at night.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a fab weekend in Barcelona . Would highly recommend motel one , brilliant value for money and the perfect location. The hotel was extremely clean and beds very comfortable. There is a gorgeous rooftop terrace where you can bring up your drinks from the downstairs bar and chill out and watch the sun set. The staff were all very good and friendly but my only issue is that they are under severe pressure , totally understaffed ! Also the bar was under stocked, they ran out of several different drinks .
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel near a park in a quiet neighbourhood. Excellent vibe. Lot’s of space in the lounge to sit, relax and have a drink. Outside space on rooftop and downstairs. Rooms are small but very convenient and clean. Super breakfast. Fast wifi. Old city, new city and sea are all in walking distance of 20 minutes.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel with my husband and another couple. Our flight arrived very early so the hotel took our luggage so we could go explore the city while waiting on our room. We got a room on the ground floor beside the bar and terrace, the bedroom was very big and a huge bathroom and terrace. The room was spotless and cleaned everyday. The bar itself is very modern and staff very friendly. The negatives about the bar were; 1. Understaffed - most of the time only one person on the bar serving drinks and food I felt sorry for the staff they were literally running in the bar dropping food at tables then back behind the bar to serve a crowd of people 2. They ran out of most beers we had to change our order 4 separate times as they ran out of everything and they didn’t seem to stock up as they still didn’t have the beer back in the following day 3. Ordered toasted sandwiches and they weren’t great at all. There is a roof top terrace which is gorgeous but if heading up there order your drink at the bar downstairs and bring up with you as there was no bar upstairs there is a number to ring if you want drinks brought up but we couldn’t find a phone to actually ring. The location of the hotel is excellent, walking distance to everything. The hotel is great value for an excellent location. Overall we had a great stay in Barcelona and I would recommend this hotel for location.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great clean hotel. Nice furniture, good beds, good breakfast, nice staff!Roofterrace is amazing. Family room was nice and spacious.Bar service was just fine. They had little food / sandwiches as well to eat.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our 3 day stay at Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella. It was a great place to call home before our cruise. The location was great! Close to Park Ciutadella, Arc de Triumph, train stop, and walking distance to the Gothic Quarter. My husband and I also enjoyed our morning walk to to Sagrada Familia. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was a little small, but we were out so much we didn't mind. Room and bathrooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. We couldn't have asked for more. Loved the upgrade to a room with a balcony with views to Park Ciutadella.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleased to have chosen Motel One as our Barcelona base for three nights. The hotel is beautifully designed, clean and located within easy walking distance of most of the sights and culture that the city has to offer, including Arc de Triomf and Parc de la Ciutadella just on the doorstep. Our room was a little on the small side but ideal for our needs. The bathroom was generously sized and featured a fantastic power-shower. Very helpful staff who spoke perfect English and were able to advise us on places to visit. Overall, great value for money.
hotelName:
11    Motel One Barcelona-Ciutadella
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited this hotel on Monday 16th September. We had done a fair bit of research to find a quiet hotel that was well reviewed by other people. this place is in a side street but within walking distance of the Rambla and all the main sightseeing areas.Lovely! From check in we realised it was going to be a very relaxing stay. We paid a little more to have a room with a balcony. But what an amazing view of mountains in the distance and just a canopy of trees on either side from the top of the balcony.The room was huge with very comfortable beds and a little sitting room. A fantastic rain shower which was very welcome, after hours of walking around.We even had a fantastic recommendation for an evening meal. The best steak we have ever eaten.So thank you so much to the lovely staff of Hotel Constanza. If we ever return we would come back to you. No question.Barcelona has to be the most beautiful city in Europe. Every building is so beautiful. It is also so clean. It appears that even the pavements get showered at night.What a great time. What a lovely hotel.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed for one night. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, and the decor around the hotel and rooms very tastefully done. The location is good and was accessible to many of the areas and sites we wanted to visit.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Constanza was in a quiet street in a great location close to all sites. The Reception staff were friendly, attentive and gave helpful advice. The rooftop bar was a nice spot to unwind and have a meal and drink which I did on my last night and the food was very tasty. Unfortunately I was disappointed in the breakfast dishes that were on offer. The eggs and baked beans were cold and the selection of fruit was poor with over ripened bananas. Also I would have liked fresh coffee instead of out of a machine. The room was clean with good air conditioning but there was a lot of noise from adjoining rooms on my floor well into midnight both from children and adults. Also I could hear the plumbing from the room next door so I had a few sleepless and disturbed nights. There are many nice cafes nearby for breakfast so if I stayed again I would not include breakfast at the hotel unless it was improved but on the whole I would recommend this hotel with it's nice entrance and waiting lounge area, attentive reception staff and perhaps a rule should be in place for late night noise so guests can enjoy their nights in a comfortable and well placed hotel in a safe area
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet, clean, cozy, and a great location. Considering this was a last minute booking, couldn’t have asked for a better find. Modern deco, close to major attractions, if not everything is a short walk away. The staff is very polite and friendly. Bubble tea and vegan sandwich place right around the corner!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, family room was big enough for 2 adults and 2 kids. Was nice having a small balcony. Room was comfortable however a bit noisy, could hear noise from other rooms and hallway. Staff were pleasant and helpful.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for three nights. Our room was on the third floor, with a good wet room and very powerful air conditioning. The staff are friendly, and the breakfast is a reasonable selection from a buffet. I would prefer if the coffee was not made from a machine but that was the only down side of three days. We went to the bar on the roof terrace and it is a good place to meet friends for a pre-prandial cocktail. The hotel is well positioned just away from the gothic town.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just had a one night stay while visiting 2 days in the city. The hotel is small, but centrally located. Staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms were fine, no complaints. Ate dinner at Bruc 33 Tapas inside hotel—very nice sangria and tapas—enjoyed it very much. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here Tue 2nd - Sat 6th July. Easy to find the hotel and its nice and central. Staff on the reception desk spoke good, clear English and were very helpful. Especially the chap who helped us with our transport back to the hotel (wish i'd gotten his name). Room itself was basic but clean, all you need for a short city break in my eyes. Double bed was a bit hard. TV has no english channels (that may bother some people). We were in 301 and had a balcony which was good for sunbathing! Mini bar was expensive so don't bother use that.The rooftop bar was a bit naff, some chairs and a small bar, but nothing decent. Nicer ones near by. Overall really good stay here and would consider coming back, however... the walls are a tad thin. We could here the people above and next to us walking around/closing doors when we were trying to sleep (11pm ish). We let it go but on our last night the room next door were blaring music at 12pm. We had to get up at 4am for our flight home. I went on banged on the door, three times!!!! as they couldn't hear me over the music, and told them to turn it off. To which they did, but we could still hear them talking and showering. I appreciate the hotel can't walk up and down the corridors policing, but they should have better noise control and rules in place for no loud music after 10.30pm. They should enforce this better. Didn't have time to speak to anyone in the hotel as we were leaving so early as I mentioned. We paid £508.77 for 4 nights, which was cheap compared to other places.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the location. It was just off the beaten path so it felt like we were in a quiet neighborhood with good options for food, but still close enough that we could walk to the major tourist sites. The room was very big for being in the city and was a great value for the price we paid.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always enjoy my stay at the Hotel Constanza (I think this was my 4th time). It’s convenient to major sights, is clean, has friendly staff, great rooftop bar...now if it just had morning coffee it would be perfect!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located, only a short work from one of the main squares. Clean, comfortable, with a super friendly front desk. Room was nicely decorated with a front facing balcony. )Rooftop closed until summer).
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifully remodeled, small hotel in old Barcelona with spacious, nicely furnished, quiet rooms. Hotel is in walking distance to Plaza Catalunia and was close to everything we wanted to visit. Beautiful, reasonable stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideal spot for city break. Spotless room and very friendly staff. Very reasonable for a big. Ity like Barcelona. We did not eat at hotel so cannot comment but everything else was good. Location and cleanliness top notch.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently traveled with two friends to Barcelona to spend a few nights before embarking on a cruise. I generally stay in Marriott / Starwoods properties since I have elite status in their loyalty program. My friends had previously stayed at the Constanza and suggested that we stay there. This small extremely well located hotel exceeded my expectations at every turn. Friendly and helpful staff, large rooms with ample amenities including a safe, refrigerator and excellent shower as well as a balcony were more than I expected from a two star hotel. The hotel is subject to the restrictive rating system in the EU but the elements that would give it a higher rating did not in any way detract from a most enjoyable stay. We walked everywhere in the central area to restaurants, museums, and shopping with ease. A delightful tapas restaurant is attached and provides breakfast for hotel guests. It would be possible to spend several hundred more euros and not find this level of comfort, service and location
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: buen situacion y habitacion de qualidadthe only problem was that you can hear door slamming and people speaking in the corridor.a part this, good hosting people at the lobby.I had the single room..
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in perfect location, would definitely stay again on trip to Barcelona. The room was a brilliant size for a family with lovely decor. The location was brilliant for getting to the main areas in Barcelona
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The one improvement point for me would be their breakfast. You have very little choice for 10 EUR extra. Rooms enough space, balcony, top shower and dito cleaning service. Very friendly and service oriented staff. All in all very good for 2 stars.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a pretty area not too far from Ramblas and has some nice restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable in size, and with all basic amenities such as mini fridge, hair dryer, TV, and plenty of sockets for all the gadgets we carry these days. Staff was very helpful too. Would surely book again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice bedroom, location and commodities! Was a great surprise. It has a good relation price-quality. The hotel are in a good location, near the principal attractions. The staff was nice! Would recommend to friends!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient and central location in Eixample, 8 minute walk to placa Catalunya (Aerobús stop to/from the airport), short walk to the Urquinaona metro station. The La Boqueria market/ cathedral /Las Ramblas area is only a 15 minute walk away. Lots of food options within a walking distance.Got a room upgrade (one with a little living area) so it was really spacious! Rooftop bar wasn’t open (perhaps because it was winter time). Nice hotel, would stay again :) great value.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Briliant value hotel, at the eastern end of Eixample. Room was cheaper, and far better than more expensive rooms in higher 'starred' hotels. Our room had a small lounge atea, and a private balcony. Also very quiet. Nearby restaurants/tapas/wine bars, well worth walking a few bocks are 'Amovino' and 'Colmado'.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel... Staff very fiendly, nothing to say except we spent a very nice trip... The food quality was also a good point so that we have taken all our breakfasts there. Very easy to ask sthg; for example a bottle a wine directly brought in our room.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good place to stay when visiting Barcelona central. Convenient for eating, bars and main tourist attractions. Staff are very helpful and proffesional. Rooms and facilities are very comfortable and Bistro next door is ideal for eating.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there from Oct 9th to 19th and loved this choice. The staff were fantastic, helped with some translations and very friendly. The location is great for walking around. There is a mini fridge in the rooms which worked great. Close to lots of places to get coffee and food. Thank you for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in a 4th floor double room. Very clean. Good storage. Room serviced to a high level every day. Amazing shower. Glad to have fridge. Tea/coffee facilities would have been cherry on top of the cake. Good aircon.Lovely staff throughout. Great rooftop bar. Plenty of sockets in the places you need them. Had breakfast. Somewhat steep for 10 euro pp - but addition of better yogurt, some fresh fruit salad, musli, higher quality cereals, bacon would rectify this. Spain/Catalunya not renowned for their breakfasts - but there are decent cafes about! Cons. Soundproofing may be an issue - if you wanted a lie in - thankfully our neighbours were quiet on the whole and we were up early. No external noise.Flaccid is the best way to describe the pillows. Give an extra pillow and get rid of pointless cushions.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You cannot beat the location for Hotel Constanza. Choose enough to Plaza de Catalunya to walk to in under 10 minutes, but far enough for it not to be crazy noisy. I stayed in a superior room, which was very well appointed and had a small balcony which was a surprise luxury. Bedding and linen is premium, there is a safe in the room, and the bathrooms are honestly humongous. Great shower... Rainfall style.The staff though is what makes this place special and deserving of a higher than 2* classification. House keeping was tip top, and the front desk extremely friendly and helpful. Every one is multi lingual so that's an incredible advantage. My only beef is the early check out at 11 am. I did get a 30 minute extension, which I am grateful for. International travelers have evening flights, and a late check out at no additional charge would sure be a major draw for choosing this place.Great hotel.. Great stay...
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel after reading reviews, first time in Barcelona for 3 nights means hubby, not sure why it was only a 2 star - reception staff were so friendly and helpful on check in giving us lots of information, room was nice and clean and also got a little balcony at the back. Didn’t have breakfast as we wanted to find places on route during our days out. Fantastic little tapas next door. It was literally ten min walk to gothic quarter area, couldn’t have found a better spot to walk into places but not be in the hustle and bustle. An absolute must is to try Tapas 24 restaurant which is 6/7 walk from his hotel - just fabulous! Would def book this hotel again without a doubt, rooftop bar was lovely but on two nights we were only ones in there which was a shame.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had seen previous positive reviews, so booked based on those. Could not have been more satisfied. Very laid back feel, tho with top notch attention to service. Short walk to La Rambla and Placa Catalonya. Plenty of restaurants, coffee shops in area. Very quiet neighborhood. Reasonably priced for a big city.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed numerous times for business in this hotel and would highly recommend. Great price super rooms and a fantastic location for all your needs in Barcelona. Staff are very pleasant and no requests is too much.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 4 nights at Costanza and I really liked the rooms and the atmosphere. However the Breakfast was not good at all. Low quality, bad service and bad taste. You always have to ask if something essential like cups or plates are missing.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near plaza catalunya, the quality is very Good, but a little bit expensive.. i enjoy a lot my trip in this hôtel. The only lack is a swimming pool in the hôtel. I don’t try the roof top but It looks like good
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated on the west side of the city, the Constanza offers a great base to explore the city.Normally, you would look to have a base more centrally, but the metro and bus system allows for easy access across the entire city.The rooms are very spacious, clean and tidy. Being city-based, you always have the issues of noise pollution into the rooms, but the louvered windows offer 100% noise and light cancellation, should you use the integral blind.A rooftop pool and sunbathing area, adds another option, as does the in-house spa.Reception offers great information and guidance on the sites open to see, and we used them a lot for advice.Would definitely stay here again, and would recommend the hotel to anyone staying Barcelona.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 4. There was plenty of room for all of us. The room is exactly like it looks in the picture. The air conditioning was strong as were were there in a heat wave. Shower pressure was great and staff was helpful.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel, I was a single female traveler (26 y.o.). The hotel is very clean and on a quieter street though still just a short minutes walk from the center of Barcelona. The reception desk was AMAZING! They were very kind and polite and offered great advice for transportation options. The rooms were serviced every day.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights in this 2 star hotel in Barcelona. The young people at the reception were all super professional, efficient and really nice. We had some issues with the reservation, made through another vendor, but they solved our problems and were very flexible, accommodating and understanding. The hotel is beautifully kept and clean. Nice rooms and bathrooms, and the location is perfect. We happened to be there during the very annoying taxi strike, but we could walk from there to all the best neighborhoods in Barcelona. Nothing was really far. Much recommended.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location here is awesome, very central to all you want to be at -and close to Catalunya if you’re taking the AeroBus in (recommended) Room was a great size, staff was all super nice and the AC here works superbly.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very clean and tidy. All the staff were very helpful from early morning to late in the evening and always with a smile. The hotel was very close to La Pedrera and Casa Battlo. It was only 10 - 15 minutes walk from the hotel.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in great location. Close to all major attractions. Very comfortable with helpful staff. There was also a great little tapas bar next door. This was handy for getting a drink on late return to the hotel
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was Wonderful! It was in a quiet neighborhood with a restaurant next door. The hotel staff was wonderful-they were very helpful with directions and places to eat. Great location-we walked everywhere. It was about a 10 minute walk to La Rambla and another 5 minute walk to Passe de Gracie. Hotel was centrally located. The room was clean and large. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, comfortable rooms, great location. My early check-in request was granted. On the downside, requested a taxi to the airport, very early in the morning. Quite disapointed with taxi conditions, old and dirty, and also with the driver. It looks like it was an illegal taxi. The driver kept making turns, apparently avoiding the police. Book your own taxi.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just returned from a weekend break with my daughter and we stayed at this hotel. The location is perfect just a short walk from Plaza Catalunya and has a variety of good tapas restaurants , bars and cafes in the vicinity. The hotel and rooms were spotless and very modern and bright .The reception area is welcoming and the staff were polite and helpful and were willing to help, providing us with maps and local knowledge and a friendly smile!We had a fantastic stay in Barcelona and would certainly stay in this hotel again if we return. Thank you to all at Hotel Constanza.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean, small balcony overlooking courtyard, staff was polite and helpful with directions to get around, helped in providing transport to and from airport. Close to stores, shops and restuarants as well as tour busses.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located. We easily walked to The Ramblas and other near areas of interests. Since our stay was short in Barcelona during this trip, we wanted something centrally located. The room was on the smaller side as was the bathroom. Overall, the hotel was nice. Staff was great, very accommodating and extremely helpful. One thing though, if you are looking for quite, do not get the room with the balcony over the road. As lovely as it was, the street was noisy.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying here for eight days - one of the best stays in all our travels. The hotel is in a lovely quiet area, and you're only a ten minute walk from the heart of the city - Placa Catalunya, La Rambla, the Gothic Quarter, dining, and lots of shopping are right there. The Arc de Triomf is only a few minutes away, and you can wander down to walk to the gardens and zoo from there. And the Casa Battlo is also within walking distance.There are metro stops very close by as well. Near the hotel there are some great places to eat - we went up the street to the corner bistro, Bar el Buscatrufas, for breakfast each morning, so we can't offer anything on the hotel breakfast, and right around the corner is a lovely place, El Mercate, with great tapas. The restaurant right beside the hotel is also really good. There are lots of little markets for picking up extras like snacks and wine in the area, and ATMs. We had the superior double room with a terrace and sitting area, and it was fabulous. The terrace faced out into the central back area, and was a lovely place to enjoy our morning coffee (we brought our own fixings), and a glass of wine after a long day of wandering. We didn't have the 'luxe' brown bedding scheme, we had the blue, and it was really quite lovely. The room was spacious and comfortable, the bed really comfortable. The housekeeping is outstanding - our room was spotless every day. The bathroom was spacious and water pressure excellent for the rain shower, which also had consistent temperature - very appreciated. The staff all speak English very well and were super helpful and friendly every time we had a question - they also greeted us every time we came into the lobby - really attentive. A note - they do provide shampoo and a shower gel, but no other 'extras' - we always bring our own anyway, but just to be aware. We were really impressed and loved it here. On our next trip to Barcelona, this will be the place, no question. Better than a three-star for sure. I'm not including pics just because there are so many out there, and truly, they are true to the experience. It's great. Thank you Hotel Constanza and all your staff for an awesome stay!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall this hotel was very nice. The check in was quick and efficient, the staff was friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable. Great location and easy city to walk around in. There's several nice restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk.We live in an urban loft back at home so the sounds of the city don't bother us. However, this hotel is full of hard surfaces including the floors in all the halls and stairways (nothing to absorb sounds). We could hear voices, footsteps, doors opening, and any little thing that dropped in the neighboring rooms echoed through the hotel. If you're a light sleeper you might want to bring ear plugs.For the ladies with a lot of hair, the hair dryer in our room had to be "held down" while using it. This wasn't a big deal for me but if you have thick hair your hand might get sore after a few minutes of that.If you need to park a car I would suggest contacting the hotel in advance. I read that there was self parking available but they only have 3 spots. We got lucky to have a spot for the few days we were there!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a night in Barcelona prior to a Sunday cruise ship embarkation. After reading reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided on Hotel Constanza. It has very good reviews, and affordable price and convenient location. I was not disappointed. As my first time traveling in another country, I was a little nervous, however I felt very comfortable and safe. It is within walking distance of tourist sights while not being right in the middle of it.My room was small (single), but was plenty big for a solo traveler. I would definitely recommend Hotel Constanza to those visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to go to BCN every week for work ... I spend a night or two in this hotel ..The service is really family style ...the room are confortable and well equip .. like to be at downtown Barcelona ...close to many restaurants and night life.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is not as close as I was expecting, and the hotel itself was worse for wear than the photos. For a little more, I think you can get something much closer to Las Rambas, and I would suggest doing that. Rooms are clean but tiny.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights pre cruise at Hotel Constanza. The hotel is great for a quick stay. The location and nightly rate were the reasons I choose this hotel. The bathroom shower was superb. I tried the restaurant next door and was very disappointed. The food was not good. The hotel a short walk to La Rambla and Placa de Catalunya. Location location. The cruise port is a short taxi ride.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here a few weeks ago for a few days. We had just arrived to Barcelona and were touring Spain for 3 weeks. This was our first stop/hotel in Barcelona and we loved it! It’s a smaller, boutique style hotel in a great location! We could walk everywhere! There are restaurants, stores and taxi stands right outside the front door! Great, great location! We had a room on the back of the hotel that had a huge balcony that we really enjoyed! The staff and service was excellent! I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone! Thank you for a great first few days in Barcelona!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our 2 night stay here. The hotel is very modern and clean. The rooms are very large with a lovely shower. The staff is awesome, very accommodating. We were able to walk almost everywhere, it's very convenient. Thank you for making our Barcelona stay unforgettable!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front staff were friendly and helpful, with excellent English. My room was clean, tidy and well aired with a balcony. The location is fantastic; 10 minutes from La Ramblas and Placa de Catalonia (for the airport bus) and in a good and safe area next to bars, restaurants and cafes. It's also in the vicinity of many notable Gaudi buildings. Would recommend booking and I would personally visit again!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here twice. Staff always nice and accommodating. Great location , just 10 min walk to Plaza Catalunya. Bruc 33 next door great tapas restaurant. Airbus from airport drops offs and picks up at plaza. Rooms nice and bathrooms very clean. Standing shower no tub. Great value for money.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Constanza was an excellent experience. The hotel is located in the center of Barcelona (3-4 blocks from La Rambla) a lot of different restaurants are walking distance. The rooms and the facilities are very clean.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Constanza Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Trip did not go according to plan, hence need to cancel the reservation with evidence as to why it has to cancel. Urgently needed to get in touch with the representative in regards to our reservation. Tried to call in but was either hung up or unresponsive. Hope to get a response here. Very disappointed
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well appointed rooms, excellent location and friendly staff make the place a pleasure to stay. The tourist district is within walking distance. The breakfast, though well laid out could do with a bit of menu changes each day. Otherwise a perfect stay.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was rude at the breakfast table , towels replaced everyday were also not clean. When asked for anything the staff wasn’t very helpful. Except for the location it was a bad experience.Wouldn’t recommend any one who is looking for good service.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't ask for a better place, location, cleanliness, the front desk, the help provided by the staff regarding directions, tours, transportation, the list goes on.They are excellent! and the hotel is close to hop on/hop off buses, El Corte Ingles, Plaza de Cataluña, and all kind of restaurants.We couldn't have made a better choice. Definitely a place to come back without any doubts. Thank you for services, thank you to all the wonderful people who work there.Cary Ossa
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for my husbands 50th lovely hotel just off the ramblas close enough to walk without being right in the hustle and bustle of the ramblas . Rooms are very clean we had a large room with a small balcony very comfy large bed
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We like this hotel. Very clean. Big room, big bed. And sanitary is more than ok. Service is very friendly, helpful. Self service breakfast. Not much choice, just good. Best of all; you are in the city, close to all. Minibar, no room service.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Onix is a bright and happy gem right on the Ramblas. One step outside of the hotel and you are in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Barcelona. The Onix is no frills neat and clean hotel. The management is friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I first stayed here two years ago when visiting the city. We were looking for somewhere close to La Rambla but also near the metro network to enable us to reach the Nou Camp easily.The Onix was perfectly placed and ticked all the boxed. The hotel itself was pleasant enough, fairly modern and clean. We're going back again in October - again as part of a football trip - so I hope to find that nothing's changed since my last visit!
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location near de Garcia metro station on Rambla catulnya , clean room, super water pressure, a really big bed, and a very friendly staff also easy access to alot of brands near the hotel. We enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an air conditioning problem that we kept sweating all night, when i complained they refused to refund the night, and said it's working well however they changed our room but still i needed a compensation..
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Onyx last week and so enjoyed our stay - the location was perfect close enough to be able to access all the sights and views of the vibrant city but not too close to be very loud. Hotel staff helpful and even stored our luggage as we had a late flight.Close enough to use the airport shuttle which was only 6 euros and great cafe close by.Only improvement I would suggest is to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room an maybe update the air con unit as a little loud.Recommend a Rambla view room ⭐️
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 11 of various ages 25 to 55. Visiting this beautiful city for a short stay. There is no publi area to congregate and after we gathered in the room to take fotos and yes chat may have been louder than the normal chat of normal room occupancy of 2-3 guests as soon as reception contacted us at 2pm the “noise” stopped soley due to us leaving to join our private yacht charter. At 8.40 that evening I received a threatening complaint from booking.com on behalf of the hotel quote I was not complying with hotel policy and police would be called with charge” in connection to the noise earlier that day. May I also add I resided in room I was allocated on check in 103 on no occasion did hotel staff contact or speak to me prior to receiving this email? The c cleaner may not understand the language of guests but a tip - a smile is universal and would serve this hotel well. Towels changed daily and rooms spotless. The roof top terrace does not permit juices water or food for consumption- this we also adhered to and left the area as we found it - spotless & our rubbish bagged. If your looking for cool drink you go go up and down the 6 floors as often as you may to buy juice from the little takeaway next door, drink and eat on the street and return to the 6th floor if like us you have a late evening flight but are no longer considered a guest
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend with a group of girls. The hotel is in a good location and is clean however, most of the staff were not friendly to say the least, in particular the maid and reception stafff. One time we made noise because we all congregated in one room and we were cautioned with police action which is EXTREMELY harsh (note there is no bar area and you are also not allowed food or drink on the rooftop so extremely limited for a communal place). On our last day we were out sightseeing then came back to the hotel (had a late return flight) and we sat up on the rooftop only to be told by the hotel staff that as we were not physically staying over night at the hotel we are not considered “guests” anymore. This is the first time I have ever come across such policy, having been on countless holidays abroad especially Spain. Complete lack of care and respect for guests let’s this hotel down.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room and its bathroom are both really spacious and clean. Staffs are super friendly. Location wise really close to the main attractions, you are able to reach them easily on foot, 5 mins to Casa Batllo, 10 mins to Casa Mila, 5 mins to catalunya (where the airport shuttle situates) and 15 mins to catedral de barcelona and picasso museum etc. The front side, facing the street, can be a bit noisy, but you can enjoy free music (there's a man playing clarinet every night). We had a really comfortable stay, literally nothing to complain about.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just back from Barcelona. We stayed in Onix Rambla hotel for 3 nights. We booked our stay with breakfast. I think it was big mistake. Because breakfast choice was really poor and overpriced. There is a cafe few steps away from hotel and you will get rolls, coffee for breakfast. It's much much cheaper. Room was clean, towels were changed every day. There was no kettle, no coffee , tea facilities. It would be good to make a cup of tea in the evening after walking all day. One good think was hotel's location. It's in the city centre and loads of shops, plaza catalunya was within walking distance. Our room had not the best view either. I will recommend this hotel just without breakfast. We loved Barcelona. It's absolutely gorgeous city.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from 3 nights at the onix Rambla. The location is fantastic with easy walking distance to the playa d Catalunya square - where the airport bus drops you off. Centrally located. with las ramblas only a 10 minute walk away.Rooms were exceptionally clean and ample in size. Beds were extremely comfy.The breakfast was very good with a good selection of hot and cold food. Reception staff were fantastic. Took the time to ask our purpose of the trip and then proceeded to mark on a map the various locations we should visit. We were seeing Barcelona play and were told exactly what to do and what metro station and stops to take - very useful!Will definitely return!!!
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second time at the Onix Rambla Hotel. It's now our go-to hotel when we want a comfortable place to sleep after the opera to which we can walk in about 15 minutes down the Rambla. The staff is extremely pleasant. Winter prices are unbelievably inexpensive. We paid under 60 euros including breakfast! The room was good-sized, with very comfortable beds. It's wonderful to stay in a budget hotel which isn't trying to save money by not giving a top sheet and forcing one to sleep under an often-way-too-heavy duvet. The bed was made up the way I like it: bottom sheet, top sheet, blanket, and spread. The bathroom was perfect, with excellent hot water and water pressure. Breakfast was a rather decent varied buffet served in a good-sized dining room. In our reservation request, we had asked for a room with a king-size bed, not on the Rambla. When we arrived, we were smilingly told that we had been given an "upgrade" to a twin-bedded room with Rambla "view". We said that we were OK with the twin beds, but that we didn't want the Rambla view, because the Rambla view (which is not a view) means Rambla noise. The receptionist told us that we could have a room at the back, but that it was one of the darkest rooms. We asked to see both rooms, for which she graciously accommodated us, even though she was at the front desk on her own. Anyhow, in the end we took the "upgrade", because the interior room was really depressing. (On our first time at this hotel, we also had an interior room, which was much larger and had a real window.) Because it was winter, the noise on the Rambla was less of an issue, but it was a presence. Had it been any other time of year, I can't imagine what the noise in that room would have been like, even with the windows closed. Even though I've spent much time on this issue here, it really was minor compared to our overall very positive experience at the Onix Rambla, and we will return.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice little hotel, close by Catalunia Square and several metro stations in a nice and lively neighbourhood.Two mornings in a row, there was no hot water in the shower. This is not OK - even though we got free breakfast as a compensation.The gym/fitness room is better than advertised: the pictures showed no treadmill/running - there is such a machine, of good quality. No weights, though.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel met our needs well, It was not overly expensive, in a great location just blocks from La Rambla and the Gothic Quarter. We had a room for three which was a nice size. Rooms were well maintained and it had a cute little gym and rooftop pool!
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Relatively good location - not exactly on La Rambla, but about 7 minutes away through Plaça de Catalunya. Good enough location though with some great tapas and bars nearby which are probably a bit cheaper than if you were on La Rambla itself. The hotel itself is modern, the rooms are quiet with air con and as we paid a supplement a small balcony overlooking the street. Breakfast was an additional 9E pp and well worth it, with a hot and cold buffet and a good coffee machine. The pool was small and cold but as it was on the roof the sun deck was nicely sheltered from any breeze so was a pleasant place to while away a few hours mid day.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in an excellent location, walkable to everything. The room is fairly large, and very clean, however, it is very basic, not frills. Our room faced La Rambla, and was very quite. We were on the second floor. The bathroom was large, and had all the amenities, shampoos, hair dryer. You can get breakfast included for an extra charge. It was a basic breakfast, with rolls, hams, cheeses, yogurts, eggs and such. We were there in September, and the hotel prices were still expensive, but worth it for the location. There was a work out room and a pool; however the pool was very small.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Placed on La Rambla, the hotel is close to the main attractions on the city( near placa de catalunya, gaudi house battlo. Also a good location if you come for shopping .Verry clean, friendly staff and with a great breakfast .Another plus is that from the balcony of the room you see the whole pedestrian boulevard that connects you to the atmosphere of the city.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for two nights and loved it. Big room with a nice big bathroom, a balcony, everything is clean and well taken care of. Fantastic location, a lot of restaurants and shopping places, walking distance to practically everything, if you prefer public transportation instead- there are multiple options of it as well within a 5-minutes walk. Most of the reception staff could have been more courteous and at least acknowledge you when you are passing by, but it may just be cultural differences so it didn't bother us. We have not tried their breakfast. The only complaint is that we love having a mini fridge in our room- not a mini bar where drinks and snacks are pre-selected for you, but a fridge where we can keep out own food.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located on the extension of La Rambla so is very close to the main tourist location but far enough away to be safe and quiet. There are dozens of Tapas bars and restaurants along the street and lots of goods shopping very close. We were able to walk to both cathedrals and the water front from the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed from 12th June for a delightful city break. We have had one night here and are pleasantly surprised with hotel. The room is extremely pleasant and clean. The breakfast this morning gave lots of choices all self service of course. The pool and gym areas although not large were adequate. But it is all about location and it is very central. Would stay again.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A small boutique style hotel only 2 blocks from Place de Calalunya, with lots of restaurants and metro nearby. We had a room on the 4th floor with a balcony window, facing the avenue la Rambla. Room decor was typical of Barcelona hotels, modern decor, but very clean. One draw back was that there was no coffee/tea making facilities, but there was a small fridge. However, the main problem was that the room had no air conditioning, and it did get fairy warm at night. The hotel did loan us a fan which did help. Breakfast was included in our room rate, whilst not A1, it was adequate with more than enough choices. The lady at the reception was very helpful, explained where to visit, and was kind enough to loan us an electric kettle to make tea.Would stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and never once did I feel hospitality from the people at the front desk (if there was even someone there). In fact staff was on the verge of being downright rude. On the day of checkout we left quite early in the morning (around 4am) so the front door was locked and two of us were there wanting to get out and get a taxi but he would't unlock the door until the third person signed for the additional room charges. Did he think we were going to run out on the bill or something? Had to ask for more bath soap and shampoo because housekeeping didn't refresh them after cleaning. Just overall a bad stay and would not stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, with helpful and friendly staff. Despite the location, very quiet and no street noise. Very clean and modern decor. The breakfast is also lovely, with a continental selection. Highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Barcelona.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with big and clean rooms! The bathroom was huge and amazing!! The wifi was excellent and the breakfast too! I would like some nutella though.. ;-) on the 6th floor there is a swimming pool and a fitness center!! The hotel has great location, near la rampla and everything you need!
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 3 nights on a Stag Weekend. Very clean and simply furnished, the bed were comfy. Within walking distance of everything. Breakfast was OK, a fair bit of choice Would stay again when in Barcelona.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my dad and son for a weekend watching the football.Booked a triple room which was perfectly comfortable and clean. Great powerful shower too. Room not overly furnished but has plenty of wardrobe space, TV (only a couple of English channels) and minibar.Breakfast was simple, a fair bit of choice and was on offer at 5 Euros.The best thing is the location, everything is close by and for everything else, the underground at Catalunya can get you there cheaply.If you're after somewhere plush this isn't for you but for a comfortable and reasonably priced base, it is difficult to beat.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great four might break over the New Year in the Onix hotel. Apart from the small breakfast room the stay was top class. Perfectly located hotel for visiting Las Ramblas and the Gothic quarter. Hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and very clean. I would recommend this hotel. Thank you Rosetta Travel for booking this city break.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel received great reviews on this site which is why we booked it. Reviews you will read here are spot on. The hotel is very clean, rooms are spacious and the location great. Granted the rooms might be a bit bear, in the end we had a great stay. Tv is limited to Spanish channels but its not a problem as the internet connectivity was really good. We had a great movie night watching full movies on laptop/tablet with a bottle of red wine and some Pringles lol! Was great.Lots of great restaurants around the area. Will recommend this Hotel for those who are interested in a comfy bed to sleep and a clean bathroom for a hot shower as they spend most of their days exploring the city...
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the Rambla! Close to transportation, restaurants, even some entertainment. Lovely rooms, very clean, fine staff, breakfast quite adequate. Lovely breakfast room, too. We're already telling friends about it!
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the hotel for 5 nights, was quite noisy on the front rooms, but clean, breakfast was ok but not much choice. Very central and near the Metro. The only downside was we asked a nice receptionist if she would kindly ring up to see what time our taxi would be coming, and her Manager, arrived on the scene, and was talking about us to her in Spanish, The Front of House Manager was very rude to us and said they didn't do things like that, we had a phone in our bedroom. We only asked because of the language barrier, I felt sorry for the new girl who was very embarrassed about it. The Front of House Manager's attitude leaves alot to be desired, especially when all the staff couldn't of been more helpful, shame the Front of House Manager let herself down!!!
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet rooms, very clean, great water pressure, great A/C. Walking distance to: shopping, restaurants (food/drink), Plaça de Catalunya, Casa Batlló, La Pedrera, La Boqueria. 1.5 blocks from Aerobus (airport bus). The perfect place to stay if you want to experience Barcelona.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed overnight whilst visiting Barcelona. Located at top end of rambla with a straight 15 walk to placa catalunia. The largest bed we have ever slept in. Breakfast on a par with express by holiday inn. Location the best with places to eat outside on street if you want.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, staff extremely helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The pool and rooftop terrace was smaller than we thought from the photographs but for how much we used it, it was fine! Would definitely stay here again if visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, just steps away from the vibrant night life, Onix is a great finding with its tall ceilings and original look. Definitely worth a visit. Great continental breakfast with a good selection of fresh food. View in front of the hotel room.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's centrally located in Barcelona at Palaca Catalunya , walking distance from centro, flamingo show, hop on hop off bus , La Pedrera , Picasso Musuem , lots of Tapas joints jus outside the hotel also Veritas supermarket near by , overall must hotel to stay if in Barcelona again
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel centrally located near Placa Catalunya.We stayed here for three nights. Little things for guests we sometimes use when we are travelling were not available at the Onix Rambla Hotel.No tea or coffee making facilities in room.No vending machine for snacks.No extra pillows in room.No face washers in room.No hotel folder explaining information, house rules, etc.Breakfast in the morning was very good with a large selection to choose from.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would gladly stay here again,very clean and nice size room and cracking little pool and sun trap on the 6th floor with a few sun loungers up there as wellIf ever went back to Barca with the wife I would definately stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room spotlessly clean. The bathroom is beautiful, ( we have a superior double room) so can't vouch for other rooms. Not had breakfast yet, but if rest of experience is up to this standard, then there should be no problems.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got a room without windows and paid more than 200 Euros. Not worth for the price. The location is good. The breakfast buffet was included but the quality of food was not good. Apples were almost rotten. The variety was not much either. I'll prefer paying outside for a nice breakfast.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this delightful smart hotel for a short break after a short med cruise.Very smart spacious well appointed rooms, we were in a room overlooking the street with nice views of the restaurants below were a little worried about the noise but it never worried us.The location of the hotel is a couple of blocks from the Placa Catalunya which is at the top of the Rambla's the lovely avenue down through Barcelona to the port area, the Placa Catalunya is also the best place to get tickets for the bus tours around Barcelona which all start and finish here so easy to jump from one to another.Breakfast was very hearty with a good range of items to sample, reception staff very helpful in storing cases once we had checked out as plane was leaving quite late afternoon. Enjoyed the rooftop pool and terrace very nice showers and changing rooms Would heartily recommend this hotel as a good central location to enjoy the fantastic city of Barcelona please remember to book on -line if you wish to visit the cathedral of the sacred family as this is the only way to guarantee a ticket for a day as only so many are allowed to walk up and buy a ticket to enter now.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, all nice and clean and the breakfast was really good. We had a room with a view of the rambles and it was not too noisy as its just a low level din outside. hotel staff were really helpful and we had stayed after a cruise and were v helpful with all of our luggage too on the check in check out days.a small but very nice sun terrace a plunge pool up on the top floor was a great find1
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quality price this is one of the best you can find close it to the center. It's located in the rambles and walking distance to plaza Catalina. They have small rooms but if you request for a large one with a small difference price you get a very good quality room
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No need to worry about anything here. Rooms are clean and big enough. The staff is helpful. Breakfast wasn't bad.The location (Ramblas) was wonderful, of course.Can't really think of anything negative.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in an great location for restaurants, shops, café etc. The hotel is clean and staff friendly and not overly expensive. I suppose the only thing I do miss (and this applies to most European hotels) is they never have tea making facilities.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location for easy access to metro,bus routes,La Rambla.The hotel is spotlessly clean.Reception is very efficient,helpful and friendly.Breakfast has a decent choice although the two staff we met spoke little English.Rooms were very comfortable,a good size with decent bathroom.
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location. Close to metro station. The tapas bar and the coffee on the same block provided very good food. The Lobby is very beautiful and trendy, but comparing to the room, the room is clean but a bit old fashioned. Because it is located where bars and restaurants around, expected some noise late night and in the morning
hotelName:
13    Onix Rambla Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very cosy small hotel in the very center of the city. Very comfortable and clean rooms. Good breakfast, good wifi and calm atmosphere. The receptionists are very nice and helping, especially the cute guy with mid-short hair :) There is a pool on top floor but it is very small, however it's ok for sunbathing!
