review_body: Very nice hotel. Close to el cot metro station. Must praise the staff, really helpful and sweet. Cool rooftop pool with a glimps of Sagrada towers which is 15 mins walk from hotel. Great Breakfast buffet and loved my stay here.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was very good. Very tasty breakfast, nice room and small pool on the roof. Location near metro and railway station Clot, about 15 minutes walk to Sagrada Familia. There wasn't any negative things.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Catalonia Albeniz with my two grown up children from 25th to 27th June 2018 (two nights). We visited Barcelona for a short vacation before heading up to the other EU countries. Heritage buildings are the most impressive point of interests for us on top of the beautiful setting of Laberint and Park of Guella. But the most remarkable for us is our stay at Catalonia Albeniz. The bedroom and bathroom are superb, clean and cozy. Linens are fresh. Nice ambience on the breakfast restaurant although with limited selection of buffet table. We love it. the most unforgotable is the friendliness of the staff especially Vako in the Front Office who checked us in and helped us with all information on the city sightseeing, tours and dining including his recommendation to visit Park Guella and Nou Camp Studium for my kids. Vako made our stay full of comfort and enjoyable. As a hotelier myself I know Vako deserves to be highlighted. He is not only super friendly, genuine and charming but also very helpful to guests especially us as the first visitor to the country and from Indonesia. He always try to upsell the hotel product and services. If I ever come back to Barcelona again in the future, Albeniz will be where I am going to stay. I found there is no room for me to give the hotel negative feedback. Everything was so wonderful.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like the room, it was clean. I didn’t buy the breakfast, it was 8 eur... For 3 nights I paid 260 eur including tax for double bed room. The pool was really small and only 1 mt deep. Nice place, the location is good, not away from La Sagrada Familia
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good position, easy to get public transportation, direct conection to airport by train. 30 min to reach the seaside on a very nice way (pietonal street and nice atmosfere).The room is clean and very simple, furniture is outdated.The pool ...we didn’t use, and we staid 8 days - is to small.Break-fast worths his price - because you cannot find something else for this money nearby.Personal very good and helpful - Thanks again for everything!
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel with friendly staff. Clot Metro station is a 5 minute walk away which gives you a 10 minute tube ride direct to Place we la Catalunya and Las Ramblas (recommend buying a T10 travel card which you can share with more than one traveller and get 10 trips). Rooms are comfortable, similar to a Holiday Inn Express but no tea/coffee making facilities in them...free coffee available in reception. Small swimming pool on roof, didn't use it but it looked nice for a cooling dip...too small for a good swim. No bar but I'd recommend the AK bar opposite if you want a quick drink to finish off your evening. Overall we were pleased with our stay.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had wonderful stay at the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and spacious and the bed was comfortable. The only not so good thing was that the walls were quite thin so you could hear the noice from the other rooms and corridor. But all in all it was quiet hotel. The breakfast was diverse and good. The swimming pool was small but good for relaxing swimming. The location was excellent, it was very close to the metro and train station (Clot), and with the R2 train it took about 30 minutes to the airport (T2).
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From arrival to departing we found the staff extremely helpful, the room exceptionally clean, facilities excellent, the quality of the drinkks and food outstanding. We can only thank the staff for making our visit memorable. This was from the management to reception the cleaners and those providing the breakfast. Those we personally thank for making our stay memorable are Juan, Amdiold,Vako,Albert, Maria and Raul. We would use this hotel again without hesitation.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, friendly staff, has a gym, nice location, good wifi, a lot of tv channels. Breakfast looks good too (haven't tried) - it's discounted to 8€. Good connection to/from airport thanks to close train stop.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overpriced and basic. Reasonable location, small rooms. Barcelona however is a fantastic place full of things to do and places to see. Would return to Barcelona but not this hotel which was booked through Thomas Cook
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a decent hotel it is close to the metro and restaurants it's easy to get every place in Barcelona on the metro (which is just a minute across the road) just get a T10 pass which you can share or buy a 2/3/4 day pass I would also say the front of the hotel is not that noisy I have stayed twice and no problem the staff can't help you enough and the el clot restaurant next to the metro do lovely food and also nice people just go and enjoy
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing friendly staff especially the guy at reception. Very good choice of breakfast. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Close to metro and easy to get to airport on the train. Would definitely stay again
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I`ve stayed in Catalonia Albeniz for 4 nights and all I can say is that it was just excellent. It should be for sure a 4 star hotel. Large room with comfortable bed, great breakfast, super great staff (Thanks Erika and Kiko) and not the least, great location (3 mins from the tube station). Totally recommend!
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Built at a setback of 40 m from Carrer d'Arago, the hotel is relatively quiet and has some space for guests to park their cars to unload their luggage. Our room at the back of the hotel which faces a courtyard was very quiet. However there is a gap between the frosted glass bathroom door and the door frame (which can be easily fixed) which allows sound and smell into the bedroom.The main reason we chose this hotel is its proximity to the metro and train (for the airport) station. The nearest metro entrance /exit is Carrer Arago Exit (steps) 160 m away while the Carrer Sibelius Exit (elevator) is 280 m from hotel. The entrance to El Clot Arago train station (elevator) is 170 m away.The buffet breakfast is worth the 8 euro.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked into this hotel for a long weekend to included a Barca home match,Staff were very helpful with information and traveling around the metro. Easy to get to from the airport, hope on the metro after departures and one change your at Clot station with the hotel a few minutes walk away.Rooms comfortable clean and breakfast was very varied from hot items to continental.Our room 603 had a street view and fridge to keep our drinks cool. The rooftop terrace with splash pool has a lovely view of Sagrada Familia and beyond. Will use this hotel again when in Barcelonia.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good stay in this hotel for 2 night.I will suggest for others who need clean hotel to stay.the location is near the metro station too.We just uses this hotel to sleep at night and everything was good.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is an awesome, clean and confortable hotel..close to public transportation and dozens of bars and restaurants . my room was very clean and spacious, good shower and tv/wifi. front desk very efficient and diligent...thumbs up to the young guy from Georgia!!!!!and better yet the price of the room!!we comeback soon!
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, relatively close to central attractions of Barcelona. Room I've stayed in was recently renovated - all is new and nice. Double windows - quiet despite facing the street. Good choice for breakfast, especially for 3* hotel. Free coffee all day long. Not sure what are the prices in high season - but for my trip in mid-Jan, the rates were super-attractive. Recommended!
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a pleasant stay for 4 nights. I could recommend this hotel for its cosiness, friendly stuff, close location to metro, clean and comfortable rooms, very friendly receptionists!I would stay again in this hotel during my next visits to Barcelona
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent value. Clean and well located. A few blocks away from Sagrada Familia and very close to the underground system and buses. Extremely friendly staff. Would certainly repeat whenever back in Barcelona.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very enjoyable stay un Catalonia Albéniz Hotel. Perfecto location very good comunicated with down town.Wonderfull staff all time trying to make our stay unbelieveble.Next time I know where to stay.Good job.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time in Barcelona. Hotel staff give us every information whatever we need. There is one metro station near this hotel so it's so easy to go anywhere by metro. And staff is supportive and very professional.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night prior to embarking on a cruise, and chose this hotel due to its proximity to the train station and Sagrada Familia which we wanted to visit. The train from the airport stops at the nearby Clot train station, a short walk to the hotel. We arrived early and our room was not ready, however reception staff were very helpful and stored our luggage, provided us with all the information we needed including a map to allow us to go out and explore the area. We returned and completed check in before heading out again for a further explore and dinner, again reception staff helped with transport and recommendations for dinner. We had a comfortable stay and enjoyed breakfast the next morning. When checking out we were assisted to the taxi at the end of the street the next morning. thanks to all and I would have no hesitation in staying again.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was perfect. Thanks a lot for everything. when we need help, they helped us with all the informations that we need. And they always did that with a smile in theur faces what makes the stay more friendly
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was worth it but paid for it when I got to the hotel. Had a lovely room. Hotel is located in a lovely area. Found some lovely bars and also a pizzeria a couple of streets away. I would stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A cozy, clean and reasonably priced hotel. 25-30 mins drive from BCN airport. Located close to the metro (El Clot), a short leisurely walk to Sagrada Familia and a taxi stand located immediately right around the corner from hotel. The staff is friendly and very helpful, especially Vako. The continental breakfast will not disappoint. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to my family and friends.
hotelName:
16    Catalonia Albeniz
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was small, but that was expected in the description. It was clean and the staff was friendly, front staff spoke English well (despite my wife being fluent in Spanish and myself being serviceable). The breakfast was actually quite good, so if you think you will use it it's worth the extra cost. A very short walk to a convenient metro station.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in BCN for the weekend. It is located 5 minute walk from metro and bus. Staff was very kind and helpful. The room was ready in the morning when we arrived. Entire hotel is very new, modern and clean!! Staff printed out all boarding passes and tickets. Felt very safe there.The hotel and rooms look the exact same as the photos. Great price too. Would stay again
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been in the hotel during MWC, they take advantage of the situation and the prices where high and on top of the high cost they charge me 7Euro for breakfast.The rooms are small.Breakfast was nice, not to much to offer.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at SmartRoom Barcelona. The location is excellent with easy access to the airport and the city centre (Sants underground station is just a 5 min walk away). The neighbourhood is less touristy than the centre of Barcelona with many reasonably priced bars and eateries. The rooms are minimalist and new equipped with all the basics you need. Breakfast is great and the staff are all very friendly and accommodating. They also offer a free locker service when you check out
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel for tourists. Staying at the hotel isn’t what you want to do in Barcelona. It is modern, clean and Nordic design in a small space. Located near train and metro. We even walked to Camp Nou for a match. No hassle with sellers like you would get closer to tourist traps.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a three nights stay, the staff is very friendly, the room I stayed in was very clean . There are a few english tv news channels, but then I didn’t, go to Barca to watch TV . There is a bus stop right across the hotel entrance. A few minuters walk to get to some restaurants. A taxi to the AirPort costed ~25€. If you are a big fan of hotel breakfast, this one is limited, bit it got all I needed for a great start of the day. Overall I’m pleased with my stay !
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean and comfortable at a very reasonable price for such a central location. Would definitely recommend it for anyone on a short visit to Barcelona.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: SmartRoom is super clean, super user-friendly and a great place for people who want no-nonsense good quality hotels. The location is great - outside of the center (so not noisy), but within easy reach. The neighborhood itself is also lovely. There are some lovely restaurants (ask at the desk), in a residential neighborhood. It was also MUCH safer than anyplace I've staying in the city. Highly recommend this hotel! It's true that the shower stalls are small. But, honestly, the room wasn't small for a European city, especially in this price range. I had plenty of room to open my suitcase on the floor and still have room to sit at the desk and move around - and that's not always the case. :-)
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay in this hotel. Reception guys were very nice and gave me great recommendations on places to eat. Room is a little small, probably could get crowded with two people staying but everything worked great and it was very clean. Walls are a little thin but I imagine it is like that in most places. I opted for the breakfast on a couple of my mornings and it was good, probably not worth the price but nice to have if you want something before heading out.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a quick search we found this economical hotel, but I never expected it to be as amazing as it turned out to be. We were given a double room with a massive balcony overlooking a narrow street that gave us the feels, also from the balcony we could see many landmarks of Barcelona. The room was cosy and air con worked perfectly. There’s a safety deposit box but no fridge but to be honest that didn’t bother us. Our room was on 6th floor so try and get a room on higher floors for better views. The staff was helpful and receptionist was available 24*7.It’s very close to the metro and busses. This was especially helpful as we reached Barcelona middle of the night and still managed to find a night bus that took us 6 minutes walk away from the hotel. Smart room hotel is Centrally located with many cafes and restaurants within a minute’s walk and supermarkets as well.I definitely recommend this hotel. Though we didn’t try their breakfast but vending machine proved handy.Overall rating 10/10
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wanted a hotel near the Nou camp and this was ideal. 15-20 minute walk. A metro stop is also nearby. Really friendly welcome from receptionist who proper looked after us. Room was lovely - just like the picture - bright modern and clean. Would definitely stay again when returning to the city.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy walk to metro. As described on their website. Would be great if there was a mini fridge in the room but there’s not. They have luggage lockers but they can fill up so if you absolutely need one (or more) as we did, get to them early before checkout so you don’t miss out. Front desk staff helpful with directions.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience at this hotel, highly recommended! The room was clean and with a nice view. The staff has been always kind and welcoming. The location was great, at just 5 minutes walk from the nearest metro station.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. Close to Sants station. Continental breakfast was good enough value with everything you expect.. Quiet residential street but close enough to good selection of bars, cafes and restaurants. Perfectly safe to walk about at night even as a solo traveller.Room small ish but comfortable and clean. Shower room with toiletries and towels.No tea coffee making facilities .Considering Barcelona is a very expensive city to stay in the summer this hotel gave you everything you needed at a reasonable price.Would stay here again in the future.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shoebox size rooms, or at least mine was. There was actually a structural column in the middle of the room. The staff was courteous and helpful. There were two twin beds in my room and I thought the mattresses were pretty flimsy. Only 900 meters from the Barcelona Sants train station.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights, and we will definitely return if we are seeking accommodation in the area. It is about 8 minutes walk from Sants-Estació (railway station), and it is easy to take the metro to different parts of the city. Also, we found the taxis reasonably priced.On arriving, we received a warm welcome; and our room was immediately ready for us. As the hotel is modern, sound-proofing was very good. Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the hotel. Breakfast was OK, but the breakfast room is quite small, if you arrive at the same time as many others.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and had a very good experience. Front desk was very friendly and open 24 hours. Got there very early, well before check in and was in luck that a room was available and was able to check in immediately. The hotel is a 6 minute walk from the Placa de Sants metro station so you can be anywhere you want to go in central Barcelona in a short time. I liked that it was not on the main tourist zone so it was quieter and more of a local experience. The modern look rooms although on the small side were very comfortable, had enough space for me and my wife, and the wifi was very fast. Definitely pleased with everything this hotel has to offer and would stay here again if I can find a good rate like I did this time. Tip: book though their website and use a 10% off code they always have available.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at Smart Room for 1 week for my birthday and first trip to Barcelona and Spain. I originally felt very safe and happy with my choice though I will admit I was concerned with no safety box. My last day I had gone to check out and the front desk manager offers me a a great deal to stay in same room. I had planned one more day in Barcelona and was happy. I left the no service clearly marked * I have photos and evidence of everything> Came back to a made bed and my back pack clearly had been gone through. I had 420 US dollars + Ray Bans that were a gift for my birthday and a gift of a nice necklace for someone else. All 3 were inside a zipped pouch inside my toiletries bag inside my backpack. All of which was gone up my return. I immediately alerted the staff and was told to wait until morning. My fault for not immediately calling the police but I am a tourist I did not know procedure. The next day I was reassured by management the situation would be solved and solution I was happy with. I was forced to spend 3 hours on a Friday afternoon the day I was supposed to leave filing a police report. 11 days later the hotel emails me to say nothing will be done. I am currently filing a claim with Tourism office and pursuing Legal action. The hotel staff is conspiring with the house keeping letting them know detailed information of when guests leave and keeping them up to date if they come back. BE WARE this is a tourist trap hotel.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is spotlessly clean, with a nice breakfast selection of breads, juices, omlette and meats.The rooms are simple but comfortable. The sound insultation between the rooms is low quality but luckily I had quiet nieghbours.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose budget over location during our Barcelona stay, and while there are a few drawbacks with this hotel, we were glad with our decision. Very reasonably priced, SmartRoom Barcelona is located in a quiet residential area outside the main tourist zone. You'll definitely need a metro card if you stay here, or it will be a good 40 minute walk to La Rambla. The hotel is just a few minutes' walk from the Placa de Sants metro station (Olzinelles is the street with the Sants Beer restaurant on the corner). The service at the front desk was amazing. The clerk was friendly and immediately set us up with a map, and took his time to recommend transit options and places to go. There is a lounge with vending machines and charging stations, plus coin lockers for luggage if you arrive early or have a later flight. We also liked the secure and reliable WiFi. Our room was sparse, but impeccably clean, and came with a guide outlining the neighbourhood and businesses the guests would find reliable. But there were challenges. There was room in the closet for one suitcase, but no luggage rack for our second suitcase, which I like to keep up off the floor. While the bed linens were crisp, the bed itself was extremely uncomfortable. I don't mind a firm mattress, but this was like sleeping on concrete. My back problems were exacerbated by the bathroom, in which there was no shelf in the shower for my shampoo, soap or face wash. I had to keep the containers on the floor, and crouching down to get them was painful after peeling myself off that mattress. I wondered if anyone had actually tested these rooms and had identified this as a problem. A breakfast buffet was on offer at the hotel for €8, or €7 if you reserved the previous day. Being conscious of budget, we skipped the buffet, not even checking it out so I could report back for this review. There are numerous grocery stores and bakeries on the same street as the hotel, and we found a pizza place just off La Rambla that became a go-to for its huge, €2.50 slices. (Side note: It's called Pasta Madre, and I literally sniffed it out around the corner from Amorino's. Such good pizza and friendly service, and sooooo cheap.) Despite the lack of shelving in the shower and the hard-as-a-rock mattress, we still enjoyed our stay at SmartRoom Barcelona, finding it great value for the price.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When my girlfriend told me she'd booked a 2 star hotel for our Stay in Barcelona after our airbnb was cancelled at the last minute, I steeled myself for absolute mediocrity at best. What followed, however, could not be further from mediocre.Situated in the quiet sants neighbourhood, an easy walk from placa de sants metro, sants rail station and also the number 46 bus for the airport this hotel was the perfect base for our explorations.The room was clean and had everything we needed, there were handy lockers to leave our luggage when we arrived. We started each day with a delightful and filling buffet breakfast at €7 per person which represented great value!A special mention has to go to the receptionists (particularly the guy with the beard and glasses - sorry didn't catch our name!) who really went out of their way to ensure our stay was comfortable, giving assistance and recommendations!Top class 100% recommended!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During research for a trip to Barcelona, finding a decent hotel in an accessible location and at a good value price was proving fairly difficult. That was until we found SmartRoom. This is a great little hotel. The rooms are very clean, simple and functional. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The hotel is located a short walking distance to the Metro, perfect to hop onto to see all of the sights in Barcelona. We had the buffet continental style breakfast every morning, which proved very filling. It was well priced and good quality food. If we were nitpicking about our stay, we would say that the pillows could've be a bit more substantial to improve comfort, but this did not impact the overall stay. In summary, we would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Barcelona.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything matchs the descriptions of the hôtel. The rooms are smalls but have everything needed. Great location in a local not too touristic place of town but close from à métro station. Hôtel is very clean and the staff is very very help full. For the price, i think you will have a hard time finding better. Dont expect à gym or à pool, just à small clean room and go out exploring.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent, attentive front desk staff. Ample breakfast that can be added on if you forgot to pay for it when you booked the reservation. Walkable from Sants rail station and metro. Even though this appears to be a small side street, enough cabs pass by that it isn't absolutely necessary to telephone for one. Would be happy to stay again when in Barcelona.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights and couldn't speak more highly of Smartroom Barcelona.It's very easy to get to from the airport. We took the Renfe train to Sants Estacio and then walked (it was a slow 15-20 minute walk). As you leave the station, through the main doors, walk straight down the road. You will come to a big junction and will see Sants Beer (which, incidentally, is a lovely tapas bar!) on the opposite side of the street. Cross over here and continue straight down this road; the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from here. The train journey is €4.10 and is not included in your T10 card. Cabs were around €30.We stayed on the sixth floor and our room had a small terrace, which was perfect to chill out on after a long day in the city! It was a little bit more but definitely worth paying the extra, in our opinion!Upon arrival, we were greeted by super friendly staff who gave us advice and recommendations to help us make the most of the city. Every single member of staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spotlessly and remained so throughout our stay as the rooms are cleaned daily; towels are replaced and bedsheets are made. The wifi worked pretty well and the vending machines are reasonably priced.We didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that! However, there was a lovely cafe about 5 minutes from the hotel called Panet, which sells beautifully pastries and baguettes. The supermarket across the road, Dia%, is very reasonably priced and the cheapest we found for water and beer.The metro line is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel; it's very easy to get into central Barcelona and it was lovely to leave the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas behind each evening! We would highly recommend staying here- it's a 2 star hotel so there aren't any 'frills' but the cleanliness, location and friendliness of staff more than make up for it!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am baffled at the 5 star reviews of this hotel. I only stayed here one night because my Airbnb place was not ready until the next day. I was shocked when I opened the door and saw a room that only fitted the bed, I felt like I was in a cage, window opened to the wall on the other side, there was nothing in the room, they take minimalistic to a whole other level. I was thrilled to leave the next morning, I think I would cry if I had to spend my whole Barcelona stay in that cage of a room.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Smartroom last night.Good location especially for an overnight before traveling from Barcelona Sant early departure.Clean and neat as a pin no doubt.BUT- Paper thin walls so you hear every movement from rooms either side and above. Light sleepers beware. Also if you are larger than a thin short model - you will battle to fit in the shower cubicle let alone wash yourself. The smallest shower I have ever had the misfortune of using.Something needs to be done urgently to address these two issues or there will be no returning guests.The staff are great and very helpful
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you are in Barcelona for 5 or more days and you need a decent place which doesn't break the bank.... Smart Barcelona is your MUST choice! Staff is super friendly, beds are very clean and comfortable, everything is new and tidy! Breakfast is a must, really all you can ask for a 7 eu bfast. Really great place, glad we found it!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super location not touristy which we love yet central. Very clean...cool...comfy...perfect...love it here and staff so helpful! Good bars nearby...easy for station and we took the tourist bus today which is a top tip. Ideal Base for a few days and excellent value!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely clean and white hotel, nothing to complain about at all. Room was spotless, sheets and towels changed every night. Perfect location on a quiet side road with little cafes and shops but in a ideal location with just a short 5 minute walk to the main streets of Barcelona.Reception staff were more than helpful on arrival and departure, asked to book us a taxi for our early trip to the airport home and that was no issue. Overall lovely stay!!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the hotel very easily, we had got the train from the airport which was just over €4 each! We walked down to the hotel which wasn't too far! When we arrived we were too early and our room wasn't ready. Staff were very friendly and explained all our booking too us and that if we cone back in an hour. He showed us the lockers that that have for €1 which fit a large suitcase in! Really handy as we then had the afternoon to explore. When we returned back to the hotel, check in was easily and we found our room. We were on the top floor as we had booked a terrace room. There was a lift for the convenience. The view was amazing.Rooms were clean, beds were comfy and everything you need for exploring Barcelona! Staff were all friendly and said 'hola' when walking past the desk. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we went to some patisseries down the street.Overall a lovely stay and would happily stay here again!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here recently for four nights here is my pros and cons of my stay.Pros:- extremely clean, the hotel is in impeccable condition, couldn't fault the hotel at all for the cleanliness - minimalistic but perfect, had everything you need for a wonderful short stay (no fridge for those who require, but we didn't need it)- some staff extremely helpful, wish I had known the names of the ones that went above and beyond, one staff member wasn't very helpful but the rest were great!- rooms bright and modern - close to local amenities including pharmacy, restaurants, metro stationCons-- extremely bad wifi, kept dropping out and not working, had to speak with staff and the situation was still not rectified. Needed it urgently and had to go to the lobby to make work calls which I couldn't do in quiets - breakfast was average payed 8 euro and we ate late in the morning, many dishes not replenished.- paper thin walls, had some very noisy neighbours and could hear everything going on in their room.... I mean everything - a little bit out the way but the price was excellent!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as a couple for 3 nights in June. Hotel is lovely and clean and very modern. All staff that we spoke to was helpful and friendly and had perfect English and answer any questions put to them. The room had adequate space for a few nights although the bathroom is small and the shower is tiny and I'm 5 foot 1! The hotel is in a residential area but there are loads of cafes supermarkets etc nearby but we did struggle to find somewhere on an evening that catered for English. I would recommend getting a taxi from airport costs €26 as the hotel is quite difficult to find.Nou camp is about a 25 min walk away. We also travelled into the main part of Barcelona via underground and this was quite easy to use. All in all a good stay
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Independent 60+travellers, using trains to commute Spain, Smartroom Barcelona was chosen for its location to Metro & Sants Barcelona for intercity travel, 10 minutes walk, & for its location out of the tourist zone. We found the room exactly as detailed online, breakfast was excellent, staff were friendly & very helpful. Wifi was amazing, bed super comfy, room very clean & quiet & shower hot every time. Plenty of bars & food of every choice near by. We sourced some delicious eateries walking distance & with typical Spanish cuisine. Metro is easy to master & the 10 ticket card worked well for our 5day stay. Taxi from airport cost 26€ & right to the hotel door. We would recommend & have already stayed again returning from Sans Sebastián.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything is new and modern, the rooms are quite small, but clean and comfortable. Good price so I'd recommend it. And it's close to the train station and a bunch of great breakfast cafes. The staff was not very friendly, so we felt like an inconvenience to the receptionist. But other than that we were quite happy with our stay.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from our first visit , very nice hotel basic but nice . All the staff were friendly and happy to help with a smile . The rooms were very clean and tidy with a good shower with plenty of hot water . Only a short walk to the place de sants metro line where you can then find your way to the hustle & bustle with ease .. lots of cafe , bars and restaurants close by . Would stay again ..Many thanks to the staff
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is about a ten minute walk from the Metro Line 1, Placa de Sants. The walk is up a hill, then down a hill. It has a self-service laundry within a block, as well as a pharmacy and several grocery stores and bakeries. The hotel was not close to the attractions but not difficult to get to them if your goal is to save some money on your room.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights in a budget room, this was immaculate. Checking in was really simple, nice receptionist. Overall the room was basic, no view from the room which wasnt a problem as it was only a place to sleep, could imagine it to be really stuffy in the summer months tho.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we needed a hotel nearby the train station , it was perfect ! although the hotel was located in an old area, a little creepy but easy to find. The room was clean and comfortable . The only negative comment is that we couldn't get any ice and there was only a small machine for snacks.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has everything you need and provides a comfortable retreat after a busy day of exploring the city. The room was fairly quiet (though one night the gentleman next door could be heard snoring!) and was always clean and tidy. One reviewer mentions their annoyance about the towels not being cleaned but as is clearly noted in the bathroom, towels are only replaced when left on the floor in order to conserve water! The area is slightly out of the centre but this is not necessarily a bad thing as it's a nice neighbourhood (mostly full of retired locals it seems) and you can be in the centre of the city within 20 mins if you take the (very reasonably priced) metro from Plaça de Sants. After reading that some rooms looked out onto another building, we requested a room with a view and the hotel obliged (admittedly this may have been down to chance) and we enjoyed a pleasant view from the third floor over the neighbouring rooftops. There is a TV in the room (brush up on your language skills by watching the Simpsons with Catalan subtitles ;)) and some hanging room for your clothes. Breakfast is pretty decent, though at €7 each, you might be better off just picking up a pastry down the road and some fruit juice from Dia (the local supermarket) I would say this hotel is more 3 star than 2 star (no bottles of toiletries but there is a hairdryer and a soap dispenser in the shower) and the only thing missing is a mini fridge in your room to store your drinks (though you can just buy a cold bottle of water from reception for 80 cents. Would definitely recommend. Thank you SmartRooms!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel in late March for 3 nights.It is ideal for city break, 5mins walk to the metro (Placa de Sants) which takes 7mins to get to Catalunya station which is the main station for the La Rambla. There are some lovely places locally for breakfast which are really cheap. Their locally recommended restaurants list is a winner - especially Sants Beer which is a great little tapas place. The room's are clean, showers are great, its in a quiet area, staff are great, speak good English. The rooms were clean, tidy and modern. Basic but exactly what's needed for a city break. No kettle but the coffee machine downstairs is 1 Euro. Easy to get to and from the airport and the middle of the city. Not far from the Nou Camp either.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Smart Room Barcelona for 3 nights and was looking for a hotel for a good price not so far from the main railway station Barcelona Sants. I had no complaints. I booked a budget twin room for myself, so it was big enough. 1-bed rooms in Barcelona can be pretty small, but this was big enough for 2 persons (2 seperate beds).Everything is clean, no weird smells, free fast WIFI (browsing Facebook or instagram with video's was no problem) and a 24-hour reception (no stress if your flight is late).In 10-15 minutes you can walk to the central station where you have metro and trains, so you can easily travel around Barcelona and to the airport.Just a few remarks. I had a room with a window on the 4th floor facing a small courtyard (so actually just some walls). So not much direct light/sun in your room. But that was OK because I was only there for sleeping. I slept well in general, except a few loud neighbours (but that's something you have in every hotel i guess). The first night was quite hot, so I couldn't sleep that well. It was only march, but still 20+ degrees and was not sure if the airco was working or not. But overall I slept good.If I go back, i'll book again here.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited here in February 2017 for 3 nights. The hotel is modern, clean and quiet. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable. I'd contacted the hotel a couple of days before we arrived and requested a kettle in the room, which they had put to one side for us on our arrival. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we preferred to eat out at he gorgeous cafes near by.The hotel is well located, a 5 minute walk to the metro and there are taxis passing by all the time.. the metro is then 10/15 minutes to the historical area away. Hotel is about 20 minutes away from the airport but we had no traffic at all.The staff were brilliantly helpful and friendly! Really pleased we stayed here :) will be back at some point!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Realy nice and clean..staff very polite and ready to serve n any help....very spcius room and confortable bed....location very close to metro station..bars..restaurants...and popular market with fresh meals...shops around ...and sun...enjoy Barcelona..
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose to stay outside of the city center of Barcelona to get a better feel for the city, its expanse and neighbourhoods. This hotel is a little gem....although it was basic, it was clean and comfortable and very close to many amenities and public transportation. We plan on staying here again on our next visit.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room, clean. As they say on their website, only the necessary is provided. We were provided a bed, two bedside tables and towels. Not complaining, this really is all you need!! Good breakfast, fresh baguettes, croissants, spanish omelette etc. Location was okay, would like to be slightly more central although very close to a metro station. TV in the room.Room was way too hot, centrally heated. Told reception and he said we could only open the windows to cool it down because if he turned the heating off, others guests would complain. Seems like something to fix.Good wifi
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little budget hotel, a bit further out but great transport links. The rooms are small but clean and simple. The staff were lovely and helpful. We did have an issue with the heating as a night it got quite cold and we couldn't work out how to work the heating panel as the rooms don't have remote controls for the air-con. When we asked downstairs we were initially told it was all centrally controlled at the same same temp for all rooms but the following day as another guest was asking about the same we were told you could open the panel door and adjust the temp accordingly! I would recommend checking your invoice properly when checking out as with us they made a few mistakes but I emailed them after and I was swiftly refunded.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel located in the Sants section of Barcelona is a budget hotel. It's rooms are sparsely appointed, but that is exactly what you expect from a budget hotel. Everything was clean, comfortable, and functional. It is a short walk from the subway metro line and also to the train station to the airport. The metro is a simple, efficient, and economical way to travel around the city of Barcelona. So with a short walk you are connected to the whole of the city. The hotel is located on a quite street, so noise was not a problem. The SmartRoom hotel offers a continental style breakfast for 7 Euro. Wi-fi internet is included in your stay. Check in and out are easy. The hotel staff was very helpful in suggesting places to go, which subway lines to use, and restaurants to try. They also allowed me to check in early as my flight arrived much earlier than normal check-in. If you are looking for a simple, economical, place to stay with a great location, then I would definitely recommend the SmartRoom Hotel.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a new hotel, really clean and surprisingly comfortable. The best thing is the location as it's close to Barcelona Sants railway station (just a 10 minute walk) and also walking distance to the metro so it’s easy to get around the city. The staff at reception were very helpful. Good value for money and there are many shops & restaurants in the area so you can find somewhere to eat quite easily.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights and we really enjoyed! The hotel is new the room wasn't very big but cosy and clean! Very friendly receptionist didn't get his name ( i think he usually has the morning shift)! Is fifteen minutes walk to Sants and another ten to Placa Espanya!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bedroom is small but cosy. The toilet and shower was very clean. I wish there was some electric kettle and tea inside the room. Downside is the breakfast! So mediocre. There wasnt even a toaster to warm up the bread. Not much choices. The cups and glasses were so tiny that U need atleast 4 of them to finish your breakfast. But despite that I love this hotel. Only a few mins walk to the sants metro and infront of it is a grocery store. Will recommend this if youre not looking for that fancy hotel.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not a luxury hotel but it is new, clean, comfortable and quite close to the Barcelona Sants railway station which suited us on our last night in Spain. The staff at reception were very helpful. The rate was reasonable and there are many shops & restaurants in the area. Beds seem to be mostly singles with two pushed together for a double. From memory our room had 4 single beds in it. A map on the website showing where it is in relation to the station would have helped. Would use again!
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel near the metro station in the quiet neighborhood of Barcelona with a very good selection of breakfast.only complaint are very small rooms, the picture looked much bigger and more spacious. staff is very pleasant and discreet
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not a luxury hotel but it was clean, comfortable and quite close to the station which suited us very well. The staff at reception was extremely welcoming and helpful. He gave us the names of a couple of good restaurants for dinner, directions to Las Ramblas and he spoke perfect English. The rate was very reasonable and it included breakfast which was great as we didn't know what time our next meal would be. We were going on a cruise from the port and it was not too far so the taxi fare to the port was reasonable. There was lots of shops & restaurants in the area, all in all I thought it good value.
hotelName:
17    SmartRoom Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got there late and was greeted by friendly staff. The hotel is very loud and we stayed over the weekend so we woke up every time someone got home, drunk and loud, after a night out. In our room the drain in both the sink and bath was clogged up and the staff did not seem to care. The pool on the roof is smaller than a bath tub. The gym has a bike, a treadmill, a eliptical trainer and one multipurpose machine. In general do expect **** star facilities.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Though the hotel itself was aesthetically pleasing there were numerous issues that made the stay intolerable. WIFI is pathetic and will not work throughout your room and the staff says they will work on it but it is still useless. Terrace can only be used by bar patrons, which is ridiculous given that once the bar closes the terrace closes. The bathroom was rather dirty and the towel appeared to be covered in blood when used.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a nice quiet area. It has restaurants and cafes on the door steps. Only 10 minutes walk to the metro station. Staff were brilliant. Only disadvantage was the sofa bed. You could feel the spring while you sleep. It was uncomfortable. The staff did try to sort it out. They did their best.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited this hotel for a long weekend city break with my partner and was met with excellent customer service and such a lovely atmosphere within the hotel (for such a reasonable price too!). It is excellently situated close to a few shops and restuarants, whilst also being a short walk to a metro stop. Would definitely recommend to anybody looking for a centrally located hotel, with helpful, friendly staff and a very clean, modern hotel!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely clean hotel in a great location to the center of town! Nice modern hotel with nice rooftop terrace for an evening drink . Pool small but available. Street noise an issue if on street side , and mornings little loud with cleaning trolleys and cleaners outside the doors .Otherwise great 2 night stay in lovely room with great selection of pillows ! Would visit again!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this cute hotel in Barcelona. The room was clean and comfortable. I really liked the bathroom! The staff at the consierge desk downstairs was very helpful and friendly. We tried going to the rooftop bar, but it was closed for a private event. Overall, nice hotel and stay.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Asked for Ice was told to go 4 blocks to purchase some.Nice room, View from room was a air shaft. Construction on outside of building we were not notified of this prior to arrival. Asked for restaurant recommendations we were sent on a wild goose chase.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel easy to find room, has a gym and terraced pool and bar/ seating area. very quite, and great room service. the onsite food we had ordered late at night wasn't the best food, felt medicore and pricey.. but great for conveince.The receptionist were friendly and helpful, they explain all clearly and proffessionally, the cleaniness of the hotel outside of the room and inside is a proffesional job ! our room was just how the picture's show. TV and facilities where great also. they even had a mini fridge in there which was usefull. plenty of lighting. it was a shame the building is currently going under works and the aircon wasn't great it was pointless putting on to be honest, so we had the windows open but the scaffolding was right there on our view and workers working passed.. this wasn't great experiance for us as we had windows open but curtains shut ? however if i were to revisit I CERTAINLY WOULD !!! i think it's a good hotel, and I have visited higher rated hotels and i think this tops it. very stylish modern and centric. love it thank you for having us.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed for 3 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were so impressed with the hotel, so stylish, great sized room, clean, attentive staff and in a great location. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently spent 4 nights in this splendid hotel on Avenida di Roma.I had a split stay, with 3 nights and then returned for the last night of my trip to Catalunya.The hotel is beautifully furnished with an art theme throughout.The room was sufficiently spacious with all amenities that you would expect. One small criticism with my original stay was that the bath tub was pretty narrow for a larger person like me and i had to ring down for a bath plug, which was surely avoidable?.....but this is a minor quibble....The hotel is very well situated....approx 15 min walk to the Plaza de la Catalunya and equal approximate distance to Plaza d'Espanya...Be wary of Taxis.......i got an official taxi to take me to Sants Station because it was raining and i got charged €10.40 for the 1.1km......outrageous.....On my return to Sercotel art hotel, the staff, who were excellent for both stays, very kindly upgraded me to a larger room at no extra expense, which was very appreciated.......(this room definitely had a bigger bath tub by the way)I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Barcelona and i would fully anticipate staying here again.Bravo!!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful! It is very inviting and clean. The decor is lovely, and the fruit water in the lobby is a very nice touch...a welcome treat after walking the city streets all day. The desk clerks went above and beyond to help us with directions and tips for travel in the city. We enjoyed our stay very much!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice and clean, but the view was of a shaft. The beds were very comfortable, the wifi acceptable, but the restaurants were empty. Bicycle and e-scooter rental was a bit pricey. Reception staff was nice.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall it was a great experience. Was greated by friendly staff ( Jordi ) and explanied everything with detail. Throught out the stay Gabriel was very helpful at the front desk, gave us great locations to try out for food, coffee and desserts. We were walking distances from a lot of restaurants and shops. Not to far also from plaza cataluyna. Overal it was a great hotel, great staff, clean. Pool was small but its not what we came for, and it was to cold for that any ways. We are planing to trip again and we are for sure staying here again.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a great break in Barcelona staying at this hotel. We had the only room with a balcony (207) which was large enough for our family of four. The hotel is about 15-20 minute walk from the Plaça Cataluna and even my 9 year old managed it several times a day so we didn’t use the metro or get a cab once. The hotel is clean and smells beautiful! The breakfast was lovely with plenty to choose from; my daughters were especially impressed with churros for breakfast every day! Dinner recommendation: Vigo is a lovely restaurant, ten mins from the hotel with beautiful paella, sangria and tapas.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It definitely suited us as a group of four friends. The size of the rooms was good with very comfy single beds in twin rooms. The terrace was lovely but the pool is too tiny, I would not really call it a pool. The A/C was quite noise in one room but at least it drowned out the noise from the street. Check in easy, check out easy, ok breakfast.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was great. Gabriel at the front desk was fantastic. Gave us great directions to get to the metro and since our room was not quite ready (we were early) he made sure our bags were taken care of. Would recommend staying at the Sercotel Amister Art Hotel.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a weekend. The hotel is clean and centrally located which is great to get about. However, there's one big downside: the way the hotel is laid out means noise from the lobby echoes through the bedrooms. You can literally hear a pin drop. This amplified noise will keep you awake. The staff getting the breakfast ready is incredibly noisy.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a solo traveler or a family with slightly older children or those who can't walk. The younger, faster, more curious, and agile "stick your head and body through openings" kind of toddler would make me very nervous at this location. In full disclosure, it is a 20-25 minute walk from the city center and Las Ramblas. It is a great walk with so many different routes lined with diverse bars, restaurants, and cafes. The hotel does have bicycles and stand up scooters available (sorry I don't know if there is a fee) for use. Pros: daily breakfast buffet was pretty good (champagne, fresh juices, water, teas, coffee, latte, espresso, scrambled eggs, potato, cold current, cheeses, breads, pastries, fruit, cereals). Plenty local of bars, restaurants, supermarkets, pizza shops right outside. The hotel room was a decent size that was clean. Front desk team is extremely helpful with planning your day. Plenty of taxis right outside and right on a bus route.Cons: it is not centrally located in the tourist hotspots (which I loved). If a central location is important to you, this might be an issue. The pool :( on the rooftop is a little bigger than a large jacuzzi. You will not be doing any laps. The center of the hotel is a nicely decorated open space from floor 0 to the rooftop that I can see a busy toddler getting into some trouble. There are very secure and clean gates, but we know toddlers.Overall, I liked the hotel and I would stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Amister Art is 10mins walk from the metro and maybe 30mins walk from main attractions.The staff are incredibly helpful and know a lot about the area and transport services. Special shout out to Jordy B who is a total legend and helped us a lot when we were late to check-in due to a cancelled flight.The room had a great view and some English language channels. The bed is super comfortable, bathroom very clean with complimentary shampoo etc and a bidday. There is a mini bar and safe too in the cupboard.The pool isn’t very big, you could chill in it but you couldn’t do laps. Lovely view up on the roof though and there is a terrace bar up there!The breakfast buffet was beautiful and the room service meals were delicious and reasonably priced. No restaurant in-house for dinner but the staff have good recommendations for places to go nearby.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was slightly small, but very clean. The lobby, and other open spaces, had cool art by Spanish artists...very very nice! Small gym was perfect because no one else used it. The hotel location is the only true drawback...you should expect to use taxis, or walk A LOT. I love to walk, but it’s was a bit too much for me. {The LIDL supermarket nearby was convenient. } The hotel really should use sound-dampening material on the rooms’ door frames - accidental slamming of doors by any guests means EVERYONE hears it— it’s because of the center-elevator configuration. Roof deck was cool. Nice place to chill {after those long walks}.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, close to everything! Service was wonderful from the front desk folks (Cristian, Laura, & Hasan) to our fravorite Chef/waiter/bartender (Yam), his Sangrias and Mojitos are a most! The housekeeper crew was also fantastic. One critic is that the shower glass needs to be longer to prevent the water from getting all over the floor. Also, the bathtub was very slippery. We will come back again. Thanks for everyone’s effort!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Amister for a short but jam packed trip to Barcelona. The hotel is easy to reach by Aerobus and metro. The hotel is attractive with interesting contemporary art featured on all floors. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully contemporary. The deck staff was very helpful. For a quiet stay request a room facing the atrium. The streets can be a bit loud late into the night. Everything is up to date and comfortable about this place.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I have just returned from a 2 night break at this very modern hotel. Although just within walking distance to the city centre it was just a little too far out. Our room was exceptionally clean but very very warm - the air con didn’t work.On arrival we were told that the Terrace Bar would be closed as this was low season - we were disappointed as the only other place to get a drink or something to eat was the main restaurant. After a long day shopping and sightseeing we were surprised to see a hanging poster saying that the Terrace Bar would open at 7.30pm - it didn’t. We waited in the restaurant for 10 minutes but didn’t see a soul. We ventured to another restaurant which was close to the hotel but didn’t feel comfortable walking around at night in this part of Barcelona.On our return we found the light in the lift was still broken even though we had reported it to the receptionist so had to get to the 7th floor in total darkness.The following morning, as we were leaving, the lift light still did not work and again, we reported it to the receptionist.The receptionist very kindly ordered us a taxi to the airport. However this cost us €50 - twice as much as when we arrived.Disappointed is an understatement!!!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Could not praise highly enough clean tidy could not be more helpful even made us a picnic when checking out at 5 am the company picking us up for airport transfer got times wrong reception at hotel spent half hour on phone and sorted it out brilliant
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was quiet, within a 25 minute walk to La Rambla, close to small shops and restaurants and clean. The selling feature for us was the exceptional service that we received from the concierge Tamara as we encountered a serious problem that required medical attention and she was efficient, pleasant and was instrumental in setting up the appointment for us. Had it not been for her help, we would have missed our cruise. The breakfast was expensive and not worth the money as it was an embellished continental breakfast so I would look for a restaurant in the vicinity instead.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a great choice for those who want to stay in a calm area or go to the small shop without any queues in Barcelona and the same time not to be too far from the city center. I really loved the hotel. It’s very cozy, has unique style and modern design. Our room was really comfortable. It had a spacious bathroom and good amenities. The only bad thing was the window in the room, which was opening to the inner part of the hotel. So no view, no sun :) The bed was very comfy. Loved it! And of course, what’s the most important. It’s very very clean hotel. Reception staff was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately I can’t remember the names of all receptionists, so I’ll mention only Giorgio’s name. Wanna thank all of them though for great reception, easy checkin and checkout, professional and pleasant attitude. Room service and the restaurant on the rooftop has some special operating hours, so check in the reception not to be hungry at night. The only reason I’m giving 4 stars out of 5, is the location. For someone, who wants to explore the central area of Barcelona, this hotel is a bit far from the crowd. It can be positive thing for some and negative for the others. This’s only my opinion after all. You need to walk 8-12 minutes to The closest metro station: Urgell, Rocafort or Hospital Clinic. All 3 are more or less the same distance. The main station: Sants Estacio is 15 minutes away. Also walkable if you have time. So, overall I can advise this hotel to anyone who wants to have a good time in a quiet area, clean, comfortable hotel but a bit far from crazy parts of Barcelona.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Great friendly customer service. Clean room and knowledgeable staff of tourists areas to visit while on vacation. Our bedding was very comfortable and clean also loved the amenities. Although we didn’t partake of the breakfast we could see it looked delicious and plentiful. The view from our hotel window was awesome. Great to see locals walking around doing their business without being afraid of being approached by anyone to harm them. Felt very safe walking with my son at anytime of day or night.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service, great breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. Loved the stay. No complaints. And hotel close to all attractions in Barcelona - buses such as 59 are very good from hotel to main attractions.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The check-in process was smooth with informational and friendly staff. The room was clean and beds comfortable. The street noise was elevated but we used a fan app on my phone to help drown it out. My only negative was one evening when my cousin and I took a sparkling water and a soda to the rooftop pool area, an employee asked us to leave. I feel that she should have said "May I get you something to drink? Unfortunately outside drinks are not allowed." Instead of "You can't drink that here. Only still water." She was abrupt with us and when a person is paying to stay at the hotel, I would expect to feel welcomed instead of run off from a lovely area. Besides that.....why would there be a difference between enjoying still water or sparkling? There are ways to enforce rules that don't make guests feel like outsiders....
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here at the recommendation of my cousin who lives in Spain. It is a great little hotel that is just right for 2-3 night stays. It is a no frills hotel with the necessary basic amenities to get you through your stay. If you plan on being out for most of the day and simply want a clean, quiet and good nights rest then this is a great value hotel! The double bed was huge and comfy so we slept well after a full day of sight seeing. The only downside is the location is a little further away from the main areas. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sercotel hotels generally have the reputation of quality and a high level of service. Not this one, however. The staff was completely aloof to all of our requests. The women requested a hair dryer that worked. Not provided. Our tub backed up during our shower over our ankles. When I told the front desk, without looking up, the clerk said there was a lot a rain recently and all of the drains were backing up. This was a total lie because our traveling companion staying in the room next door had no such problem. The staff did not offer us another room. The nine Euro box lunch was a joke and the breakfast bar had rotten fruit in the fruit bowl. To top it off, even though they advertise being close to the Metro, this is not true. We lugged our bags for blocks to reach this place after our flight arrived from Iceland. To top it off, we requested the front desk clerk to call a cab for us. This request was ignored and we ended up going out to the street and hailing one ourselves. For the price, avoid this place and stay somewhere else.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for the rooftop terrace and the little pool was an added bonus. Although not in the centre exactly we still found it easy to get around and enjoyed the walking. A taxi into the centre was only a few euros.The rooms where spacious and the beds and pillows very comfortable. They where cleaned daily and fresh towels provided.Staff where very friendly and helpful with booking trips etc.We had a late flight and they allowed us to store our bags and wait on the roof enjoying a last drink before we got picked up. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Room AC wasnt working ! And i spent the night with an extra fan from the hotel since there is no other rooms ! In the morning i wanted to make coffee and i saw red lipstick on the hotel cups where they weren’t clean well !!! Horrible night and morning!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was great and the location was perfect in order to see various sites of the city. It was very clean and with qualitative breakfast. You need a 10 minutes walk to the nearest subway station so near it in mind in case you carry luggage. The personnel did not seem very friendly, but when we asked for something they were there to support us.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location - about a ten min walk to Barcelona Sants station, ten min walk to the nearest Aerobus bus stop, 25 min walk to Plaza Catalunya.Rooms - very comfortable and nicely decorated, and more spacious than the average BCN hotel rooms. There was plenty of hot water, and the AC and WiFi worked well. The only reason I did not give this hotel five star was because a couple of the fixtures in my room needed some work (one of the electric sockets was not firmly screwed in, for example). The staff - very friendly. I arrived at noon , and the check in staff allowed me to have my room right at that time, which was much appreciated. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked this hotel. It's right on the edge of Eixample in a nice residential area. Clean room, large bathroom. Reception staff were very helpful and pleasant. Didn't eat breakfast so can't comment on that. I would recommend.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would say okay but I would not return. Arrived at the hotel just before 11am, told rooms not ready we would need to wait until 2pm. I would understand but was not advised of check in time/not helped with anywhere nice to go. Bed situation was bad being two single beds pushed together, which kept on splitting, this should not be advertised as a double. The room needed repairing as chips in walls,door frames badly damaged. Weather was 30 plus degrees and aircon barely worked. The "pool" if you can call it that was the size of 2/3 argos paddling pools which was photographed at an angle to make it look full size. This was disappointing as a pool was a factor in choosing the hotel. Their was no iron in the room, i had to ring to get a one, which was a cheap iron with no cover so the water would go everywhere. Tv barely worked so had to stream off phone. The room was clean though. To conclude the price paid does not match the standard of the hotel and 100% not 4star standard more of a low 3 star. Staff nice enough ajd clean but if on a couples trip, look to stay elsewhere.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotell is fairly centra, the rooms are ok sized, the staff was friendly. Just make sure you dont eat at the hotel restaurant, that was just a waste of money. The Iberico Sausage for 9,50,- euros was just a tiny sausage in a dry bread, with almost no garnish. The pasta was ok, the pizza was a frozen pizza. But since this is a review of the hotel not the restaurant its still 4 stars.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at the Amister Hotel before and there seems to have been a change of management since. The hotel was very short staffed - one example - no tea bags were replaced but the receptionist could not leave his desk as there was no one about. We had to collect them ourselves. The staff were all new and had been asked to deliver the same spiel whether it be true or not. On one evening we went to the Roof top bar only to find there was no one there to serve the drinks!Most of the staff felt uptight and had no idea how to deal with any problems. All in all not impressed.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with family for 3 nights. Hotel is clean, service is friendly - though a bit clueless at times, and the breakfast buffet is good. Wifi is quite good. Rooms are a decent size with a large bathroom. However the rooms lack seating space, except for an armchair, and are a bit bare - you'd expect a 4 star hotel to be better furnished. We had issues with the TV and the kettle, and the front desk, though helpful, wasn't exactly efficient in addressing our problems.The hotel location is convenient, but not excellent. If you are averse to walking for 15-20 minutes to reach a bus stop, especially if you have small children or elderly people with you, then you probably would want to look for some other hotel. If you don't mind a short walk, then this hotel offers excellent value. Taxis are easily available, and the average fare to Placa Catalunya/Ramblas was 10 Euro.There are quite a few reasonably priced cafes and restaurants close by, and we liked exploring the area around the hotel. Overall, this hotel is good value for money.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here in Barcelona for 4-days/3-nights coming off our cruise; from check-in to check-out and everything in between - nothing but pleasant, professional, helpful staff (Giorgio and Christine were awesome) and extremely comfortable and clean facilities. Larger than normal rooms and bathrooms, free breakfast buffet with lots of variety, fitness center, located near metro or walking distance of several great restaurants and sights to see in Barcelona (we love to walk so we took advantage of this location to hit Gaudi's Sagrata Familia, Casa Batllo, and the las Ramblas promonade). If you are not a walker, plenty of taxis in area to hail and utilize. Rooftop terrace, bar and plunge pool very refreshing after a full day of walking or touring the city. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues whether traveling to Barcelona on business or pleasure.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Sercotel Amister Art Hotel for six nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is well placed, about seven minutes walk from Ugell, Rocafort and Entenca metro stations. The hotel itself is clean with huge beds, friendly staff and a nice feel about it. We enjoyed the roof terrace and plunge pool - a welcome relief in the hot sun and after much walking around the city. We complained on one occasion when some urban rap music with many offensive swear words was being played on loop on the terrace, a really odd choice and definitely not family friendly, but the manager responded personally and it never happened again so we felt much more comfortable after that. All in all we would definitely return, thanks to all the team.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very nice room with a huge bath. Buffet breakfast offered a wide variety -- eggs, meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, cereals, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nice artsy decor throughout the hotel, with an interesting rather circular layout. Our room window provided light but no view. The rooftop terrace is very nice, however the weather was too cool for us to enjoy it. This hotel is not very close in to some of the Barcelona attractions, but there are several metro stations within walking distance, so we were easily able to get to the areas we wanted to visit (we've been to Barcelona several times). We also easily walked to the Barcelona Sants train station for a day trip to Girona. We took a taxi to the port to board our cruise ship for about 17 euros.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
