Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights at the start of May. Good location, a short walk from Santa train station. Hotel was great. Room was on the 5th floor and very quiet. We didn’t use the Restaurant in the hotel so cannot comment vn the food. Hotel is about 25 minutes walk from la Rambla and the main tourist area - really enjoyed the location as we were able to visit some great cafes, bars and restaurants in this part of town which were full of local people which gave us a really different experience from our previous visits to the city.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel was not in the heart of a busy tourist area so it was nice to enjoy. Some good walking to main attractions, but also more hole in the wall restaurants nearby to walk to at night. Room size was great. The bathroom was huge, and the room was spacious. Bed was comfortable and lobby was very nice and clean. Internet was good and speedy as well. Did not use it, but there is a pool, albeit small on the roof.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice Small friendly hotel situated about 20 mins walk from Las Ramblas,Good size rooms especially for families , clean and tidied each day.Metro service just around the corner at Hospital Clinic about 8-10 mins walk and a very good area for decent food, quality restaurants including Don Tomato, La Capriccusio and the magificient Paco Meralgo all within 10-20mins Walk, no need for the taxi.Hotel pool is very small and more like the size of a jaccuzzi but as a base and if you are eating out in the evenings then this hotel is good very for money.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel as the photos and reviews looked very impressive, here are a few things you should be aware of. I’d say that in comparison to other hotels I’ve stayed in , this one is over priced for the amenity’s, the staff were fairly helpful but when we spoke to the director he was pretty rude when we complained about the lack of air con. I mean what woman would want to get changed/ sleep with a window open when you have a main road and a construction site opposite? Have a look at other hotels in the area, you’ll get more value for money. Building site - There is the construction of a new block of flats/ hotel right next to this hotel looking now at other reviews it’s been going on for at least a year and isn’t showing signs of stopping! The photos don't really include this, so be prepared for construction noise from early morning to early evening. For anyone staying in the rooms next to the main road it’s pretty loud, also this is very loud whilst on the rooftop bar so makes for a less than relaxing experience. Bedrooms- We booked a room to sleep three, the room itself was nice enough and the bathroom was spacious, however all they’d done was add a cot bed into the space where the bedside table had been which was disappointing as I’d have expected three actual beds. This room is comfortable for two people but it’s a push to accommodate three and becomes very cramped. The bathroom is always very warm also as there isn’t any real air conditioning in it and what air-conditioning IS available in the rooms is at the mercy of the hotel director. This means that if they decide to, it will only blow hot air OR cold – which you’ll appreciate in a room with 3 people and a construction site/ main road outside, opening the windows ( which was the suggestion when we complained to the hotel director ) Isn’t the best solution for this problem so we had no air con for 2 out of the 3 days we stayed.Roof top bar-There IS one on the roof but it isn’t open at the moment, I think it does opens in the summer however. If you want to have a drink on the roof, you must ring the bell for a waiter to come and take your order and they will go away /make the drink and return with it. It’s easier to just bring up your own and store it in the mini fridge in your room, which you can purchase from the local “supermarcat” across the road ( you’re welcome). As for the pool, well… Let’s say that if you pushed off from the edge you’d hit your head in the other side, it’s about the size of a large Jacuzzi and could only accommodate 4/5 people at most . With the construction site opposite I can’t see many people taking advantage of the pool/ sunbeds, but with enough alchohol anything is fun!Checking in/ out- When we arrived it was around 11am, we were told check in wasn’t until 2pm but if we paid an extra 10 euros per room we could go in early, most hotels I’ve stayed in just let you in and don’t charge for it! Also there is a “city tax “which we had to pay, this was 1.80 euro a day, per person and per room. By the time we checked out, we owed an extra 47 euros between the five of us (over two rooms) and that was without air con for two days !
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very nice 6-night-stay in this hotel. Excellent service, walking distance to the city, comfortable rooms and a nice little pool on top of the building. We were especially pleased with the bikes to rent for free and recommend the hotell to offer more than two bikes in the future. A good hotel to explore Barcelona for the first time. Thank you to the excellent personal on the hotel!!
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was excellent and the breakfast very good. The suite was really good size for family with both shower and bath.would definitely stay again. Nice walking distance to two metro lines. Good restaurants in the neighborhood.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 1 night in a double room (single use). Chose this hotel mainly for the location (proximity to Barcelona Sants railway station) and reasonable price (prepaid offer). Liked:+ Very comfortable bed, linen and pillows. Had a good sleep!+ A safety box, a kettle (+free tea, coffee, water) and mini-bar in the room.+ Friendly staff at the reception. + Convenient location for those who need to travel somewhere from Sants railway station (not more than 15 min on foot). About 10 min from one of the stops of Aerobus from the airport (Gran Via - Urgell). About 15 min to the Magic Fountain. In the nice neighbourhood of Eixample.+ Good value for money (in my case). Disliked:- The fact that my room had a door (locked) to the adjacent room. You can hear everything that happens in the neighbouring room through this door. If I'd stayed at the hotel longer than 1 night, I'd have asked to change the room. Fortunately, our timetable about when to go to bed coincided and it was quiet at night but in the evening I was "lucky" to listen to a "live pop concert" with my neighbour as a soloist:) - Not the best condition of the bathroom. The bidet was leaking.GENERAL IMPRESSION. Positive but 1) make sure you need this very location. If you are interested in the very centre of the city (the main part of Las Ramblas, Barrio Gotico or Liceu), this hotel is a little bit far away.2) avoid rooms which are supposed to be adjacent. WOULD I RETURN? Yes, to a quieter room, if I needed again this location and if the price were similar to what I paid.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, quiet, and luxurious in size (bedroom AND bathroom).Especially given the fact it was only 90€ per night on booking.comReal perks are very affordable rates for early check in, late check out and breakfast buffet (which btw included even complimentary Cava and the rarity that are chia sedes + vegan friendly choices of milk). Would recommend any time.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the nicest and friendliest hotels I have ever stayed in the world. The hotel is very modern, clean and has a very relaxing feel to it. The Rooms are very modern, extremely clean and beds extremely comfortable - proper duvets and soft pillows, not just blankets which you get in must hotels. Bathroom is extremely spacious as there is plenty of room between the toilet and the shower/bath, great mist free mirrors and very soft towels!Breakfast is a bit better than your standard buffet breakfast on the continent, but you have all the necessaries and can eat as must as you want!The service was excellent and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, they recommended were to go and showed us in detail how to get there. They even sorted us out with FC Barcelona tickets an hour before the match at cost price.The hotel is within walking distance of everywhere. It is only 10 minutes walk from Sants train station, which has a regular train every 30mins to the airport. 15/20 minute walk from Las Rambla and Pl. de Catalunya, one of the main shopping and dinning areas, 15 minutes to Sagrada Família and 20 minutes walk from the Nou Camp.When we were checking out, I was very impressed with the way staff handled a very awkward and rude American pair, who were complaining and giving out before they even checking in. The dealt with the matter very professional and were extremely friendly and courteous to the pair.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night pre cruise, like this area as there are plenty of reasonable restaurants about. Staff were friendly, room was spotless. Wish I could have stayed longer to try the free bike hire. Loved the roof top bar, great cocktails.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Liked to stay at Amister hotel. The room was great, spacious and cosy. Also clean and quite. Really good atmosphere at the reception. The breakfast service also provided everything man needs. Also they have a bar and small pool at the top of the building.
hotelName:
18    Sercotel Amister Art Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the first thing that I have to mention is that staff are so kind, responsible and patient. the location is also great because it haas easy access to almost every where and there is a bicycle station right in front of it incase you wanna explore the city by biking.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Laid back hotel in quiet neighbourhood. The room was super clean. The bathroom could do with an upgrade, but like I said, it was always very clean. There are public transport to the city center (metro from Gloriés to Pl.de Catalunya) and to the beach (Tram 4 from Auditori to Ciutadella Olympic) Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We had a lovely stay.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were clean and the interior was nice. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast offering contained what one would considerfor a 3 *** hotel. Only 4 of 5 points because the WIFI did not work properly and stuff in the bathroom was broken. All in all, we would recommend the place.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived quite early in the morning but they managed to get us (two couples) rooms without much delay. Very helpful staff. Great bakery just up the road. Comfortable room with safe and free wifi. Very handy to public transport.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: VERY CLEAN ! VERY POLITE AND HELPFUL STAFF! Good breakfast, good location (if you like to walk) BUT VERY small rooms. At least ours. In the hotel pictures the feeling of space does not represent the reality.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service, room neat, clean, spacious. Great location, closed to many interesting places. I was impressed with staff attention, specially Maria, Omar and Ariadne, good experience. I will recommend this hotel to family and friends
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Almost everything was really perfect but there were only two problems for us.One of the problems was to require money for printing out a few travel documents by the hotel. There was even a dedicated public computer just for this purpose. The other problem was the room isolation. Some rooms were big and they were divided into two room by an inner door. For this reason, every sound in the next room could be heard easily.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’d been searching for a hotel for weeks but couldn’t find one meeting our requirements within our budget. It got to the point when I was just going to bite the bullet and book one regardless of cost but something made me have one last search. Thank goodness! This little gem popped up and was ideal. Fabulous location, clean with good facilities and excellent value. Discount if booked direct and breakfast included which was a bonus. Breakfast was delightful with a fab selection, something to suit all tastes. Staff were all lovely. All in all our experience was an absolute pleasure and we’ll certainly keep it in mind for any return trip.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel. Clean room, comfortable bed, good bathroom, big TV, kettle with tea and coffee facilities in the room. Normal breakfast. Comfortable location, 5 minutes to metro or tram station, 15 minutes to the Sagrada Familia by foot. The only minor slowly wi-fi
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, very clean rooms and common areas, excellent amenities and warm welcoming staff ( specially Ariadna) the breakfast is delicious and varied. Highly recommended. We have enjoyed our visit to this beautiful city.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights and had breakfast included. Good stay, clean rooms, nice breakfast and staff. Location is 3/5 (only Sagrada Familia is close) and need to travel at least 30 minutes to get anywhere (but that's the thing with all Barcelona)
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel pictures seems very nice and cozy. The reservation team are really professional they answered all my inquiries, so excited to my visit with my family. Will write another review after my stay as well.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel and great service. Came here for a football match at the Camp Nou and needed the tickets for the game to be printed off! Karina was very helpful she sorted out my email and printed my tickets off straight away! All other staff very helpful as well.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in very good location, there are 3 metro stations and tram all within 7min. from the hotel. You can also walk to La Cuitadella park and Sagrada familia in 15 minutes. The room was reasonable size with summer terrace (only rooms on the top floor). Good size bathroom and nice shower. Hotel provides shower gel and soap but no body lotion. Good selection on breakfast: 3 types of bread, ham cheese, pastry, yogurts, fruit and vegetable, cereals. Coffee could be better. Not many Spanish/tapas bars around the hotel but the Las ramblas and old town is only 3 stops away by metro.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Except for the tiny room, as a labyrinth, everything was as we expected. Very clean, good breakfast and friendly staff. Pretty close to the main touristic objectives. Very close to Sagrada Familia. The bus station is around the corner. Good job!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay at Hotel Teatre Auditori for three nights with my friends, in February 2019. All was great: the rooms, the staff, the breakfast and the location. I recommend this nice hotel. Surely, we come back here when we visit Barcelona angain.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is worth it to stayed, close to Sagrada, has big room and clean room. The best thing is the staff really heplfull, named Karina. She's so kind, she gave a lot of advise to me when I got stolen in Sagrada. She check my next flight, print out my document that I need to bring to catch my flight next day. I really appreaciate the conversation with her, that makes me calm down after I lost my pasport. Definetly the best staff hotel that I ever meet. Thanks!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is situated on a quiet side street between 2 metro stations. I used Monumental and it was under 10 min walk to the hotel. From the hotel you can walk 5 mins to Encants flea market and the bottom of Av. Diagonal and around 15-20 mins stroll to Sagarda Familia. It's not in the centre of town but I think the trade off in price and quietness makes the location great! The hotel itself is really nice, it's clean and modern and the staff were all really friendly. There is a computer and printer in reception you can use (I think 50 cents for 10 mins) if you need to print tickets etc. There is also a vending machine and the reception is 24 hours. The breakfast is good, moslty cold but nice bread and meat and cheese etc and an instant hot drink machine. Was nice to have but not sure I'd pay the 9 euro it would cost seperately when there are a number of cafes nearby. The room itself was nice. I had been allocated a room with a double and a single bed so it was quite big and the bathroom was modern and everything worked. No view from my bedroom but possible from higher floors. My only disappointment was that the walls are SO thin. Some people were talking in their room and I actually had to check they weren't right outside my door. Also the cleaner starts at 8 am and the thin walls mean that you can hear the inevitable noise. Maybe I was just unlucky I had loud guests but bear in mind if you're looking to sleep in late you may struggle. That being said a room on the higher floors may help this.Overall reallly nice hotel, for 1-3 night stays I think a great choice!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, friendly, safe, well located. Nice breakfast, Will return if rate is similar in the future. I love the area and I must say the room was very clean and comfortable despite the fact that it was small. I had 2 beds. I will add that Karina at the front desk was extra nice.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights in this very reasonably priced hotel. We slept well in the comfortable beds and although it wasn't a particularly large room, the bathroom was spacious with an excellent shower. Plenty of towels were provided as well as soap and shower gel. The windows had very effective black-out curtains as well as lighter ones for privacy. There was a small fridge in the room as well as tea-making facilities. Although our room looked out onto an apartment block, it was very quiet at night. We could also see a rather beautiful religious building, which housed a school so there was some playground noise in the morning if the window was open. The hotel is opposite the National Theatre of Catalunya as well as a major concert hall so it's worth looking to see if you can catch a concert whilst you are there. There are various metro stations and bus stops close by and it is only a short walk to the Sagrada Familia. All in all a good place to stay and we'd recommend it for good value.We would have liked a couple of coat hooks and another for towels in the bathroom. It was just slightly shabby round the edges in our room. Arriving at Glories Metro at 21.30 was somewhat disconcerting as the area looked very bleak and we didn't find it particularly easy to find the road we needed. The following day we realised that we'd gone further than we'd needed to. So, if arriving at night, do your research beforehand and it'll only take you 5 minutes!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: exellent hotel fare price. very clean. close to metro stations. the hotel is welcoming.omar and ariadna from the reception are very nice and helpfull.the hotel is close to the sagrada famillia and digonal road.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was an unforgettable trip despite the rainy weather. Top roof room (thanks to caring stuff) and Cava with beautiful views of Barcelona helped us have a great time. Breakfasts were very tasty with a variety of local dishes.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect stay for very good price. Very good location - Sagrada Familia within short walk, close to Nord bus station and metro, on quiet street. Breakfast was excellent (except I would prefer better coffee :) ), wonderful and helpful receptionists (big thanks for helping us!), rooms were clean, comfortable. We arrived late at night and got an upgrade - excellent room on 5th floor with nice city view. Definitely would stay there again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and simple hotel, 3 stations of the metro away of the very centre of the city. Very well renovated rooms, excelent and helpful receptionists. No room service. Very small the single rooms. I beleive the site shows only the big single rooms that are at the ground floor. Good choice, I would stay again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful experience at this hotel. Staff were helpful, providing useful information about transport links, places to visit as well as general advice. Venue was situated in a good place to explore the sights of Barcelona and we enjoyed our stay immensely.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a booking via hotel's website and I got a room smaller and by far different from that shown in photos of Double Room. The breakfast and the personnel were just nice. The location was great - only 10 mins walking from metro Glories
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a good location in as much as it’s really close to the Sagrada Família but it’s a bit of a walk from places like La Rambla so it depends what you are looking for in terms of location. The rooms are very clean and the bathrooms are lovely and really modern. The rooms aren’t huge but plenty big enough for what you need. It was certainly very quiet and we enjoyed the breakfast, which was quite a range. The staff were pleasant and in comparison to other hotels in Barcelona I do feel we got value for money.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is good, within walking distance to Sagrada Familia and a few other iconic places. We had a twin room which was smaller than expected, room was tidied everyday but not really cleaned. Toilet wasn't cleaned and bed sheets weren't changed. Breakfast was alright but I'd had better range of food in other 3 star hotels elsewhere. Staff were very nice and helpful. Overall, we were happy with our experience in this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly good hotel for the price range . Near metro stations and Sagreda Familia. Our room although quite small was fine , very quiet and comfortable bed. Lovely big shower cubicle. Breakfast was your standard fare . Didn't quite get the scrambled egg as is was nearly white in colour but plenty else to choose from. Staff were friendly and helpful,
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Teatre Auditori is located on a quiet, not particularly scenic, street a little way outside the center but only a couple of blocks from a busy commercial area with numerous local restaurants and shops. It is a short walk to the Glories metro stop and there are good bus connections. Our room was small, but not overly so, very clean and up-to-date. In fact, it was large enough that there was room for a small table and chairs to supplement the small desk and single chair. The bathroom was larger than expected, with a very good shower. The beds were comfortable, especially if you like a slightly soft mattress. There was a safe and a kettle for heating water for tea and instant coffee. In-room Wifi was free and reasonably fast. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. My only complaint is the need to feed coins into the computer in the lobby to use the internet and print out tickets, boarding passes, etc. The fee is low, but annoying. All-in-all, an excellent value for the price.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is in a quite good position, walking distance from the sagrada familia, and 20 min to the palau della musica, and 30 min walk from the gaudi house (both of them) also taxi are quite cheap and easy to book there.The parking in Barcelona is quite impossible (as driving there) so the fact that a private car park is at walking distance from the hotel is a good bonus.The breakfast is very various with lot of selection of savoury and pastry but the quality was not always great. and the fact that the breakfast is served in a basement (without windows) make it a bit depressing in the morning (and TV that play music video don't help)
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My hysband and I spent four nights in Teater Hotel in August. We were really pleased with our choice. Fantastic location, not far away from the city center, very clean rooms and quiteness. A 10/10 except for there was something wrong with our tv during the weekend. The staff tried to solve it but it seemed a professional was needed. It turned out that the expert wasn't available. We were offered a change of room very kindly but we prefered to remain in the same room an waited for support next day. It would've been great if it had been solved at that time. But everything was fine and friendly staff there. Greetings from Germany.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely disgusting place, dirty, leaking and staff are incredibly rude. Not at all a 4 stat hotel. We arrived at the hotel with the concierge showing us to our room and presenting a half soaked bathroom because of a leak in the ceiling, and then as an alternative was offered a room with no window that smelled of damp. With no choice but to take the room with the leak, we discovered that the window looked into the foyer and all we could see of outside was the pavement , with no idea of whether it was light or dark outside. Next day we complained and got palmed off by an extremely rude and arrogant member of staff, only to be offered the room with no window again and were told we were lying about the leak!The second night we moved to another hotel, hotel Catalonia park Putxet, which was well worth paying extra for than staying in that pathetic excuse for a hotel. NEVER stay here, the pictures are nothing like the hotel itself. The picture attached shows a taxi driver on the pavement outside staring directly at me as I take pictures of him.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean hotel and very friendly staff.Small but cozy rooms.The AC was terrible ! I would never expect a room being so smelly due to the Air Condition which was really malfunctioning and useless.... I stayed 3 nights and all my clothes got a smell of MOULD! Very dissapointing for a 140€/night room...
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was just what we needed on our recent trip to Barcelona. It’s in a friendly neighbourhood which is safe to walk around with plenty near by, including metro stations for ease of getting around. Our room was spacious and clean, although no outside view. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Perfect whilst visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a birthday celebration. The rooms were spacious with tea and coffee facilities. Shower was enormous and shower products replenished everyday. Breakfast was good with a wide variety of hot and cold. Reception staff were very friendly and informative. Just about a 10/15 minute walk to the basilica, but a bus ride into the centre La Rambla and the beach. A very enjoyable stay and just a pity it was so far out
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The overall stay was enjoyable. The hotel is located just outside of the main tourit areas so you can walk to things such as the sagrada familia but you are not overwhelmed by the constant noise and busy streets. The hotel is just as shown in the pictures, nothing out of the ordinary. The staff however, are amazing. Always willing to help and giving us amazing tips to make the most of our time in barcelona. They were able to help us get a “sagrada familia - gaudi” tour last minute, which i also really recommend.Breakfast is simple but theres a wide variety for all tastes. Always had multiple options of fruit, cereal, bread, eggs, etc.The only issue we had was one of the days we decided to sleep in longer and the cleaning lady came into the room saying that if we wanted her to clean the room it had to be now. We had no problem, as we told her, waiting until the next day to have our rooms cleaned, it was just extremelly unconfortable for my friend and I to be woken up with a woman inside our room.Nonetheless, i would recommend it if you are staying in Barcelona for a few days.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our overall stay was very good, the room was pretty big. Big bathroom, big bed, clean room. Nice breakfast. We enjoyed our stay and we were pretty happy with the fact that it was 5 minutes away from the bus and metro stations. It was located in a quiet neighborhood and could be easily reached from different places in town. Personnel was helpful and kind.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights prior to a cruise.Hotel is in a quiet area, about 15 mins walk from Sagrada Familiar.Had a room overlooking the street but heard no noise and slept well.Hotel is quite basic but very clean. Breakfast is buffet style- selection of cereals, fruits, pastries as well as some hot selections and the dining room staff kept everything filled well.Karina and Omar on reception were both excellent and provided lots of information about where to go and what to do, as well as helping with taxis as needed.Would have no hesitation staying again if staying pre cruise but found the hotel a little far out from La Ramblas, where we spent both evenings.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is close to two metro stations - Glòries and Monumental, across from the theater, 15 - 20 minutes walk to Sagrada Família, and 30 minutes walk to the city center. Quiet and convenient. Easy to navigate. Amenities I liked: tea kettle in the room with tea and coffee provided; apples in the lobby, helpful staff Things that could be improved: no tissue paper; minimal room for luggage unless you move the furniture around on your own; they spray the room with some kind of air freshener which you can smell on the bath towels, attention to detail could be improved - e.g. hair on the floor after cleaning
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Once we got our bearings this hotel was in a great spot, approx. 25 mins walking distance from Las Ramblas, a 5 minute walk to Glories Metro station and the Tramway is directly across the road. Room was spotlessly clean and simply laid out and compact - complete with kettle and a little study desk and chair. Little disappointed there was no comfortable chair to relax on after our full day's walking but there was no space for it. The hotel was quiet overlooking the back of the National Theatre. Breakfast was continental buffet style and was served in the basement.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it s was very well, the room was very clean, the food was very good, towel was change every day. I was surprise I was pleasantly surpised by a exiistence of safe, fridge and a mug for preparing cafe sand tea. Congratulations
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed from the Friday until the Wednesday in the room that I asked Ruth for, thanks Ruth.The staff in general are really great. Unfortunately I don't remember all their names, I should by now as this is my third time there.Maria and the other lady whose name I have forgotten at the breakfast are really super jovial people. It is a real pleasure to be attended indirectly by such people. Thanks to both of you, you have always been excellent.The food at the breakfast is excellent, not a massive choice but more than enough for such a smallish hotel. Fresh fruit from melon, strawberries, mango, apples, bananas, grapes etc.Concentrated juices not bad but I prefer water in those cases. Coffee not bad for a automatic machine.Choice of cakes, biscuits, jams. Bacon, sausage, beans, egg. Breads of different kinds, croissants (not the best), omelette excellent for one that is not home made, tastes almost like home made. Really nothing bad at all. I have never not enjoyed the breakfast there.Staff at reception really friendly and helpful.An extremely useful service is the possibility to shower later in the day. You have to obviously vacate your room by 12.00. I wet off, came back at 16.30. They provide you with towels etc and the show room has a toilet and is big enough.You can leave your luggage in a lock up and it is well protected.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was 105, and I'm quite sure all rooms at 1st floor are the same. basement style rooms, if I open the window I can see the reception and the parking entry, the air-conditioning that works as a heater is old and noisy, difficult to sleep with so many noises. Looks older than in pictures, maybe if you get a different section of the hotel ...No worth the price
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited with my boyfriend for a city break for four days and loved the fact that the room we had booked was almost like a small apartment. It was very novel to have two arm chairs to sit at separate from the bed which meant we could eat our lidl breakfast in comfort as well as having a small fridge to be able to use. I think the only negative would be the location. Although it was easy enough to walk to the tube to then get into the city it was a bit of a quiet area with not many nearby shops and restaurants that you'd want to eat at. We ended up grabbing some supplies from Lidl a 10 minute walk away and then knowing that if we wanted something more substantial we'd have to travel into town. If I visited Barcelona again I'd be tempted to pay a little more money and stay somewhere more centrally located just in terms of ease.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well i want to thank you Ariadna from reception for your help and your attention.Because of your information about the city my holiday was perfect.You are the best.Soon i will come again.I like the services from here.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well positioned, within walking distance of Sagrada Familia. The room was nice and the bathroom equipped with toiletries. Breakfast was poor with only a few dishes to choose from and not really timely refilled. Staff were friendly and helpful. All in all, it wasn’t bad, it was rather average.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Teatre Auditori is situated 5 minutes walk from Grácia metro station and 15 minutes walk from Sagrada Familia.Rooms are clean and the service was good.Sometimes you can hear other people in the floor in the rooms talking.Breakfast was OK.Definitely I would recommend this hotel for a good price / quality ratio.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our visit to Barcelona and this hotel was perfect for what we needed. Excellent room service. Generous buffet breakfast. Courteous staff. We would definitely use again. We highly recommend it.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location is great, the stuff was kind and the room was clean. Let's not forget that we are in a 3* hotel, of course you will find things that ar old and dirty, but you only came to sleep more or less in the hotel and the rest of the day you'll be out in Barcelona The surrounding area of the hotel is quiet and you can easily walk to Sagrada or any other attraction.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival asked for a map for the hop-on-hop-off bus, initially the front desk lady was eager to help once she found out I had already purchased the ticket, she requested me to return the map since she couldn't give it to me, the tone used wasn't very courteous. Seriously? a hotel can't spare a single map? definetly lacking in customer service. In addition, next day came late at night to find my room hasn't been made. Spoke with the same front desk lady, that promised to do something and let me know and never did. Very disappointed.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for our break at a reasonable price, nothing fantastic but rooms were clean and had all we needed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good, although the place did lack a bar to relax in following a hard days sightseeing. It is reasonably close to a metro station, which you need to use, as it’s a long walk to most of the sights. I would recommend the hotel although it is very basic
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The breakfast had have a little selection.Powdered Eggs instead of fresh eggs.Alread at the first day I grabed three pieces of mouldy bread.Rooms:Average and very small.Absolutly no space to store our belongings expect the closet.Cleaner did not work very good.Location:Very good.Just around a 10 min. walk to Sagrada Familia.15min. to Parc de la Ciutadella.Bus, Metro and Tram Station nearby.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is 5 mins by metro from Sagrada Familia or 15 mins walk. Also 10-15 mins by metro from Rambla and 3 mins walk from the metro station. It is a very good 3 star hotel, really nice area, close to Torre Agbar and Glories shopping center. Very clean, comfortable beds, good size room (twin room had a double small bed and a single bed), walk-in shower. Our room (607) has a nice view over the Theatre and Torre Agbar. Breakfast was really good, lots of choices (eggs, bacon, beans, fruits, yogurts, pastries. I particularly liked the breakfast room, which was really nice and cozy, nice decor. Omar at the reception was extremely helpful, gave us lots of information and booked Flamenco show for us. I really liked the hotel and I would recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Teatre Auditori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel at nearly midnight to be greeted by a smiley friendly receptionist. She processed us quickly and sent us up to our room. The room was stylish, spacious and the bed was huge and very comfortable. I awoke in the morning to the very enticing smell of fresh bread. We took breakfast at the hotel on our second morning. There was a wide selection of baked goods and continental style breakfast dishes, all very tasty!We loved Barcelona and the hotel, and will be back again.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good, friendly, clean and ideal Bakery for snacks and breakfast...great location next to main walking area at Gracia Place. Ideal for Bust Tours and other interesting buildings.......just a walk from La Rambla & Gotic.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very compact room lacking in a few basic amenities such as towel rails, tea and coffee making facilities. Focus seems to be on design rather than practicality. Noisy street early hours of the morning from unloading trucks etc. Bakery/cafe is quite chaotic and takes up the entire ground floor, again meaning the hotel lacks the usual communal spaces and tranquillity. Breakfast was of a good standard, but again set in amongst the hustle and bustle of the bakery and non-hotel guests. Staff (just one receptionist) are friendly and helpful.Overall, not bad, but felt like the bakery and cafe was the main business, with the hotel being an afterthought.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location and friendly staff! Walking distance to central Barcelona, breakfast for 11€ buffé style. Hotel staff was Nice and friendly. No gym in Hotel but the staff recommended Duet fit, about 10 min walk from there.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sleeping above a bakery (and a quality bakery at that) is just a wonderful thing. The rooms are pretty basic and the beds aren't the most comfortable, but we loved our stay there. The shower was awesome. The location is great. I recommend it.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location with very comfortable rooms, great staff and a brilliant breakfast from your personal bakery. Amazing restaurants within walking distance in one of the nicest areas in Barcelona..Just loved it!!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place to stay! It is in a perfect location (being a 15 minute walk to both La Sagrada Familia and Placa de Catalunya), the rooms are spacious and well decorated and the staff are friendly and willing to help at all times. We loved having the bakery just below us, it made breakfast easy and there was always so much to choose from (the nutella croissant was to die for!). It would've been nice to have a mini fridge and tea/coffee facilities in the room but other than that, everything was perfect! We will definitely be returning and would 100% recommend the hotel to others.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a different hotel to what you would normally stay at.The bakery provides a wonderful place to have a break.Rooms are a bit small but functional.Location is in a safe area and well serviced by many restaurants
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely hotel close to great transport links. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was a little small (especially for the 'deluxe' double) but it was clean and comfortable and fine for a solo traveller. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room which was surprising for a Brit! There was an excellent selection at breakfast (11€ if room only) or you can buy items separately from the bakery if you don't want a huge meal.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, room was clean and nice appearing, however, my thermostat was fixed at 24 degrees celsius in the room (which is WAY too hot for me to sleep in) and I could not adjust it. I complained to the front desk staff about it. The first night they tried to fix it, however had to get maintenance from offsite. The second night I demanded a new room. They convinced me that it was fixed by Maintenence, even though it was not. Had to suffer for 2 nights. I would not go back to this hotel for any reason!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Food is delicious at the bakery specially the breakfast. The team were supper kind and helpful.The location of the hotel is perfect near to most of the attractive locations in Barcelona. Room, shower and toilet is clean.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the decor, the bakery and the location. Near to most things so you can walk or use the public transport to get around. Close to BusTuristico stops and many restaurants. Nearby parking garage where you can park safely.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really only 3-5 minutes from Casa Mila and 10-15 from Casa Batllo - so, ones of the main landmarks are extremely close. The Bullard bakery on the ground flour became the best place for breakfast - we’ve visited other cafeterias nearby, but the choice and coffee were a lot worse there. If you feel that you want a more nutritious breakfast than sandwiches, pastries, yogurts, smoothies, fruits and coffee which bakery offers - take the hotel breakfast (it’s 10 euro per person and there are also eggs, jams, cheese, ham and cereals). Our room was small but it’s okay for 2 people, no more. There were no problems with anything in it. It’s clean, light in colour and well-organised. The staff are speaking English fluently and are ready to answer any questions. We had difficulties with paying by credit card because of our bank which didn’t allow it. Nevertheless, we got the room keys at once and could even pay without any worries on toe last day.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here twice whilst in Barcelona and both times the coffee and cakes were delicious. The bakers kitchen is open so you get to watch them baking. The price is very cheap and the cafe itself is wonderful.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, weird layout to rooms and uncomfortable bed that made you very aware of other persons movements. Wish we could have had 2 beds as requested instead of a king size. Bakery downstairs was very good!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel at a reasonable price, given the great area in which it is located (beautiful, clean and not too crowded). Small but well equipped & furnished rooms, with a modern design. Good quality bakery on the ground floor of the hotel. Great wifi
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the front desk is tiny with a spartan staffing the quality of the service is uniquely impeccable. Thenpervasive yummy smell of bread is seductive and our room was charming. The location is ideal and there is a hip feeling to the bakery/restaurant. I highly recommend this for couples or singles, yet not for families.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place has good potential but lacks maintenance. First night we had a broken bed that keeps shaking and creaking, we could not sleep and the staff did not find any solution for that day. The next day they replaced the room with another one whose window is broken and does not close. it's tiring to have to complain continuously to get a just normal room.Otherwise, the staff is friendly and tries to find solutions especially the girl with blond hair in boyish cut. the location is good too and allows you to visit much of the city on foot.I found the parking expensive also € 22 / day.The beach towel loan service is very useful.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Compact (smallish) room that has all the amenities and a fantastic shower - tip: the interior door has full-length mirrors. The highlight, however, is the bakery and cosy seating area: the actual bakery is fantastic and far above usual "hotel breakfasts", it's actually a place where it's worth eating. It's also well-located with several decent restaurants within 10 minutes as well as two underground stations connected to the main lines to reach most places in the city.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Food and staff awesome. Itsa nice bakery on the bottom and a hotel on the top.. it smells delicious they make own bread there....and its soft and fresh. They sell croissants sandwiches desserts juices and cafe.....staff very nice......i didnt stay in hotel but looked nice....
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are 5 Praktik hotels in Barcelona and we stayed at the Hotel Praktik Bakery. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it and would happily go back in a second! The hotel is located above a bakery that has been operating with the same family for several generations. The aroma is intoxicating (and the pastries are outstanding!). The hotel is clean, very modern rooms that are small but have everything you need. It's located very close to Gaudi's La Pedrera and bus/metro lines. The staff couldn't have been nicer (let us keep us our luggage there after checkout until we left for an evening flight) and there is a room on the 1st floor for hotel guests to use the Internet and just sit and relax. I recommend this hotel without hesitation.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a nice concept and very clean rooms. There wasn’t a fridge or a coffee machine in the room though. I think these are necessities for every hotel.Plus the rooms were quite small (but the bed was huge).
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite cosy and is situated in a perfect location in Barcelona.However, a few small details could be improved. For example, the rooms disposition doesn’t allow for enough privacy in the bathroom, no water heater is available, as well as no fridge or minibar.Sixt floor inner side was quite quiet.On some occasions the bakery smell gets a bit overwhelming and nauseating.Actually all the small discomforts would be perfectly tolerable on a lower price range.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful, contemporary place to stay in great location with delicious cafe & breakfast available. Loved the minimal room and simple details. Would stay again and recommend it to others, too. Look forward to staying in future.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was hit & miss, reception is in an odd place really, you have to walk past the counters full of beautiful pastries,breads etc & depending on time of day pretty well full on chaos with people queuing to order, waited a good 5 mins for someone at reception so asked bakery staff (in limited Spanish) for help which all 3 staff were totally not interested, they thought it was amusing as all were talking & laughing about us. Not a good start. Staff member finally arrived & a quick checkin & into our room.Room smallish but already was aware of that, very clean, great bedding, pillows & towels also very good, Complimentary shampoo & conditioner, moisturiser, no glasses only plastic cups & no fridge, very good aircon as extremely hot on our stay. We had breakfast one morning & ticks all the right boxes as breakfast goes. You can also just order coffees & pastries/ toasted sandwiches from bakery & bring them into cafe/breakfast area in Hotel if you want. Hotel is in a fabulous location, many bars/tapas & restaurants in this area. Easy walk to main tourist areas where you can catch hop on/off buses. Taxis can be easily caught at corner of street on your right of Hotel. Recommendation to Hotel maybe changing reception sign to the front of bakery to stop confusion. Had a great time in Barcelona, lovely City.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adorable, smallish hotel on a major street. The bustling bakery downstairs has delicious pastries, sandwiches and coffee. Staff is friendly and speaks English. Room was very clean, bright and the perfect size for me as a single. A couple would be comfy as well. The room is small, but who cares?? Americans seeking an American sized hotel room need to stay in a Marriott hotel. The bed was amazing and linens crisp. Bathroom was compact but updated. Large shower with separate toilet; a pocket door separates this from the bed. Bright window lead to a Juliette balcony. Blackout drape was provided. A/C was adjustable, but I didn’t need to lower it even as temperatures outside climbed to 90F. Towels were soft and replaced each day; safe under the sink.This is a modern, bright, European style hotel. The location is fantastic for those wanting to site see or just stroll through the neighborhoods. Closest to La Pederera; Casa Batlo; Passeig Gràcia; Casa Vincenz; 20 minute walk to Sagrada Familia. Really lovely experience and having the working bakery downstairs was a treat for both the eyes and the appetite!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super cute hotel, with an amazing bakery on the ground floor. Location is excellent! Very comfortable stay, no issues with cleanliness. The staff was nice. We did have an issue with the air conditioning, it kept automatically switching to 27 degrees. However, after alerting the staff they handled and fixed it directly. Overall a perfect stay!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel! Couldn’t rave about it more, great vibes, aesthetic and location! The bakery was so convenient and delicious, the smell of fresh bread and pastries lingered through the mornings and this was a delight. The location was great, felt very safe and secure but also not to busy or touristy either! Overall would recommend to friends and family, and would stay again in the future.Our only slight downside was that we couldn’t put subtitles on the tv - to English - so we muddled through on our limited Spanish. And there was no fridge / ice buckets available for a cool drink through the evening / mornings.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at for 3 nights prior to a Western Medeterranian Cruise. The location was excellent, and the neighborhood wonderful. We were slightly off the beaten path, so the area was quiet, but we were very near bus and metro stops. The room was small, but perfect for sleeping and well kept. No chairs or places to sit other than the bed. The bathroom area could be closed off with a barn door and the shower was lovely. The staff were very kind and helpful, although we did have a mis-understanding about the "free neighborhood tour", we were told it was around an hour, but it was more like 3 hours. Felt like we found a hidden gem, would recommend this hotel to everyone.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The price and cleanliness stand out and the smell of freshly baked bread tops it off. The rooms are a bit small but they are very clean. The location of the hotel is perfect, right around the corner from shopping, Plaça Reial, and a taxi stand across the street. The bakery is phenomenal! There are a few tables in the front open to the public but the entire back are is dedicated to hotel guests. I would highly recommend!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, clean and comfortable rooms (if a little small... the shower was almost half the size of the bedroom, design team did not get that quite right). Although decor was crisp and attractive, it seemed a bit like style over substance.The smell of freshly baked bread in the morning is a dream to wake up to, sets the hunger pangs into action on opening your eyes! The coffee was the most delicious we tasted in Barcelona, which is a huge positive, but also the biggest negative, the breakfast which is supplied by the hotel included a coffee from a Nespresso machine, which is a little gimmicky. Not even a fresh pot. When we asked the reception staff, the lady said that the coffee was ‘supplied by a separate company, and was not included in the price of the breakfast’ this was a huge disappointment, surely this could be negotiated with the company...? We ended up buying our coffee separately. They were clearly able to supply the baked goods as part of the breakfast, so why not the coffee? It felt as though they really could not be bothered. Paying customers at the hotel, having to pay for the coffee separately is not an acceptable package. Not a complete customer oriented experience. The cafe was also closed on Monday, which we were not advised of, we came down to check out and to pick up a croissant to go, and the whole of downstairs was closed, again, disappointing - should be made aware of this if offering ‘breakfast’.Not terrible, but would not visit again.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I want to preface this review by stating I am a high maintenance American female. This review may not be helpful for everyone, but if you are also a little high maintenance, this maybe just what you need. The hotel is a legit bakery. You wake up every morning smelling fresh baked bread and pastries, which could be a good or bad thing. For me, I didn’t mind it. My room faced the back of the hotel, but I’ve heard from coworkers, if you are faced in the front of the hotel, you most likely be woken up around 3-4 am by the delivery trucks being unloaded. The room itself was extremely small. When I first entered it, I HATED, but it has grown on me. If this had been a personal trip, rather than for business, my husband would have never of fit. The first day, I had asked for extra hangers. The 5 provided in the room wouldn’t cut it for my 2 week work stay. They said they didn’t have any extra, which I found strange since they do offer laundry service. Not a huge deal, but slightly annoying. The first 2 nights my toilet ran the ENTIRE night. Until I figured out how to tap the small flush panel just right, it would have run the entire time. Annoying for me, costly for the hotel. The one thing that would persuade me to never stay at this hotel again is the fact that you can not control the temperature in your own room. It is controlled by the hotel. Every night I had to request the manager to turn up my AC. I run HOT, sleeping in 23 degree conditions just doesn’t work. Even when he turned it up, it still never got cold enough. He was super nice and helpful though, told me to call down if I didn’t notice a difference and he would have someone come look at it. I noticed the slightest difference, but it just still wasn’t cold enough. Overall, the staff is extremely nice and very accommodating. I arrive at 11 am, when check in wasn’t until 4 pm, and they still allowed me to get into their only available room. I am here on business for 2 weeks and was only able to get into this hotel for 6 days, so they obviously do really well, it just wasn’t for me.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not sure what we got into but staying above an awesome bakery was wonderful. Pastries and sandwiches were delicious. The hotel was sufficient. Not a huge room but who hangs out in the room. A little tight when you are hanging for a week.Neighborhood was great with plenty of dining options walkable. We did walk 30 minutes to several sites of interest.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was clean and comfortable and the cafe with bakery downstairs amazing and convenient. Would thoroughly recommend. The neighbourhood is also very safe and close to the shopping district. Would stay here again for sure!!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great location, and the style of the room was nice and modern, though small, but with a nice shower. Only real problem was that you couldn't control the temperature at night and it got warm.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We requested a king size bed and, although the bed was spacious enough, it wasn't a real king since it was actually two smaller beds put together with a pad over both, so the space between them was evident when the beds separated slightly at night, making it somewhat uncomfortable. We would like to book again since we loved the location and the bakery downstairs, but as far as the bed is concerned, do you offer any real kings or are all of them only two beds put together?
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very clean. Though it was small, all the key points were met for my needs. Very nice rainfall shower head with good water pressure, a large window that opens, and high ceiling made up for the smallness for the room. The best part is that we woke up to the aroma of freshly baked pastries every morning!!!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Praktik for 2 nights based on reviews and location. The hotel is located in a nicer region of Barcelona. High end clothing shops and hotels surround the hotel. We enjoyed being away from the general tourist areas which are accessible through the cities abundant taxi service. The staff (special thanks to Mary) were exceptional. Extremely helpful, attentive and efficient. Cons; The rooms are small with not too many amenities. This was not important to us personally but for some it might be.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small hotel was perfect for my week in Barcelona. It has been refurbished and now has a funky, modern vibe. A fun quirk is the bakery in reception, where you can see the bakers busily producing the days bread and delicious patisseries. Then you can buy the bakery goods and ready made salads and coffee at the bakery counter which adjoins reception. However, if you just want unadorned fresh bread to do your own catering, you need to go round the corner to the shop itself, where you can buy fresh loaves and bread by weight. There is a breakfast buffet but I didn't try it, preferring to cater for myself. Happily the hotel doesn't mind of you are a guest and bring your own food to the dining room. My room had french doors with a little railling so you coule look out and see Sagrada Famiglia further down the street. It was about 20 minutes walk away. Casa Mila is on the next corner from the hotel. Very convenient location with most things within walking distance.My room was lovely. All clean and white. It was a grrat size for one. The only downside is that there is no tea and coffee facilities in the room. But forewarned is forearmed and I took a jug and teabags with me from NZ.I really liked staying here.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For my wife and I, this was our first trip to Barcelona and were a bit concerned when booking our hotel where it would be located and how close to the major attractions it would be, and this hotel did not disappoint. It is 1 block from Casa Mila and one of the major high-end shopping districts, along with reasonable walking to Playa Catalunya and La Rambla. There's also a city tour bus stop within 2 blocks. Beyond the location, the check-in process was quick, the wi-fi was fast, and the food from the bakery was great and affordable. We would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future as the only negative we noted was that we couldn't get the thermostat to work so our room got a bit warm at night.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little hotel is in a great location much is walkable and the subway is very very convenient and easy to useroom was large for european standards and shower was terrific.staff was quite helpful and the breakfast (add'l fee) was quite good
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You'll find this boutique style hotel only a 5 minute walk from the main road. Using public transport from the airport was no issue in our quest to find the hotel. First impressions where very good, the entrance is filled with cakes and freshly made bread from the bakery, it's clear the bakery is a popular destination amongst tourists and locals. The room was very well designed, although smaller than anticipated; but this wasn't an issue. The use of this intricate space seemed very clever. We had a large double bed covered in white bedding. There wasn't a spec of dust or dirt to be found anywhere. The view from the balcony is a nice compliment to the room.The staff in the hotel are very helpful, they will be able to provide you with directions, transport links, tourist information and off course they can give you great recommendations on which pastries taste the best. Like most places, you can store your luggage when you check out. I'd definitely stay here again. Hotels in Barcelona can be fairly expensive, but this hotel offers a very competitive option. Tip: The bakery downstairs does serve the public as well as hotel guests. They reserve a few tables for guests in a morning but due to its popularity it can be difficult to get a seat; arrive early for the best pastries and seats.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little gem is convenient to all the “must-see” areas of Barcelona. While the rooms are small, the affordable price and great location more than compensate for the size. The delicious pastries and sandwiches in the bakery are definitely a plus.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to stay. With a bakery downstairs close to old town but still away from the crowds. Centrally located to Gaudi first house, his summer house in Garcia and the cathedral. I would stay here again when visiting the area.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stopped at the recommendation of a friend. I had a delicious sandwich and also indulged in a pastry. Both were quite good. The location was great as I was walking from Família Sagrada back to my hotel. It was busy, and finding a place to sit was a little challenging, but that’s a testament to its popularity.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 4 of us spent 3 days in Barcelona at the end of a long cruise. A friend familiar with Barcelona recommended an area to stay in that was central to many of the great sights and we selected the Praktik Bakery. To be honest, the thought of a bakery at the ground floor of our hotel helped seal the deal. Bakeries are so hard to find in the USA these days.What an amazing place! It was not just a bakery, but the best one around - we know because we tried others during our walking around. But, we all know the purpose of a hotel stay is also the room. The room was clean, relatively large by European standards, quiet and comfortable. The shower was also amazing - a large rainfall type shower that was quite relaxing. The front desk was very accommodating - even to printing out tickets purchased on-line and boarding passes for us. We walked everywhere and this hotel is central to many attractions. Finally, it was very reasonably priced. When we return to Barcelona we will definitely look to stay at the Praktik Bakery again!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wake up to the heavenly smell of fresh baked breads.The rooms are small but adaquete for 2, well thought out and smart use of space.In a nicer part of neighbouhood, posh street just 2 blocks away.Breakfast!! Just line up and buy em! You will see that even the locals flock here for breakfast. Wished I've stayed longer than the 2 nights I did.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We need to pay the apartment, as we arrived. Afterwards we first got the chance to see to see the apartment. It was not as clean as expected and the bedsheet was not wrapped around the blanked, as it usually is. So you’re skin touches the blanked itself: we don’t feel comfortable with that. We also expected a nice view (old buildings with small balconies) as it’s shown on the pictures. Instead there was a backyard and no balcony.We asked very friendly if there is the possibility to get another room. The receptionist told us, that the pictures on Booking must be a mistake. He doesn’t know a room like shown at this Hotel.I need to show him the Booking a few times, till he believes that it is not my own booking fault. All this takes an hour or so. Too much, for getting a solution.By the way. There is no solution yet. The receptionist told us, that he hasn’t the power to take a decision.The Bakery is fine. Products are great. Waiters are very unfriendly.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a perfect location! Amazing bakery. Clean and comfortable hotel. Close to everything. Perfect for you Barcelona stay! My husband and I rented bikes from a place near by and this was such a central location. Great restaurants and bars in walking distance too!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location and very helpful staff. The rooms are very small and stark. Everything is white except for the tile in the bathroom. There is NO place to put more than one suitcase except on the floor. Breakfast at 11 Euros each is way overpriced. Better to buy your breakfast at the hotel's bakery where you have a far better selection. And clearly better to take a taxi rather than to walk in Barcelona. The crooks can spot a tourist a mile away and their bag of tricks to take your valuables and make them theirs is creative, to say the least. Beware.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Small rooms but adequate for our stay in Barcelona. Breakfast was good but my family wished we had not done the breakfast included option. They would have preferred to go through the line at the bakery and get fresh coffee and not from a machine. Can't get ice if the bakery is closed.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a very nice and unique Hotel in the Heart of Barcelona. Staff members were very friendly and helpful. The Bakery on the Main Level is part of the Hotel and of amazing quality and variety. The Rooms are spotless clean and modern with a very nice Shower. The downside was that aside from the Bed(s), there is nowhere to sit. Additionally, the HVAC is controlled for the entire hotel as one and will keep resetting to whatever the Hotel as a whole is programmed for. Hence, the Room did not have any air circulation even on relatively warm Spring days.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister recently moved to Barcelona so I was coming over to visit her. I have just returned from a recent stay here with my 22 month old daughter. We had originally booked a different hotel and the booking got cancelled by the hotel. We then stumbled across this one. As annoyed as I was at the original hotel I’m so happy it got cancelled. I loved this hotel! I had booked a baby cot and requested early check in. The cot was made up in the room and the room ready early. The room was much smaller than I imagined, but absolutely perfect! Everything needed was there, it was lovely! The shower was great. There is a small shower also if you don’t want to wash your hair (or, in my case, for the toddler to use). The bed was massive and comfy and had enough room to pop my folded down stroller under it at nights. On night one my daughter got sick over the bed and me. I requested fresh bed sheets, we had to wait a long time for them to arrive but there was only one person in reception, and he was busy. When we checked out the hotel kept my bag until I left for the airport. Every staff member I spoke to were friendly and helpful. All in all a most wonderful hotel. The bakery and breakfast was so tasty. The only silly downside for me was there was only 2 English tv channels (which were serious American news channels). Silly complaint, but when my baby went to sleep early, I’d nothing to do as forgot my book. Also, there is no kettle in the room. I had brought my own local tea bags with me, so every night I brought a cup of hot water up from reception for my tea. Totally silly downsides which I can deal with. All in all, I will be staying here again when I visit my sister next. Hopefully it’s soon. I’ll remember my book, and my tea bags and I’ll have just as lovely time!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's such a unique atmosphere when you have to go through the bakery to get to the reception. The rooms are really simple but very special and cute in their simplicity. The corridors really smell like fresh bread, it's not just an advertising gag. For breakfast you can either buy something in the bakery or you choose the buffet where you have a selection of mini-versions sold in the bakery. Again, the atmosphere in the breakfast area is great as you can watch the bakery while they're working.The staff is really competent and friendly.Thanks for the pleasant stay.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful stay we had in this quaint hotel. Located in a pedestrian street the hotel is a nicely decorated, boutique hotel. The hotel is spotlessly clean. Bed and pillows are very comfortable. The breakfast at €10 is exceptional value for the range of food offered. Above all the staff are very friendly and helpful. There are plenty of fantastic restaurants nearby with convenient stores. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Musik Boutique hotel is excellent. Even though it is situated in central Barcelona it is in a quiet place and very clean. Service excellent. Great room and always clean with good Wi-fi a safe in room good air condition. The breakfast was great
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I just spent the last 6 days at Musik Boutique and LOVED our stay! The hotel is set within the medieval streets of old town and are within walking distance to many great shops, restaurants, and tourist attractions (Picasso museum, etc). We met up with a few tours in locations within walking distance. The hotel is also easy to navigate to via metro from the airport. Our room was spotless every time it was cleaned! Our room also had speakers in the main area and the bathroom that connected to our phone to play music, which I really enjoyed! The breakfast was pretty standard, but good (eggs, bacon, veggies, fruit, fresh croissants and pastries, etc). There were some staple dishes, like eggs and pastries, seen every day, but other dishes were swapped out. My sister loved the espresso machine. The staff were lovely and accommodating, especially Glen, who took the time to make us feel welcome and give us information on things to see and do in the area. Overall, lovely stay!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Marvellous place!!!It was the first trip for me and my wife outside of Greece and the Musik hotel was the best choice.The hotel is in very good spot you can go everywhere on foot. The breakfast is great and the stuff very very helpful and always with smile
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The location was ideal for sightseeing with 2 metro stations 6-7 min away in either direction. The hotel was very clean with comfy beds. The staff was very polite and they always willing help us with directions, always smiling. Breakfast was decent and had several choices. We love the music system they had in the room. We definitely staying there again and we do recommend it.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I loved our stay. The hotel was very clean and quiet. We were both very happy with breakfast and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to all attractions and we were very grateful for the jump on jump off transit. Las Rambla is about 10 minutes away. The airport is about 20 minutes away which was great as well. We hope to return in future.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We selected the hotel because of its proximity to airport coach drop points, coach transfers to the grand prix circuit and certain parts of Barcelona we wanted to visit during our 3 night stay including the Rambles, Gothic quarter, marina and beaches. The hotel certainly deserves it's rating. The room although smallish in size was more than adequate for our 4 night stay. It was very clean, quiet and comfortable. Bottled water provided every day which not all hotels offer. The whole hotel is well maintained. Check in staff were very polite and spoke good English. We had the buffet breakfast at extra cost as it was not included in our room rate, there was enough choice to satisfy lighter eaters and those who want a more substantial breakfast. The food was tasty and reasonably priced for a major tourist area. So very pleased with our stay and would use this hotel again if visiting Barcelona. Being picky, would have scored 5 if there was an outside space with a view.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional central location, walking distance from most things. Being in the old town, however, It can be a bit hard to find. Rooms were reasonably sized, very clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and efficient. I can't really fault it and would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
