review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights as I explored Barcelona. The hotel room was very comfortable, clean and inviting. The hotel staff were wonderful and kind. It is a great location in the Born area to explore the fun of Barcelona.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked five nights at this hotel and were happy with location, staff, room and breakfast. This hotel provided so many options for breakfast. The perfect sunny side up eggs were eye catching. The staff are to be commended. From the front desk to housekeeping to hospitality and food service everyone was helpful, professional and friendly. This makes such a difference when we travel as we like to interact and get to know folks.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed our stay, the rooms where nice, mine had a private balcony, and the staff were very helpful and kind. My plane was delayed and they helped me with transport from the airport even though i was late when ordering. Perfectly located in the old part of town, made it easy to walk everywhere.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I had a lovely stay overall. The room was clean, comfy and pretty. However the sound system offered was broken along with the AC. The major negative aspect was the workers that started drilling on our floor early in the morning. We had to ask reception for them to stop. This is not professional and guests friendly in our eyes. The hotel is well located in a very nice neighbourhood. I would still recommend it.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very good hotel located at the heart of the city, they have ample space in their rooms, service is excellent. We made some special requests and they helped us with everything we needed.I recommend this place if you want to stay in Barcelona for a couple of days
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel located close to all things tourist. Lots of restaurants and shops. Great staff, clean rooms and comfy beds. Walking distance to beaches, historic locales and open air marketsReasonably priced for all it offers.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed, family of 4, with another family at this hotel for the marathon. The hotel is in a great location for city, beach and restaurants. It is spotlessly clean, very helpful and friendly staff, gave us great recommendations, would highly recommend.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is tucked away in the back streets of the Gothic quarter.Very friendly service, excellent but basic breakfasts providing wide choice for English cooked and/or continental.Room was clean, with a huge shower and comfy bed.If you're expecting views then forget it but who lives in a hotel!!!!The best part is its location within easy reach of bars, restaurants etc.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel. It's well located, close to metro stations & ten minutes away from Plaça Catalunya where the bus from the airport arrives. The staff is nice & helpful. The breakfast is very good, the room was clean and the bed super comfortable. We had a great time there, totally recommend.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a long weekend stay for my 50th birthday at this fantastic hotel that we couldn’t recommend enough. Friendly staff, nice clean rooms with mini bar, toiletries in bathroom, robes and slippers supplied. The buffet breakfast was good value for money with so much Choice. Thank you for making our stay a very welcome one.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with lot of friendly staffs. We can call them anytime if we need any help! It’s very helpful and sweet.The audio in the room is so perfect!!!! Especially when you are taking shower! And the breakfast is very good as well definitely will come back again
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the Deluxe room. Our room offered amenities such as slippers and bath robes, plush Egyptian cotton sheets, increased space, minibar, and a small balcony (nothing spectacular or even close to note worthy to see from there as it was just another building). They advertise as all rooms being sound proof which was not the case. I could hear house cleaning services in the other room in the morning and banging from the floor above us. However, the rooms were very clean, provided more than adequate toiletries. As far the buffet breakfast, we did it once and I would recommend if you have the time, for the money there are some delicious breakfast spots in Barcelona that offer amazing breakfasts at similar rates to the hotel. I personally would say don't eat there. Barcelona restaurants have too much delicious food to be tried. The location was excellent and very central to so many great things. I would definitely stay there again and would either do a Deluxe room or Junior Suite. I saw the standard room and it was much to small. The staff was friendly and very helpful.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Musik hotel for 6 nights. Our room was modern, comfortable and really quiet. We loved its location in the old gothic area of Barcelona. Everything was in walking distance and there was a train station about 300 meters away. We had breakfast included in our tariff and it was fine - filled us up ready for the day ahead. We found many reasonably priced tapas bars, restaurants in easy walk. The street seemed a little dodgy at night although we had no trouble. Staff were helpful. Recommended!!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night in the Junior Suite- we had a fabulous view over the city and our room was so comfortable and quiet. Staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms are modern and clean, and breakfast was delicious. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were happy with our three nights here. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us book tickets for the local attractions and print vouchers etc. They also provided tips on attractions, restaurants and what to expect in the city.Rooms were decent size, comfortable, decorated beautifully and had good amenities.The location was good, close to gothic quarters, Plaza cataluyana, resturants and metro station. Hotel is little away from the main road but that was not problem for us.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can't say enough nice things about this hotel. Spiffy decoration, helpful staff who spoke good English, fine location and soft bed. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Breakfast was a cut above the norm in Spain as well.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say was really looking forward to my stay at this boutique hotel when I booked it early on this year and I wasn’t disappointed Arrived mid morning our room was ready! Brilliant after a early morning flight to get freshened up before venturing outHotel has a vibrant fresh feel hotel staff were very kind and helpful, breakfast was plentiful to set you up for the day would of been nice if I could of got some gluten feee bread but sadly that wasn’t available understandably a small hotel has to think about cost and food waste.We had a spacious superior room on the 3rd floor front facing with charming views of the maze of streets ahead in Barcelona, toiletries were plentiful and welcome surprise more than your normal shampoo and conditionerOne of our day trips once we booked required tickets to be printed and the lovely chap at reception was accommodating and come to our rescue and asked us to forward the email with the vouchers so he could print for me thank you!The hotel and the area around it was amazing base couldn’t of picked a better place to stay that had so much around it and easy to get around, found it very easy to navigate the areaWould highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel with charm and kindness in a very safe area, you will love this hotel if you don’t go for the trappings of big bars, spas and restaurants this little place is a home from home lovely place to get your head down and relax after a day of sight seeing We hope to be back again soon!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We needed a hotel where we felt comfortable while we laid our head. We'd sightsee during the day and only slept there at night no lounging around. If you're looking for a comfortable hotel with not so many bells and whistles. And only 1 English speaking channel and that was only the news. BRUTAL! Hotel was nice area was sketch. Literally saw someone get robbed around the corner. a bit scary. be careful and keep yr bags secure.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impressions of the hotel was a stylish little hotel with very friendly staff. The little added touch of a cable or bluetooth to connect personal music to the rooms really helped it live up to the name. The room itself was clean with large comfortable beds. The bathroom was also clean with a powerful shower over the bath. We’d paid for breakfast which had a decent spread of cooked breakfast, cold meats and pastries. The only disappointment for me with the breakfast was the cold baked beans which seemed a little odd but that really is picking fault. The location of the hotel was great. It is located right by the gothic quarter with a huge amount of small twisty streets to explore. It was also a very short walk from a metro station. My main criticism was down to the description of the room, which may be more down to Expedia than the hotel. I booked a superior room which was advertised as having a balcony. This was one of my main attractions to the hotel over others I was looking at in Barcelona for a similar price. The room I was allocated, while being a superior room did not have a balcony. I didn’t complain given that looking at the front of the hotel, even the rooms that had a balcony didn’t seem to have anything that could be described as more than a Juliet balcony. If you were looking for a hotel where you could sit out and enjoy watching the world go by I would suggest looking elsewhere.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms in the Musik were nicely and simply decorated. The breakfast buffet was well-prepared. And now the good news ends: The smell of sewage in the bathroom was overwhelming, the noise from the street was deafening (don't even bother to stay unless you can get a room in the back) but my personal favorite was when the room wasn't made up at 4:30 in the afternoon on the second day of our trip and the surly dude at the front desk explained that the staff cleans from the 6th floor and then moves down. You're right -- it's MY fault that those clowns stuck me with a first floor room in the front of the hotel. Promise: Won't make that mistake twice
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little hotel with cozy rooms, but clean, comfortable, and well maintained. Very efficient use of space! All the staff were friendly and a personalized welcome note was waiting in the room when I arrived. Nice breakfast with both hot and cold options. Really liked location, not on a main thoroughfare but easy to get to points of interest and transport. Would stay again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb and way and beyond experience stay in Barcelona !!!. The room was perfect as I was traveling with my mom and I am a bit claustrophobic . The big windows helped a lot . When we arrived late at night we were already in doubt about the neighborhood safety , but that changed the following day when we walked around the neighborhood , the proximity of the attractions , restaurants , shops , grocery stores , cafes etc was just within reach . Musik Boutique gives you that Catalan culture experience away from the touristy crowds which me and my mom loved as you come out and explore the narrow streets of Ciutat Vella , El gothic and El born . The receptionists were very knowledgeable , helpful , and courteous , all spoke in English !!!! Help me navigate Barcelona , where to go , and where to eat . We were ensured that the neighborhood is safe , no violence but just be extra careful about the pick pockets which we already knew . Our room was tidied up everyday , , everything we need was provided . BTW I have traveled over 15 years and I have to say that the beds were very comfy and beyond a 3 star standard , we had a restful sleep for 8 nights which is very rare for travelers like us . We felt like we were at home . The breakfast buffet was free the first day but we opted to just pay extra for a few days for the breakfast . The food is great and the staff in the kitchen were amazing !!! Emerald prepared a freshly baked croissant for my mom and she appreciated that too much . There are good cafes outside the hotel which we also loved . The location is perfect !!!! Diversity is amazing !!!Tucked in to gothic quarter and el born . Ciutat vela is pretty . 5-10 mins walk to Barcelona’s attractions such as the Barcelona Cathedral / Barri Gòtic , Arc di triomf , plaza catalunya and many more . Hotel is close to the metro as well . Taxi cabs are also an option , but they won’t drop you off in front of the hotel due to the narrow streets which is not a big issue . Thanks again and I cannot think anything negative about the hotel . You are all amazing !!!! I will definitely consider to stay there again and refer you to my friends and family . Alvin Andaya NYC
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing helpful staff! We stayed here 3 nights, great location near the Picasso Museum...in the Gothic Quarter. Lots of great bars/restaurants within walking distance. Super-clean modern room amongst 400yr old buildings. Faultless and fun!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my daughter stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is lovely inside, very clean and very modern. Location wise it was down a small narrow street which at first I was a bit wary of but soon got used to it and loved all the little shops and street art that we walked past to get back to the hotel. We walked back between 11pm and midnight every evening and there was always lots of people around. The safe was free to use which I thought very good for a 3 star hotel. Our room was on the 6th floor at the back and was very quiet at night time. There was also a fridge which was great. The beds were lovely and comfatable and the shower was amazing - lovely and big. We did not eat breakfast as it was not included in our room rate and there were plenty of places to get a croissant and coffee, however I heard the breakfast was very good. The hotel is perfectly located to walk to many of the sights including The Picasso museum, La Rambla and Arc de Triomf. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently had the privilege of having a four night stay at the Musik Boutique Hotel with my girlfriend (staying 7 - 11 August 2018). The hotel is perfectly located about a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomf metro station and about a 10 minute from the hustle and bustle of the Las Ramblas strip, making it the perfect base for exploring all the points of interest in Barcelona. Despite being located in the Gothic quarter of the the city, the hotel is quite modernly decorated and furnished. The staff were warm and friendly and very helpful with recommending parts of Barcelona to see and was located near an array of amazing restaurants off the beaten track.Although the room was a double room, it was very spacious and came nicely equipped with a mini bar (although it would have been nice if it was pointed out that the things in the bar weren't complimentary). However, as it was such a good experience I would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn't think twice about using it again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a suite for a week and it was lovely and quite comfortable. Although we intended to book a hotel in El Born, and thought we had, it turned out we were on the outskirts. Still, it was fine and convenient to many of the sites. The staff was quite helpful and friendly. My only complaint was that breakfast was not included, which it should have been for the price, and the cleaners should have changed our dirty glasses once or twice during the week. And, be warned, taxis are reluctant to drive to the entrance of the hotel --- they're afraid they'll be stuck on the narrow streets. They'll pick you up at the hotel but will refuse to drop you off at the hotel, including at all hours of the night, so be prepared to walk 10 or 15 minutes to the hotel. The area is known for pick pockets and can be confusing too, so be aware of your surroundings.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was perfect. Close to so many good restaurants. The area felt safe. We had outstanding service from the staff. When we arrived, the room was not yet ready so we opted to wait in the lobby since it was so hot outside. We were kindly offered coffee. On the last day, we had to leave earlier than the start of breakfast service, and they kindly prepared the breakfast earlier so we were able to eat before leaving. A taxi was also booked for us. The room was perfect and so clean. We loved the modern bathroom, the free toiletries, the slippers. The beds were very comfortable. We also didnt hear anything from our neighbors. Wifi was perfect.We were on the last floor and in the middle of a heat wave, so the A/C had a bit of trouble cooling the room, but we were given a fan to help, which we appreciated. The breakfast was also outstanding; one of the best I've ever had in a hotel. I would stay there again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at this hotel was very nice. It is not overly convenient to public transportation, which was a problem when we were there since taxi's were on strike, but this was not the hotel's fault. They did, however, have a difficult time guiding us to how to take the public transportation. The room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was perfect and the staff, front desk, housekeeping and breakfast server were all helpful and nice.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to preface this statement by saying that I am a well-seasoned traveller and I am NOT picky by any means. This hotel is super cute, with comfortable rooms and super comfy pillows. The check-in staff was super friendly and was nice after a super delayed flight from Mallorca. However, there was a GIANT issue that makes me post this (I still have five more nights here, btw). My friend and I got a room five flights up, no big deal. When we checked in, we were told the elevator was broken but we could leave our bags downstairs and could get it when the elevator works again. Ok, I admit I was a little annoyed, but understand these things happen. I was super tired and stayed awake longer than I wanted until the elevator was fixed. Ultimately, it got fixed. The next day, my friend and I had a VERY long day of climbing steps and walking uphill all over Barcelona (I was super happy that I doubled my step goal for the day). On the way home from dinner, we were beat. I jokingly said “Wouldn’t it suck if the elevator was broken again?” I totally said this joking, as how could this happen two days in a row? It did. We got back and the elevator was broken again. The LAST thing I wanted to do was climb stairs after climbing all day. I’m paying money for a hotel with a lift. I HOPE this doesn’t happen every day. I’m very bummed. To those of you with luggage, be comfortable climbing five flights with it and climbing five flights to go back to your room. This hotel has all the makings for five stars, however, this glaring issue only gives it two. I would love to recommend this hotel to friends and family who travel frequently to Barcelona but unless things change, I unfortunately cannot.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated in a perfect location for exploring Barcelona, especially the gothic quarter and the old city. The rooms are exceptionally clean and spacious for a city Center hotel and offer comfortable beds and modern bathrooms. The staff are friendly, welcoming and very helpful, giving good advice and directions if required. This hotel is great for couples who want to walk around the city and explore what Barcelona has to offer!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small boutique hotel exceeded my expectations. We stayed at this hotel for a couple of days before getting on a cruise. We were greeted by Daniel at the front desk. He was very helpful in suggesting places to eat and to visit. Great customer service. The room was clean and a good size. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a good variety to choose from. The location was close to a number of places. I will not hesitate to choose this hotel if I ever visit Barcelona again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. The location was wonderful. It was so easy to walk to various sites. The hotel itself is clean and well maintained. It is a basic accommodation at a fair price. It could be improved by at least putting a hot water kettle with some coffee & tea in the room.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first trip to Spain- we landed in Barcelona but my luggage did not! Musik Boutique Hotel was our first stop and Daniel and the front desk staff called the airlines for me everyday to track it until it arrived(4 days later). Our room was beautiful and very modern. We asked to stay again on our last night in Barcelona and they put us in an upgraded room for the same price! Hotel Musik has a great location, though tucked away on a narrow street. At certain times of day, it is closed to cars so you may have to exit taxi and walk a short way to the hotel entrance. Close by the Arch de Triumphe, and Santa Catarina Market.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed 3 nights at this lovely little boutique hotel in the El Born district of Barcelona. Lively, artsy neighbourhood close to excellent restaurants like Elsa y Fred, Ginette and Quillo. 7 minutes walk to the Museo Picasso. Easy to get around anywhere from here or hail a cab at the end of the street to places further afield. Lots of warnings about pickpockets in Barcelona which we took seriously. Just walk with confidence and keep your phones etc secured and all is well. Quite a lot of activity in the neighbourhood by day and at night it gets pretty quiet. The hotel was excellent. The front end staff were all very helpful and accommodating. We really enjoyed our stay here and would come back again. Thank you, Musik Boutique!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked at Musik Boutique Hotel for the night before a cruise. We were pleased with the accomodations. The room is small but it has everything that you need. The location is amazing. You can walk to every place of interest. The staff was beyond friendly. The hotel manager even left a handwritten hote at our room to welcome us.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am always impressed by Europeans who speak such beautiful English and so few Americans including myself are fluent in another language. The staff at this hotel spoke such beautiful English and had an amazing grasp of current America. Very impressive!! And patient!! Our taxi driver even called for directions and they guided him to the front door (through a tiny street!)This hotel is in a perfect location. Our favorite part of Barcelona was the gothic section and we were right there!! So convenient to everything!!Shower was spectacular!!Bed comfy. Clean! Clean! Clean!Breakfast was delicious with the most perfect eggs I have ever seen!Upon arrival, a welcoming note and bottle of cava awaited us!! This was a special trip for us and this was the only hotel to acknowledge this! We were truly touched! Thank you!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A small hotel, close to everything - Rambla, seafront, a bit of a hike to Sagrada Familla but we did it no problem. Super-clean bathrooms which for me is a major issue. Nice mattress. Located on quiet street. Front desk staff is very helpful. Your room key will come with a pouch showing suggested local restaurants. These suggestions are excellent, we in particular loved Ginette. The only negative, for which we cannot blame the hotel, was that one night we were getting back late, close to midnight and were harassed by a couple of guys. I guess this is a price to pay for being located on a small street, on the balance this is very minor. Our breakfast was not included and having tried a couple of places first two days we opted to have breakfasts in the hotel - worth extra 10 euros. Certainly will book again when we travel to Barcelona next time.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is immaculate, quirky and in the perfect location to explore Barcelona. The staff are so helpful and friendly too. We were even left a little note in the room on arrival wishing us a good stay! The room is modern and has a surround sound system for playing music in the room. We paid the €10 for breakfast a few days and it was worth it. Lots of choice and easy to decide on the day if you want to have breakfast. The hotel is situated 5 minutes walk away from the gothic quarter and cathedral, nearest tube station and about 10 minutes from Las Rambles. Whilst in Barcelona we visited the port, beach, Mount Tibidabo, Nou Camp and Park Güell. We felt safe for the majority and just kept our belongings close by. There are lots of people asking you if you want to buy drugs (even during the day) but we just ignored them. Would definitely recommend staying here to explore Barcelona, relax and a bit of luxury.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely hotel in the heart of the city in the Gothic area. Close walking distance to Las Ramblas and other attractions. Nice small hotel, decorated with modern furniture, with only 23 rooms. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included with our booking and provided an excellent variety of items. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights, very nice, small hotel, clean and tidy. Staff were very attentive and helpful-nothing too much trouble- breakfasts were very good and well worth the 10€Local to most places, metro 10 min walk.Would recommend
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and convenient small size hotel in the heart of the city. I would recommend it to anyone (couples or families). Everything was as expected, clean, friendly and very convenient for nearby nights out. We only had breakfast once (which was good), but since it is inside the heart of the city center, we used it only once since we opted for the other plenty nearby local options. The room and the hotel is as shown in the hotel photos.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights and I can really recommend this hotel. Good and calm location, super friendly and service minded staff. Everything was clean and fresh. Ps, breakfast is cheaper to add to your booking at the hotel than adding to your reservation via booking.com..
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recommend this hotel for location, service and comfort. The front desk staff was terrific, especially Daniel, who was very patient answering our seemingly endless questions. Location was handy. My husband and I walked to many of the sights we wanted to see. Excellent restaurants within walking distance, too. Located in the Gothic Quarter, on a street with many nice little shops. The rooms were nicely decorated and clean.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a trendy, clean hotel in the center. The receptionists are superkind, and the rooms are perfectly clean.I would go there again. Als the location is very good, close to Via laietana and plaza catalunya.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awful service and unacceptable attitude to guests. Our team including the clients that our company hosted in Musik Boutique Hotel experienced a number of issues during check in, transfers, and last but not least, charges. We had to consistently complain to hotel in order to have the very basic service a day before checking out. 8 rooms for a week including transfers of 2 mini vans were paid well in advance by our company and the service offered was consistently poor, adding unnecessary stress to our business trip. Rooms on the back side of the hotel look at a really dirty space last cleaned years ago. The front desk manager didn’t allow us to pass our disappointment to the General Manager of the hotel and we had to make a lot of noise for a paid service. Facilities of the hotel are also poor, no room service available for meals, no restaurant.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights from 19th Feb. Arrived mid afternoon to great receptionist looking out all the good sight seeing to do. On arrival in our room we were very impressed, spacious rooms, comfy beds and everything you could need. The location of the hotel was perfect around a 10 minute walk to the catalunya square where you can travel throughout the city. Would 100% recommend this hotel and would happily stay again.
hotelName:
21    Musik Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at the Hotel Arc La Rambla. The rooms were quiet and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The hotel is in a wonderful location. This was our second time staying at this hotel and will do so again next time we are in Barcelona.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 days stay. Staff really helpful -got us tickets to football game as well as other enquiries. Room small but clean. Very Central to what our wants were. Really fun area to stay in.Breakfast available.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very well located on the bottom end of the Rambla. Easy walk to many attractions, shops transport etc. the room was compact but reasonable. Small fridge, no tea coffee. Good bathroom. Quiet room for sleeping. The biggest issue I had was with a green led exit light in the room. It illuminated the whole room at night. Drove me mad. Breakfast was good but if you go down after 9.30 lots of food has run out and they don’t seem to replenish. Otherwise reasonably comfortable
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location, if you want to be in the middle of it all, is superb. Close to everything, not far to the famous fountains (taxi prob best) but only a short walk to the marina and the beach. The staff were friendly on arrival and gave us leaflets for local attractions and also helped us sort a taxi on the first evening. We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking La Rambla and had a little terrace which was nice to step on to and soak up the atmosphere. The soundproofing wasn’t bad either. Complimentary water in the room replaced every day was a welcome touch. Small points about the room but ones of note. Our room was dark!! That said it’s an old building and this time of year there are still leaves in the trees which are in front of the terrace door so that likely name it darker. There was no power supply near a mirror (other than the one in the bathroom which got foggy after showering) which, as a girl, I found annoying as we have things like hair straighteners to use and no mirror to stand in front of. The table in the room was a bit tired, the veneer was peeling on the legs and people had fairly obviously used the table to open beer bottles in the past. The other thing neither of us liked one bit were the little cushions placed on top of our pillows each day. they smelt! Old and musty and god knows how long since they had been cleaned. We put them on the chair each day and each day they were put back on the bed. No thank you!! Overall it’s a good place to stay to be right in the middle of it all but if we go back to Barcelona we won’t stay there again- id much sooner pay for something worth the money further out of the city.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice 3 star hotel, excellent location. Staff is very polite, Christina in reception was especially helpful and pleasant. Although the hotel is right on the Ramblas, we asked for a quiet room and there was no noise at all
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here based on its location. Was fairly expensive but rooms very large. Good balcony to relax. Service was excellent with the staff booking all our adventures for us and giving us great advice and recommendations. Did not have any food as there is plenty around the area. Only negative was the bed being 2 singles joined. Not to comfy. But otherwise all good.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly, not a bad hotel for the price. We only selected a room only package for 3 nights. We requested for there to be a kettle in the roll and this was given to us from the first night. An iron and ironing board was also given upon request. Everyday you get 2 fresh bottles of water. Only downside is my room was located near the cafe so we could hear music playing in our room. Also the shower head was a bit stiff and only pointed in 1 direction. All the staff are lovely and help you out with anything you need including metro travel and places to visit. Would recommend to couples and friends.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Excellent location.Center of the Town.Very nice rooms.Very comfortableKosher restaurants in five minutes walking distance (makabi).Be aware to the pickpockets guys...Lots of tourists
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with a nice restaurant although breakfast may not be included. Staff was helpful when we needed advice on things to do. Only complaint was the location of the shower handle. I couldn’t turn around without turning it off.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were on the smaller side but very comfortable, The free WiFi and the meeting area in the lobby were also very good. The location was excellent on one of the busiest streets in Barcelona. Lots of great eating places around and the place was clean
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just arrived back from a five night stay at arc la rambla Hotel , fantastic location, lovely room over looking la rambla with a small veranda, close the doors and the noise from outside vanishes meaning a good night's sleep, two bottles of water left in the room daily and beds made and towels changed, good sized fridge and a safe free to use, room and bathroom spotlessly clean with free toiletries, breakfast is definitely well worth the cost with plenty of choice of food and drink each morning, the staff on the reception desk are excellent, nothing is to much trouble and they always welcome you with a smile (extra thank you to Andrea on reception who helped me out with a phone call regarding shuttle pick up times being changed) if I had one minor issue it would be that even though you can ask at reception for a kettle I'd have loved there to be tea/coffee making facilities in the room but other than that this hotel should be proud of itself and I'd recommend anyone to go stay there. One very happy, relaxed customer, thank you.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family room was perfect for 2 kids (3 and 6). Clean, big bathroom, nice rooftop terrace for a picnic, smoking or kids to cool down or play. Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Walking distance to many attractions.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in room 509 August 14-16. This room is amazing for 3 or 4 guests, it has 2 levels, 2 bathrooms and a huge terrace with outdoor shower. Hotel staff was excellent, breakfast every morning was awesome. We usually stay in 5 star but highly recommend the Arc for its location, customer service and standard of accomodation. We'll be back next time!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is situated toward the bottom end of the La Rambla, close to the marina, which makes the location ideal. We found the hotel to well presented, clean and tidy upon arrival.Room - Our room was what you expect from a 3 start hotel, but will say that that the room was clean, had good AC, a good safe, and fairly comfortable beds. The room also had a balcony which looked out to the El Ravel area. Where it was not the most picturesque view, I found it to be a nice touch to the room. They have free Wi-Fi, though unfortunately, not the most consistent in connection. I often found myself using the data from my phone. Staff – Reception staff were very professional and processed us quite quickly when checking in/out. I found the chambermaid/cleaning staff to be very friendly and often cleaned our rooms daily to a very good standard. All in all, I would say that we had a good stay and would recommend.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would we stay again ...9/10Where we disappointed ...definitely NotValue for money....excellentNoise from La Rambla....Yes. But hey we are Cranky OAP we enjoyed the ambience Go stay at the Hilton if you want a sterile HolidayBreakfast ...Good slightly better then We expected Our Room was on on the 4th floor overlooking La Rambla...Room 408 not large but better then London Hotel rooms. We Are from Australia so unsure of value for $$$$ but we left with getting value for money 5 stars for position
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights and was pleasantly surprised at this hotel. Rooms have air con, free safe, fridge, clean towels daily and bottles of water supplied daily. The breakfast room is a hidden gem and has everything you want for breakfast. The bonus is the roof top garden with sun loungers which we used instead of going to the beach. Would definitely recommend
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. People at the front desk were very nice and friendly.Rooms were rather small. Two twin beds pulled together and a small desk. Had to upgrade for €35/day. Got a room that was slightly bigger. Balcony was a joke. I’ll say 12 inches deep. The hotel was fully booked. So we got a room on the 1st floor(2nd for Americans). Breakfast was €13. You get 20% discount if you’ll eat there for 3 days. This hotel is conveniently located right on La Rambla. Market, supermarket, Metro station,shopping center around Plaza Catalunya were within walking distance. 20 minutes walk to the beach.Before you book make up your mind what do you prefer-Peaceful environment or loud music, drunken people screaming and fighting . La Rambla is a street where they sell souvenirs and have subpar places to eat.The whole area architecture wise is rather gloomy. All buildings are of dirty yellowish color. It is interesting to explore. Especially around 8 am and if you love photography. If you walk away from this area then you’ll be able to see locals not just tourists. Barcelona is beautiful and people are nice.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Barcelona for the first time and this was the perfect location! We were able to walk everywhere. The restaurants that are next to the hotel aren’t the best but there are plenty of other amazing places to eat not too far away. The room was small but pretty typical for what you get in Europe. It worked out perfectly for us, we would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in an excellent location (bottom of Las Ramblas) and we felt because of this it was great value for money. We were impressed with the cleanliness (rooms were serviced on a daily basis with bottles of water left in the room fridge). The staff were helpful and friendly and the room also had a safe, air con and terrace. There were lockers (€2 to use) to store luggage which was really handy as although a later check out than some hotels (12pm) we had an evening flight.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Right on Las Ramblas, they were fully booked and did not offer early check-in. They offer to hold your luggage until check-in, at 1400. There is a holding area with one computer that provided internet access, a TV, 2 chaise lounger, several chairs, and tables. Very helpful staff. I had a second-floor balcony room. Perfect! There was a bit of noise but no real issues, the balcony doors were semi soundproof. The room was clean and the air conditioning unit worked, you have to stand directly below the unit and point the remote at it! Very comfortable.There are patio restaurants and bistros all around. There were a convenience store and a pharmacy across the street.Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The room, a junior suite was good. Clean, comfortable bed. Take note - they make you sign a document that says you'll have no one in your room. As a single traveller I incorrectly assumed they meant not having anyone else staying in the room. Yes - I should have read the document before signing. Anyway - I took friends from another hotel up to see my room. On showing my friends out - about 5 mins - the reception guy (Chilean) berated me for violating the document. I couldn't even explain to him what I assumed it meant. Every time I tried to speak he shouted over me. Then he says "Barcelona has 80 million visitors and I don't care if you don't come back", and he pointed to the cameras and said "they are everywhere". In the end I said, yes you're right and just walked off.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for before and after a cruise. Cruise shuttle bus stop is about a 5 to 10 minute walk. They have convenient, secure luggage lockers. The staff was very helpful and spoke very good English.Our first night we had a small room. It was small, but it was sufficient. After our cruise, they upgraded our room to a much larger room with a balcony overlooking LaRambla! Both rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from an amazing holiday in Barcelona. The hotel was beautiful and clean and right in the middle of everything you could need.The staff were so helpful with booking day trips out and also helped with a birthday suprise for my boyfriend. We will return as so much still to see and experience.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two night at this hotel and the location was superb, right on La Rambla. The hotel was nice and clean and the breakfast was good with a nice selection. The room was probably the smallest we've ever stayed in but the hotel do state this before booking, small balcony but no view. The bathroom needed a bit of updating and general TLC but the room was adequate for our two night stay.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Arc La Rambla were amazing!!! Very helpful, attention to detail and great service. I was greeted with a very warm welcome, suggestions on the attractions and things to do. Any information I needed they provided at ease and efficiently.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Right on Las Ramblas, Easy check in. Very helpful staff. we had a front balcony room and we were worried about the noise from the street, needn’t have as the doors are pretty much completely soundproof. Breakfast was ok, though the toaster literally takes around 10 minutes. Clean room and bathroom. Very comfortable. Could’ve done with another chair for the balcony. Plenty of plug sockets, a working fridge which was useful. The safe in the room didn’t work though.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of four stayed in a great apartment in El Born neighborhood last week. We returned to Barcelona from Costa Brava for our last two days , and I decided to stay some place a little different. Las Ramblas is not our favorite hang out, but I loved looking down on the scene from our balcony . Our teenagers room had a largish terrace that looked out back, at the the graffiti and narrow streets. We ate lunch there from the good we brought back from the Boqueterua Market . I liked being close to Raval. We spent a Kate Saturday night at an outdoor neighborhood party/concert ( Raval Against the Machine) after a fantastic meal at Na Mindona. I wouldn’t want to be here for our whole stay, but perfect for a couple nights.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Barcelona 2 days prior to getting on a Cruise! This hotel is amazing! Cute balcony right on La Rambla Street! Very clean.Short ride to port. Central location for shopping and great cuisine. There is a bank across the street in order to get currency exchange. I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in June 2019. Service: 4 stars. Overall decent service. They were helpful only when you ask. Seem a little impatient with our tourist questions for restaurants and transportations. We were supposed to check in at 2pm but they delayed it til 2:40pm and we end having to run and rush to our tour by 3pm. They prepared lunch bags for us cuz we had a 6:45am tour and breakfast hour starts at 7am. Amenity: 3 stars. room size a bit tight but it seems standard for most Europe hotels. The shower head was super high so I couldn't reach to adjust angles. AC works fine. Breakfast was better than expected I wish I had more time to enjoy. WiFi speed is decent. You can rent lockers to put away your luggage for early check out or waiting to check in. Location: 4 stars. very convinient in the heart of La Rambla. 5 minute walk to must sightseeing places and restaurants. It was surprisingly quiet at night considering it's on a big street. Safety reminder: we were robbed in the early morning 6:30am on our way from hotel to tour meeting spot. Couple teenagers robbed our phone straight off my husband's hand and ran away. Stay alert if you head out in early morning or late evenings. Be careful when using google map on your phone.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is modern with our room being a bit minimalistic in furnishings. The rooms are clean and the beds were decent. The doors from our room and the rooms in the area of our room shut noisily. There was a sign on our door asking you to shut the door softly. The staff was helpful in directing us to less pricey restaurants off the beaten path. The location is good.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is ideally situated right on La Rambla ,so it's perfectly situated for any visitor and especially for those with reduced mobility. The staff are wonderful, cannot do enough for you. Any request is handled quickly and efficiently. The staff were very helpful when I needed an adapted taxi for my wheelchair-bound husband. The accessible bedroom and bathroom were very good-plenty of room to wheel in under the handbasin, perfect roll-in shower,grabrails in correct position.The only setback in this hotel is the size of the lift to the bedroom-you would not be able to manoeuvre a power chair in and out of it due to its positioning. We had a manual wheelchair so it was ok.Overall this hotel is perfectly suited to a person with reduced mobility or a disabled person who has a companion with him/her.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it! Location, Staff, cleanliness etc were amazing! We have absolutely no complaints! It wasn’t an expensive hotel. In fact it was great value for money!I would definitely stay here again next time I visit Barcelona!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has great location..right in the middle of Las Ramblas...walkable..shop..many bars and restaurant around..great transportation.close to train station..a few steps from colon plaza's..staff was very helpful and friendly...
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best location în heart of Barcelona. Great breakfast. Great espresso coffee.home made bread At breakfast. Good clean Room.Personal At The reception very nice.they offered US all Information we need. very silent în The heart on city
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this wonderful city with so many great things to see and experience and this hotel is right in the heart of Barcelona! We loved our stay here...from the spacious room, wonderful and friendly service, great breakfast and the best location ever! We would definitely return.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A super friendly, clean and well located hotel. We were staying with an 8 and an 11 year old who both loved the hotel and the friendly staff. The room was very clean and well equipped and the location itself is fantastic, just at the bottom of La Rambla where it’s not too busy, but within easy reach of the metro, barri gothic and the port. Will definitely stay again the next time we are in Barcelona.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived just after midnight and the area outside was ‘lively’ but after a smooth check in we went to our room and it was very quiet and peaceful. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean - and kept that way by the cleaners during our 3 day visit. I’d booked a room with a small terrace and it was lovely to have our own outside space. It was at the back of the hotel so no view of La Ramblas but that was good as it was so peaceful. Great location for a short visit to Barcelona - near the bus stop, metro or to walk around the Marina or La Ramblas area. Great weekend and I wouldn’t hesitate to book again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our third visit to Hotel and was thoroughly enjoyable very comfortable rooms and exceptionally well positioned close to Metro and bars, shops and all the Sites of Barcelona. Will return again in the near future.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night before our cruise and I wish it could have been more. We were lucky enough to be upgraded which we really did appreciate. The staff were so helpful, check on was quick and our room was spotless. It is an easy walk to the port and then shuttle to the terminal. We overlooked the Ramblas but the noise was only in the background. Had a great night's sleep and feel ready to join our ship in great spirits.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are helpful and friendly and the hotel is spotless. Excellent location for exploring Barcelona. Our room was ready straight away when we arrived from an early flight which was a huge bonus as it gave us the rest of the day to get out and explore. We will definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean, and the staff was friendly. The room was a little smaller than we thought it would be but it was comfortable. There is parking available across the street which is a plus, and the hotel helps get that organized for you. Awesome location - right on the bustling La Rambla stretch, mere steps to the gothic quarter.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect. Lovely duplex room with huge balcony leading from bedroom. Breakfast was great, hot and cold selection. Staff very welcoming and helpful. Easy walk to all attractions and beach. Will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect, perfect, perfect! My Nan & Grandad booked a trip to Barcelona as a surprise for my 21st birthday, so I'm not exactly sure how expensive this hotel is but I would 100% stay here again! Lovely, modern, spotless hotel.. The location was AMAZING, more towards the sea end of Las Ramblas, but still pretty central. I saw some reviews saying the rooms were poor, but ours was lovely.. We had one of the rooms at the front of the hotel with a balcony, nice size room, modern, clean and spacious.. I understand these rooms are more expensive but well worth it! Staff were friendly, they helped us purchase our hop-on-hop-off bus tickets.. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, I really hope to return one day! :)
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff very helpful. Great location for sight seeing, handy for the port and underground trains. Beds very comfortable and room nice and clean. The only downside was the room was very dark, the window opened into a small light well we were on the first floor and the light came from 5 floors up. We had to go outside to find out what the weather was like. Apart from that we had a very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: second time that we stay in the hotel, the location of the hotel is perfect, close to the harbor and on the Ramblas. Very clean rooms and nice and helpfull staff. Every morning a complete breakfast. We arrived at 9.30 am but that was not a problem. We left the trolleys in the lockers and at 2 Pm the room was ready. On the last day it was possible to have a late check-out at 5 Pm for 50€ extra.Next time we visit Barcelona we will stay in the same hotel.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights before going on a cruise and found it to be central to the places we wanted to go.Next door there is a small Irish pub that comes to life in the late afternoon.Close to all your shopping needs. The hotel has a good breakfast for a price or you can have it included in your accommodation fee.The rooms are clean and modern and the beds were very comfortable. I would most defiantly stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our accommodation was pristine, comfortable and convenient. However, during a heavy thunderstorm, I requested a teabag from the front desk as there was an electric kettle in my room, and my husband felt chilled. I am 81! My husband is 85 and has Parkinsons Disease! I was told 1) "We do not provide teabags to our guests." 2) "You can buy them in a supermarket."In decades of travel I have never encountered such a UNIQUE notion of HOSPITALITY.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel in Europe at least twice a year. This hotel is awesome. Great location and the staff is so helpful. Speaking English was easy for both of us. Less than a block to a Metro station. The staff was so helpful explaining how to get around the city. Upgrade to the terrace room - well worth it. The rooms were large with wonderful amenities. Just like the pictures. Also get the breakfast. It was so yummy!! I would totally stay here again if I'm ever in Barcelona and I highly recommend it to any other travelers!!!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arc La Rambla Hotel is clean, comfortable and well located. Interior is updated and very nicely appointed. I would recommend Arc la Rambla to anyone looking for a great city center location. Extensive breakfast buffet with fresh breads, fruit, eggs, bacon, meats, and pastries. Can't beat the location and the noise outside is not an issue. There are new double glazed windows in the rooms.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful trip, great hotel and staff. The room was clean and spacious. The staff helped us with all our trips, advice and made it so easy for us. The breakfast was excellent value.The location was perfect for the port, Gothic and Rambles.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in an ideal location, the entrance opens out right onto La Ramla and the location is also close to most of the tourist sites of the city. We had a double room at the front with a balcony looking over La Rambla. Our visit happened to coincide with the Barca v Liverpool game so La Rambla was VERY lively. Very good test for the soundproofing but no problems with noise once the balcony doors were closed and the curtains drawn. Room was adequate size with a comfortable bed, good shower and ample storage and wardrobe space plus free safe.Reception staff ,especially "Sonia", friendly and very helpful.Good Breakfast Buffet. No other restaurant facilities but direct access from Reception to the Tapas Bar next door and all the restaurants on La Rambla just outside the front door.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great. La Rambla is out the front door with lots to see and do. The room was small...two twins, a desk and chair, and a reasonable toilet and shower bathroom. We were on the 4th floor near the rear so there was no street noise, but a lot of hallway noise. The a/c was stubborn. I had to ask twice for extra pillows. This was their cheapest room, but still pricey for what you get. I doubt I would stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location on La Rambla! Everything was nice and clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We celebrated a big birthday during our stay and when we came back in the afternoon the room was prepared with confetti on the bed and a Birthday Greeting, very appreciated!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located in La Rambla. Close to the metro station and bus stops. There are plenty of restaurants around. Breakfast is great and staff is very helpful. I would stay there again. This is a very busy and noise street, so ask for a room at the far back so the noise doesn’t disturb you at night.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Arc La Rambla
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a place to stay in Barcelona for a weekend visit, this is a really good choice. Close to Plaça Catalunya, Sagrada Familia aswell as the Hop-on Hop-off busses at Casa Batlló (about 5-7 min walk).When arriving we got a really good introduction to Barcelona and a map where the guy in the reception marked places for us to visit. The room was very nice, clean and modern, if i were to mention something that was not so good it would be the sound/noise that you can hear from other rooms/corridor outside your room. Next to the hotel there is a supermarket for every-day needs and across the street there is a really nice restaurant named "Lokal Bar".There are plenty of cafés close by where you can eat breakfast since the hotel does not offer that service.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled three of us. The room was clean with good AC, covenient to go many places and didn't hear loud noses from other rooms nor street. Located walking distance to Sagrada Familia, major brand shopping street. The restaurantes and cafes close by were very reasonablly priced and delicious. Recommend to go La Musclira for seafood dinner right next door. But the bathroom smelled very bad. I am assuming coming from old drainage pipes. They could have used fresher bath towels. Front desk person was helpful fro getting around places.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in May in the Economy Triple Budget room. There was nothing Triple about it. The double rooms next door were the same size. Ours only had an extra bed. Even the double room is really tiny. And expensive at 100 euros a day.There is no table in the room to keep your things. Near the bed there is a small shelf 6 cm x 4 cm. Enough space to keep a smartphone. Ridiculous. Nothing else can be placed on the table. We actually had to keep our glasses, keys, watch on top of our bags.No kettle in the rooms. So you can forget hot water for tea coffee. And the coffee machine and water machine in the lobby did not work for the entire 4 days we were there. I complained about this on the 2nd day and the reception arranged a kettle for me.The location is good yes. But I really cannot recommend this hostal to families. For singles/ backpackers maybe yes. But again at €100 a night it is just too expensive and for a room which does not even have a table!I've done a lot of reviews on Tripadvisor if you see my profile, and I've mostly given 4 or 5 star ratings to even 1-star hotels because of the value they give. But Martinval has to get 1-star rating only. The rooms are just ridiculously tiny. They need to drop the price by 40% to come to fair value.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is well located in the center of Barcelona. The room was clean but minimum comfort. The shared bathroom was very clean which was nice. Room 120 has a balcony which is a plus. Fairly good deal.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a few nights in the hostal and it was amazing. I definitely agree that this hostal should have an elevated rating. The staff are so welcoming and friendly, they helped answer all my questions and upon arrival provided us with a map highlighting the main attractions. They are always happy to assist you and we enjoyed our stay here - also prior to our stay I would email the hostal and they would always reply so promptly which was so helpful. Will not hesitate to book again. It is very central and close to main sites as well as close to many restaurants. Loved our stay!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent location. Cleaner in every day. Shampoo and little extras provided. Doors to balcony were a nightmare to close. No kettle which was disappointing. We were on the fourth floor and the lift broke down the last two days of our stay. Overall ok but I wouldn’t go back.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff on reception were really helpful and friendly, the room was large and comfortable. Whilst it could have done with some tlc and the furnishngs are fairly basic it was clean and really well maintained and the bed was very comfy.If all you want from a hotel for a city break is a well located, clean and comfy room to come back to at the end of a day exploring you couldn't get better value for money.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here for Chelsea vs Barcelona, decent sized bed and tv. Fit for it's purpose as somewhere to sleep and shower. Would recommend with mates or as a couple but maybe not for families. Nice distance from the city.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely apartment. Much bigger than we expected. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Air con room. Nice old fashioned lift in the building. Good location -surrounded by shops and restuarants. Nice tapas restarants nearby.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the 3 bed apartment for a short city break as two adults and two older children. I think we struck lucky with Hostal Martinvale- the apartment was much larger than expected, spotless and complete with air con. It is centrally located and the only slight issue was the small sign that you could miss. Reception is in the first floor and we must mention Christian who was such a kind, helpful member of the team he really went the extra mile (he is also an honorary scouser which helps!).The apartment was cleaned every day and toiletries were left for all to use. It would be perfect for self catering with a large fridge freezer and hob with a Spar next door, but our 2 days were spent eating out. Everything was within walking distance and we felt safe. Would we stay again? Yes!!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in mid june for 2 days. The location is not too far away from the happening areas at La Rambla and we walked to and fro without any problems. There are loads of shops nearby for food or to buy things you need.The Big sagrada church is also nearby.The best thing about his place is the staff. They go out of their way to help you. The two young women who were at the reception were very friendly and gave us a lot of advice on where to go and what to see.There an ancient lift in this hotel which is something to see in itself.I recommend fully. The price is very reasonable and the service exceptional.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: great location, big spacious triple room, clean and updated, balconies, fun antique elevator, 24 hour front deskCons: uncomfortable beds, zero air conditioning, thin walls, faulty outlets, extra hidden charges at check in
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 100euro pr. night and they do not provide "hand-soaps" in the bathroom. Rooms are not so clean, and the people at the reception are not very kind.However, the location of the hostel is good. You can to Pl. Catalonya in 15 min.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 3 nights on March with my friends at this Hostel. We arrived early morning and there was no problem leave our luggage there until late check-in. People on the reception are very nice and helpful (I have also very good experience with email communication before booking). Hostel is in great location just about 10min walking time to Sagrada. Building is old but rooms are nice and clean with every day housekeeping. Our room had balcony which was great. If I come back to Barcelona, I will book the same Hostel for sure . Thank you
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a hostel the level of service is really high. The rooms are clean and tidy, and they changed our sheets and towels every single day. It is a great location, waling distance from almost all the famous sightseeing.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was quit old. We didn’t have a good heating at our room and even after complaining twice, the staff told us that this was not possible because the rest of the hotel was hot. Very noise place Bad experience
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can't really expect much considering the price. The room was small and clean, so it is a good choice, if you don't plan to stay in it much. The staff was friendly. Hostel is in a nice district, not far from Sagrada familia. However, I would recommend taking a bus or metro to reach other parts of the city. The only reall disadvantage was very poor WiFi. Overall quite nice experience in a budget hostel.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay here for 5 nights. The room was so clean, basic and comfortable. Aimilia at the reception was so helpful and kind. The location was good near Sagrada familia and casa Battlo. We had great breakfast at Balaurd, a bakery at carrer del Provenca, 2 blocks away from the hostal. The room was quite because the balkony looks at the back side of the building. Some noise from the next door people but this wasn`t big deal. All the time hot water, every day cleaning the room, new towels.Thank you, guys
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Luckily stumbled across this Hostel on Bookings.com and I'm so glad I did. We had a triple room with an ensuit booked (room 33). The room itself was just big enough for 3 but the bathroom was a great size.We were given towels and toiletries in our room and refreshments were available in the reception area. The staff at Hostal Martinval were all very attentive and helpful with emails prior to our visit and during our stay. The location of the hostel is great. It's a 10 to 15 minute walk from the central area and there are lots of cafes and restaurants near by. I would definitely book here again and recommend it for a short stay in Barcelona.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is like a crossover between a hostel and hotel. Spacious room and bathroom. Can't really complain about the actual room itself. I would have expected a little more comfortable beds for the price. Also the couple times we were out late we got yelled at by security even though we were not being loud. It's as if they did not want people to go out at night at all. They were very rude following us to our rooms. The location was pretty good. All in all okay stay but there may be better options out there.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon checking in, we were immediately given tips on where to go to eat, to shop and sight see by the member of staff at reception. The staff in general were very helpful and lent us an iron and an adapter plug when we needed one. They also have a safe to store important items such as passports in.The location of the hostal was perfect as we were around 10 minutes walk from Sagrada Familia and Passeig De Gracia which was super convenient. If you're worrying about food then that's not an issue as there's a SPAR right next door to the place where you can buy fresh watermelon, water and cakes for super cheap. I recommend going to NOSTRUM which is on the same road for breakfast/lunch as it's super cheap and tastes great. There's also an ice cream parlour directly opposite the hostal which is always a plus.The only issue that we did have however was the noise. Particularly if your room is facing the street you'll find that you can practically hear everything and anything such as litter trucks to pedestrians speaking loudly. Because of this I only recall sleeping well only once, which was a shame. The fact that we had noisy neighbours didn't help. Overall we had a positive experience with this hostal and is perfect for short stays.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked an economy double room for 4 nights. The room perfectly clean with brilliant, spacious en-suite. Towels and toiletries provided and replaced each time the room was cleaned by the housekeepers. (Who weren't intrusive at all!) The friendliest + most helpful staff ever answered all our questions, provided us with a map and detailed for us all the attractions and how to get to each. Even taught us the metro system and arranged our taxi to the airport at the end of our stay which was extremely helpful! Walking distance from metro, Sagrada and La Pedrera with 24hr supermarkets and quaint local restaurants/cafes just down the street. (Check out the 'Palermo restaurant' 2 mins walk away for quality tapas and coffee.) Wifi a little slow at peak times in the evening however all in all a comfortable and safe stay in the heart of Barcelona!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay in Barcelona. Clean, enough space, good mattress and close of many attractions in the city. There is always someone in reception in case you need something. Very friendly staff. My sisters and I enjoy our stay here.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and nice, the room had a beautiful balcony as well! The matress was a tad hard on the back but it was still alright! Close to town and main attractions and people working there were so nice and polite! Will probably stay there again when back there!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was very nice! We had a room for two persons with our own bathroom. Pros: very friendly and helpfull staff, very good location, no noise from outside, new towels every day. Cons: the elevator was very old (not sure how safe it was), we could here our noisy neighbours from the other room. As a pregnant women I would have needed a bit better bed and a pillow... Definitely would recommend!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean room (are cleaning every day), friendly staff and the most famous attractions are near the hostal. I would come back again. If you have any requests, just ask the hostel's staff. They will help in any situation.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is located 15 mins walking from Placa Catalunya and around 5 mins away from Psg de Gracia and Gaudi's famous buildings. There are lot of nice restaurants and cafes nearby and a number of grocery shops.The staff were really nice and helpful and spoke really good English. The reception was open 24/7 which was a huge advantage. We had a room with a bathroom which was great. But the bathroom's floor was not profiled properly and everytime we took a shower the whole bathroom's floor got flooded. Our room had two windows but when we opened them we found out that there are shafts there so there was no daylight reaching our room whatsoever. We spent the whole days outside but it is nice to see bright sun in the morning especially in a place like Barcelona. There was a smell, I think it was coming from the bathroom or from these shafts and you could hear people in other rooms or apartments using toilet because of these shafts behind the window. Generally though, the hostel is a good base for tourists to get some sleep and rest ;)
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were here during a 5 day sightseeing tour. The hotel is loacated in an old house in the middle of the city. The elevator is scary first but it is cool after that. The rooms are separated with slim walls, but Its not problem because I couldnt hear the neighbors. The room had coolig and heating as well, the bathroom was big, and the bed was comfortable. I would come back here any time.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a long weekend with my gf. It was good value for money (location, cleaniness, room, staff). Man called Alvin at the reception was really helpful with everything. Grocery store 50m away + metro and bus also close. Only downside is AC which is not possible to adjust or turn off. Therefore I rate this place 1 point down.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the beginning, the hotel seemed reasonable. However, we had to share the bathroom with another couple, who took ages when they used the shower. Also, we had an incident with a man that lives there In the attic. He was incredibly rude to me and made us feel really uncomfortable. If you want to have a good holiday in Barcelona, I would advise you to find a different hotel, because this man lives there and if you have a problem with him it will ruin the whole experience.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostel Martinval is centrally located, approximately a 10 minute walk from Passieg de Gràcia station. I emailed the Hostal before my arrival for advice on travelling from the airport and received a prompt reply listing various options. I ultimately choose to travel by train, purchasing a T-10 ticket which I found to be economical and simple (the ticket can be used for 10 journeys on the train/metro so I travelled with it to and from the airport with a couple of other metro uses too, all for 10 euros) I had booked a double room which was spacious with both a double bed, single bed, small desk, ikea wardrobe and a small balcony. A plug in electric radiator was also in the room which I appreciated as I am sensitive to the cold! The bathroom was shared with one other room and was spacious with a good shower and plenty of hot water. The building itself has a charm to it, with some nice original features. I didn't have much interaction with the staff but they seemed friendly on check in and check out.My only complaint is that it was very noisy. I am not sure who was above me, but in the evening and in the mornings there was alot of banging which sounded like children running about. I only stayed two nights and it did wake me one morning.
