Also when the guests in the room next door were returning at night it was very loud; heels clanging on laminate flooring and the bedroom / bathroom doors banging. Noise seems to travel through the building quite easily. I would not describe the accommodation as a hostel given that you are provided with towels, shower gel etc and there are no dorm rooms as far as I am aware. It is more of a budget hotel.I am quite particular about noise as I like a good night of sleep so I maybe would not stay here again. However overall I think it is good value for money and worth a try.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a four night stay there. Clean comfortable rooms. Friendly helpful staff. will definately be back. It was very central to the main shopping areas and nearby metro was superb for getting around the city
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here. The room was clean and there was a nice big bathroom, and the hostal is in a good location near a metro station that goes to the airport. However we were in a room right by reception and it was very loud at night because you could hear people coming and going at all hours. Also it would be nice if they did breakfast or had a vending machine or something (there was a coffee machine but it didn't seem to work), however there is a Spar over the road.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly stuff.Perfect location.A place where you feel like home.For my short stay of 4 days i had tidy &clean room every day.There is everything you need clean towels,showergel,shampoo and other hygienic things every day on your stay.It was winter time so we had warm and cozy feeling in the room.Next time i will choose again this place.Highly recommend it!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent four nights in Hostal Martinval with two of my friends. We were given a 2nd floor room at the front of the building.Towels, Shower gel, shampoo, make-up wipes, shower cap & a shoe shiner were all provided for each of us on our beds upon arrival.The used towels were changed every day as well as the room being cleaned.During our stay, the bedside lamp bulb blew - the receptionist changed this for us immediately.The only downside is the rude night receptionist (male). Whilst my friend was going to the toilet in the shared bathroom at 2am(ish), the night receptionist came up and shouted into our room "DOES SHE WANT TO SLEEP OUTSIDE?".Apart from that, I thoroughly recommend this hotel. Perfect location.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There was no fuss and no frills here. The hostal was cheap, centrally located and had friendly and helpful staff! We had a swift check in and were able to leave our bags as our rooms weren't ready. The room was comfortable and spacious and we had opted for a private bathroom. All in all I had no complaints and I was certainly not disappointed.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely short trip here in September 2016! It was more a hotel than a hostal. The room was very clean and nice/ spacious. Also lovely bathroom. Quiet area meaning a decent night sleep. Good location as near metro/train/bus and a easily accessible to walk places. Lovely quaint original lift which really gave a historic feel to the city and the hotel. The staff were very pleasant and helpful with directions etc. TIPS: buy an all day hop on hop off bus ticket from the hotel (28 euros each i think). Also go to Tibidabo- amazing views. Sagrada Familia is also amazing. Would definitely return. :)
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent accommodation, clean and spacious - Hostal staff extremely friendly and helpful - would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in Barcelona but be away from all the hustle and bustle but still be in easy walking distance - Girona metro only 5 minutes away along with the Passeig De Gracia - would love to go back!!!!!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean enough. Cute little patio area to drink coffee on. Walls were a bit thin so it was difficult to sleep on some nights. Location was excellent. Front desk was very helpful with recommending local spots to grab food etc. No major complaints...good value!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WE booked a room with a view for 3 people for 2 days at a very reasonable price. the view was an understatement and the staff were very friendly, even contacting us when one of us had left their passport behind. only slight complaint was that it was shared bathroom facilities but it was clean. Overall a great stay!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives:Very clean and comfortableCool temperatureFriendly staffGreat showerMaids happy to come back and clean later Able to leave bags on last dayGood locationQuietNegatives:Surrounding area at night is quite quiet and possibly not good for tourists (not a massive problem though)No safeWould definitely return.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed there for two days at the end of june 2016. The location is very good at 5 minutes walk to La Pedrera CityBus station. The apartment is very big, cleaning is beeing done daily, the receptionist was nice. We recommend it!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The biggest brownie point this place has it's location. It is very close to Casa Batlio where you can easily catch a hop on hop off tour bus or just walk to La Ramblas or Placa Catalunya. The rooms are spacious and clean and also the staff is very friendly. Being a sucker of anitques I quite liked the old style lift it has. There is also supermarkets close by and cafes on the way to the passieg de gracia. I would stay here if I went back
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wouldn't say it's a hostel, as you not sleeping in a shared accommodation.My room was nicely furnished, spacious with private bathroom and a balcony.Located just 10 min from Girona metro station, 15-20 min walk from Sagrada Familia, there are shops and cafes nearby.The only minus that there could be a kettle with cups provided.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near Av Diagonal, one of the most important streets in Barcelona, you can go everywhere using the metro station, close to Verdaguer, Girona and Diagonal stations. It´s located near many restaurants and you can walk from there to La Iglesia de La Sagrada Familia in 15 minutes. The hostel staff bring an excellent service, they are always willing to help you. The room was clean up everyday and is according to the price paid.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Very helpful and friendly staff. Safe and secure. Rooms were ideal no breakfast available. Near placa di gracia and metro. Would recommend for young couples or friends on a city break. Near loads of supermarkets and resturants
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostal is located at a quieter place in Barcelona but it is only 10 mins walk to La Sagrada and Passeig de Gracia. Staff are friendly and kind. Rooms are very spacious. Toilet and shower room are fine. Bed is not bad, Wifi is very good as opposed to some comments. We did nit have problems with the connections and it was fast. We cannot give an excellent ratings due to the following: walls are not soundproof so you can hear people's conversations, there is no proper climate control, there's just a vent at the top of the door and on our first night we woke up in the middle of the night perspiring because it was blowing hot air. We spoke to the staff and they did listen and on the next night there was no hot air blowing in ou room. The staff told us that he did not know what to do because some guests were complaining that it was cold and some were saying it was hot. The solution is SIMPLE, just install proper air-conditioning in every rooms where the guests have the ability to control it.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was wonderful and very helpful guiding us around the city. Location was great a 15 minute walk to sangrada famelia and the short bus ride to the beach. The hostal was very basic but very clean and pretty comfortable for the price. If you are looking for basic hostal very clean and pretty comfortable for the price. If you were looking for basic hostal at a very affordable price then look no further.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival, we were charmed by the district and the building. Inside there is a birdcage lift to the first floor reception. We were shown to a spotless room, comfy room. The receptionist had informed us that we could book tickets for attractions online. When I didn't receive the confirmation the next day, she made sure that it was sent to the hostel and printed the tickets for me. Nothing was too much trouble, and she was allways cheerful. There are lots of smashing resteraunts in the same block or just a few streets away. The Casa Mila, and Sagrada Familla are within walking distance. Oh, and there is maid service, every day.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed during MWC and loved the warm welcome, including a packet of ham and olive oil wrapped with a personal note! The bed was comfy, the room a good size and the bathroom very roomy. Everything seemed very recently redecorated and clean. Location wise, there are a couple of coffee shops and restaurants nearby and you're ten mins from the city's main shopping street. Sagrada Familia is close by but the old town is a 30 minute walk away. There is a metro station very close though! Really recommend this as an affordable option.
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is coming from a very fussy girl... I had a GREAT stay at this hostal. My friends and I stayed here before Christmas and we had a great time. The location is perfect! Super close to the Sagrada Familia and about a 5 /10 min walk to Passeig de Gracia! When I come back to Barcelona I will for sure stay here again! Great value for money and friendly staff. All round a great stay!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we booked apartment for 5 girls and paid £10 each per night.We had big spacious apartment with one big double bedroom,two bedrooms with one bed and another double bed in living room . Apartment has one bathroom and one toilet.Very helpful people working at the reception.perfect for location for staying in Barcelona exploring by foot.Would recommend this hotel.Thank you Hostal Martinval
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a nice stuff, have been really helpful with getting to the airport. Gave some good advise what to see. Room have been cleaned even if we didnt ask. We had everything we needed. Close to the sagrada familia, casa batllo, metro and etc. 20-30min to the airport by car, 30min to the see by walking.definitely would be coming back. :) Tanks!
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was a really nice place and the location was perfect.just so near to every thing that a traveler needs.there were good restaurants around .reception was very friendly and helpful.the most important thing about this hostel was the safe neighborhood just was very safe even at 4,5am
hotelName:
23    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A cosy, beautiful and colorful place.Very clean, nice people, a splendid and cosmopolitan atmoshere.Free cooffe, free tea, a kitchen with all that you need.I highly recommend! We had a nice and unique staying:)
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a private room with a shared bath. The room and shared bathrooms are clean, The kitchen area is very nice, and stacked with coffee and tea. Is certainly one of the nicer hostels I've stayed in in general.Cons: The walls are thin, the first night there was a loud child next door. The beds and pillow were uncomfortable, and I didn't had a good night sleep. My main gripe is the value. The price is too high when compared with other places. We we're charged 450 euros for 4 in May. There are several two bedroom apartments a few doors down that were available and very nice for the same price. I would suggest looking around for something else.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very happy with our choice, clean and bright room, friendly service, situated at 10' walk from Sagrada Familia and Passeig de Gracia shopping street.In addition there are plenty of breakfast options in the neighborhood. Billy Brunch at 30m was the bomb, we went there every morning!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service and facilities. My wife and I visited in December and stayed in the private double room with toilet. The rooms was great. On the last day, our flight was in the late afternoon, we asked the staff for a place to keep our luggage after we have checked out and they were happy to keep it for us. They also provide free dinner on Thursday night so all the guests in the hostel can sit and eat together.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is such a beautiful place to stay, friendly staff , good location, beautiful rooms.I would recommend this its as good as a hotel yet half the price. We had a private room with private bathroom and balcony. Great experience all round.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice private room with nice bathroom and a mini balcony too! Well located, very friendly staff, great value for money comparing with other hostels nearby, we checked out at 10am and went out in Barcelona for the day and they let us shower when we came back to get the luggage before we went to the airport, even the public showers they have for the people in the dorms are very nice and clean. Would definitely book again :) Thanks for a nice experience
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived early morning from Australia but the staff were really accommodating & let me store my baggage and provided a map of where to visit. There’s a big, open kitchen that looks more like it’s from a family home than a hostel kitchen, while the living area had plenty of comfy chairs & games to chill out while I waiting to check-in.I stayed in a private single room. The bed was comfy, the fan worked well, couple of plug sockets to charge things, and plenty of space.The whole place is very modern and clean. The staff were brilliant.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the most comfortable places I’ve ever stayed in my life. Huge gigantic room with balcony. Super clean. Tile floors. Shared baths are spotless and new. And Pam is a sweetheart. Really nice and helpful. Superb location. Plenty of life on the street but not at all bothered by excessive noise. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly, clean and bathrooms just renowated. Our room was lovely. Theres a big kitchen where you can cook, and even a laptop for guests to use in a shared living room area. This is much nicer than other nearby hostel w same price. Our 2 beds room incl even a tiny balconyThank you very much!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fab hostel with very clean bathrooms, cute balconies and private rooms for couples. Staff are all friendly and welcoming, the location is great. Cannot fault it! Thanks for the great weekend! We were given umbrellas - it was pouring it down all day, and were able to store our bags whilst we went exploring before and after check-in. Nice and spacious, shared kitchen, with some shared food and drink too. Will definitely be back!Hidden on a corner - remember to look up for the sign or you could easily miss it!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is located in the center of Barcelona and close to the metro (Verdaguer) so you can reach any part of the city in max 30 min. The kitchen is stunning and always clean, so are the dorms and the bathrooms. The staff is very kind and always happy to help if you have any question. In addition, they treat each other with respect in the hostel. No-one switches the light on in the middle of the night or leaves their dirty dishes in the sink and everybody likes to chat and spend some time together which creates a warm, welcoming atmosphere. I had a great stay at Primavera Hostel and would recommend it without any doubt.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a clean and spacious hostel. The staff is friendly and it was calm. It is close to the metro station. There was not breakfast but there was a big kitchen. I can suggest it for a nice stay. Nice one
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hostel very nice for meeting people from all around the world, there is a nice living room where people sit and talk and get to know each other beautiful and clean aswell, I also like how close it was to the las ramblas literally two or three streets away, and also very close to la sagrada familia
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at Primavera Hostel in a private room for three nights and nearly four full days. It was a really pleasant stay. Barcelona hotels in the summer are so expensive and we found Primavera to be very reasonably priced for what you got in return: a clean and spacious environment, friendly and helpful staff, and a cute and quiet location. Do note that it is a long walk from the Gothic Quarter and El Born, so if you plan to spend most of your time in those areas it might be best to consider staying closer to them (we love to walk but it did get tiresome as we were logging about 10 miles per day including our sightseeing). Would certainly recommend.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for money and very gentle vibe. Kitchen area was clean with plenty of pans, plates etc. Laptops provided in communal area. Wifi.Only negatives to bear in mind would be noise (people talking till v late, doors banging at night, no aircon in the summer, and , for me, very soft pillows (road far too noisy to have window open at all).Overall, good locations, lovely laid-back staff, good clean facilities etc but if you are noise sensitive, take earplugs!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I were there for 4 nights sharing a 6 bed dorm. Location was great, 15-min by foot to La Sagrada Familia (as well as La Paradeta for awesome seafood, you've to check that out) and 5 mins to the nearest metro. Staff were on 24/7, pleasant as well and would offer tips and recommendations if you need help.Have to say that a hostel experience was not to our taste, hence our average stay at Primavera, but we booked it due to budget constraints then. For the price, it was still quite a good value considering how expensive accommodations in Barcelona can be. No AC (fans don't reach the top bunks, so I had to use my USB-powered fan) and spotty wifi in our room also didn't help.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel made space for me and treated me like a queen... came without a reservation! They had free pizza, helped me with all my questions and were very kind and knowledgeable! The night shift lady with dreads told me about free entrance to the Guel Park if you go before 8am and I got there at 7am it was the best... the sun, very little people and the magic all to myself with some neighbors that told me about the best view from the three crosses!!! Amazing! The only thing I would recommend is a ceiling fan, the floor one for the six bed room didnt seem enough. Although it was loud because it is in a bid steet, the location is the best and I wake up at 6am so it didnt bother me I already have reservations to come back! I brought them a real plant to say Thank You! It was very clean, comfortable, beautiful and very convenient. The employees are very very nice!!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely a place to stay when you are in Barcelona, you cannot find a place better than Primavera which worth the money you pay.Tha staff were parfect in manner, their proficiency has impressed us during our stay.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A value for money hostel. Staff are very helpful. They have these common events for guests. We were hosted for a trip to the musical fountains, in the city centre accompanied by the charming Gabriella. She made our evening unique. An added help was that she knew Spanish, which was convenient as an introduction to Spain. In the room there is this cosy balcony, where you can sit and have coffee. A well stocked kitchen, where one can make you own tea and coffee. And though the washrooms are shared, they are spic and span and hygienic. Highly recommended
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is located some 5 minutes frm the metro and 10 from the Sagrada Familia. Check-in time is 1pm and it is very very strict about that (we arrived 12.30h and had to wait), but that is fully ok. :-) Staff is nice, but at the time we were there (beginning of May 2017) there were some construction works on the floor above us and it was quite noisy. We were in room no. 12 (double room) and as soon as somebody uses the bathroom next to the rooms, tou hear the rambling in ghe pipes. Otherwise it's a good place to stay!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good hostel - location could not be better (close to Sagrada Familia, 10 minutes walk to the other Gaudi house museums, Plaza Catalunya & Nord bus station); friendly & helpful staff (shoutout to Ron to whom I have the most encounters with); clean dorms & bathrooms; free pancake breakfast on certain mornings; stable wifi & homey atmosphere. The only downside were the super soft pillows which I hated & even asking for a second pillow (which was soft as well) could not relieve me from the neck & shoulder pains I had to endure when I woke up. Lastly, having bedside charging outlets on every bed would have been nice as well to juice up the tech gadgets to which we are enslaved to...
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first hostel experience. I traveled with my cousins and we didn't know what to expect, but what an amazing experience it was. Rooms were really clean, super comfy bed and what an amazing and friendly staff. A special thanks to Ron for being so welcoming from the beginning. The location is perfect. Restaurant downstairs. Everything was great. Thank you for an amazing stay! I know I will be back to Barcelona some day and this will def be my place to stay. :)
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for three days while I was in Barcelona and all the staff members were so kind! I felt really safe in the hostel and even the neighborhood. Everyone was so welcoming and really helpful. Everything was clean and just everything was perfect. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definetly this hostel is the place to be in Barcelona. It made my stayed worth it :) great location, very central. The best thing about this hostel it's probably the staff, Pam, very sweet, Ron, the coolest guy ever who make free pancaks Durin and the shy guy from the reception also very nice people! I'm always going to remenber this hostel
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I travelled to Barcelona between 21-25 November, and stayed 4 nights at the Primavera Hostel. We were very satisfied with everything - friendly, youthful staff, clean place, very cozy, and friendly. I want to especially thank Pam, who welcomed us and helped us with a map of the city (they give one for free), and explained things around. The hostel is located quite central, and we walked around it a lot, up and down the streets - Sagrada Familia, Casa Battlo, and La Pedrera are superclose, as well as Placa de Catalunya. There are coffee shops around and it's very easy to reach the place by metro, by stopping at the Verdaguer station. Considering my mother's age (50+) and her experiencing a hostel, I think it's quite a good signal that all conditions were good for us. We were very happy with the choice! I recommend booking early, as we got really good prices for our stay.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a preconceived image of what a hostel would be like but have never stayed in one before and I was very wrong! We arrived late on a Thursday evening for a weekend away with the girls, we were welcomed into reception and had a quick tour of the facilities and taken to our room which was a good sized room with a double bed and bunk beds for the 4 of us. The next morning we needed help planning our day and reception pointed us in the right direction. The hostel is in a great location and it didn't take us long to reach where we wanted to go. We came and went as we pleased and stored food in the kitchen if we needed to. Hostel is lovely and clean has free wifi. Beds were comfortable and noise was kept to a minimum. Would stay again, thank you for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel has the perfect location, facilities, accommodation, information and its right next to Sagrada familia. The staff are just amazing. The cleanest hostel i have ever been to. I really can't explain why there is such a warm and cosy feel but it's incredible here. Even if you didn't enjoy Barcelona, this hostel in itself would make an incredible holiday. The staff are always there, nothing is ever too much, they cook dinner and breakfast on certain days and are always there to chat too and answer questions.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights at the hostel. It is a basic hostel with all the essentials. The rooms and facilities are kept very clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. Great if you're looking for a social hostel - there's a comfortable common area with laptops and good wifi throughout the building. A tasty, simple free dinner was provided one of the nights where we met some great people who we went into town with later. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What's good about the place??Everything. Good location - it's in close proximity to a couple of metro lines. Also walking distance from some major commercial centres and touristy places. Staff was really helpful. Evy actually helped me plan a quick day-trip to some of the more touristy places. I used the remaining days of my stay to visit the non-touristy Barcelona - which btw is a lot better than the touristy part. Anyway, back to the hostel staff - they're very helpful and nice. Kitchen is clean and well equipped. Personally, I loved the music that they played in the living room. It played continuously at low volumes, so was possibly not uncomfortable for anyone. And the staff cleaned the rooms and washrooms daily. So the hostel was quite clean as well.What's not so good about the place??Two things actually. First, being a central location, the traffic noise is loud, especially in the morning. Second, I visited in July - it was often hot at night and the rooms didn't have air-conditioning. There were portable fans, but I was the upper bunk, so the fans weren't very helpful.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel has everything going for it - 1. location (walking distance to the metro stations, to the main landmarks such as sagrada familia, to the main shopping district of barcelona), 2. cleanliness - super clean bathrooms and common areas, 3. very friendly folks who manage this - Evie is a darlng, she keeps this place as lively as it can get. Was here with my girlfriends, and we probably had one of our best times together here.wifi / cellular network is sketchy sometimes but its not really too much of a bother.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Primavera totally make the experience. They are so welcoming and helpful, even cooking a free dinner (with wine!) for guests once a week. The rooms are a bit noisy from other guests and traffic close by, so you'll want ear plugs. The shared bathrooms are cleaned frequently and well arranged so that you're almost never left waiting for the facilities you need. The bed was comfortable, and bath towels large. The location is about a 30 minute walk from the main tourist area, but close to the amazing Sagrada Familia.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here were really friendly and the hostel had a very welcoming vibe. We were in a shared room for the first night and a private for our second and both were great. I would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This amazing hostel in Barcelona is away just enough from the 'tourist areas' to allow you peace, quiet, and local prices. Walking distance from The Sagrada Familia, you will still not notice the hordes of people usually thronging the church. I was surprised when I turned a corner and saw this huge line to enter the place (Sagrada familia, not the hostel). The other attractions- La Rambla, Place de Catalunya, etc.- are best accessed by the metro. The Verdageur metro station is very close to the hostel (within 500m), but it is initially difficult to locate the hostel. A couple of times and you should be okay. You don't need to cross the 'Diagonal', which is the main road- so don't get lost while looking for it in the first instance.The hostel itself is on the first floor, and you are given the key to the entrance & the hostel gate upon check-in. You really feel you live in Barcelona for a few days :) There are 2 kitchens, multiple bathrooms and toilets so that we were still discovering the hostel on the second day! The people are just great, and give you tons of info if you seek it. The fellow hostellers are amazing as well. Really comfortable stay. We aren't forgetting Hostel Primavera in a hurry. Definitely recommend!!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner absolutely loved this hostel, not only were the staff incredible kind but they even cooked for us one night we were there. The vibe was very home-like. We enjoyed this hostel so much that we lest our other hostel early just to come back and stay here again. This hostel is exceptionally clean and has two kitchens to use plus great bathrooms and showers. I highly commend the staff here, they legitimately care about your wellbeing and I would recommend this hostel to anyone visiting Barcelona. Thankyou Primavera Hostel
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights with 2 friends, in a 4 person private room. When we arrived the girl on the reception desk was extremely friendly and went about pointing out on the map all the tourist areas and activities.Our room was of a good size, and had all the authentic Spanish original features of the building, including a balcony which was a great addition. We did not have a private bathroom, and shared with others in the hostel, but this wasn't an issue as they were very clean and plentiful.The hostel is located just a short walk from the Sagrada Familia and the main shopping areas of Barcelona, which meant we didn't have to use taxis or the underground system much. I would highly recommend staying in this hostel, as the value for money was so high. I recommended the hostel to my sister and her friends on a recent trip also.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Receptionist was very friendly, he introduced us to Barcelona with a map and gave us advice on foods and attractions. We had the room for 4 people. The room was amazing and it was very well decorated. It was clean, tidy and spacious ! It may be abit noisy in the morning when theres alot of vehicles passing by. Other than that , the hostel was excellent ! The toilet and bathroom was clean, spacious and tidy. We had a great stay and Im sure you will too.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is small itself. Beds are packed. LOCKERS R BROKEN n even fixed afterwards it was vulnerable... Hot water stopped suddenly.... water did not drain away n some lodgers caused a flood .....kitchen is dirty... this hostel is insane.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Primavera is perfectly located in Barcelona with all the sites either a short walk or taxi ride away. The hostel itself is kept very clean and the room i stayed in was nice and spacious with a very comfy bed! There are bathrooms and showerrooms close to the bedrooms. The staff are very friendly and helpful if you've never been to Barcelona before and will outline the best places near by to the hostel. Mitchell and Guy were the people working when i stayed - top guys !
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very freshly styled, nice spacious room, two kitchens (one big and one small) very well equipped to cook whatever you want, one big bathroom another smaller one - this is a summary. On the very same street there is a 24-hour Pakistanis shop if you arrive late at night like we did. The staff is very helpful so don´t hesitate to ask them whatever you need to know - shopping, restaurants, attractions. Bad things: Although the hostel is on the first floor the lift could be working and it was broken. The small bathroom smells reaaaally bad and it could be cleaner. Despite all of this I will recommend the place to my friends, the relation price-quality is very good!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location!!! Just a few minutes walk to Sagrada Familia. Subway station is also nearby, Carefour Express 2 blocks away.There is no other better place with such a reasonable price.Staff are all very helpful, kindly answered all my question about taking bus or subway etc.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant location, withtin walking distance of lots of key monuments, main shopping strip in Barcelona and amazing restaurants and bars! Beyond helpful and friendly staff available 24/7. Beautiful, clean hostel. Don't hesitate in booking at this hostel you will not be disappointed!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A Canadian girlfriend and I spent three nights at Primavera Hostel in Barcelona and it was fantastic! The hostel was extremely cute - nice open living space, clean bathrooms, and two kitchens. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful. Location is excellent - we were a two minute walk to a busy metro station and walking distance to Sagrada Familia.My one complaint is that the 6 person rooms are quite small and the bunks very noisy - was pretty difficult to sleep. If you are a light sleeper I would recommend a 4 person or smaller room. If you are there to party, will be the right hostel for you!Would stay again and recommend!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and well maintained hostel. Location was good, just two blocks awayfrom the Verdaguer metro station. Common areas were clean and spacious. The staff were nice and welcoming.However, the 6-bed dorm i stayed in did not really meet my expectations. Small room, not so clean, uncomfortable mattress and creaky bunk beds. Lack of power outlets. And no A/C but fans instead so it was really hot in the room especially at night. And there was too much noise outside (cars, buses...) to leave the window open overnight.No breakfast included!!!Overall,i'd say i paid too much money for what i got (25 euros per night). I've stayed in much cheaper and better hostels!Would not recommend, unless they lower their prices.Elisabeth
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly!! Always approachable. The place was very clean and well maintained, and the common rooms were a comfortable place to relax. A bit of a walk to the main attractions but would highly recommend!!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was nicely surprised by peaceful, cool and friendly atmosphere of Primavera hostel. Very good located, really clean, quite place with nice design (the ceiling in the rooms are amazing) and very well equipped kitchen, cosy communal room, free Wi-fi limited on social networks but with possibility to use one of three computers by free if needed. The guy in reception (sorry, I forgot the name) was warmly welcoming, helpful, chatty and taking very good care about everyone. Valuable deal for money and if you search for a nice, clean, tranquil place, then Primavera is the right choice for you! Only I would advice to the Slovaks girls working there to be a bit more careful when talking to each other, you never know, who can understand you.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A cheap domestic hotel. We spent few hours before an early flight and enjoyed their hospitality. Very clean. Nicely decorated. Very helpful staff. Keep in notice that they are not tourist information and might not be so accurate about the information they give (public transportation atc.)
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was our third time in Barcelona and primavera hostel was by far the best one we have stayed. the staff make it everything so simple and nice.it has one of the best location in the city specially good for us cause its a walking distance to ¨Gracia¨ which is the alternative district... loads of restaurant near by and cool shops. the hostel has nice ambient and very clean. we gonna come back for sure
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: from the the moment we arrived until we left:( we felt like we are staying with our frinds:)we finish our euro trip in Barcelona and obviously Primavera hostel was the best place to do it. the location cant be better. the room was spacious and with a beautiful sunny balcony. the beds 10. the showers had a good stream. the hostel was always very clean and with a very chill ambient. we stayed there for a couple of nights more than planned:) we loved this hostel. Thank you Evi mirka toni mitchel and yuna
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we loved this hostel and will come back for sure next time in Barcelona,the hostel stays in a beautiful building in a perfect location - a local district which is a walking distance to all major attractions...and metros of course:). the hostel had an amazing ambient with international staff which really made the difference from other hostel we have stayed. we met people from all over. the rooms were beautiful decorated and a lot of space. shared places and showers were spotless as well as the kitchen. they give Free light breakfast.. in short RECOMMENDED!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At my trip to Barcelona i choose to look for hostel and not hotel Like I always take,I find this charmi place Primavera hostel and recomend it to every one,beutiful place that get you inlove from the first moment you enter, The stuf are realy nice and helpful and got great recomends for restaurant and activity in the city,I find it much nicer to stay at Hostel because of the worm treatment of the workers,Defenetly will come back
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived late at night to the hostel and directly got the room which was much better than the pictures.. so a good surprise. the satff was very nice and helpful with their advises and every morning they baked cakes for the guests. we got the sunny room with the balcony, the beds were really comfortable and the design was making a relax ambient through all the hostel... we met cool travelers from different places and we extended our stay in 4 days.. the hostel was by far the best one we have stayed in europe. we gonna come back here to finish our trip to europe so see you soon:)Highly recommended!
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: best hostel we have been in our trip in Europe. very cosy and feel like home. the hostel is really good located near everything important in barcelona. the place was clean and with fresh ambient. the staff made our stay amazing..good suggestions and helping us with everything we needed. thank you very much primavera hostel. Recommend
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we entered this hostel, we felt that it will be an interesting staying.And we weren't wrong. The attention we received and the service have been impecable¡ from the guiding of the host regarsing Barcelona, to the tidy and clean room, we have no complaints¡ For sure, this location is to be considered when coming in Barcelona¡
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is the best hostel i have been to my travel in Europe. very easy to find with a great location, the hostel is beautiful decorated and amazing ambient.v staff is the best, give me many good advices and took all the people to flamenco show and after we had a drink. the hostel has very good kitchens and many common areas. I meet many people and make many friends there. didn't want to leave.. thank you very much mirka, pali toni y mitchel.
hotelName:
24    Primavera Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with our stay at the apartment. It was very spacious, clean and modern. It consisted of a big living room with sofa, armchair, coffee table, dining table and chairs as well as TV. The main bedroom had a big double bed and a spacious wardrobe, the other bedroom which we haven’t used had a single bed. The kitchen was spacious, and quite well equipped with cups, glasses, cutlery, plates few saucepans and a kettle. However, you won’t find any washing up liquid nor dishwasher tablets there. I suggest these could be provided, as well as some washing powder. There is a fridge, washing machine and a dishwasher. You also have to bring your own coffee. The bathroom was clean, too. The apartment is just a short walk from majestic Sagrada Familia. Our flat was on the first floor, so we only had a glimpse of it from our balcony. The balcony is narrow, it had a little table and 2 chairs, just enough for 2 people to sit outside. The flat faces a busy road, however when we closed the shutters in the bedroom, we slept ok. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to take some earplugs, just in case. The booking said there would be a daily housekeeping, however this didn’t happen during our four nights stay (the cleaning lady came only once and just provided some fresh towels, but nothing was cleaned). This should be improved.A short walk to the underground station from where you can catch the train to the airport at low cost.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A visit to Barcelona was called for so onto Hotels.com to find accommodation for three of us. An offer came up for Apartment Marina so checking it out online it seemed a good bet. But would it be. In fact it was a better deal than we had expected. Four minutes walk to Sagrada Familia and numerous good, reasonably priced, restaurants and bars. Transport also within five minutes. Secure entrance past a reception which was always manned by very helpful guys. On out first night the poor guy was in panic for me when we didn’t have a corkscrew in the kitchen. He was great and found me one within minutes. I think he realised that you couldn’t visit Spain without wine.Lift up to the apartment, in our case the third floor. Nice large lounge with TV (never used by us) with plenty of seating and telephone. Two bedrooms for four people, one with safe. Both with plenty of storage space. Bathroom with everything you could need. Girls said that the hair dryer worked better than any they had used in other establishment. Toiletries. Shower in the bath. Fully fitted kitchen with all appliances, including dishwasher. OK, missing a corkscrew but that was amended immediately. Balcony. If you are lucky at the front, with a view of the Sagrada Familia, but with the road noise (not too bad at night). And daily cleaning service.A great apartment complex for a reasonable price.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Good size apartment. Great location for seeing all the sites and near metronstation Lots of places to eat nearby. Clean and comfortable with good facilities for family stay. Friendly helpful staff.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an absolute wonder. We stayed in a 90sm, 2 bedroom apartment. 3 groceries 1-3 minute away with a carrefour express. Public bus stops 2-6 min away. Subway 4 min away which is right ar familia segrada, thus every time you take the mtr, photo ops daily at familia. All their windows have motorized steel blinds, my first experience ever. Balconies are such a bonus for us to contemplate early morning fresh air. Streets are generally quiet until 1030am. NO TRAFFIC at any day in barelona, what a miracle! We did some dinner cooking at the apartment making use of its induction, oven and microwave. We benefitted from the huge ref/freezer. And dish washer. The place is a complete package from kitchen, 2 bedrooms, living and dining room. The only things they don't have are washing machine and iron, which are not absolutely needed. If you are looking for a most convenient place to stay with family at a very reasonable price, look no further!
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at these apartments for a few nights before our cruise. Our unit had balcony and it was very clean. We thought it was a great location, and in a great neighborhood. Would definitely stay there again or recommend it.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A family of 4 with teenage girls we’ve done plenty of city breaks and try out lots of city accommodation and this one was great for our needs. Very clean, spacious, so quiet and a little balcony to sit out on. We had a room on the 5th floor at the rear overlooking the courtyard and it was a lovely way to wake up. The metal shutters make the rooms pitch black at night and are easy to roll up in the day. Rooms cleaned every day and fresh towels provided if you wanted them every day too. Perfect for the Sagrada Familia, we never sickened of walking past every day, but if you’re wanting to be part of the action, these apartments are a good 2 mile walk to the beach and to the more central parts of Barcelona. There are so many little bars and restaurants around that we stayed local most nights. Avoid Trabucaire bar and restaurant on the corner facing up towards the Sagrada Familia as it’s horrifically overpriced and we were totally ripped off! Otherwise, don’t hesitate to book these apartments, yes they’re basic but they’re great value for money and so clean.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 nights here, close to Sagrade Familia temple, however next time I would book something closer to the beach. Couple of supermarkets only down on the road which was very convenient. We had a balcony overlooking Sagrade Familia. Bed were comfortable, however road was very noisy, woke up couple of times middle of the night for shouting from the main road as windows weren’t great. Wifi was very slow so we had to pay extra for fast wifi.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to La Sagrada Familia but a little away from the La Rambla area. Very spacious, air conditioned, clean apartment with 2 bedrooms, living room and a kitchen. Price was a bit high. Did not have view of the church. Internet was slow. We came in on Friday evening and stayed for 2 nights. The (Friday) front desk man was a little cranky but the other man was more friendly and kind. He helped to call the taxi when we left.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The positives outweigh a couple of niggling negatives.Apartment size and layout good, we had access to a patio for breakfast and occasional snacks.Location great, very easy to commute everywhere.Would however recommend taxi from airport on arrival.No laundry facility and staff unaware of local laundromats but google it and we recommend Splash nearby.Crockery and cutlery adequate.Free WiFi useless, luckily I had senn reviews mention this and made arrangements to have a Webspot unit delivered before we arrived.Plenty of reasonably priced, reasonable quality restaurants in the surrounding area.Great little supermarket on closest corner.Not sure which apartments have the view of Sagradia Familia but ours sure didn't.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is very spacious (two bedrooms, living room, kitchen, balcony), the kitchen well equipped. I have read in previous comments that the location is pretty noisy (noise from the street), but even if the traffic noise is heard a little bit, it really doesn't matter, after a day of sightseeing, you sleep like a baby.The bonus is a market a few steps from the apartment.And the cleaning lady has been very nice and polite.The Internet connection is very slow.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time I've stayed here and I would stay again. The apartment is great, lots of space, close to attractions and some excellent local bars and restaurants. There is good local transport and it's easy to travel from here.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came for the MotoGP and decided to add on a couple of days as we hadn't been to Barcelona before. The apartment was convenient to metro and supermarket making it ideal for getting around and picking up supplies as we did a mix of self catering and eating out. It was lovely sitting on the balcony in the evening sun with a glass of wine watching the world go by. Bonus was having it cleaned every day as that was not something we have experienced before in an apartment. We are already planning a return visit and would definitely chose the same accommodation based on value for money , cleanliness and location.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very well-appointed apartment with the amenities of a hotel. We loved staying here, so close to the Sagrada Familia, in a neighborhood with local charm. The apartment had a full kitchen, a balcony with table and chairs (facing an inner courtyard and the windows of neighbors), and a doorman/concierge who was very helpful with baggage and setting us up with a tourist bus. Because of the doorman, we felt safe and secure during our stay in Barcelona. Carrer Marina is a great location. There are tiendas nearby, a boulangerie for cafe con leche in the morning, and all manner of interesting little shops. If you want to know what it feels like to live in Barcelona, and apartment like this is a great way to start!
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had stayed her twice before, with very nice results. But the service has really deteriorated.Good points remain: Good price, excellent location just next to the Sagrada Familia, with dining and a nice store just around the block. Fairly roomy.Bad Points: We were a party of 4. The rooms have beds enough for 4, but not hot water enough, even with "Naval" showers. Would not recommend for more than 3.Room is an apartment, but without much supplies, especially in the kitchen.Service was simply not good. We missed room clean up one day because we were in the room at the moment it was to be cleaned. Later told that they simply skip the room if we haven't made arrangements before. Well, we would have, had anyone thought to inform us of this policy. Came home after a day around the city to no toilet paper and a pile of dirty towels. The front desk gave us towels, told us we'd have to buy our own toilet paper at the nearby store. Hospitality, indeed.Except for the beginning and end of the encounter, the front desk was just surly. It's not that hard to speak to a customer who has a request, like when the Wi-Fi code changed.We won't be back.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These are decent size apartments just a few minutes walk from Sagrada Familia and metro station of the same name.Reception staff was very friendly and spoke good English and was happy to help about nearby attractions and supermarkets. Inside there were very good size bedrooms and living room, the kitchen had all the needed dishes inside the dishwasher. There was no washer but did not need it either. The wifi is a bit slow but OK for checking fb and whatsapp. The reception staff was very happy to keep my luggage for a few hours after check out and gave me stickers for collection. All in all very good value for money and would recommend to anyone planning to stay in Barcelona
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a true apartment with 5 rooms-2 bedrooms, one with a king bed and one with a twin bed (where we put our luggage), a kitchenette, a living/dining room, and a bathroom. It was very spacious and comfortable, and we got a great price on tripadvisor through Agoda. The location is great-2-3 blocks from the Sagrada Familia and a 20 minute walk to La Rambla. The downsides are the WiFi-it literally took me 20 minutes to get my Samsung phone connected to it, repeatedly entering the password. My husband's iPhone and our MacBook Air connected after entering the password 5-10 times. Once connected, it only took a couple of times entering the password whenever we had to reconnect. Noisy-our room faced the street, which is a pretty busy street, even late into the night.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very good with it being about 2 blocks from the Sagrada Familia. Very close to numerous restaurants. The apartment was very spacious with 2 bedrooms, complete kitchen, and living/dining area. Check in is a little strange since the desk attendant is also the parking structure attendant (next door); check-in took awhile since he was attending to his parking customers as well.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this aparthotel for an inexpensive break away in Barcelona. What a great little find for about £80 per night. Good things - it is very central to Sagrada Familia and other attractions. It was well decorated, very clean and had everything we needed. Two bedrooms with plenty of storage space, a sitting room, dining area and a kitchen (it had all you need including a dishwasher - enough to make the basics). It had maid service every day. There are supermarkets and restaurants very close by. Highly recommended. On the down side, the bathroom was small, and the views weren't great, but it feels churlish to complain when you are getting such a great deal.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just backed from the Barcelona, Marina hotel. The apartment was clean and tidy. We had everything need to the self-catering. Amazing location and get view from our balcony. We will back there. Thank you.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely apartment! It's located within a stones throw of the Sagrada Familia and conveniently within a minutes walk of the metro station. We had a two bedroom apartment which was very clean, modern and spacious. The kitchen was well equipped with a kettle, dishwasher and other mod cons - the only thing that we missed was a toaster - but we just used the grill. The bathroom was a good size and the beds were really comfortable. Rooms at the front looking on to the road could be quite noisy with traffic etc but the one at the back of the apartment was really quiet. There are window shutters in the rooms which pull down and make them pitch black and add a little extra security. The staff were really helpful and friendly. We didn't have a problem with the wifi - you just need to get a code from reception. Check in isn't until 2pm but if you arrive earlier it's not a problem as they have a place where you can store your bags in the meantime. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place right next to Sagrada Familia, 2 bedrooms, large living room and dining table, equipped kitchen and 2 balconies!! All the windows and sliding door have a built-in blinds system that can make the room pitch dark and ads security. What else can you ask for? Maybe a coffee maker in addition to the little espresso old fashion cup that I actually really enjoyed much to my surprise.Daily maid service and everyone is really pleasant and helpful. There is a great grocery store, a liquor store and a fresh fruit and veggie stand right outside the door. At the grocery store the Champagne (cava) is almost cheaper than water and pretty decent. For a non beer drinker it was awesome :)We bough a 2 day ticket to a big bus tour and used it almost like a taxi around town, the bus stop is next to Sagrada. WiFi is a little sketchy and you have to log in every time. Even bought the upgrade and it wasn't very smooth either. Wifi seems to be a problem all over Europe and in this day and age I honestly don't understand why? There is also some city open WiFi that is also very spotty. It is not a big problem, just a nuisance and not very reliable to organize the guided tours that we purchased ahead of time.And keep in mind that the official language is Catalan not spanish, it came as a big surprise to us. Again, just small inconveniences, the hotel and the whole Barcelona experience was fantastic!
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good sized suite on the 4th floor with balcony overlooking the Segrada Familiar. Well equipped kitchen and a daily maid service. It really couldnt have been better but the internet was patchy and slow. We had a bedroom at the front and one at the back, the front room was a little noisy with traffic, back room overlooking the courtyard was silent.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this to be what we were looking for and meet all our needs. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The internet was a problem, even though we paid for the upgrade. Someone came to try to fix it but was not successful. The area was very nice. Lots of restaurants and stores. Very safe at night.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Those who want top staff support should not expect it here. The support is suffice enough. The apartment size is generous and well set out with bedrooms 1 single 1 double good wardrobes and nice bathroom The best feature is its great location near Sagrada Famila and the metro.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 4 of us youngsters reached Barcelona city on Saturday after 2 great days in Port Aventura-Salou. Our first impression of the city was a bit shocking since we were almost robbed twice on our journey from Salou to the apartment, if it wasnt for friendly locals who warned us as well as our own alertness. Although we've frequently traveled to Europe, this type of daylight robbery was a first time experience. However this was the first and last time we would face something like this. The next few days were a breeze. We reached the apartment tired and were immediately given check-in after prompt collection of City Tax. There's always atleast one staff at the reception on a shift basis since reception is open 24 hours. They are very helpful, speak English (relief since not many in Spain do) and will book a cab for you at any time if need be.We booked a 2 bedroom apartment between the four of us. The apartment was exactly as was shown on their website. As most apartments in Europe, it had two bedrooms, a hall, one bathroom and a kitchen (pretty big kitchen). It also had a cute balcony. We didn't really have a view as such, just facing few buildings like one would in a complex. Although areawise its not on the Ramblas, I rather prefer staying a little bit away from the main area, in a central yet quiet place. The apartments are right next to the Sagrada Familia, and the metro stop by the same name. This is the L5 metro line that links to Placa Catalunya with one change in 10 mins or a good 30 min walk. The Collblanc metro stop which is the one near Camp Nou is on the same line,8 stops from Sagrada, incase you plan to catch a game of FC Barcelona (We saw the Champions league game vs Celtic 7-0. Great 1st game experience). So all in all very convenient apartments. The grocery store which is exactly 1 building away is open through midnight. At check in, you get a basic slow internet speed and can increase speed for more money (We paid EUR 5 for 3 days of bonus speed, worth it).All in all, great deal for the price. I would highly recommend this over some airbnb apartment, simply coz they've got a 24 hour reception and thats always a plus point security wise.Only Downside which may be a big big point for some people but wasn't for us: The second room had twin beds, although we joined them together, the overall size of the room was really tiny. Maybe meant more for kids rather than adults. We are pretty tiny ourselves so it wasn't that big a deal-breaker. Will surely return here if we return to Barca.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After our flight was cancelled in the USA we arrived a day late to this apartment, we emailed the ownership that our flight was cancelled saying we would be a day late. We were informed when we arrived that despite our email and circumstances (flight cancellation) they would be charging us for the night we did not stay there. In addition, they rented the apartment to another customer for that night, so in essence they were double paid for the apartment. We thought it was unfair and inappropriate.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apartments Marina was our second stop on a 19 day trip. Our first stop was in London in some VERY tiny accommodations so at first we were delighted to walk into such spacious accommodations. However, overall I would not recommend for the following reasons:1. The beds were hard/uncomfortable. Also, they provide basically 2 crisp/rough sheets for covers so it was not cozy at all. I tried to request a blanket but they don't offer them in the summer.2. The bed sheets had a bad odor, like stinky feet. We had them swapped out but they still smelled. No screens on the windows to air out the rooms and there were occasional mosquitoes so out of luck there.3. The balcony looks out to other apartment buildings. Not a big deal but no view at all except old junky apartments. We chose for the location, size and price as a place to sleep. While the price was great, next time I will pay more. Also, I think we will stay closer to the water next time as well as it turned out we did end up wanting to spend an hour or two each evening to relax/wind down and would have preferred a view.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked here only for a night before returning back home and to be close where the rest of our group was staying. We were surprised with the space and comfort of our room, the location is also great with the sagrada familia a block away and metro station too. neighborhood is full of places to dine and of little markets if you feel like fixing yourself a bocadillo or a meal..
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Going to visit the La Sagrada Familia Basilica? If so, this is the place to stay. We stayed there 5 days and loved every minute. We sat out on our balcony and we could see the basilica. We were a couple but we had a 2-BR apt that was spacious, very clean with full kitchen and a marble bathroom. It is also close to two different city on-off bus tours, multiple restaurants and grocery stores within walking distance.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives: Right next to Sagrada Familia and the subway. Dia supermarket next door. Very spacious apartment with living room, two bedrooms, bathroom and kitchen with all the utensils. Two balconies. Excellent if you like cooking at home in addition to eating outside. Walking distance from Casa Mila (15 min). Very friendly personnel.Negatives: free wi-fi is very slow. There is a presumably faster wifi you could buy for 5 euro a day.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:- Great sized apartment with a decent sized balcony Good, safe location. Supermarket just few moments away. Close to Sagrada and adjacent metro Nearby large covered market 10 minutes walk from Sant Pau ( World Heritage site)..Best find within whole of Barcelona, value at only 7 Euro admission. Beautiful place.Cons :- Wi-fi awful. It gave us such frustration at not being able to get online. The staff were not at all helpful regarding this. In fact one guy on the desk recommended  that I went to the shop opposite and paid to use wi-fi there !!!! The only place I  could get wifi was in the kitchen and it kept dropping off after 5 to 10 mins. ROCK HARD BEDS !!! we are not fussy when it comes to beds, but these were really hard !! We stayed there a week and after one night on the bed where I  found it difficult to sleep, I awoke next day with aches and pains in my back. Not good when you are on holiday ! I spent the next 6 nights sleeping on the sofa. Lacking in kitchen utensils, very meagre assortment.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would give this 5 stars but we had no wifi during our stay. I needed it for some work, so this was really inconvenient. We asked the staff repeatedly but despite all their attempts, they were unable to fix it.Apart from that, this was an excellent apartment - spotlessly clean, generously sized and even with a dishwasher in the kitchen. Balcony with a view of Sagrada Familia and extremely nice and helpful staff. The area is about 20 minutes walk from the centre, safe and with 2 supermarkets within a minute's walk.But no wifi in 2016? Come on, get with it.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Food: Affordable food in and around the area.Service: Very friendly hotel service.Apartment: Very large for European standards. 2 Bedroom with washroom, kitchen includes microwave, stove, fridge, all pots/pans, cutlery, plates, cups etc… and living room with table and sofa. Front and back balcony.Location: Conveniently located, only a 2 minute walk to Sagrada Famillia and about a 30 minute walk to Parc Guell.If you are looking for a nice clean and conveniently located apartment at an affordable price this is a good choice.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2-days prior to our cruise with Royal Caribbean. This apartment is close to port in Barcelona. Right around the corner from the Sagrada Familia. Priced reasonably. Convenient stores down the street, a little pricey. Apartment nice size, can sleep 4 adults. Restaurants in walking distance. Loads of fun in this area. Would definitely go back.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location close to Sagrada Familia and with plenty of bakeries, cafes and supermarkets nearby plus a metro station. We booked a one bedroom apartment but were put in a huge two bedroom apartment with a view of the church from the front balcony. The apartment consisted of a big separate kitchen with a small interior balcony. A huge living room with dining table, sofa and a rather small tv. The bathroom was nice and big and so was the master bedroom with plenty of closet space, a double bed and a safe. The other bedroom had a queen sized bed and for one. There seemed to be no wifi. Bed linen and towels were nice and fresh and the apartment was well maintained and cleaned every day. Reception seemed to be manned 24/7 by English speaking staff. They all seemed helpful. Very good place to stay for the price I paid.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located very close to Sagrada Familia, and it is extremely spacious which was nice. In addition, there are small grocery stores nearby, so you can easily make your own food in the apartment. The only problem was the internet. It was extremely slow, and in order to get better internet, you need to purchase a package. I didn't purchase the internet since I luckily only stayed for a very short time. Overall, the apartment was definitely spacious and in a good location, and I'd consider staying here again. My only wish is that the internet worked but otherwise, things were fine.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well equipped apartment for family or business, Location is good near la sagrada but metro is a bit far.Reasonable ventilation, small balcony, grumpy reception- it is integrated with a parking house so very accessible if you go by car,Ok beds, Good value for your money.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got a really good deal by booking directly with the apartment hotel. 84EUR a night/3 nights for a spacious 2 bedroom apartment. Check in was painless other than the older of the two staff did not give us the wifi details. Not a big issue since we did not need till the next morning. Great functional kitchen, good size American style 2 door fridge/freezer and good cooktop/oven, all very modern. Yes, no tea towel if you don't want to use the dishwasher. There was only two of us so we opted to wash our cups etc. and just leave every day to drip dry. Maid service was included. When we arrived the blind in the living room was crooked and when we tried to adjust the whole thing fell off on the floor. We contacted the front desk and since it was Sunday they said it would be attended to next morning. It was fixed before noon Monday morning. We also had trouble with the safe but the front desk came into our apartment to assist and reset. We found no issues with customer service especially with the younger of the two staff. He was extremely helpful. Internet was OK, again no major issues. The apartment itself is minimalist but we do not mind modern Ikea type furnishings. Location was excellent. We asked for a high floor and got it with a fabulous view of the Gaudi Sagrada Familiacathedral to the left. Lots of bakeries, small supermarkets, cafes and restaurants all walking distance. The baguettes are fantastic and so cheap. Just buy some cheese and your good to go! There are also authentic butcher shops but we did not cook too much given we were only staying 3 days. We did take the hop on off bus which the hotel helped with by giving directions and a map. This is a must if it's your first trip to Barcelona. It is a little far to Placa Catalunya where you catch the express bus to the airport but the taxi fare is not too bad. I think it was in the region of 12 Euros. We were not promised a washer dryer nor was one in the apartment. It would have been nice but not disappointed since we did not expect it. The Would we stay here again - DEFINITELY. It's not 5 star luxury but way better than a hotel room if you are staying more than 1 night.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very comfortable in this very clean, basic but reasonably equipped apt. It was nice to have a full kitchen for breakfasts, and the extra space of a living room. The air conditioning worked very well. We also enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the evening before dinner. The view of the Sagrada was very minimal but the balcony was a lovely space to sit outside. Good location – two blocks from the Sagrada Familia Metro stop. The reception staff were friendly, warm and helpful. We would return here again.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in June. The staff were vey rude and hardly sppke English. The website advertises a washing machine and dryer but there were none in the apartments. No toaster or tea towels in the kitchen. Very noisy location which never stops, even in the early hours of the morning. Would not recommend.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i wanted to stay near the sagrada familia and decided on this place after looking at other reviews and i can't say that i was disappointed. the apartment was a good size and spotlessly clean and was a great price. there is a subway station 1-2 mins away and there is also lots of shops and restaurants nearby too. there was a bit of noise from the street outside but that was to be expected. the staff were helpful and friendly. when i come back to barcelona again i will definitely stay here.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of these apartments was fantasic, just a short walk from Sagrada Famiilia and easy access to tourist bus and also underground network. There is a supermarket right next to the apartments that was never closed and had all the essentials you need but there are also lots of restaurants nearby and a Costa coffee. We prefered the restaurants but there is a KFC and Burger King nearby if thats your preference.The apartments were well equiped and clean and I have no complaints. We were on the first floor and there was some road noise (miminal) and what you'd expect in a city centre.Barcelona offered everything, we enjoyed visting the sites and also days at the beach which is easy to get to on the local underground service. Overall a great stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for money apartment, quite spacious with a well equipped kitchen. Located close to public transport with plenty of restaurants and several supermarkets close by. Very close to La Sagrada Familia, but the queues to get in are very long.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't expect luxury or the brand new everything.These apartments are "essential" and minimalistic but perfectly suited for a stay in Barcelona.In the configuration I used (it's the 5th year in a row) I had apartment with kitchen, balcony, toilet, two bedroom, and livingroom.The balcony and living-room are really spacious and comfortable, ideal for your stay.The bedrooms are very small and "minimalistic": don't expect anything more than a bed and a closet. From the balcony I could see La sagrada Familia which is a couple of minutes of walking distance (like the metro station).Just next to apartment there is a small supermarket and plenty of restaurants: you don't need to go far to satisfy your most basic needs.The apartments are spotless clean and no matter what party you have in the night, the day after everything was perfectly clean.The staff at the reception is nice, friendly, and (when they can) helpful.Be polite with them and they will help you.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently had a four night stay here during our vacation and cannot have asked for more!It was only my mother and I, and our 2 bedroom apartment on the 3rd floor was wonderful! We had a great view of Sagrada Familia from our balcony.The apartment was spotless! And the option to cook breakfast or lunch was great! It's close to a couple of grocery stores, which is very convenient.We had no trouble finding our way around Barcelona from this central location.The staff is friendly and were very helpful!I would def recommend this hotel and would, without a doubt, return!Gracias!
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent choice for a stay in Barcelona. Two bedrooms, a full kitchen and bathroom, comfortable living room, and a balcony with a view of Sagrada Familia (room 4-2) made for a great stay. It's a five minute walk to the metro, a 15 minute ride to center city, and there are lots of restaurants and grocery stores in the area. We paid for wifi, and it worked fine the entire stay on both our Apple and android phones and tablets.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is huge for its price in Barcelona! Our room has a balcony that looks out to the back of other buildings. True, there wasn't much of a view but it is surrounded by other tall buildings so it wasn't too hot to sit outside and enjoy the sun.The rooms are clean and AC works really well. They also have free Wi-Fi; however, you have to ask the front desk. They don't volunteering tell you the service.
