Each apartment also has a safe; unfortunately, there wasn't any instruction on how to use it. :( So we managed to lock it but failed to open it. You can also store your luggage at their locked room. It is definitely a big plus!It is only couple of blocks from La Sagrada Familia and metro. And tons of restaurants and markets around. There is also a little playground behind La Sagrada Familia so my 2 young children get to play.I would definitely stay here again! The front desk personnel we met were very friendly and helpful. Great find for our stay. :)
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives: Good value. Close to Metro and La Sagrada Familia. Clean. AC works well. Quiet if apartment faces inner court.Negative: far from the center of Barcelona, approximately 15 minutes on Metro or about 45-50 minutes of fast walk.Why did I rate this apartment at only 2 stars: the administration charges about EUR 16 for a week of WiFi Internet access. There is only one corner of the apartment when we were able to get one bar of WiFi reception. It was so fragile that it was coming down to no reception at all every 30 seconds. We made requests to the administration every morning for 7 days to no avail. One time we were even told that "everyone else has no problems with WiFi. It seems like your problem".WiFi Access Points are commodity this days. When extra money is being charged for WiFi access, the responsible party has to make sure that there is enough APs to provide the service.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 2 triple apartments in the Marine as part of a large group coming to Barca for a birthday celebration.Top marks to this company. Their booking process was efficient, the reception staff were helpful and friendly. The apartment are huge and have everything you need. Top marks for value and location.I would recommend them to anyone, I will be back some day.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed on the fifth floor with a balcony. So I could sit with a glass of wine and watch the church every night. The location is excellent. You can walk to most sights and metro stations. There is a nice supermarket a block away which sells ready-made food and wine/beer. If you take streets about one or two streets off from the main touristic streets, you can see the cute little cafes and bars locals go to. Somehow I got a two room unit with a balcony. The master bedroom, a single room, a well equipped kitchen, a bathroom with a tub and living room are spacious and clean. This place is perfect for a family with children. They can buy food and cook simple meals.The staff jus gives you a key.You cannot expect more than that. They also take care of the garage so most of times they are busy tending the garage customers. My sony tablet and samsung galaxy didn't pick the wifi signal up here. Otherwise, this place was GREAT.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was perfect and the rooms were beautifully modern. The terrace facing the inner courtyard wasn't much to look at but because we were in a great location we walked everywhere. The rooms were quiet and beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly and incredibly helpful. There was a grocery store and pharmacy on the same block and there were too many restaurant options from which to choose. Having a kitchen, especially at the end of our trip, was a nice option for when we tired of restaurants. We would stay here again without hesitation!
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can call this a real apartment but with a service like in a hotel. The reception staff is nice and helpful. Rooms are big (huge!), clean and nice. Very quite - we didn't hear our neighbors while being during busy season. The presence of kitchen in the room is absolutely fantastic! There is a grocery store just few steps away that works till 2am, so we were able to see Barsa up till the subway closes and still able to get some food.Location is fantastic! Every morning while going to subway to bus stop you see Sagrada! It is magnificent! And the metro station is very good - it can quickly get you to the main attractions.These apartments are perfect combination of price, location, rooms.I would definitely stay here again if we happen to visit Barsa again!
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights in early December. Travelling with just cabin baggage, these apartments are probably not ideal, as they are very large with surplus storage space, but lack some essentials such as tea-towels, basic cleaning materials, etc. Our apartment was also not very clean, particularly sinks, work surfaces, and the marble effect floors, and the maid service seemed rather limited. Set against these negative points are the amount of space, the extremely convenient location just 2 mins walk from La Sagrada Familia and the adjacent metro station, the wide balcony with its view over to the towers of this stunning piece of Modernista architecture, floodlit at night, the wider location in the architecturally significant Eixample of the city,, the help afforded by the 24 hour reception staff, and, most significantly for those travelling on a budget, the price. We would stay again, but only if we were travelling with hold baggage, and were staying for nearer a week.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re not worried about a picturesque view and can put up with a short journey on the Metro (about 5 stops to the Old Town, Las Ramblas and waterfront), then I’d recommend these apartments.We found them clean and spacious with comfortable bed and – thank goodness! - air conditioning. Although they face out onto a main road, we weren’t disturbed by traffic noise. The staff were friendly and helpful, coming up straightaway to sort out a small programming problem on the safe. As already mentioned, there are a number of cafes, restaurants and supermarkets nearby, plus a nice bakery. The Sagrada Familia church and metro station are about a 5 minute walk away.This is the second time we’ve used these apartments and we would definitely book them again.
hotelName:
25    Apartaments Marina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable, friendly stuff, they gonna help u... i think when i accommodate there it was used to be called Hotel Best Price Gracia, but the rooms look same as on picture so i guess this is the right place. Good fir price, recommending, new n pretty
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for only 3 nights in a two beds bedroom on the ground floor.The front desk staff was really helpful and hospitable.The room was clean. there's no fridge, though.The location of the hotel was the best..a quiet neighborhood, a couple of steps to the metro station and Diagonal Mar shopping mall.It was a nice peaceful stay.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for the x3 main nights of Primavera sound. When we first found the hotel we initially thought 'area feels a bit dodgy'. However, as soon as we walked through the door that went away. The person on reception who checked us in was amazingly warm and welcoming. Hotel appeared spotless. The room could be called a little basic but everything you need is there and the bed was really comfortable. Could not be any more perfect for the festival - 10 min walk to either the festival or beech. Close to cashpoints and a shopping centre. Close to metro, trams & buses. Close to bars restaurants and cafe's. There is literally nothing bad to say about this hotel that I can think of.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is part of large building complex, right at the center, small entrance. Close to metro, great front desk girl, very helpful with information. Room is much smaller than look in photo, not much space to put luggage. Room has old building smell, even it was just remodeled four years ago.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impression was of a reasonable hostel/hotel in a quite run down area.I was told that the hotel sits in the more residential part of Barcelona and therefore it is quiet. It certainly was quiet, but the smell out on the Rue Diagonal was really pungent when walking around.The smell in the room matched the odour on the street, with a distinct perfume of damp washing that had been left in the washing machine for days.The rooms are sparse, but for the money you pay I guess you get what you pay for.No tea or coffee facilities at all and not enough room to swing a small mouse let alone a cat!Thank goodness this was only a very short stay. If you're looking for a place to spend no time in apart from to sleep, and you have a bunged up nose or generally haven't a strong sense of smell, this place will be ideal for you. A little too basic for me. The only saving grace was a slightly comfortable bed.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No soundproof at all.Breakfast aufull cause it’s not on the hotel property is out on the cafe next to hotel.The 4,5 is way to much for this “hotel”.Service is ok. Rooms are tiny small bathroom also small.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maria and her other colleagues were very kind smily and helpful with everything we neededThe room very cleanBus tram and metro station 1' far..You can go everywhereThere is bus 7 and tram and line4 down town every 3mnts!!!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small, clean, in a great location, 10 minute walk from the beach and a 2 minute walk to the nearest metro. Plenty of lical bars and cafes to choose from. Friendly and helpful staff, I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The name itself says it all. For a Family of four person but even for just a couple its the ideal place where to spent a holiday in Barcelona. With the balcony view on the Sagrada Familia only a block away , shops and restaurants are close by . The owner Nuria a very nice person is ready to give you a warm welcome in a very clean apartment on the 7th floor with elevator of course and all the conforts you might need ... free fast wifi included.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for three nights at Hotel Best Price Diagonal. Whilst the overall service was ok, I had a very unpleasant experience on the morning of my departure. Whilst taking a shower, I was sliding the shower door to close it when it disintegrated and smashed on me.The shower and bathroom floor was covered in glass and I sustained cuts to my feet as well as finding splinters of glass in my arms and in my hair. Following my trip, I made a complaint via booking.com who I booked the hotel with, but the hotel refused to take any responsibility, blaming me for the accident. In their response, they said that the shower door could have been broken with a punch or use of excessive force. So not only was I injured by their poorly fitted shower, it was also blamed for it. I would not stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for two nights. Very clean and stylish. No fridge in the rooms. They charge 3€ to change the towels. 400m from metro station. Good neighbourhood.breakfast was not included but they have a restaurant.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated in a more rezidential area, near the forum. It is 2 mins away from metro station and 1 min from tram station. It is also near diagonal del mar mall. The zone is pretty quiet. The hotel is situated at the ground floor of an apartament building. The rooms are iluminated through an interior garden. The room was clean and had air conditioning, but it doesn't have a fridge. The breakfast is 6 euro, but it doesn't offer to much. It is consisted of a juice, a coffee, a sandwich/pastry/toast and a fruit/yoghourt. You take the breakfast at a bakery near the hotel. We didn't like that the options were too poor. The sandwich were only two pieces of bread with a few pieces of salami or cheese. The vegetarian options are limited. The atmosphere of the breakfast at the small terrace is pretty ok and coquette.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and comfortable place to stay, WiFi excellent, staff very nice and friendly, ten minute walk to beach and big shopping centre and only 1 minute walk to metro would highly recommend and would 100% stay here again
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As first timers in Barcelona this hotel was perfect for our 3 night stay. It is spotlessly clean the rooms are quite spacious and the beds are extremely comfortable....once you have done the amount of walking we did in a day you will need a comfy bed. The reception staff are friendly and helpful giving us valuable information about the underground system, attractions we might want to see and gave us a small map to guide us. This was helpful in helping us to find our bearings. Next time we are in Barcelona we will definitely be staying here!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 7 nights in this nice hotel last September. It was a new, modern and very clean hotel. Its location is great for travelers like us, who want to participate in events hold in CCIB, though it is easy to access to main attractions of beautiful Barcelona. There are only some steps to tram station and a short 3 -minute walk to metro (Selva De Mar station).Diagonal mall is close with lots of shops and restaurants. If you are business travelers, as my husband and I were, you could buy a variety of gifts and souvenirs for children in reasonable prices! Breakfast was ok served at a nearby café. We liked it. You could choose among some variety of drinks, sandwiches, fruits and yogurts. There was also a very nice bakery nearby. Our room was very clean and comfortable. It was in 3rd floor and very calm. I am not sure about the noise in first floor specially the room located near reception. Staff were helpful and nice. Anyhow, for our purpose this hotel was an excellent choice. If I was with whole family for an entertainment trip, maybe I would have booked some property closer to city touristic attractions.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a friend mentioned, this is a hidden jewel in Barcelona. Although it was not my initial option for staying in the city, as soon as I changed of hotel, I enjoyed all of its amenities. The staff is wonderful! The price is just right, great location and excellent accommodations. I Look forward to go back and stay there once again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Expensive for the room paid room price. No kettle to boil hot water in room. Room temperature is centralised therefore it may or not be suitable for you. Only complimentary is hot water and tea bags at the reception. The hotel name is covered from sight by trees. However, location is close to city; tram/metro is a road cross away from hotel. City is only a few metro stops away. You can walk to Diagonal Mar shopping centre; 8mins. Lastly, service by receptionist is good. Readily shares information of the city upon arrival.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice budget hotel, with good facilities. Staff were extremely helpful & cheerful - a remarkable difference to what I'm used to in U.K.Room was spacious & clean. No tea making facility in room though. Bed was comfortable.It takes about 45mins to El Prat airport - 2 stops via metro & train. There's a tram stop directly in front of the hotel, and metro stop just 3mins away. For shoppers, it's 5mins walk to the MAR shopping complex & also not too far from the cruise ports.Only stYed one night so didn't explore much. There's free wifi, which is great.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from glorious Barcelona. Personally I couldn't recommend this hotel enough if your travelling on a budget. Very responsive to emails with any queries and travel arrangements from the airport.The Metro was literally a short walk away from the hotel. We were greeted at reception by friendly staff and even though we were early for check in the room was ready for us.Modern, spacious rooms with room to hang clothes, tv, desk plus the added security of a safe. I've stayed in some 4* hotels and have never had such a comfy bed/pillows. After a long day of exploring it was a delight to sleep in.Plenty of towels and a hairdryer in the bathroom. Though would advice to take your own shower gel/shampoo.As it was my girlfriends birthday they very kindly made two towel art swans and scattered rose petals on the bed. A great touch.We made are way to reception were the front of desk shown us a map of things to do, best places to eat and places to avoid, a very personal touch. You can buy all your tickets or bike rental etc.The beach is literally a short walk away and you can walk along the front into central Barcelona or get the metro which takes 10 minutes. Don't be fooled by the 1* rating. It doesn't have a swimming pool/spa or a restaurant, and it may not be in the most vibrant part of the city, but it's a clean, modern, friendly hotel perfect for a budget get away We will definitely be booking this hotel again next time we are in Barcelona
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super friendly helpful n nice staff, clean room bathroom little tight , location nice quite ideal if u have activities at ccib ( convention center) beach is near, breakfast was at a couple of steps in a cafe n affordable but to me I didn't like it and i don't recommend it, generally recommend this hotel
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While this hotel is a little ways away from City Center, it is right across the street from the metro station that will have you to the Center in 15 minutes. The rooms are basic and immaculately clean; it's the ideal hotel for tourist activities! What makes this hotel 5 stars is the staff - while every staff member we encountered was wonderful, Anna at the front desk stood out the most. She was so gracious and helpful, and made us feel like we were staying with friends rather than in a hotel. When we return to Barcelona, this will definitely be our go-to hotel. Thanks so Oscar, Anna and the entire staff that make this hotel such a wonderful place.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had our best stay at Hotel Best Price Diagonal! It is a perfect hotel for a city like Barcelona. We went to our honeymoon and stayed there for a week (from July 3rd - July 10th). The hotel room was perfect, had a very comfortable bed, very good AC, good showers, also the rooms were very clean, the only negative thing was that the room walls were a little bit dirty (the ceiling had dirty footprint marks). The location is perfect, quite and you can get to the city centre in 10-15 minutes, the beach is like 5-10 minutes with walking. The staff was fantastic, we brought in a lot of sand to our rooms and by the next day, our room was always very clean (thank you, and sorry for that), the reception was also fantastic, Anna and Sandra helped us a lot to make our stay perfect (also thank you for the other receptionists as well). Barcelona is a great city, with a great beach and has a great feeling of freedom and peace, it is also very easy to find everything with google maps and the public transportation system is quite simple, or only the ticket system is a little bit strange. Long story short: This hotel is fantastic, with great staff, great location (especially if you are going there for the beach). We loved to stay there, and we are very happy that we have chosen this hotel for our honeymoon.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can't fault the hotel for the price we paid. The room was clean and the staff were very helpful. We didn't have breakfast but bought our own from a local supermarket. The location is a little far out of the city but was fine for us as we were happy to use public transport (of which there are many modes nearby).
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was modern, bright and clean. Friendly staff. Across the road from the metro station, which is on the main line to the centre. Next door to a supermarket. The hotel deserves a higher star rating, I would highly recommend. Wifi available.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good access to city by tram and metro. In area frequented by Spanish people. Local restaurants good. Very helpful staff in hotel. We arrived early and the receptionist made sure our luggage was safely stored away.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived, we immediately got to experience the excellent service in this hotel. The receptionist gave us a map and walked us through the whole metro system in Barcelona. The hotel looks new, the rooms are (kept) very clean. There is a huge shopping mall almost next door, as well as a metro station (Selva de Mar). Absolutely no complains about our stay
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accommodation was great. Helpful and friendly staff. They advise, assist. Rooms beautiful, clean and cozy. The hallways were very beautiful decorated. Computers with free internet next to the reception.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was an experience to stay here !The rooms are a little small if you spend too long inside them but they are clean and the bathrooms are pretty good.What makes this place special are the staff !!!The breakfast is functional but very good value.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great for everyone who is looking for good value and good quality in one. Really enjoyed my stay in here, nice staff quiet location and clean rooms. Only one minus was that the bed was very soft and the blanket too small other than that this hotel has it all.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern clean rooms, spacious shower and bathroom. Clean towels are offered ever 3 days or there is a €3 fee. There is breakfast (bocadillo, juice and coffee) offered for €5, however, there are many restaurants near by. 15 minute walk to the beach, 10 minute walk to a near by mall and 5 minute walk to Selva de Mar Metro station. Room was cleaned despite the "do not disturb" sign was placed on door. However, I believe the sign fell off the door because it was not on the door when I returned. Better door signs can resolve this in the future. However, all of my electronics were in touched and where I left them.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 6 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. Handily placed nr Metro and Shopping Mall. But not too near. Rooms were spotlessly clean, serviced everyday.Bed very comfy. Great air con. Staff were exceptional. Nothing too much trouble, We didn't use the breakfast facility next door . We used the bakers on the corner nearby which was great. Open 7am . Fresh bread was very good. Had breakfast in room. For the price, About £40 per night this could not be faulted. Don't be afraid to use this hotel !!.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel for the price, very clean and cozy rooms,friendly and helpful staff and a great location near the beach also a very good location when it comes to public transportation. Cannot think of anything to improve .
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled to Barcelona for a long weekend and we stayed at Hotel Best Price Diagonal. The rooms were small but very comfortable and clean. Also very modern. The staff was extremely helpful. They were ready to give directions and tips. Easy access to the Metro station Selva de mar and 15 minute walk to the beach.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very happy 6 night stay at the Best Price Diagonal.Make no mistake, this is a basic hotel - room, bed, shower, but that is all one needs for a city break. The room was perfectly clean, the bed was completely comfortable, and the shower was wet.The name Best Price is wholly correct in the case of this hotel, as it does lie at the lower end of that scale; the value in this increases when one counts in the brilliantly friendly and helpful staff, which are exactly what you want in the morning.Location-wise, it lies all of 800 yards from the north-east end of the beaches; around 150 yards from the Selva de Mar Metro stop (which runs straight to the city centre in less than 15mins) and within a short walk of the Poble Nou ramblas which has all the restaurants/eateries one could need.It's been said once, but it needs saying again - the staff here are brilliant.I intend to return.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great. 10 minutes to the beach and shops, tram right outside hotel. Clean rooms and amazingly comfortable beds. The staff are so friendly and helpful. I would happily stay here again. There is an area by reception you can buy snacks and coffee, and drinks. Lots of little cafés nearby for breakfast. There is an in room safe, hair dryer, such a great little hotel for the budget conscious
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were really happy with our choice of the Hotel Best Price Diagonal. This hotel is in a lovely location away from the tourist area, but still close to the beach. The staff have been super friendly and this is usually what matters most to us. There were 5 receptionists during our 3-day stay and they all deserve 5 stars!The room was really nicely decorated and well equipped and the breakfast in the cafe was lovely too!Will definitely stay again!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and girlfriend chose this hotel as the price was very reasonable and location seemed good and we were not disappointed. The beach is about a 10 minute walk, there is a huge shopping centre around a 5 minute walk away and the metro is literally across the road.Very accessible to all parts of Barcelona and in a quieter area so there is very few tourists in this area.I did not rate highly the breakfast at the cafe beside the hotel so we went for the baguettes and such in the supermarket in the shopping centre instead where the food is incredibly cheap.This part of Barcelona is great for the beach too as although busy it is not half as busy as near the touristy parts where you cannot see a clear piece of sand!Also special thanks to Ana at reception who was very helpful for information on everything!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were a reasonable size and comfortable , especially the bed. The foyer fridge was well stocked and reasonably priced. Situated in the newer, modern end of town,beside the larger hotels , but only a short Metro trip from the city. Breakfast had to be bought , but there is a lovely patisserie next door, or you are only a ten minute walk to an excellent shopping centre, with every fast food outlet you can imagine. Very near a great beach too, Lots of local bars in the district. A very clean , modern hotel.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel due to reviews but not a great experience. We were give room number 2, which was basically the first room on the right and next to reception. We were told it was not noisy which proved incorrect. We had little sleep between the receptionist coughing, people talking and shouting in reception and the noise of trolley bags being run past our door. I have little doubt the other rooms would be satisfactory for the price as they had comfortable beds and were well appointed. The rooms on reception should be heavily discounted and the reason why explained and then people at least have a choice. I made my view known to the receptionist who offered nothing but an assurance she would take my views to the manager. Heard nothing so wrote an email for the attention of the manager and got no responce or acknowledgment.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in early May. Impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel, the staff were polite and helpful and it wasn't a bad price. Short walk away from the L4 metro line and tram line and not far from the beach. Room was clean, had enough towels and beds were made each day. Had a safe in our room. Air conditioning in the room too (although you couldn't change the settings, we were freezing one night and hot the next!) For a budget hotel in the outskirts of the city, it was a great deal.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel as it was the cheapest hotel near a conference venue. I was on a strict budget. It is a no frills hotel but the rooms are very good and clean. Everything was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful.If I went back for a conference at that venue I would simply return to this hotel.If you want good accommodation, and are not concerned about all the frills, then this hotel is excellent.Breakfast was available nearby and other meals within 400 metres.I was on a geological conference AAPG and will recommend it to organisers
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'll start with the few things I liked:- Bed is SUPER comfortable. I've never felt so good on a bed, and it's a king size (for a double room). - Room is modern and cosy, forniture quite new (although the shower had one rail half-broken. nothing major.) You also get a desk and one chair. Safe-deposit box is €1 a day. Now the things I didn't like:- The room is noisy even during the night. I've spent 4 nights here and every night I could hear some sort of buzzes coming from outside my room (I guessed they were phones of other people in other rooms that were reciving notifications? Still not acceptable and quite hard to think this scenario could be true EVERY night).If your room has the window to the street, it might be nosiy in the morning as well (as in my case).- No shampoo in the shower. Not even the basic one they usually give you in a 3 stars B&B. There was only a body wash soap which also destroied my hair in just 4 days.- Poor Internet signal (at least on the first floor where I was). Very slow, good just for small browsing, but not for work or anything similar.- Fake TV - you can only play radio on it.- You have to pay extra to change your towels.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small hotel is located on a square with a supermarket, bakery, pharmacy etc. and near a big shopping mall with lots of shops and restaurants. Tram and bus are in front of the square and the metro is around the corner. 10 Minutes walk to the beach!The hotel is modern and the reception is very nice. They even borrowed us an umbrella when it rained. We had a room with 2 separate beds. Unfortunately, there is no view outside, only onto an inside garden or at plants. The beds were good, the bathroom was very small. There is a blowdryer and showercream. There is no noise from the outside (traffic e.g.), however, if other people close their door, it awakens you.At the reception you can buy a voucher for a good breakfast at the bakery on the same square. There is a vending machine in the lobby with coffee, beverages and sweets. This is a good hotel if you don't want to be in a quiet area with good public transport.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I certainly booked this hotel because of the reviews and the price. I stayed with my husband for 3 days and it was excellent. It is a clean hotel with good connection to the city center (TRAM stop is in front of the hotel and the train station is 5 minutes by foot). Shopping center and beach is in the nearby. Rooms are modestly equipped, but good for having a sleep. Wifi worked excellently (the best wifi in all hotels that I have visited). The staffs are very kind and helpful. The hotel does not have own restaurant, the breakfast is at the near cafeteria. The breakfast's option is limited, but very good.I recommend it.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I attended a conference nearby and the hotel was close (walking distance). recentely completely refurbished. Good option for short trips / bizz. Breakfast is outside (nearby diner) which is a small disadvantage and there is no gym either.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best helpful staff. I have stayed in .a y different star hotels. Too far out of the way had to get taxis or subway into town. Dont think I would come back because of this. Taxi driver didnt even know where it was. Beds really comfy.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful place for a short or long stay. Very clean and tidy, staff very extremely helpful. Located 10mins walk to the excellent Spanish beaches. Near to both local shops and a big shopping Mall.Metro 5 mins away direct route to central Barcelona with all its attractions
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was fine, room was okay. Air con and wifi worked alright. Bed was average, wouldn't say comfy. My real qualms were the the extra costs of amenities which would be free in other places. You had to pay extra for the towels to be changed, extra for the safe, for water, and a small bottle of it was 1 Euro. At the Hyperstore, you could get 1.5 litres for 35 cents. Note, the dining area is not even in the hotel: its a cafe 2 minutes walk away. Huh?? The breakfast was included in the base price but still, 237 Euro for 3 nights and the food is a dry baguette with salami, coffee and juice? Dry sandwich means that, a slight spread plus a slice or 2 of salami. How much are tomatoes, onions, cheese, eggs??? Wow! For 7.95 you could get a NY Burger Meal at Pollo Campero inside Diagonal Mall, which I recommend by the way.Front line stuff were amazing but paying extra for amenities put me right off.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the BestPrice Diagonal hotel for 5 nights. It is situated close to the Selva de Mar metro station and there is also a tram station nearby. If you are planning to travel by metro, bear in mind that it is really wet and warm in the underground corridors in summer, although all the public transport is equipped with air-conditioning. The hotel rooms are all very small: there is only a bed, a TV, a wardrobe with some hangers, 2 shelves, a small table and a chair. There is also a mirror and a hairdryer in the shower. The room window is not transparent at all (I think it is due to the fact that all the rooms are situated on the ground floor), but it opens, so you can have some fresh air if you don't like air conditioning. The cleaning of the rooms takes place every day, but the towels are only changed if you pay 3€ per person. You can buy coffee and some snacks for 1€ at the reception. The water is potable, but if you prefer bottled water you can also buy it for 1€. There are a lot of flyers at the reception, you can use them, some of them will provide you with discounts. The hotel theoretically offers a transfer to the airport for 37€ (taxi is 41€), but it was not available when we asked for it (it is also possible to get there by metro and by train, the hotel will send you the instructions by email). Neither was the massage. Nevertheless the staff members are mostly nice and smiling. There is a shopping mall with different restaurants nearby, the beach is 15 minutes walk. It is very good for a 1-star hotel, just don't expect too much from it and you will enjoy :)
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel and great personnel at the desk.Location: Very well balanced location. 12 minutes walk to the beach. 5 minutes walk to the subway and 10 minutes ride to the heart of the city. You have everything around you that could come in handy. Small private supermarkets, megamarket at the nearby mall (8 minutes walk), bakery, flower shop (for the romantics in us), etc. Around 37-43 euro for taxi to drop you off at the hotel from the El prat airport. The same for getting you to the airport. Around 12 euro for the taxi to get you from Placa Catalunya to the hotel.The tourist bus has a stop at 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Comfort: Bed is a pleasure to sleep in and pillows are great. The room and hallways have a chic feel to them. Room is a little bit on the small side but we were only in our room to sleep. So no harm done there for us. Bathroom/toilet is badly aired. Shower steam and toilet odour remains in the room for too long.Hygiene: The cleaning service cleans the room very well. It is a shame though that you have to pay for the towels to be changed (it's because of the environment, they say) . I understand that you don't change your towels on a daily basis when you're at home. But when you go to a hotel, you expect them to change them.Reception/desk: Very helpful and friendly service is given to you from start to end. They are honest and really want to help you out. Whether it is tourist information or printing your e-ticket for the flight back. They are there to help and inform. For 3 euro per person it's possible to rent beach towels. Conclusion: Very well thought out hotel with great personnel and localisation. You won't be sorry you stayed here. There are things the hotel can work on to improve. Price quality wise it was a treat for us. We will be definitely staying here again when we come back to Barcelona. We do hope the towel changing policy and the airing of the bathroom/toilet gets better.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time in Barcelona and aside from the fact that the city is beautiful, our vacation was made significantly better because of this hotel.The location is in a fairly quiet area and the Metro is only around 2-3 minutes away by walk. Most places are relatively easy to get to from this hotel which obviously adds to the overall experience. In terms of pricing, I would say that it is very fairly priced. As for the rooms, it was pleasant and refreshing to see that even though it is a 1 star hotel, the rooms were very clean and very reasonably sized.Overall, we only encountered a small issue on the first day with the safe not functioning properly but that was very quickly amended the following day.One final note, I would especially like to thank one of the staff members of the hotel, Gustavo as he simply made our stay so much better. He helped us so much with any questions we had in general about either the city itself or any other queries we had in general. This person in question simply made our stay so much better. A special thanks you, Gustavo.In conclusion, I would very much highly recommend this hotel as it simply enriched our overall experience in Barcelona.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have a 9 and a 5 year old and we found the family room with attached bathroom clean and comfortable. The air-con and wifi were great. The kids could only take so much 'culture' in town so the short 10 minute walk to the beach each evening, importantly bypassing the busy moterway via a bridge, was their highlight of each day and it felt refreshing to get away from the busy city. The beach had showers and a climbing frame too. A shopping centre with large supermarket is 3 mins walk away and great for cheap eats or food on the go. The tube is also very close and is on the yellow L3 line which takes you straight to most of the major attractions in the city centre. SO good choice for all but particularly families.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the second year in a row for me to stay here. The conference centre is a about 10 minutes away as well as the shopping centre. The nearest tube station, Selva de Mar, is only a minute away and the "yellow line" takes you to downtown a few minutes. A brisk ten minute walk takes you to the nearest beach. The new hotspot of hip restaurants and other small businesses in Barcelona, Poblenou, is ten blocks away. Forget the hipster apocalypse that is Gracia and head to Poblenou, you will not regret it. Service is superb. It is really personal and caring. Note that this is not the kind of "a stick up your bottom" and a pretentious yankee smile kind of service. These people really care about their customers. The rooms are modern, clean, and the hotel is really, really quiet. Aircon works perfectly and you can set the temperature to your taste. The beds (and pillows!) are really good. I know that this is a personal subjection, but to me, just perfect. The "Feng Shui" is really strong and potent in the rooms and in public areas of the hotel. The led based lighting (which changes colour in the night) really adds to the nice atmosphere. The interior design is really timeless with clean surfaces and small accents. There are no trendy gimmicks in play here. The free WiFi works really well and there is a computer for the guests to use in the lobby. There is a small grocery store, a hardware store (in case you need a hammer or a screwdriver), a pharmacist, a fishmonger, a beauty salon, a bakery and a tobacco shop next door. Summa summarum, the name of the hotel "Best Price" is actually accurate. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm often in Barcelona for business and this past trip specifically at the conference center (about 5 minute walk from hotel). The location was perfect but more so was the friendly staff, modern rooms, design and overall cleanliness. I was so surprised to find such an ideal business-friendly hotel for such a great price in Barcelona. I've been to quite a few and this one is hands down the best. It's also about a 10 minute walk to the beach and shopping center!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Best Price Diagonal
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nisia B&B is excellent! Lovely home, delightful staff, perfect location. The breakfast is very convenient, and the living area is quite pleasant. It's very quiet at night. They even scheduled a taxi for my trip back to the airport. I would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I visited Barcelona at the end of August in 2018. We stayed in Nisia for two days. It was a delightful experience. The whole family is friendly and helpful. They went out of their ways to help us with the information in order to tour the area. Also, the location is great, quiet but very close to downtown area.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before selecting this B&B I had read many of its reviews and I must say that some of them just did not correspond to the reality we found. The place is really well located, 5 minutes on foot from metro stations and from touristic places such as La casa Milla - La pedrera with the advantage to be inserted in a residential area where also non-touristic places can be quickly accessed - there area supermarkets, a pizzeria, a drugstore and many other conveniences just in front/beside of it. The breakfast was good, with orange juice, coffee, water, 2 types of bread, ham, cheese, yogurt, muffins, fruits and small cakes. The place, located in the 2nd floor of the building, has a nice common living room and a balcony. The bedroom had a good bed (not too soft, not hard) and the bathroom was new. Everything extremely clean. All day and night long the place is very quiet, perfect to sleep. The air condition works really well, is central, but each bed has its own control. Laura (the owner) and Daniela (the responsible for cleaning the place) were very nice and helpful/available. I can only strongly recommend!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights with my boyfriend in the attic room. Matteo was great! Really friendly and helpful and gave us some good tips on where to go and where to get a good coffee :) The neighbourhood is perfect... so quick and easy to get everywhere by bus/metro and there's plenty of shops and restaurants in Gracia with the lovely square round the corner and nice atmosphere. Would definitely stay in this area again and would recommend to anyone looking to stay in Barcelona. Breakfast was good and overall the room was clean and comfortable. Only thing I would say is the attic room could do with a bit of updating/ tlc! Other than that a fabulous stay! Thanks Nisia
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 days in Barcelona in this very clean, well situated B&B. The manager was very helpful , friendly and professional.The rooms were a good size and the common area was bright and large. This B&B looks exactly as the photos . We were very happy with our choice and would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place was quite a breathe of fresh air and served as quite a homely, warm and relaxing retreat after strenuous chaotic days on the streets of barcelona. The location is also in quite a unique and harmonious neighbourhood and the people who host you are very professional and very supportive. We were directly dealt by Mateo who not only opened up to us but also gave us great suggestions and made great recommendations of things to do around the city. All in all a very memorable place with great vibes and a salubrious environment. Couple-friendly family-friendly vacation-friendly and a place where i'll definitely go stay again.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Finding a reasonable place to stay in Barcelona is a challenge. Nisia B&B is a great solution to this problem. The communal space is lovely, simple and clean with a small traditional terrace to the street. Rooms are private, clean and comfortable and feel like you're staying in a friend's guest room. Nothing fancy, but perfectly adequate. If you want a hotel with matching linens and endless hot water this place is not for you. We loved the location: a 5-20 min walk to most all the major attractions but with beautiful neighborhood plazas, markets and restaurants just a few blocks away. On top of all this Matteo, Nisia's caretaker, is clearly besotted with the city and has great tips and suggestions to make your stay unique and memorable.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had to climb three floors of stairs (no elevator), very narrow, especially for two seniors to climb. Room was not what I expected. Shower head was full of hairs from other people who had stayed there. No television in the room. Shower was so small that I almost did not fit in it (could not move very well). Air conditioning ---None. They said it was ventilating but in three days I never heard the unit work. Had to open the window- view was not at all what one would really expect.The advertisement says something about a Library where you could get information. All they gave me was a map- I saw no place where there was a library nor books.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a pleasure to stay in Nisia - you feel the welcoming atmosphere from the first moment, and the friendly and service minded host, Laura and her staff, is the key to the good vibrations at this place. The rooms are quite small, but the big advantage for such a small hostal is the private bathroom in every room. We rented both a room and the apartment at the top floor. The apartment has a bit more space than the rooms and has a fully equipped kitchen (and access to a roof terrace) and a TV (spanish channels). However the free wifi is not working up there, but you can use it in the common room downstairs. Cleaning was very good and breakfast (included in the price!) was more than sufficient to start the day. Air condition worked well. A bit limited hot water for showering because of the size of the tank)The location of Nisia is perfect. Gracia is close to many of the attractions of Barcelona, but is like a small town in the town. Lots of small restaurants (many of them of good quality and better prices than in the most tourist infected areas), shops of all kinds and and it's own food market. To bring home some good meat: The family butcher shop in the corner of Reial de la Vila de Gracia (150 metres behind Nisia) is recommended. Great service and high quality. The Nisia is situated in the main street Gran de Gracia which at day time is quite busy. The sleeping rooms is at the back of the house so there is no noise problem (the back side is the lack of a good view). The breakfast room is facing the main street however - with a tiny balcony - very nice). Quite a steep and narrow entrance from the street door to Nisia (especially to the apartment on the top, but no problem if you are not disabled or if you try to carry more than one suite case at a time...).All in all: Absolutely recommended if you don't want to pay for luxury but prefer to stay in a homely atmosphere in a villagelike part of the town, share the breakfast table with other nice people and enjoy the personal touch and amiable service from the hosts. And you will be happy to stay well away from the chaotic and more and more dodgy Ramblas.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thought this place was a real "winner". Laura and Paolo are excellent hosts.. There is a lovely communal area looking out over the street - we'd been on the road for 2 weeks staying mostly in conventional hotels and especially appreciated having a comfortable communal area we could relax in and make a cup of tea etc when we needed. The room we were in was quiet, with a very comfortable bed, and large opening windows. Wifi was excellent. The breakfasts were very good and Laura has gone out of her way to try to cater for all tastes. As others have said, you need to be aware that the BandB is up two flights of narrow stairs, the toilet cubicle and shower are small, and the shower and basin are in an open area in the room - none of that worried us, but it wouldn't suit everyone. The location is wonderful - the friend we were visiting recommended we stay in his neighbourhood and what a wonderful place to stay - lots of character, plenty of places to eat and placa to sit in and watch the world go by, and within walking/metro/bus distance of all the attractions. All in all, tremendous value and we hope we can return one day. Thanks Laura and Paolo!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 7 days with my girlfriend. The place is very close to public transportations and in 15 minutes you can reach every spot in the city. If you like walking, Sagrada Familia is 25 minutes away as Picasso museum and the Ramblas. The place is not huge, they have a nice little apartment on the roof and some bedrooms (with bathroom) on the 2nd floor, I have tried both and I can say that they are clean and comfortable. The breakfast is good and the owners speak 4 languages Italian, Spanish, English and German. They are also really kind.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Nisia Bed & Breakfast is in a great location. All you need to see is in walking distance. The rooms are cosy, coulourful and clean and most of all the owners are very welcoming and go out of their way to start the day off with a good breakfast. We really loved our visit!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is a great option if you want a good location but you're on a bit of a budget. Laura was always very quick to respond to any emails and questions we had before we arrived to the B&B. We had a little bit of trouble finding it once we got off the metro, it's a good thing we had Spanish SIM cards in our phones. There's no sign or anything outside of the building or on the callbox so we walked by it a few times before we figured it out. We got in kind of late at night, somewhere around 11pm or so arriving from San Sebastian. Laura was waiting for us when we got there (I'm not sure if they live on site, I usually only saw them there in the morning and when she greeted us). The kitchen/common area is really nicely decorated, I liked it a lot. We stayed in the room at the end of the hall on the left ("T" I think?). The room was nice and the bed was reasonably comfy. The hot water thing doesn't bother me, they have a notice on the wall that explains it really well - each room has its own dedicated hot water tank. I don't expect them to put the huge tanks like we have at home here in Canada in a tiny little room in Europe (I have been known to regularly shower for more than half an hour with very hot water). I just turned the water off when I wasn't using it and then turned it back on to rinse and had no problem. I've been to other places that have restrictions on their water usage as well so I didn't mind. There's a nice big closet area to hang up your clothes/put your suitcases also, though the layout of the room was kind of odd, even for Europe. When you come into the room, the bathroom is in one big sort of open area with a little water closet for the toilet with a folding pocket door. The sink is out in the open and the shower is a stall, also sort of out in the open. The bed is in its own kind of closed off area (an archway leads into it), but the vent for the A/C is out in the bathroom area so it doesn't really get to the bedroom very well. We work in residential construction at home, so I assumed the strange design was due to the fact the B&B appeared to be a flat that was converted to a B&B later on, and the ducting for A/C and the waterlines were in wonky spots. Due to the design, the room got very hot at night since the A/C never seemed to reach us. That's the only reason I'm taking off one star, because I have trouble sleeping if its too warm (too warm for me is anything over 22 degrees Celsius, I think it was 27 degrees in the room which is pretty hot).The location is within easy walking distance to La Rambla, and the district the B&B itself is in is very nice. The metro is a few minutes walk away as well. In the block around the hotel there were a lot of nice boutiques, but we were always walking by too early or too late to visit them. There's also plenty of nice coffee shops and bakeries, as well as two decent sized convenience stores up the road should you need anything. We had to get some laundry done while we were there, Laura and Paolo helped us find a place a couple streets over. I can't remember the name of the place, but it's very small and had two Spanish ladies working inside. I think it was actually marked as a drycleaner's. I'm not sure if we would have figured it out without knowing Spanish. There's another one close by that's run by a nice Chinese man, but he only does commercial loads. We stayed here for a few nights. It's actually pretty quiet at night, but we did have to leave the window open a couple times during the night due to the heat. If you get the same room as we had, you'll be treated to a nice view of the neighbor's beautiful rooftop garden (very pretty when they had it all lit up at night). I slept well for the most part, and I would still recommend this B&B when visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this B&B for two nights and they were great. It was great to have the bathroom in the room instead of a shared bathroom. Laura was also great. We enjoyed our stay. Very close to metro station and walking distance to many sites.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights at Nisia B&B in July 2014, under the care of Martina, the owner's cousin. We didn't spend a lot of time there (we were in Barcelona after all) but what time we did was very comfortable and we felt welcomed and well taken care of. We were a little unsure about the location when we booked it, but absolutely lucked out. It's in Gracia, a beautiful neighborhood with great architecture and restaurants and bars and without the hordes of tourists, just a few blocks to Eixample, and then Las Ramblas, El Born, etc. We were able to walk everywhere, and the trip to / from the main train station was super easy by Metro. We'll definitely be back.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing find in Barcelona. Great location near Diagonal metro stop. Quiet B & B in a good neighborhood with easy access to metro, TI, Gaudi sites, grocery stores and bakery. Very nice owners. Good, healthy breakfast and central living space, with clean, quiet rooms; maybe 4 rooms total, so it's a calm, relaxing oasis amidst frenetic, but fun, Barcelona.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Go and meet Alex and Karina on à Nice place Nice room and the right place to be un barcelona there you CAN meet people from all over in 6 days WE met belgians germands israéliens and à couple from America
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alex , Carina thnx for ur generous hospitality , u r amazing host. My sister n I are appreciative. Hopefully to c u again. Sorry if I shared my postive experience late. The breakfast was interesting specially when u were sharing ur local daily life n ur trips , waiting ur visit to our great nile river.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: * Good atmosphere* Excellent hosts* Healthy breakfast* Comfortable RoomsI went for the second time and will always go there when I am in Barcelona.Alex and Carina always tend to help to organise your day.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really love this B&B runned by very friendly Carina and Alex. They are so nice and helpfull. The room we had was quite small and basic with one bed (perhaps140-150 cm), a small WC and shower. But it worked very well and was clean. The B&B is within walking distance from the city center and The Sagrada Familia. There are many nice and rather cheap restaurants in the neighbourhood and the B&B is situated along a main street. But we heard no traffic or noice, only very very weakly sound from the Metro.I really recommend this B&B and would like to stay there again if going to Barcelona.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nisia a warm B&B managed by Carina & Alex, two kind hosts.Booking via email was quick and easy.The directions we were given were simple and accurate. We could get there 1h30 after landing in El Prat airport.The appartment is well located (5min) walking from 2 metro stations which makes traveling around the city very easy.As it is a bit north the famous Diagonal avenue, it's located in an area where there are almost no tourists while being very close to everything.You can also enjoy wandering in the neighberhood and live the locals way. Lots of bars, cafés around.The room was correct. The toilets were very small though but..it is not a big deal.The shared living room and kitchen were nicely equipped.I would consider going back to Nisia next time.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed Barcelona a lot, especially coming back to the bnb. The bnb had a comfy living room and open kitchen-coffee and tea anytime, you can put your drinks or wine in the refrigerator. A kind guest even offered us their wine and beer to unwind. The room is basic, clean, good bed and bathroom. The hosts, Carina and Alejandro, were very warm and welcoming, helped with luggage, adjusted breakfast time so we can eat since we were leaving early. Breakfast was plentiful with meat and cheese, OJ, fresh coffee and yogurt. Very nice neighborhood, close to Metro, 20-30 min walk to main sights. We loved Familia Sagrada Church, Parc Gruell and Monserrat. We hope to come back..
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, walking distance from 2 metro stations. Very nice breakfast. Alex and Carina are great hosts, very kind and helpful. Gave us lot of tips about the attractions and helped us find a very good Flamenco show... Would love to come back.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I were looking for a quiet and secure place to stay in Barcelona. We stayed 7 nights at Nisia B&B and our experience was just perfect ! Our hosts, Carina and Alejandro, are very welcoming and were always available to answer our questions. You will feel at home and very at ease ! We had a beautiful air conditioned clean room with a private bathroom. We slept very well. The B&B has 3 bedrooms, a beautiful kitchen and a cosy living room. Wifi is included in the price and works well. The location is ideal since it is directly on Carrer de Gracia, the main street of Barcelona with all the shopping stores. We were 15 minutes (by walk) away from the center (touristic) of Barcelona but just minutes away from the more local part of Barcelona (no tourists !!), where we had the chance to try amazing cheap meals. There are many pickpockets in Barcelona and we felt very secure at Nisia B&B. The apartment is on the 3rd floor, so we felt very at ease leaving our private belongings in the room all day. The price is not expensive for the room and breakfast that Carina prepares for her guests every morning. I would recommend this B&B to anyone who loves comfort and quietness !Thank you Carina and Alejandro for making our stay just perfect !
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This guesthouse is a lucky find! It's in a great location- we loved wandering around the narrow streets behind the guesthouse, lots of boutiques, cafes, bars, ect. The owners are very nice, the place is clean and two metro stops are nearby. Breakfast was lovely. I highly recommend!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: a cool litel B&B in center of Barcelona, the service was very good, both of the owners are very kind and helpful.there are three rooms during our trip we stayed in two of them(we got to Barcelona twice during the same trip) and both of the rooms were very cozy.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What this B&B lacks in five-star design and decoration it certainly makes up for in homely charm, friendliness and location.The B&B is on the main road between Diagonal and Fontana metro stations, but despite this you don't hear any noise. The three double rooms are located towards the back of the B&B, and there is a shared kitchen and living room. Rooms are somewhat basic but certainly provide everything you need, and the price is hard to beat. Breakfast is good.Because the B&B is small you get lots of privacy, and Carina was very accommodating about our desire to sleep in in the mornings and have breakfast a bit later!Alex and Carina are really helpful hosts and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Barcelona the next time I visit.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you to the TA reviewers who helped me choose this B&B. It is perfect for a stay in Barcelona, and Alex and Carina are such friendly and helpful hosts. Nisia is on a busy avenue, but the rooms are double-glazed, and certainly my room which was at the back, was very quiet. There were plenty of clothes hangers and a low shelf which you could store luggage under, and a higher shelf for lighter luggage.Breakfast is cereal, kiwi and yoghurt, with meats, cheese and bread/toast and jam/marmalade with tea/coffee. I found it plenty, and didn't need to eat till late afternoon. It was nice to meet and sit with the other guests each morning, to share our experiences of the city.There is a fridge and use of microwave and kettle anytime. The lounge is large and comfortable with a TV, DVD player and plenty of travel guides.It is a 20 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya, but only 5 -10 minutes from either Fontana or Diagonal metro stops; although Fontana is slightly farther, it is downhill from there, if you have a lot of luggage. Nisia is next door to the tapas bar, and directly opposite DIR. It does have a very narrow entrance and stairs, but Carina and Alex helped me up and down with my luggage.Nisia is on the same road as La Pedrera and Casa Battlo, which are also both near metro stops. La Sagrada is probably a 20 minute walk, but also at a metro. So you have all the benefits of staying in a great city, without being in the busy centre, and it's like being in a home away from home. I hope to come back to Barcelona and stay at Nisiaagain. Thank you Alex and Carina.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling alone for my first trip to Europe I was pleased to read the reviews of Nisia Bed and Breakfast on tripadvisor and booked part of my stay with Alex and Carina. Nisia looks exactly like the pictures show, large community living room with dining area and kitchen, bedroom with ensuite bath. The location was excellent, many local shops nearby, close to 2 stops on the green metro line and a tourist information office (TI).  After some miscommunication with my son, I followed the directions given for public transportation from the airport to Nisia and found it no problem (I do not speak Spanish) and did not have a phone. Carina graciously let me leave my bag there (I had arrived early) while I walked to my son's apartment. The local area (off the main street) is quiet, quaint, with neighborhood plazas and all around there was superb architecture to stroll and see. There are many small shops and restaurants nearby. I always felt very safe in the Gracia area and in Barcelona and spent my days sightseeing by myself while my son was in class. Alex and Carina had some very useful books and offered the use of their computer to research or to print admission tickets. The free WIFI worked great! The breakfast serve each morning was very filling and I often did not even think about food until mid afternoon. I enjoyed visiting with Alex and Carina in the mornings and with the other guests (a couple from France, we overlapped 1 day, and a family from England, sharing the apartment for 3 days). It was fun exchanging tourist information each day on what we had visited or done and how we got there. Alex and Carina always had suggestions and advice which was helpful. The bedrooms are located in the back of the flat so they are not right on the street (much quieter). It is on the second floor with no elevator, if that is an issue for someone (the stairs are steep) - not a problem for me. This has got to be one of the best values in Barcelona and I am afraid it will not be kept secret for too long with all the awesome reviews it gets! I thoroughly enjoyed my time at Nisia and would not hesitate to stay there again if I am ever lucky enough to come back to Barcelona. Thank you Alex and Carina.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a place where you can feel at home when travelling. The hosts, Alex and Carina, were extremely friendly and welcoming from the first moment we set foot in Nisia. They also had good tips on what to do and see in Barcelona. In addition to this there were travel guide books and maps available in the B&B as well. The room was small but it was nice and clean with an en suite bathroom. The simple but sufficient breakfast was served every morning from 8.30 to 9.30 (working days) and it carried us well until lunchtime.We didn't use the facilities of the common room very much since the weather was superb and we were out exploring and enjoying the city, but there are lots of options in the common room as well. There are books and games, a tv and a stereo. Also the free wifi is excellent.The location is good along the metro L3 (green line), about halfway between the stops Fontana and Diagonal. Also the buses 22, 24 and 28 run right next to the building, but since the street is a one-way street, we only used the buses when travelling from the city center back to the hotel. The stops for the buses running in the other direction are located one block off of the hotel building, so when going to the city, we usually walked to the Diagonal metro station (5 minutes).There are numerous little shops (grocery and other) in the vicinity. Also ATMs can be found effortlessly and there is a post office as well. The neighbourhood (Gracia) is very lively with numerous little plazas and nice bars and restaurants that are mainly filled with locals, so you can taste the real Barcelona very easily.Travelled with girlfriend in April 2013, stayed for five nights. Excellent spring / summer weather during the whole stay!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is a bedroom with ensuite, and use of the kitchen to make drinks and the living room to play games or watch DVDs is all included. The breakfast is plentiful, and the couple who run the apartments have travelled extensively, and are very friendly and helpful, and booked us tickets for places using their laptop.Its about a mile from the city centre and close to Parc Gruel. I would highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nisia is a great place to spend time in Barcelona , the location is perfect to walk around many of the most important sites in the city , the host are very warm and the facilities are very comfortable.Gracia is a wonderful town full of little squares loaded with bars, restaurants and shops just around the corner from the BB. But the most important item I bring back from Nisia is a new friendship with Carina and Alex ( the innkeepers ).
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I like to get a local feel for a place we visit. We don't want to be just another tourist. We stayed here for 5 nights and felt right at home. Alex and Carena are very welcoming and accomodating. It's just near the metro so it makes it easy to get around all over Barcelona. There are plazas just around the corner with great cafes and tapas restaurants. Don't forget to enjoy your Gin and Tonic when you visit Barcelona. The beds are comfortable, and the breakfast is great (Various meats, breads, fruit, yogurt, cereal, and great Manchego cheese). It's located on a very busy street, but in your room you can not hear the street noise. The balcony looks out over the tree lined avenue (so pretty). You are far enough away from the heavy bustle of late night life, but close enough that if you decided to join it you could do so quickly.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First thing we liked about this b&b is the location. Very central, easy walk to plaza catalunya. Metro station 3-4 mins walk. There are some very nice squares/'plazas' at 5 mins walking distance from the location. Carena pointed to some very nice local bars and tapas places around the corner. Hosts, Alex and Carena were wonderful. Gave us directions to many places/restaurants, suggested things to do. Carena even booked the online tickets for sagrada familia for us. Which saved us some time. They themselves travel a lot so they know what guests expect from a b&b. They also helped us to carry our bags down the stairs.We took the cab from airport since we reached at night and it was around 30€, right in front of their door. While going back we took the train and reach airport in 50 mins.The house itself is nice and clean. It is a 3 bedroom flat and guests live in each of the bedrooms. Nice big hall to relax and watch tv/read, with small balcony overlooking the street. One can use the kitchenware and tea/coffee machine throughout the day. Lot of travel guides to and other books to read. Since we stayed over Christmas, we were the only guests and it was very quiet. Breakfast was fresh and good to start your day on a happy note.All in all a very good experience., would stay there again and would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little gem is the best kept secret in the heart of Barcelona. Really well located, we were able to just walk everywhere from the metro, to the beach, to the nice restaurants and plazas in town. Alex and Carina were really nice hosts, showing us around and letting us know about the happenings in the city. We also enjoyed the daily yummy breakfast. We highly recommend Nisia for your upcoming stay in Barcelona! Cindy & Charles
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been in Nisia with friends two weeks ago, the place is in a quiet Gracia neighbourhood, you can know the real Barcelona in this area, you have a lot of restaurants and bars around the squares and the atmosphere is wonderful.Carina and Alex ( the owners) friendly people, and the breakfast is very good.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from Barcelona, we had a really great stay in Nisia, the service is great, the location is very good, 20 minutes to walk to the center and the owners, Alex and Carina , are wonderful. They help us to find restaurants, events and atractions. The breakfast is delicious and the coffee is amazing!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nisia bed & breakfast is a great stay option in Barcelona if you're looking for something central and affordable.The B&B is located off Passeig de Gracia making sights easily accessible. The hosts, Alex and Carina are extremely friendly and warm and the apartment is nice and cosy. The rooms & bathrooms are on the smaller side, though not surprising for what you pay. The common area is lovely - we came home early one evening and sat in the living room drinking wine and chatting with another guest. Breakfast is included and was more than adequate. The only downside is the apartment in located on the first floor up a narrow staircase, so taking up two heavy suitcases was not pleasant. Otherwise no complaints with the stay.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, we loved our stay at Nisia. Carina and Alex were very welcoming, and we felt like we were at home. The room was small, but perfect for a busy stay in Bcn. Clean, comfortable bed, very quiet. The location is phenomenal. We walked EVERYwhere from Nisia. It's super central, close to the metro but also to Passeig de Gracia. The street where Nisia is is also great with some architectural gems. There is a supermarket downstairs for water, fruits, etc. We loved the breakfast with the other guests (2 other rooms) - it was a great time discussing our trips and countries with them. Carina and Alex have great recommendations for food. There are tons of great food options closeby. The price was great for Bcn. No problem with anything (ac working as we wanted, shower had enough water etc.). The only downside is the small size of the rooms but for the price, that's not a problem at all! Definitely recommend this little gem!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to Carina and Alex, we spent 4 wonderfull days in BCNThey are very nice people and their guesthouse is a lovely place, situated in my favorite neighbourhood in BCN:Gracia.Muchas gracias otra vez para todoI will tell my friend who are going to Barcelona to come to your place!See youBastien from Paris
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alex and Carina are fantastic hosts.Alex was there to receive me and helped carry my luggage up and down the flights of stairs. He shared his knowledge of Barcelona and the dos and donts.....Carina came in and prepared the beautiful breakfasts every morning.It was a very homely environment. The place is very clean and such a great location!I will stay here again when I next travel!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although at first we had a little trouble finding Nisii (note the little sticker on the intercom, it is hard to notice!!!) choosing this B & B was a hit. At the beginning of our holiday Alex gave us a map of Barcelona, told what is worth to see and pointed corresponding points (the map was very helpful helpful during all trips), and in the following days, always willing to answer any questions or concerns. The second part of this amazing duo was Carina - just nice, helpful and in addition preparing a delicious breakfast ;)Nisia B&B has a very good location - near the metro and one of the most luxurious streets of Barcelona. The apartment has a common room and kitchen (you can use the dishes and refrigerators), and several comfortable and nicely furnished rooms with air conditioning.
