In the morning Alex or Carina preparing breakfast (delicious and very filling), and is highly recommended especially amazing coffee;)In Nisia you can also meet interesting people from around the world (and talking with them during breakfast)... So, I highly recommend this location to all who want to spend a nice time in Barcelona!!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed there very well! Our hosts, Alex & Carina, were very kind and available and helped us to spent a very nice weekend.Nisia B&B is located in a very nice quarter; it is quite close to underground stations and not so far from the centre of Barcelona.Going there was really a good choice!
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I agree that both Alex and Carina are wonderful and very helpful. They provided us with recomendations on where to eat, and what to see. Our son has gone to live there so we picked this accommodation because it was around the corner from his apartment. We have been to Barcelona before but stayed in a business hotel near the station. Although it was very posh, it lacked both atmosphere and wasnt near the real family areas of the city.We were not disappointed with either the accommondation or location of Nisia. The communal room was very nice and our bedroom (which was at the rear of the accommodation) was very quiet. The air con was excellent for us, as the temp went up to 32 c whilst we were there, but the nights were very cool. I cannot comment on the other rooms but ours was great.The breakfasts were great with a good variety of things to eat. Alex's coffee is fab!The location is very convenient for both the metro and for the various squares in the area.I do suggest however, that it is made very clear that if you had a mobility problem you would find it very difficult to get up the very narrow staircase. The staircase is very tatty, and gives the wrong first impression, as the apartment is clean, and very modern. Don't be put off by it!The only suggestion I would make, is that a larger sign is placed near to the front door. It took us several walk passes to actually realise that the apartment was behind the very small door, and the name on the bell wasnt very large and could have been easily missed.Regarding the rough towels, I find this a hard one (sorry about the pun!.) Without the use of a tumble drier they will always be stiff. However, I recommend you see them as having an exfoliating experience which is very good for your skin, and cost a lot of money in England!!!We are going back to Nisia in October and would gladly recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I agree with all reviewers here that the hosts Alex and Carina are wonderful and very helpful. The property is located very close to the metro in a nice location and the breakfast is decent with cereal, fruit, pastries, ham & cheese, bread and coffee. The rooms are very clean although very small. We reached at the property at around 10 pm and Alex let us in. He gave us a tour of the B&B and also explained us about Barcelona touristic sites and how to remain safe within the city. However, we decided to move from the B&B in the morning. We spent a very sleepless night - the beds and pillows are very uncomfortable and the air conditioning was virtually non-existent (the a/c is set at 24C which we found to be quite hot for us,esp since it was 21C outside). We also agree with a previous reviewer that the towels are extremely scratchy. Also, there is only a limited amount of water supply for showers which we didn't know about before we went there (we didn't actually take a shower). We met Carina in the morning and she was very understanding about us leaving abruptly since we were uncomfortable and nothing could really be done about it. All in all its mostly a hostel level accommodation which might be okay for the price, but we did get a 4* hotel on Las Ramblas for not significantly higher than the rates at Nisia.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I echo all of the reviews that talk about the fantastic location. Nisia is very close walking distance to the subway, which will take you anywhere in the city, and Placa de Cataluyna is only about 15 minutes away by foot. As others have said, the bed and breakfast is not fancy, but it was very comfortable and clean, and it served my needs perfectly for my five days in Barcelona. Alex and Carrina are charming hosts, and I really appreciated that on two days when I had to leave early to take tours outside of the city that they had a place set for me at the table in the morning along with access to all of the food that I needed. They could not have been more accommodating. The Gracia neighborhood is extremely charming with many outdoor places to eat within the several nearby plazas. I would caution potential travelers about two things. First, there is a bit of street noise, especially on the weekends. It didn't keep me from sleeping, but I did use ear plugs a couple of times. Second, as others have commented, the establishment is two floors above the street with no elevator access. The staircase is very narrow. It didn't cause any problems for me, but it certainly could be an issue for anyone with limited mobility. I encourage anyone to check out check Nisia who is looking for comfortable accommodations at a reasonable price in a perfect location.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nisia is in a great situation. Handy for the "diagonal " metro station for going north-south and east-west. Also for some really nice bars and restaurants. The rooms, although small, are very clean and the breakfast/communal area is ideal. Carina and Alex could not be more helpful. Just be careful going up and down the access stairs - 4 flights - very narrow. If we return to Barcelona we will certainly go back to Nisia
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our hosts carina and alex made us very welcome and were friendly and helpful.Our room and the shared kitchen/lounge were kept very clean. We were able to relax and to use everything as we wish (look at the internet on our pc, watch TV, listen to a CD, drink wine, etc) which was good.It is very well situated for the gaudi buildings/shops/restaurants/transport links The stairway access (there is no lift) to the rooms is 'interesting' (dark/narrow/damaged tiles) and could be a problem for some people.Our bedroom, shower and toilet were compact but enough for us.Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good points--Very good location in a neighborhood close to many of the tourist attractions in Barcelona. Spotlessly clean.Not so good--The breakfast. It is basic but filling. The problem is that the same bread, muffin, juice, and kiwi 5 mornings in a row gets pretty boring.Also, Alex and Carina seem to know very little about Barcelona beyond an area about 2 blocks from their establishment. This is all the more surprising since Carina grew up in Barcelona.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Getting to Nisia B&B from the airport was a breeze, as it is a short walk from two metro stations. My room was spacious, quiet and sunny and there was a cosy common area with a balcony looking over a magnolia-lined street in the Eixample. From there it was an easy stroll to good food, la Rambla and Gaudi sites. The best part was the hospitality. My host Roc was totally helpful with everything from finding local sights to getting medication for me when I was sick. Great breakfasts (whole grain toast, cheese, ham, fruit, juice & tea) made better by great conversations about Spanish and Catalan culture.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Carina and Alex were probably the nicest people we met on our trip through Italy, France and Spain! The room was clean and tidy and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location was very good with many things to walk to and public transport very close as well. The bathroom was a little small, but I think that is to be expected in any big city.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a very quick visit to Barcelona. Nisia couldn't have been a better place to fit my requirements. The staff are attentive to your needs and helpful with suggestions of what to do. The feel is cozy and peaceful even though it is right in the heart of the city. A 20 min walk will get you anywhere you want. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nisia B&B is a wonderful place to call home when visiting Barcelona. The location could not be more perfect, and discovering the neighborhood of Gracia should not be missed. Staying here gives one of the opportunity to experience Barcelona as a true local. Gracia is a safe district filled with much energy and a wide selection of shops, plazas and restaurants. Our host was a close friend of the owners, and he offered us wonderful conversation, direction, and warmth. We could not have been happier with every aspect of the experience, and extend our thanks for his gracious hospitality. Nisia B&b offers a comfortable,secure and clean retreat after a day of walking the city. We were the only guests during our 2 night stay, and we had full use of the lounge/kitchen area making our stay feel more like apartment living. We would not hesitate to return.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a nice stay in this Bed and Breakfast. It is located in a nice area not far from the Centre.In the neighborhood are a lot of tapas-bars, cafe's and little restaurants.
hotelName:
27    Nisia Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked a trip for a few nights to Barcelona for my boyfriends birthday and as we were on a budget we decided to stay here. Knowing it is a hostel made me apprehensive, however as soon as we arrived all worries we might have had were quickly erased. The staff are all wonderful, kind and funny giving us all the information we could need and more. We had booked a shared bathroom but were upgraded to a private. The room was tidy and clean and had everything we could need. The location was perfectly central with so many amazing things right on our doorstep. I would highly recommend this as accommodation while staying in Barcelona and we will be sure to be back.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made a reservation with Guesthouse Gotic last week through Agoda, which is the same platform as Booking dot com. According to the booking a EUR payment was to be collected by the property as a non-refundable pre-payment. I paid online by credit card.During the night after I made my booking my credit card was charged in GBP for a different amount than the contractually agreed EUR amount. The property only has a minimalist webpage with only a phone number and no email address to contact. I tried to contact them via Agoda customer service, which is a hellish experience and called them to have the charge reversed, or a written confirmation that this is only supposed to be a pre-authorization, which will be reversed once I pay in EUR at the property.Via phone they lied to me and claimed that they had not charged my credit card, which was a blatant lie since I had my credit card statement in front of me.Via Agoda support they eventually acknowledged that they indeed charged my card with a fraudulent amount but both Agoda and the property exhibited an utter incompetence in getting the issue resolved.After several days back and forth via Agoda automated support system and several phone calls to the property, my booking was eventually cancelled without my consent and the fraudulent amount PARTIALLY refunded by the property. I made a loss since they probably refunded the fraudulent GBP amount and not the actual EUR amount.This cost me a substantial amount of time and nerves and is due to corrupt business practices and utter incompetence, STAY AWAY!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Now this is a hostel I am willing to stay at again! A friend and I stayed in a private room for 3 nights... good price for the location. Spacious room, feels very clean. Bathroom down the hall, and not too many people to a bathroom, as I never saw another person! I haven’t stayed in many hostels and had one bad experience, but Barcelona Gotic opened my mind. Very modern decor.Location and the hostel itself feel very safe. 2-3 blocks from La Rambla and metro stops.Everything was very hotel-Like, which is pretty much the only way I’ll go.Front desk allowed us free locker space when we first arrived while we went out on the town waiting for our room to open up.Would definitely recommend for lodging in the Gotic Quarter, and Barcelona in general. Happy I stayed here.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right in the middle of the Gotic Quarter.The lodgings where fantastic.Friendly staff and very clean.Everything inside looked brand new.On top of it the price was very good.The place had free wifi and 24/7 a person in the reception, we didnt try the breakfast.I would recomend!!!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a private room with ensuite for three nights for our long weekend. It was very basic but perfect for just sleeping as we were out from 10:00 - 23:00 each day. The staff are friendly and the location is fab! Wasn't too loud considering it's on a busy street. The shower was nice (good pressure and hot!) Room got cleaned and fresh towels every day. Hair dryer was very weak. Matress pretty firm. Free wifi. DIdn't have the breakfast but it's only 3 euros.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I came for a short break in Barcelona at the end of July and were delighted with the Guesthouse. The room was comfortable, they moved us to a superior room (with private bathroom) for no extra charge and had good sized lockers for us to store our case in (as we arrived in the city early morning before we could check in). The service was excellent.The location is ideal. From the guesthouse the walking time to places such as La Rambla, Barceloneta, La Catedral and Ciutadella is very easy (anything from 5 minutes to 15 minutes). There are some wonderful bars and restaurants within a stones throw of the guesthouse (Bar Celta Pulperia and Colom Restaurant were two of our favourites - both less than 5 minutes walk from the guesthouse).The only slight difficulty we had was controlling the temperature in our room (we were in Barcelona during a reasonably hot weekend). There was a large fan provided, but the fan wasn't very effective. Nonetheless, the shower water temperature could be turned down cold if desired and the large balcony-style doors both proved helpful in mitigating this. No hesitation in recommending this place to all visitors in central Barcelona who want comfort but without paying inordinate amounts of money to central hotels.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a room of three people for a single night stay on our way through Barcelona, and for the price, we were very pleasantly surprised. The location is fantastic, less than five minutes from the bars and restaurants of La Rambla and in the middle of the lovely Gothic Quarter.The staff were great and welcomed us, and although we had paid for a shared bathroom they upgraded us to a private room with bathroom which was fantastic. The room had a ceiling and wall fan, so although a little noisy, it was a good night's stay in an air conditioned room (after a week in 35 degree heat!) Great little find and would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Guesthouse is centrally located and has all necessary facilities, they clean up the rooms every day, the security seems to be good since the reception is occupied 24/7 and you can enter the hostel only of they know you/let you in.We liked our stay at the Guesthouse except for the staff, they were unfriendly and e.g. arguing about payment right on arrival with no credit card acceptance (only cash). Who carries around so much money in cash? Also, when I tried giving them a review, I noticed that thay cancelled my reservation on the booking webpage, although we stayed at the Guesthouse during all the days of the reservation.All in all, good value for the money but it could be perfect, if the staff were nice! In an international city like Barcelona smiling and being helpful is a must.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location, in center of the old city, near the Rambla and in walking distance to the seaside.. The guesthouse is situated in an old traditional building with tre characteristic atrium in the midlde. The staff is frienly and wellcomming. The breakfast is good for the price.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did everything it needed to for the price. Good location, friendly helpful staff. I stayed in a single room which had a little balcony. Only downside is the walls are thin so I could hear the neighbouring rooms' tv.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Basic accommodations in the gothic quarter off La Ramble. The staff is very helpful and professional. The room was small but clean. Was very satisfied with our 5 day stay. The surrounding neighborhood is active late at night and can be noisy if the windows are left open. Great value.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a nice place to stay and was exactly what we needed. Travelling with teenagers and close to the beach, La Rambla, Picasso Museum, ambiance. Great welcome and assistance of the lady in charge. Gave us a larger rom as we were with kids and much appreciated as have own bathroom. Thank you. So we easy to be around. Room was big and good housekeeping service. Perfect for us. Will back.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very average, small for two people and had no air conditioning, only fans which were very noisy at night. It is in an an excellent location near to Gaudi exhibition centre, restaurantsand la rambla- however as newbies to Barcelona we didn't realise this until our last day and when we asked the receptionist for some advice on our first evening about which museums we should see or what restaurants she didn't tell us any of this information about its excellent location within 5 mins of everything!!! frustrating, also the coffee machines were broken and the pole that held our curtain broke and when reported no one came to fix it. I won't be rushing back here. It is clean and great location that is it!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi, Me and my husband stayed at Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. It has very friendly staff and a perfect location where you are close to most things. The rooms are pretty basic but they are clean and there is everything you need. So we would definitely come back and stay there.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a comfortable guesthouse, in a superb location: on a narrow mediaeval street, right in the heart of the Gothic Quarter of the Ciutat Vella (Old Town). My room was clean and well-equipped, with a window that opened out onto a quiet residential street. There's also a 24-hour reception. The breakfast buffet is insanely good value at just 3 euros: you really could eat enough to last you all day if you wanted! My only complaint is that the staff members are a bit variable: I had a very sullen check-in experience.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with 2 friends in the three person bedroom with en suite bathroom. I'd never stayed in a hostel before so was fairly apprehensive prior to arrival. Our room was spacious, clean and we were provided with fresh towels every day. Staff were friendly and helpful. Strong Wifi connection in the room. The hostel is located in a great area, just a few minutes walk to La Ramblas and easy to get to tourist sites. Only downsides were that the safe was not working (and we had to give our key to reception every time we left) and the room got a bit cold during the night, other than that I can't fault it for the price!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable accommodation, well connected and in a good location. Dear staff. We have been offered an accommodation with en-suite for the price of one with shared bathroom. Good breakfast for the price of 3 € per person
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is in the gothic area which is a central area and is bordered by cuitat vella with is the main centre of Barcelona. It's a short walk from famous sights like Las Ramblas. If you're getting a private single room you have to share a bathroom but it's all very clean and decent. Walls are a bit thin so sleep can be interrupted. Would definitely recommend for the solo traveller especially!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredibly friendly staff, very clean, very artsy, perfect location. More of a hotel than hostel. Rooms cleaned every day and fresh towels given. Incredible value for money. Got upgraded to private en suite free of charge despite booking shared bathroom. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to all- young people and families alike
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't be more positive about our three day stay at Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic. Jordi and all the staff were extremely helpful with all of our questions including directions, and any other information we sought. The shared bathroom was spacious and clean, our room was clean and perfect.Their location in the Gotic district made for easy walking to nearby attractions, metro, etc.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location of the guesthouse is ideal if you want to be centrally based - its a 5 minute walk to las Ramblas, 10 minutes to the beach and from the metro stations nearby you can get to all the major attractions. The room we were given was better than we expected - the room was cleaned daily and fresh towels provided when used. although you could hear people in the street outside in the evening (if the balcony doors were open..) it was not excessive and quiet by the time we went to sleep. the staff were very friendly and helpful when needed. we didn't have breakfast at the guesthouse so cannot comment on that. the restaurants and bars nearby were excellent and there were lots of shops and markets within strolling distance. we would definately stay again, in fact we were already considering coming back with our children very soon. For the price, location and value I can't see how any other hostel or hotel could come close.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location for walking around centre; not so good for metro or car. Extremely nice staff and decent room even though walls were thin and we had noisy neighbours. But good value and a positive experience overall.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay at the Barcelona Gotic. The location was perfect for exploring Barri Gotic..and feeling immersed in this unique part of Barcelona. The room was spotless and the cleaning staff were excellent..it was so nice to have a cleaned room everyday with fresh towels and refilled soaps. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern. We had a balcony which was nice (although a little smaller than we had hoped). The staff are very helpful and friendly. It is very relaxed..you can come and go as you please as the desk is 24 hours. It is excellent value for the price. Just be aware of the extras - wi fi in the room, (it is free in the communal area), the room safe is 1 euro per day and breakfast is 3 euros per day per person. We would definitely stay again ..hopefully later this year !! Thanks Barcelona Gotic!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights. We chose it for the location and price. It was really hard to beat. I'll start with the positives. Clean room and our shared bathroom was V clean. Rooms got cleaned daily. Breakfast was pretty good for a continental in a hostel. Staff were pleasant. Location is superb. The Gothic quarter is somewhere that is perfect for tourists. As central as can be. Some nice bars and cafes nearby alongside cheap supermarkets. Ok now for the cons. Obviously when paying a low price there will be trade offs. Walls were thin. Thin enough that we could hear the people in the room next door whispering. Not an exaggeration. I'm a heavy sleeper though so it didn't bother me too much. Security was a major turn off. Had I realised before how security worked there I would not have went for it. So you get a key for your room. You have to give the key into reception when leaving the hostel and ask for it back when returning. Seems like a very insecure method as there was no verification required for collecting a key. We were also handed the key to the room beside us on one occasion. There were no safes in our room to add to this so we really did not feel like our things were secure in our room. If you want to use a locker it is €2. I probably wouldn't book again mainly due to my thoughts on their security. Also they have emailed me that they are having a competition for leaving review. The prize is a mini iPad. To quote the email "But remember… participate will be possible as long as the person has stayed here and can appreciate her o his experience publicly." Incentivised reviews are often misleading. I'd recommend this place if your on a budget but don't leave your valuables in your room.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great place to stay, lovely rooms, perfect location, ideal base for the city centre and near all the bars with cheap drinks. Building was hard to find, lots of small roads leading to the guesthouse so easy to get lost and at night the main door is locked and you have to press the door bell. plan your journey to the Barcelona gotic. Rooms are basic but that doesn't matter when the city has so much to offer. comfortable beds, balcony above the road and bathroom was clean and spacious.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All I wanted was a simple, clean, cheap and safe room in central Barcelona. And this place has it all. You get what you pay for. Recommended for budget travelers (especially solo travelers as they have single rooms as well).
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel location was just perfect near La Ramblas!. Really comfy and clean beds, Our room had a shared bathroom when I booked it, but they gave us a room with a private bathroom for the same price. The staff were extra friendly and helped us with everything.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was awesome, price to conditions is super good, I've really enjoyed living in this hostel. The best thing about it is the location, it is close to the best spots. Staff is very nice, cleaning room everyday very carefully changing everything. Hostel style is nice and fancy.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hostel is the location. Right in the center of Barri Gotic, and quite close to the beaches and metro stations. We stayed in room Picasso which was quiet and really big. The staff was also really helpful.If I ever come back to Barcelona I would choose the same hostel and the same room.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our private room was clean and cozy. I liked the atmosphere and energy of the old building. Location was really good and staff really friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks a lot!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great experience this was. Location was so good near evrything you need. Very clean place, nice rooms, friendly staff! We defenitley go back there!!! I realy enjoyed staying in the old part of town...
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to be in the middle of hipster place this is your place.Important thing that it is very quite in the rooms as they are Not facing the street with all the shops and bars. We had a room with bathroom in there but the community bathroom&toilet is very clean! Bad service (this is how Catalonian people are).There is a Breakfast for 3 euro but very poor.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this place was the staff! So so lovely and accommodating and happy enough to speak Spanish or English. Very clean and we ended up with an ensuite after booking a shared bathroom so that was great. Great central location and the cocktail bar next door was such a perk! A little noisy but nothing unbearable.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the centre of the gothic quarter, the hotel is in a great location and nearby are some cheaper bars and cafes to eat in. Staff at reception were very friendly and welcoming. The room was small with a few little scuffs and marks but like the whole place, very clean. A modern bathroom with hot water, what more could you ask. The communal bathrooms were also very clean , although if a messy person has been in this might not be the case. I think it is excellent value for money and would stay again.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This guesthouse is in a great location in the Gotic Quarter and the staff were very friendly. It is nice and clean but unfortunately both me and my friend found we didn't sleep well as the mattresses were uncomfortable. But this is a budget hotel so you pay your money and take a chance. We had a private room and it was quiet apart from the water pipes when others turned on taps. I need my sleep so for this reason I wouldn't stay again but perhaps the beds are more comfortable in other rooms.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Guesthouse for 8 nights and everything was great! Staff was realy nice and very helpful. There is no kitchen for visitors but you can buy a breakfast for 3 euro person/day and you can eat as much as you want. The location is great because there is 5 minutes to metro station (there are 2 metro station nearby) and 5 minutes to La Rambla.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great base to explore the Gothic Quarter and city centre, and just a 15 minute walk downhill to the beach. Friendly staff on hand round the clock and room cleaned to an excellent standard every day. Cool courtyard in the middle too!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at the Guesthouse for 4 days and enjoyed it very much. The rooms are clean and are cleaned regularly. The balcony, though small, is enough to enjoy the gothic streets of Barcelona. There was a sink in the room, a ceiling fan and a safe. The bed was wide and confortable. The only downside was some noise from next door, but there was no noise from outside. But the best part is the location of the Guesthouse - its right in the middle of Barcelonas Gothic quarter (next to the George Orwell sq.). And all that for a reasonable price! highly recommended!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guesthouse is located really close to the city centre,only a five minute walk away form La Rambla and inside the beautiful Gothic Quarter!You can walk almost everywhere from there.The staff was amazing,so helpful kind and smiley,they really provide the perfect atmosphere!!The rooms where modern and cute and superclean(people came everyday changing sheets and cleaning up) and there were two fans for the hot days.Last but not least they offer a breakfast buffet for only 3euros per person that is just perfect (and with a nice variety) which is exactly what you need to start your day!I highly recommend it to everyone,you would be more than satisfied!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights at guesthouse Barcelona gotic and were wowed by the location, the friendly staff and the value that you get for your money. The nights were quiet and everything seemed to be very authentic. This is easily the best hostel of our trip!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed their during beginning of our trip in Spain and at the end also for a total of 14 daysWe were on the 3rd floor and had to carry our two suitcases up the 63 stairs and our two handbags... we asked for help and were told help is not availableThe ceiling fan did not succeed to bring the temp. below 29ºC/84ºF at night... most of the time it was 30/86 or 31/88 even if we kept the door open with a stopper and the balcony door wide openThe lady at the desk is very helpful and nice... but her hands are tied... she does her best to answer your tourist questions, but anything related to help with luggage, frig. that does not work or intolerable heat in the room... she knows that the owner does not want to do anything about that .... you can ask 3, 5 or 10 times you will never get an answer with a solution to your requestOn top of the wardrobe there was ¼ of an inch of dust and moss... possibly too high for the cleaning lady to see or reachWhen we came back for our second stay, it was always there even if we put something on top of the wardrobe so tat she will see it
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was exactly what we needed. We had shared shower rooms which were always very clean. Breakfast is basic but all you need with toast, spreads, plenty of fruit juice and water, and some small muffins/pastries. The rooms do however get very hot (especially if you're from Scotland!) and as a result we didn't sleep very well at all despite a ceiling fan and another plug in fan. The hair dryer was good to have however it is quite small and as a result took far longer to dry my hair. A couple of time I had to air-dry as someone else in the hotel had it and hadn't given it back yet!All that aside I would definitely book again but maybe take my own hair dryer and something to help cool down the room at night!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a very good option if you look at the price-quality for a couple days. The location is perfect in a nice neighborhood. The hosts of the hotel are the sweetest en try to make it the most comfortable for you. The rooms/bathrooms are very clean. Besides the squeeky bed there are really no complains. Breakfast is basic, but not also not expensive and optional. I consider to come here again if I'm back in Barcelona!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a bit impressed with the facility. The people over the counter were helpful. The place was clean. The rooms were too. Our room was cleaned everyday we were there. There was breakfast but you had to pay for it. There was no AC, just a ceiling fan and regular fan. The window to the balcony was nice but it would have been nice to have an outlet near it so we could get the regular fan near it to get fresh air in the stuffy room. Really fast internet. The other downside was the minute you left the room and want to leave the fans on or leave your phone charging, the electricity would turn off! Even the refrigerator! The beer we left in there was so warm from leaving the room all day. Overall - it was good. Could improve on some things.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic for three nights in a single room with shared bathroom. The location was perfect being within walking distance to la ramblas and also the monuments in the gothic quarter. I was a bit sceptical about sharing a bathroom with another room, however it appeared to be clean every time I used it. My room was also cleaned daily and I was provided new clean towels on both days.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, very clean and tidy. Cheap too! The only downside i could think of is that it is a little hard to find at night and that the breakfast could be a lot better. Would recommend this place to anyone.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice staff, room was clean and tidy. Didn't have a/c but had a cooling fan. Can come and go 24 hrs a day, there is always someone at the reception. Wifi works on the top floor. Really good location but Google maps the place beforehand so you know what the place looks like and how to get there. Would defiantly say there again
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there with a friend of mine for a couples of days. Super location! We had a warm welcome, and the warm and friendly vibe remained throughout our stay. Our thanks to the staf (and especially to Sophie), who were 24h a day available at the desk! Great recommendation for when you're staying in Barcelona!
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was cleaned daily, staff was lovely and helpful. Also the location was very good, near the beach and center! My sister and I stayed for a few days on a vacation. Establishment offered free wifi and price of breakfast buffet was reasonable. Option to leave luggage in safe on first and last day of travel.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time staying at this hotel and boy what an experience!Firstly finding it in the busy streets was an absolute nightmare, hotel signs? Nope!! Name on door? Nope! I walked past it about 4 times before stopping locals to ask for help. Press the bell and the door opens so then to make my way upstairs to the reception. I was greeted by a man and woman who were nice enough, he did say when you leave the hotel leave my key with him.8 am I woke up and left the hotel to meet someone, no one was at reception so I just nipped downstairs, it wasn't an issue because I was only a few minutes!Only to find, that upon my return with my friend and I was to be greeted by this vicious woman who was very upset I had left the hotel with the key, this is the key which was in my hand that I opened the door with, the last thing I thought about was keeping her happy and pressing the bell to give her the room key...She was not impressed! In fact her attitude was shocking! She was refusing my friend into my room. Whilst I packed my case because he wasn't a guest, she told him to sit in reception and be quiet!?!? She then continued to follow him telling him to be quiet, his repbecause your the one making me talk...To be honest I wouldn't stay at this hotel ever again and certainly would NOT recommend staying here... This woman who claims to be the manager is a horrible woman who is rude and quite honestly Nasty!Oh did I mention that someone has wiped the nose up the wall in a little shelf set into the wall and I had to sleep next to that...Pay a little more and stay some where which will show you a little more respect as a paying customer. The actual hotel was not bad, clean bathroom and communal areas, the room was alright for the price paid.Ypu do get what you pay for so I can't really moan about that.After I wrote the above the actual hotel manager has been emailing asking for details and in his and the hotels defence he seems to be talking time to look into this with some seriousness, so for those wishing to book then maybe give it a go and you will receive a better experience than myself. Have a nice trip:)
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: excellent location of this hostel was main reason that my girlfriend and I chose Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic. But when we arrived, turned out that even more excellent was service, personel create very homely atmosphere. Big + for everyday cleaning of rooms. Certainly we'll come back to Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for people who are eager to visit the city, 4 minutes walk to Las Ramblas, 8 minutes walk to the Barceloneta, quite street in the centre of the most beautiful Gothic area. The staff at the reception desk was very helpful and friendly, they speak in many different languages. Room was ready for our stay and VERY CLEAN! Towels are changed everyday, as well as the whole room is cleaned daily. Extraordinary quality in reasonable price! I definitely recommend this place
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hostel is absolutely ok and advisable. it is very well located in the city center - old town. service is perfect. rooms fit their description. everything is clean. the price is very attractive. no noise, no disturbing guests, everything ok.
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this apartment for 3 days. And we really enjoyed it! The apartment was clean, cheap and in great location.Clean toilets , tovels changed everyday. Excellent for my purpose, In the future I will recommend the hostel to other people!"
hotelName:
28    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very nice stay here for 3 nights. We had 2 rooms, one for us and one for our 20something sons. We both had rooms with a balcony which was great. The rooms were quite compact but nicely done. Sheets and pillows were very nice. Love when they are white!! Towels were good size and not scratchy. Shower room with toilet gets very wet as there is only a half glass shower enclosure. Trouble with our air conditioner, would not stay on and it got very hot during the night! Loved the location, easy to walk to la Sagrada Familia and all over. Lots of restaurants very close too.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room itself was very clean, although it was quite small. The problem was the noise from outside (inner garden of the building). The window was not soundproof at all, so I heard all the noise coming from the elevator and rainfall. If you are sensitive, I would suggest you a pair of earplug.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a refreshing hotel to return to after busy day touring Barcelona! Comfy room, very friendly staff, lush garden terrace to relax in. Great espresso in the a.m. to start the day. Would love to visit again--soon!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were clean and equipped for everything you might need, the location was perfect and the terrace at the back of the building was the cherry on the cake. Staff are friendly and I would definitely recommend
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was really nice and the room were comfortable and clean. My highlight was the morning coffee at the beautiful terrace. I will really recommend this hotel. The price is very cheap and the location is near to the city center.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very happy with this hotel. I chose it as a low cost no frills hotel and it exceeded my expectations. My room was very comfortable and modern, the location within easy walking distance of everything I wanted to see in Barcelona, Sagradia Familia, La Pedrera, La Rambla etc. The staff were pleasant and helpful. There is a pleasant terrace where you can sit outside. The hotel does not serve food but there is bakery close by where you can get croissants etc for breakfast and the hotel has tea coffee 7am to 12 noon. A vending machine has cold drinks. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was great, helped me a lot. The hotel is very clean and I had everything I needed. The location is also very good, close to Rambla and Sagrada Familia and Metro stations. There is a non stop supermarket right across the street.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful time returning to the Praktik Garden after our last visit, three years ago. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable and the overall vibe of the hotel is clean and peaceful. The hotel is in an ideal location, with easy access to everything in the city. Free coffee in the morning is a treat! (We liked ours in the garden or on our balcony). Would highly recommend. Thanks for the lovely return.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Neat little hotel that offers a great location within walking distance of many Barcelona attractions and is one minute from a Metro stop. We upgraded to the bigger double room which was definitely worth the extra 12 Euros a night. Lovely high-ceilinged cool room with good shower and toilet provided all the space we needed. The hotel doesn't provide food but does serve free coffee and tea every morning in the garden area, which was very pleasant, until noon. There are a choice of bakeries 1 minute away around the corner. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. We will come again. Many thanks
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really loved our stay at the Praktik Garden. We had a suite room on the first floor and it was great. We loved the fun and quirky style of the room and the rest of the property. The price was excellent and the location can not be beat. We were able to walk to most of the sights we wanted to go to or we could jump on the metro which was only 5 minutes away. There are not alot of "extras" with this hotel which keeps the cost per night down but has everything we needed. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was great, can't say enough good things about it. The double room itself was clean however it was way too small. The sink was in the room and toilet and shower were behind thin glass door that wasn't completely sealed (a little too much lol). Also there was no closet for clothes and not enough space to keep our suitcases open. We felt like we have paid too much for what it was and we felt like we were in a fancy hostel. Again, everything inside was clean and looked nice, yet it was too small and not so private.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time we stayed here. This time we took the suite which was great. Nothing wrong with the standard room, but ofcourse they are quite smaller.Location is great. Decoration is awesome and the staff very friendly.Next time for sure we will choose this hotel again.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was traveling alone, the room was too small actually, The hotel has the most wonderful atmosphere ever, and the garden is amazing and so peaceful!! The area of the hotel is one of the best in Barcelona. It is so close to everything and surrounded by groceries stores, bakeries, laundries, and coffee shops and bars.I would really recommend this place if u are coming to Barcelona for sure.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely adore this hotel!  I first came across this hotel from a blog post of travel writer. At first I was taken by the concept of a theme hotel. Praktik Garden is a hotel that centers around the theme of a garden. On the property are two adjacent outdoor garden sitting areas that guests are able to enjoy. I was traveling with my sister and her family (who were booked in another room) and we were able to spend time each other in the lovely garden space. This was much more enjoyable than being inside a hotel room.Not that the rooms weren't comfortable, far from that. The rooms were perfect and were stylish and modern yet not excessive. I had a balcony that opened onto Barcelona, a private bathroom, an area to store my belongings. The bed was King size, firm, and very comfortable. The hotel decor was quirky and hip. Location excellent. There is a metro stop just around the corner.The hotel staff was very helpful in directions and were also able to help be book tickets to Park Guell for the next day. My own search came up with the day being sold out.To top things off, the room was so affordable. Great value.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying in - Suite (July 2019)PositivesExcellent location, very central and close to the actionSuite is a good size and decent air conditioningLovely dual rainfall showerStaff very friendly and helpfulVery clean and tidy overall, with strong design elementsGood strong Wi Fi throughout Free tea and coffee in the morningNegativesBed was two twins pushed together with a sizeable gap in between.Few amenities outside of the basics. No tea/coffee/fridge in room, lack of overall storage for clothesAlthough square footage in total seems large, room is divided into two ‘spaces’. The second area overlooking the patio (although masked by foliage) is separate, not well air conditioned and pretty much useless for anything other than storing cases.Lighting in the room and bathroom was particularly terrible. There were lots of lights in the rooms, but their position and style really became an annoyance when trying to get ready, etc.Walls were very thin and we were woken several times hearing noise outside the room. Overall we enjoyed our stay in Barcelona and found the position of the hotel very convenient. The room however did not live up entirely to our expectations and consequently we would not stay again.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Praktik is a great location for sightseeing and close to the city centre for shops restaurants etc. The hotel is very clean and comfortable with quirky decor and a nice terrace with lots of lush greenery. They offer free tea and coffee in the morning which is a nice touch. Having stayed in lots of hostels, I felt like it had the same hostel vibe but just an adult one!The front desk can help to answer questions and book you tickets to places like Sagrada Familia etc. However I was a little annoyed when they told us we didn’t need to book Park Guell tickets to go there and find out we couldn’t get in because we didn’t have a pre-booked ticket!!! My advice is just to book any Gaudi attraction way in advance! Although clean and comfortable, I have to admit it was quite noisy, I wouldn’t say I’m a light sleeper, but on some nights I struggled to get off to sleep! Lots of kitchen noises, could hear people showering/the noise of the water pipes, and hearing other people walking up and down the nearby stairs. Similar first thing in the morning. I would say if you were looking for just a relaxed stay where you can have a lie in-perhaps not the right place?! If your looking for somewhere to come in late and get up early to sightsee then perhaps it would be a good option for you!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this boutique hotel in central location; friendly staff, lovely outside patio for guests, small rooms but with character. Rooms with balcony are our favourite. Stay here every time we visit Barcelona.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms was small (single) but very clean.The bathroom was almost new.The location was very good ,near to metro station.The staff was helpful .Finally at the first floor there was a terrace were you could drink your morning coffee and discuss for the day to come.In general a decent choice.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights and were delighted with the hotel. Quirky designs and decor make the hotel stand out from the rest. Designed by the same person who did El National restaurant (also well worth a visit) it features bold circus themed rooms and common areas. Excellent staff are very helpful in pointing out local restaurants etc. Situated within wash walking distance of all the main areas, I would strongly recommend this great hotel.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, comfy beds, very clean (although room smelled like strong cleaning products).Hard wood floors...people stumping on your head... Get top floor rooms and not on garden side... Loud there because of people hanging out late on balconies. Expensive for what it is.Would not stay there again. Better options for the price.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with the hotel. The location is ideal, within walking distance of tourist attractions. The rooms are small, but with big, comfortable beds. We also appreciated the discounted parking in a nearby car park.For the price, the hotel is excellent value.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This feels more like a fancy hostel than a hotel.Room was super small, and everytime someone would take the elevator, the window would vibrate and make a horrible noise. Spent 3 nights barely sleeping
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, rooms are rather small, and there is no option for breakfast, they just offer the room and free coffee and tea which is very short if you're staying as a tourist and would like to have good breakfast before going out. Anyway it's rather easy to walk and have decent breakfast in the coffee shops nearby - recommend the ones at Passeig Sant Joan
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a cute and quirky hotel. Set in a great location for not only places of interest, but also for local cafés and restaurants for grabbing breakfast or more. Easy access to the metro line, and is in a pleasant area for walking around. Would come back!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a very nice one, designed with care, in the heart of Barcelona. The staff has been very kind. I highly appreciated the complimentary tea/coffee in the lounge, with terrasse, in the morning. The position is central and both easy to reach from airport and useful to move around the city centre.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in May, the hotel has everything you need, comfy beds and a great shower. There is no breakfast served in the hotel, but free coffee & tea available every morning. We were staying with 2 other couples and the hotel has great communal areas both inside & out where we could meet for morning coffee or a drink in the evening before we went out. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the theme and decor of the hotel. Our room was quite lovely. The staff met allour requests and also made great recommendations. In the heart of Barcelona close to some amazing restaurants and great shopping.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I quite liked the design of the hotel, BUT I had sevaral issues with my room - there was an unpleasant smell from the canalisation in the bathroom, which was really not nice and around 7 AM it was very loud in the corridor, maybe by the cleaning services. Also the room had a tiny window facing a wall, so no natural light inside the room. All in all for the 100 EUR paid per night, not so good deal. The Staff was very very nice and teh location is great!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with friendly staff. Room could do with a little fridge and a bottle of water, place to put your toiletries at the sink and a bathroom door that closes instead of the glass door for more privacy. All around good stay. Will stay here again.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in the city center, quiet location, Girona metro station station around the corner, on the way a few bakeries and small restaurants to have breakfast. Hotel need some renovation, we got a pretty small room. Good for two nights though.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything as expected from the website. Great teracce. Delicious coffee for free. Such a lovely kitchen/public room. We loved everything in this hotel. Lovely decoration, have lots of pics with the "mental marvel" wallpapers =)The only negative point I want to make is the unbelievable amount of coffee pads that are spent each and every morning.. Unfortunaltely.. the coffee was exactly the great pleasure so I have also drunk a lot.. :( but I would have felt much better if it would not be a pad machine.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, good value and clean. Staff we're helpful and allowed us to check in early. Room was a comfortable size and bright and airy. We go to Barcelona quite often and this is our new favourite hotel! Will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk workers were very helpful and answered all of my questions with a friendly spirit. The hotel itself is charming and has a nice patio in back. The room was small but very nice and we got a good price since it was off-season. Great shower. Great location too - we will try to stay in one the Praktik hotels when we return to Barcelona!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was recommended to us by a trusted friend that the Praktik Hotels were reasonably priced, stylish and clean. We were so happy to find a place that was ideally placed for our needs so late in the day. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before booking a room, I tend to read the reviews and that helps us make a choice. We were going to be in Spain for almost a month so we wanted nice rooms at reasonable rates. This fit our needs. Excellent location, friendly staff, comfortable beds, fresh and fairly recently established. Our room was small—but bathroom large so it would have been good to have a stand in there for a suitcase. Our favorite part was the lounge and garden on the first floor. The expresso machine was very slow in making a cup of coffee—-everyone thought one guest was an employee as she helped several of us. She said she’d mentioned the problem the day before. Big problem? No. It’s a quirky hotel—-more quirky than I had expected. Would we return—-yes but I’d check carefully to be sure we had a room a bit larger and with a larger window on the 2nd floor or above.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This the hotel is not in a very good area. If travelling to see touristy things like us, I'd suggest something in the heart of the Gothic Quarter for sure.This hotel was nice and modern, it looked clean but our room had a really bad smell like dirty socks. We stayed for three days and with plenty of airing out the room during the day the smell wasn't too offensive. We did tell the reception and they said they'd get their cleaner to air the room our during the day. Although they were friendly - they didn't offer us another room.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable rooms friendly staff i forgot my adapter and they lent me one for free..close to passeig de gracia and barrio gotico ramblas...etc they have a garden to relax..there is free coffee from 0700 till 1200
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Praktik Garden Hotel. Staff are very friendly and very helpful. Our room was nice and exactly as described on the website, and the bathrooms are beautiful. The queen bed is two singles joined together which is rather uncomfortable to sleep on and the air conditioning/ cooling was not working very well or at all, but apart from that the room was great and we would stay again.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unfortunately we were let down by this hotel. The interiors is nice, basic but arty which I like. However when booking the suite room I requested one with a balcony which was confirmed via email. As we entered our room we didn’t have that at all... unfortunately our room was small and dingy as the window was in a separate area of the room which let limited natural light through. The bathroom was lovely however but didn’t fancy sleeping in there...When I came down stairs to ask about the room I requested the receptionist said it was booked. I showed the email that the colleague sent confirming the room and received a ‘sorry but it’s not our problem’. She then checked if it was available for us which it was on our last day. Seemed pointless but I wanted what I paid for for at least one day.  The room we asked for that we had for the last day was beautiful, much bigger, lovely balcony and so bright! It’s a shame we didn’t have this for the whole time as to have a coffee on the balcony in the morning would of been lovely. There is no comparison with the 2 rooms really. You certainly wouldn’t pay the same £100 p/n price for the first room being so basic and a lot smaller. The free coffee in the morning is good and the interior of the communal space is nice. Walking to the main areas of barcelona is easy, we didn’t use any transport even to the park which is about 45 minutes walk as it’s nice to see everything around. Gothic quarter is about 25 minutes walk and las Ramblas is about 15. I have emailed the hotel prior to this review to let them know my disappointment especially as it was my partners birthday present. The response was speedy however not the great. A few excuses about their policy and that both rooms are classed a ‘suites’. They agreed that their colleague made a mistake but other than that it was mostly trying to reason with me with excuses. Also a paragraph started with ‘We are not going to reimburse you any amount’ I didn’t even ask for a reimbursement in my email so that also got my back up.Unfortunately I won’t be staying again for the lack of care of my complaint in person and via email. If I had the room requested or at least the staff were a bit more concerned with my complaint my rating would be a lot higher.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We slept in this place for 6 nights! Bathroom had bad smell and noise from the pipes even at night. Bad light and no full mirror. We slept on single beds and they very uncomfortable as the beds were against a wall facing the bathroom. Socket for your phone right next to your brain & nowhere to put your extra belongings.Don't see myself going there again.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came back to Barcelona after having lived there for 6 months for a placement abroad and could not have wished for a better hotel to stay at!I arrived with my friend around 11AM and immediately we were notified that our room was ready and that we had received a free upgrade! Best way to be welcomed back to the city! Staff are very friendly and helpful! And maybe weird to say, but the scent in the lobby when you enter the hotel is amazing, smells like Barcelona! Housekeeping cleaned our room every day and it was spotless, the only thing that left us a little confused was the fact that there was a sign in the room which said that when your towels were hanging that they would not be changed. However ours got changed for clean ones every day, not really a problem, but when you’re trying to think of the environment it is not really sustainable especially when you give the guests the choice. Further on, in the morning till 12PM they have coffee machines available where you can make a cup of coffee and enjoy it outside on the terrace, breakfast is not available, but enough nice breakfast spots around! Besides that, the location is perfect, just a couple of minutes walking from Passeig de Gràcia! Highly recommend this hotel! Will defenitely return soon!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I spent 4 nights here on a trip to Barcelona. The hotel was really clean and quite quirky! The room was sizeable enough for the two of us, clean and had enough storage room so we weren’t completely living out of a suit case. There are lockers downstairs to store your luggage so you’re not carrying it round before check in or after checking out and we’re really easy to use. The staff are friendly and helpful. The shower was amazing! It’s location is great, 5 mins walk from the metro and easy to get to places from. If we come back to Barcelona, we would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful restaurants, sites and shops nearby. Close to metro station. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean rooms. Good size shower with large towels. Bed is comfortable. Very reasonable rates. Only negative is the bedroom is small.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very clean, quiet and yet the perfect location to explore / walk around Barcelona.The staff were very friendly and helpful in recommending restaurants nearby.Although no breakfast was included, they provided coffee / tea in a pretty 'Garden Room' on the first floor between 7am until Midday.There are patiserias nearby to buy croissants etc to have with your coffee.Excellent value.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location good, not too far away from center and road not too busy outside. Room size and facilities were good. Free morning Coffee a bonus but could do with having the opportunity to make your own in your room as Coffee stops at 12 noon. Bit noisy on a night from other guests but you cant choose who stays there when you do
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good concept, price and location, tiny but clean and modern rooms with excellent shower. Perfect for a short stay for a couple or friends. Free coffee in the morning is a bonus, but expect nothing extra. :)
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel, although well located, has several problems. The check in is very time consuming, the rooms are small. The cost benefit is not adequate. The biggest problem is not even the rooms are small but the fact that they are not well prepared. There are no places to hang things in the bathroom. There is no place to put the towel in the sink, which is located outside the bathroom, inside the room. This can actually be an advantage because it facilitates use. But it would have to come accompanied by more attention to provide places to put things on the sink, soap, toothbrushes, etc... It wasn't worth the money spent.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was close to the main areas of Passeig de Gracia and an easy walk to La Rambla BUT quiet!! Wonderful. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Great price for Barcelona especially over the first three days of New Years!We used the stairs but there is a lift. The room was so cute. Very comfortable beds and soft cotton sheets and duvet. Made for a cozy night. Bathroom had a nice shower and large cotton towels. Our room had a terrace which was so nice to set out on in the evening and mornings. On the day of checkout, we had a late train to Valencia so they offered very convenient luggage storage in nice lockers for 1€! That way we walked to Park Guell for a tour and didn’t worry about our backpacks. Oh and the added bonus...DESIGUAL Outlet is NEXT DOOR! Leave room in you luggage to shop, shop and shop!
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Praktik Gardens is in a fabulous location to everything of intersest as well as close to the main shoping area. Many littlle bars, restaurants, cafes and supermarkets on your doorstep. The reception area is very quaint with very friendly and helpful staff. The room was fresh and clean. The bed was very comfortable with lovely crisp white sheets. The bathroom was generous in size and quite updated. We found it an easy hotel to find from the RENFE Passeig Gracias station, but also easy if you caught the Aeroport bus. The room at night was also nice and quitet. You can also make a great coffee for free on the 1st floor. We will definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very well located, close to everything. the room was small but very cozy and clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel has a leisure area very well decorated and comfortable. I recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I choose this hotel cause I read about it in Annas Edit blog- and the rooms on the pictures looked lovely. I booked a superior double with terrace- well it was kind of ok, but the room felt very cold and dump, as the towels felt itchy and grey. on the second day, nobody came to fix up our room. The duvet was thin and we had to ask for extra blankets and the walls were dirty. I m not gonna be too critical cause we didn't spend so much time indoors and the location was very good.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: really great area, lovely staff, clean, stylish, cosy in January and can imagine the garden being beautiful in summer. would stay here againalso a coffee machine in the morning is a great additional touch and really affordable
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nicely decorated and was clean. We chose the largest room possible because we'd be staying for a full week and it was still quite small, though the balcony was nice. However, it always smelled like cigarette smoke. Customer service was a little lacking and they never replaced our glasses in the room, which we left on the floor with the dirty towels. They just left them sitting there, which was a bit odd. It was conveniently located and we walked everywhere.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is good; walking distance to the metro (Girona station) and the main shopping street Passeig de Gràcia. Unfortunately the good stops here.Receptionists have terrible customer service. We didn’t feel welcome by the lady at the front desk at all. At check out, early in the morning (7am), had to ask them to get us a taxi rather than being offered. We stayed in the exterior balcony room, which was small and the basin was located at the entrance not in the bathroom. Room and bathroom were clean. Did not use the courtyard and lounge areas, but they look good and clean.
hotelName:
29    Praktik Garden
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Average place to stay, staff pleasant, Barcelona a bit smelly in general, La Ramblas over hyped not as good as Madrid. Go around the back of this hotel and you find a great street for people watching with reasonable prices for beer and food. Do the open top bus tour to see some great places
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were not expecting much as the hotel is listed as a 2 star hotel however we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean with fresh towels and hand towels. Our rooms were cleaned every day and our towels changed as we requested by leaving them on the floor. There was a safe in the room that we utilised and it worked perfectly without issues. One night, my friend cut her toe and I went to the reception to ask for bandages which they were able to provide me with. The hotel was also in a good location near to tapas bars and a short 1 minute walk away from Paral.lel metro station! I would without a doubt stay here again if visited Barcelona again, a great hotel for great value.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is nice and the room clean and comfortable... but ı was stolen the last night in that hotel and ı am convinced that it's someone from the staff... ( cleaner?) . The manager was not willing to help and asked for a police Rapport. I was already back home... be careful and use the safe...
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good locationEasy access by subwayVery cleanModern and elegant designFriendly serviceUnbeatable priceSingle Room on the smaller side but very functional and prettyAvoid first floor as you will hear the subway underground and rooms facing the avenue which can be rather busy
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friendly welcome awaits you at Hotel Paral.lel. The room I stayed in was well kept with great facilities. The breakfast in the canteen has a great selection, although the immediate area will spoil you with cafes to begin the day - and bars to end them.Being only 30 mins from the beach by foot, Hotel Paral.lel is well placed for relaxing by the sea. The Gothic Quarter is only 20 mins from the doorstep and most things a little further afield are accessible easily by public transport. I found the metro the best way to get around town, and the nearest station is merely a hop skip and jump away. Hotel Paral.lel even provide you with a map of Barcelona (including a little map of the metro), which I referred to more often than the map I bought at the airport!The staff were always courteous and kindly stored my belongings while I explored the city one final time after checking out at 11am, with a flight later that evening. Having a 24 hour reception was invaluable as catching up with friends continued much later into the night than I had intended!I would absolutely recommend Hotel Paral.lel to anyone.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. Friendly staff. Generous breakfast. Clean rooms. Well maintained premisses. Locatiion near parral lel metro situation makes moving around the city very easy. We stayed in a junior family suite which was quite confortable.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is rated two star should be three star at least , we did not try breakfast at nearly 10Euros we considered it expensive , try the local places we found we could eat for three people for the same. That was only grumble (Yorkshire man) I would recommend this hotel well situated easy to commute to all the sights bus and metro just outside. Some good bars etc very nearby.Use the Aerobus to get there it stops at Placa Espana just a 15 minute walk down Paralel.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights in this small hotel in a busy district of Barcelona not far from the Plaza de Espanya. The room was a good size with wifi and a large television and was remarkably quite, given the location full of bars and night life. Although classed as a budget hotel, it was not that cheap but then nothing is in Barcelona!
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we are in Barcelona, ​​we always stay in this hotel, in a pleasant neighborhood with mainly locals. Hotel has excellent price performance ratio; are always there to your complete satisfaction. Front desk very personable and helpful. Within walking distance of the tourist center (10 minutes walk), with the advantage that you are not constantly part of the many tourists. The Metro close by (3 minutes walk; L2 and L3). Advice: diagonally opposite the hotel is restaurant Pasapalo where you can eat well at normal prices; cozy, mostly local visitors.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is basic but appears new and has everything one needs - ensuite bathroom, free Wi-Fi, cleanliness, left luggage room and friendly staff (especially John on reception). There is a BurgerKing next door, supermarket underneath the building, a 24 hour shop across the road and plenty of cafes and food places around it. Plaza Catalunya, Ramblas and the seafront are all within 15-30 min walking distance. The only downside for me was the noise of traffic and people from the main road, otherwise superb.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Specially the rooms that face the main street. Very noisy at night.Good small rooms far from being a 2* hotel. A lot of 4*'s are worse.Not bad location for sightseing if you dont mind to walk.Be careful with the backstreets some of them may be pretty dangerous.There is a street full of "pinchos" bars right behind the hotel. This is very nice, although it can be very crowdy.
hotelName:
30    Hotel Paral.lel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
